items.content:
Company Profile

Founded: 2015 (4 years old) – HQ in London.

Revenues: £1m run rate with 250% year on year growth

Funding to date: ~£4m in equity & grant funding.

Industry: Predictive analytics, Tech for good, IoT, Social Housing, Property Tech

Role: COO, Switchee Ltd

Reporting to: CEO (with dotted line into other founders)

Location: Kings Cross, London

REM: Competitive salary and a generous stake in the company. Cash remuneration between £60 - 75k with a total package value exceeding £100k.

About the job

We are looking for an exceptional COO to drive operational excellence and growth. This is a rare opportunity to enter a senior position at a funded start-up, established 4 years ago that is now entering scale-up phase.

Reporting to the CEO, the COO will take charge of the Operations, Finance, Talent and People functions. They will also act as a bridge, coordinating people across the company. Initial responsibility will be for 7 staff (3 of which are direct reports) within these functional areas.

Our mission

At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper. One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane household object, a thermostat, into a product that reduces energy bills, looks great and offers control to those who want it. We are also revolutionising the way social landlords manage their housing stock with an obsessively tailored SAAS property dashboard and handy alerts on things like when the boiler is going to break.

Our next project is to build the ultimate connected hub for the social home. It’s going to revolutionise the way residents interact with their properties and landlords manage their homes.

Our Journey

We may be only four years old, but it’s already been quite a ride. We are already working with 45 of the biggest housing providers in the UK. We’re growing 250% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact. We are a team of 25 passionate and ambitious people driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords.

We are looking for an outstanding individual to join our senior leadership team. Your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.

Your responsibilities

As COO, you will drive our business operations to deliver against our ambitious expansion goals by planning and coordinating activities between key teams. You will be responsible for instilling and developing a culture of operating excellence and fostering an aligned, focused and productive environment within the company. You will anticipate operational issues and resolve them proactively before they arise.

Your direct areas of responsibility include, but are not limited to:

• Running the finance department and managing our financial controller.

• Overseeing the operations team including supply chain, manufacturing, customer support and installer support.

• Managing our Head of Talent and Workspace, assisting in getting great people into the business and maintaining our excellent culture.

• Contributing to company strategy, sitting on the senior leadership team.

• Helping the founders execute on fundraising.

• Positioning the company for scale through developing and sharing best practices.

• Attending certain board meetings in an observer capacity.

We are a company built on a strong technical foundation. You’ll need to grasp and communicate a technical solution with staff and external stakeholders.

Your experience

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

• A financial pedigree (e.g. MBA, ex CEO/CFO, finance sector / fundraising experience etc)

• Ability to run a finance function that includes planning and fundraising

• A proven track record of leading and scaling high growth organisations

• Experience in designing and improving management reporting processes

• Open-mindedness and ability to improve in response to constructive feedback

• Ability to work horizontally across multiple functional groups

• Strong leadership capabilities and aspiration for excellence

• Proven capabilities in growing talent and teams

• Experience coaching team members, including leaders of teams

• Ability to communicate with credibility and gravitas both internally and externally

• An excellent academic record

• Knowledge of the housing sector is a bonus but not required.

About You

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

• You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.

• You care about the environment, are interested in energy efficiency and have thought about the challenges and opportunities posed by an evolving domestic energy market

• You like technology and neat solutions to complex problems

• You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.

• You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.

• You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.

• You delight in your colleagues’ successes and thrive on your failures; you grasp any opportunity for learning and constantly seek to improve.

You can expect…

We like to keep things simple and flexible at Switchee and consider you to be joining our family.

We don’t currently track holidays so you’re free to take as much as you need. We often work remotely but are sensitive to the needs of our colleagues. We socialise together with regular outings in London and an annual “working remotely” trip where you have the option (but not obligation) to join us in working from a fun location. This year we took the whole team to Spain.

If we end up working together, we can offer a competitive salary and a generous stake in the company. Cash remuneration between £60-75k with a total package value exceeding £100k.

Interview Timetable
Applications open: 25th July
Interviews: W/C 26th August
Appointment: Before 15th September

items.title: Product Manager
items.content:
Product Manager

United Kingdom, Lancashire
Company: Daisy SMB

Overview

Are you an experienced Product Manager looking for a new and exciting role within a leading telecoms business?

We are looking for a new Product Manager who will manage the introduction and lifecycle of Daisy Communications products and services. They will monitor the portfolio’s in-life performance and maintain a thorough understanding of the market; identifying opportunities for new product introduction and contributing towards strategy and roadmap for the solution area.

The product manager’s objective is to ensure the success of Daisy products, which means working collaboratively with sales, operations, finance and commercial teams across the group to drive successful outcomes. They will ensure that the product and service offering are competitive; that our go-to-market propositions are clear; and that Daisy SMB remains differentiated against competitors.

Job Title: Product Manager
Hours of Work: 37.5 hours per week Monday – Friday
Role: Permanent
Location: Nelson
Salary: Up to £35,000 DOE – plus a company car/car allowance

Your responsibilities

  • Development and in-life management of products and services that are ‘easy to buy, easy to sell’ and relevant for all business units within Daisy Communications.
  • Maintaining a strong understanding of Daisy Communications product’s positioning within the market; including customer perception, knowledge of vendors, competitors and analyst’s perspectives.
  • Contributing to product strategy based on your knowledge of the product and the market
  • Continual evaluation of market opportunities and identification of new products and capabilities within your solution area
  • Actively promoting and evangelising Daisy Communications products to both internal and external audiences, including sales, operations and customers
  • Production and management of product roadmaps.
  • Development and ownership of business plans to support investment and measure the success of new and existing products or capabilities
  • Leading virtual teams to launch new products, services and capabilities into your solution area; delivering against requirements for sales, marketing, operations, commercial, finance, billing and customer functionality
  • Contributing to pricing strategy in collaboration with commercial and finance teams, based on your understanding of the market and the value we deliver to customers, with input into supporting cost models and pricing tools.
  • Product performance reporting as required by the business
  • Working with the procurement and strategic alliances teams to support management of vendors and vendor support and investment
  • Identifying and driving business improvements and operational enhancements across your solution area
  • Sales and operational enablement; providing training and producing materials and documentation
  • Promoting best practice for product development and lifecycle management

What are the benefits of working at Daisy?

Our colleagues work hard to deliver for our customers and that is why we give them the recognition and rewards they deserve for their effort

But working at Daisy is much more than just a fair salary. It’s about providing a range of benefits and opportunities to all our staff to make working with us enjoyable.

Our ethos is simple: the more you put in the more you get out.

Here are some of the benefits that we offer…

  • 25 days holidays, plus bank holidays, and the option to purchase more!
  • Professional development to help you achieve your personal goals
  • Eye care vouchers available and discounted Medicash membership
  • Access to discounts and savings at more than 1,200 retailers
  • An additional day off on your birthday or if you’re getting married
  • Auto enrolment following probation into a salary pension scheme
  • Access to exclusive offers on a range of Daisy products
  • Up to four weeks’ company sick pay over a 12-month rolling period

Apply for job

items.content:
NATIVE ENGLISH LEVEL ONLY. We are looking to add a motivated, full-time email outreach member to our growing team. 

The position involves administration of various digital outreach campaigns and managing the responses to them.  Responses come in via Email to a number of inboxes. You will need to manage a number of inboxes ensuring that all messages are dealt with in a timely, professional manner. Responses will range from a simple yes or no to specific requests for content to be written and submitted to a website.  You will also coordinate with our content team to produce requested content and manage the process of getting it successfully published. 

This is a long-term, work-from-home opportunity of 30+ hours per week, but the hours for this position are flexible and can be adapted to your schedule. 

Desired Skills & Qualifications:
We’re looking for people who are able to work 30 hours a week or more, or will be able to in the near future.

Native English speaker.
Resilient nature and an ability to multitask.
Comfortable working with new software and a willingness to learn.
Excellent time management skills due to the work-from-home nature of the position.
Excellent organization skills due to the need to manage multiple email threads at once.
Detail-oriented due to the nature of our reporting structures.
Motivated and driven by achieving personal and professional goals.
Ability to adapt to and work within proven processes and systems. 
Ability to make decisions quickly regarding the viability of a website.
Ability to adapt your communication style.
Ability to communicate instructions and guidelines clearly and concisely.
Comfortable with basic financial negotiations.

Who Are We? 
We are a fast-growing digital marketing company that runs websites in a number of niches, including website brokering, finance, and more. We have a growing team of remote workers who promote these websites. 

PLEASE FOLLOW THE APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS!
Please submit an application to jock@digitalexits.com that addresses the following points in order:
1. Please describe your experience with email communication - sales and marketing preferred, but not necessary.
2. What is your current hourly availability per week?
3. Describe the last repetitive task you completed and how long you were working in that position.
5. Write the word “Hamburger” at the top of your application. 
6. Describe how you stay focused on the task at hand whilst being surrounded by all the distractions that come with working from home. What tools and processes do you use to help manage your time, focus, and productivity (i.e. to do list, calendar apps, separate home office etc.)?
7. Why do you choose to work online/remotely?
8. Give an example of a time you turned a “No” into a “Yes”. Successful negotiation is key to this role, so we want to know you have experience with this, in any area of your life.
9.  Any questions you have about the position.

10. Which Job Board/Website did you see our job ad on.

Please number the sections of your application that correspond to each question.

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) QM -Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP QM specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong QM experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Quality Management (QM) modul
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the QM modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment, several S/4 HANA implementations under your belt.
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of QM and experience with S4/HANA
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP QM specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.content:
We’re a fast-growing start-up bringing innovation and uniqueness to fashion essentials. Our first product? Tights - the world’s first to be ladder-resistant and seamless (www.hedoine.com). Designed in London, engineered in Germany and made in Italy, we’re proud to be solving a problem faced by women around the globe; tights that ladder right when you need them most.

As part of our continued growth, we’re looking for a driven team member with an entrepreneurial spirit and willingness to jump into new challenges every day. You will work closely with operations, tech and marketing to ensure all projects, campaigns and daily business run smooth both operationally and technically, with the aim of building our infrastructure and scaling it globally.

Your responsibilities will include:

- Managing and monitoring all business platforms including Shopify, Amazon, Zendesk
- Uploading and maintaining product content on all channels including our own store, facebook and eCommerce partners
- Monitoring and reporting on inventory
- Increasing the efficiency of the company's online sales by optimizing and implementing operational processes
- Analysis and reporting
- Customer Service tasks

You will have:

- Minimum 2 years experience in eCommerce, Operations or Project Management
- (Ideally) experienced with Shopify, Amazon, Zendesk, Google Analytics
- Interest in fashion or online retail businesses and the drive to scale
- Attention to detail and urge to improve processes and infrastructure
- Analytical with self-starter attitude, willing to take ownership and go over and beyond with a positive personality and a great sense of (dark) humour

We're based in London and fluent English is required, if you also speak German or any other language that’s a bonus.

This role is part-time capacity, with the possibility to extend to a full-time role. We are happy to explore this role as an inhouse or freelancer position.

Benefits: Competitive salary and package, based on experience – meaningful bonus - plenty of opportunity to make a significant impact and to take on more responsibility as we grow – a lot of flexibility regarding working hours and remote working options – a great office – tons of fun at work, promised.

Join the adventure of growing an incredible brand with exceptional products, backed by great investors and a world-renown advisory board, with ambitious & fun working atmosphere! Looking forward to your application (ideally cover letter and CV)!

items.title: Senior Product Designer
items.content:
Senior Product Designer at Highrise

Remote | International

REMOTE

About Highrise

Highrise is a casual mobile game and community where people make avatars, design art and environments and meet new friends. We are building on the spirit of applications like Animal Crossing, The Sims, Habbo Hotel and Second Life.

Over 3 million people create avatars, chat and make friends in Highrise. We are a fully remote team of 20 backed by YCombinator, Bessemer, Maveron and other leading investors.

About the Role

We are looking for a skilled and enthusiastic product designer excited to make the world both more accessible and fun. You will be working to construct delightful user experiences around play and friendships.

This is a cross-disciplinary role, where you will work closely with our engineers, PMs and game designers to shape the optimal experience for the Highrise audience. You will do everything from brainstorming to UX design to visual design.

You’ll also conduct user research/interviews, and synthesize those findings into written documents to communicate findings to the rest of the team.

What will you do?

  • Create delightful user-centered experiences by building and adhering to established design patterns.
  • Generate mockups, wireframes and polished visual designs.
  • Work with PMs, engineers and other designers to solve complex product and business problems.
  • Make your own schedule, effectively estimate tasks and deliver on time.
  • Establish, maintain and follow consistent internal design guidelines for UI/UX.
  • Survey other applications to understand what does and doesn’t work.
  • Conduct customer interviews when necessary to collect feedback and understand user requirements.

Who are you?

  • Experienced: You have 5+ years experience designing and building product experiences for end-users and have shipped design for a product used by many people.
  • User-centric: You have a strong user-centered approach when making design decisions, and you back those decisions with user research.
  • Open-minded: You’re very open to feedback and trying new things.
  • Learn from users: You have some experience conducting user interviews and/or surveys.
  • Skilled Written Communicator: Highrise is 100% remote, which means writing is our primary means of communication. You’ll use written summaries and reports to explain decisions.
  • Know your tools: You have some experience working in a prototyping tool like InVision and design tools like Sketch/Adobe XD.
  • Meticulous: You have a strong attention to detail when it comes to design guidelines and consistency.

Benefits

  • A competitive salary
  • A fully remote team means you have the freedom and flexibility to work where and whenever you like
  • A strong set of core values
  • Camaraderie from far: we chat daily in Slack and video
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Annual company retreats
Apply for job

items.content:
Chargeback Analyst at ActBlue

Remote | Entry-level | Part-time

Location: Remote

WHO WE ARE:

At ActBlue, we build and power the premier online fundraising platform for Democratic campaigns, progressive organizations, and nonprofits working to create a better future. As a nonprofit ourselves, our mission is to put power in the hands of small-dollar donors and make giving online to these groups as easy as possible.

Since 2004, campaigns and organizations across the country have raised over $3 billion using our tools, with an average contribution size of $40. Thousands of groups from presidential candidates to environmental organizations to local school board members count on our fundraising tools to fuel their organizing work.

We’re a growing team that has a big impact on the future of our country. Each and every one of us is fully committed to our mission, and we’re looking for more great team members who match our passion and are ready to dive in.

THIS ROLE:

The Operations Team ensures the smooth functioning of one of the most complex political financial operations in the country. We process countless donations on a daily basis through our software, and this requires a high level of oversight and management. As part of the Operations Team, the Chargeback Analyst will be responsible for responding to and tracking transaction disputes from our various credit card processors. Efficient, accurate responses to disputes allow us to appropriately mediate any issues arising from donor contributions. We handle sensitive data through various financial interfaces, and the ideal candidate knows that this work requires serious attention to detail, thoroughness, and discretion.

By helping resolve any issues that arise with our donations, this role is crucial in making sure we consistently provide the best service to the Democratic campaigns, progressive organizations, nonprofits, and small-dollar donors relying on us every day. This is a fully remote, part-time position with a flexible schedule. Applicants must be able to work a minimum of 20 hours per week, with more hours and overtime available during certain predetermined times throughout the year.

YOU WILL:

  • Organize incoming online dispute inquiries from credit card processors.
  • Manage and respond to dispute inquiries in a timely manner.
  • Track dispute results and translate them into metrics to help us improve our processes.
  • Collaborate and coordinate with other remote coworkers.

YOU ARE:

  • Organized and efficient: Due to the nature of this work, you will always have a deadline to hit this role is perfect for someone who has a serious knack for managing their time and workload effectively.
  • Highly detail-oriented: This work is repetitive and involved, and it is absolutely crucial to our organization’s success. We need someone who has an unwavering attention to detail. Comfort and familiarity with data entry and/or numbers-based work is preferred.
  • Comfortable going solo: You will be working remotely and on a flexible schedule, which means that you’ll largely be managing your work independently. You’ll have a great team to turn to when needed and regular check-ins with your supervisor, but we would like the person in this role to be adept at independent work.
  • Ready to learn: The tasks of this position are very detailed and specific to our organization. We don’t expect that you’ll be able to go at it alone on day one, but we would love to bring someone on board who is eager to learn and develop new skills!
  • Interested in helping us improve: Every system can evolve for the better, and ours is no exception! Someone who can come in with fresh eyes and help us sharpen our work will be a major asset.
  • Familiar with our tools: We mostly use Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets for this work. Experience with SQL is also a plus, though not required.

LOCATION & COMPENSATION:

This posting is for a part-time, fully remote position. This position is temp to perm, guaranteed through April 2020, with potential for a permanent position afterwards. ActBlue offers competitive hourly compensation and a generous benefits package, including fully employer-paid health, dental, and vision insurance, and an employer-sponsored 401k contribution plan. ActBlue will also provide the technology and hardware needed to do the job.

ActBlue is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against candidates on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Women, people of color, LGBTQ individuals, and members of other minority or marginalized groups are strongly encouraged to apply.

ActBlue cannot at this time sponsor work visas.

Apply for job

items.content:
Education Solution Consultants work with Oracle University Education Sales Representatives to develop and deliver comprehensive, customized education solutions that enable successful implementation, adoption, and usage of Oracle technologies to OU customers and prospects. This includes understanding the customer s business objectives and critical business issues, and creating comprehensive training readiness solutions to support the customer s proprietary business processes.

Analyze a customer s training needs through discovery, and develop a comprehensive training solution to address project team readiness specifications. Actively communicate the value of Oracle University throughout the sales lifecycle. Participate in professional development sessions for OU sales representatives and fellow sales consultants. Understand Oracle corporate direction around new product development, mergers and acquisitions, and curriculum delivery methods. Ensure a complete transfer of information to Oracle University s Delivery organization, and post-sales support personnel. Understand and utilize Oracle methodologies, standards and frameworks around customer communications, including RFPs, RFIs, proposals, and services descriptions. Understand and promote Oracle s implementation and education best practices, tools and methodology. Identify opportunities to expand the breadth of Oracle University solutions during throughout the sales lifecycle, including identifying User Adoption Services (change management, end user training, etc.). Understand how to build a message around the impact of the technology change on a customer s entire organization.

2 years training experience in developing comprehensive training solutions, incorporating a variety of delivery methods. Demonstrate the ability to discuss projects with various levels of customer management at a comfortable depth. Demonstrate a desire to continually grow one s skill set. Strong organizational skills and an attention to detail. Ability to effectively communicate ideas orally and in writing. Prefer strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively on a team. Communication will occur regularly with sales representatives and management, sales consultants and management, customers, and other Oracle organizations. Ability to take advantage of learning opportunities, and apply knowledge and skill on the job. Demonstrate a positive, can do attitude. Ability to travel in the continental United States as needed to meet with customers, support Oracle hosted events, etc. College degree, or equivalent experience. Familiarity with Oracle training development tools (Tutor, UPK, SimBuilder).

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Senior Sales Consultant

Location: US - Remote option; (Burlington, MA or Austin, TX office locations Preferred)

Sales Consulting Team supporting Oracle Cloud University s Sales Organization

Overview:

Provides direction and specialist knowledge in the development of detailed enablement solutions for Oracle s Partners. Facilitates Partner s understanding of Oracle Cloud University s learning and enablement options and solutions for Oracle s Software as a Service (SaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) / Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) offerings. Engages with Partners through presentations, demonstrations and written proposals while providing subject matter expertise and support -both pre and post sales.

Detailed Description:

As a Senior Sales Consultant you will be responsible for providing presales functional support to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. As a Senior Sales Consultant you will be required to:

  • Design, validate, and present learning and enablement solutions for Oracle s SaaS and PaaS/ OCI offerings

  • Design learning program strategies that align to partners business agenda and that have clearly defined business outcomes in support of cloud adoption

  • Develop and deliver sales presentations and demonstrations

  • Articulate Oracle University s enablement approach and methodology

  • Develop and maintain high quality, professional relationships with the Partner eco-system, internal sales teams and VP of OU Partner Enablement

  • Act as a resource for less experienced Sales Consultants

Core Responsibilities Include:

  • Working hand in hand with the OU VP of Partner Enablement to identify partner learning & enablement requirements based on the partners desired business outcome and current consultant readiness along the cloud lifecycle journey.

  • Mapping OU training programs and offerings to partner requirements resulting in a long term relationship / program that enables the partner to meet their objectives.

  • Developing and delivering high quality, customized Oracle presentations and demonstrations to address customer enablement needs

  • Working with the OU VP of Partner Enablement to develop the appropriate sales strategy for the top Global SIs and Key Partners

  • Establishing account presence and build trust with key contacts

  • Managing Partner visits, presentations, and general partner requests as directed by management

  • Pursuing non-traditional approaches, when appropriate, to resolve problems and maximize opportunities

  • Communicating information proactively with other Sales Consultants across organizations

  • Working with the OU Partner Project Management Office (PMO) to provide metrics on enablement programs and progress in support of partner s key metrics and KPIs

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor s degree or equivalent, advanced degree desirable

  • Industry Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience working with enterprise software solutions

  • Prior enterprise software implementation experience and work with an Oracle Partner or System Integrator preferred

  • Strong knowledge of Oracle s Software as a Service (SaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS/ OCI) offerings

  • Must demonstrate strong pre-sales skills with the ability to work within complex sales cycles

  • Demonstrated understanding of standard business processes and Partner/System Integrator business models

  • Must exhibit strong verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques

  • Must be able to work both individually and in a team setting

items.content:
Heartland Financial USA, Inc. is a growing dynamic organization with many locations offering uniquely different banking and financial solutions for businesses and personal clients. As a performance driven company, we strive to create a culture of excellence with high standards, and high values while providing outstanding growth and involvement opportunities for employees. Join a team that makes \"Great Things Happen!\"?

The EDD Analyst I is responsible for performing and documenting customer due diligence processes assigned and document findings and other issues. Analyzes the customer due diligence process and methodology to identify patterns and trends. Communicates with Regional BSA Officers to adequately identify and address issues. Anticipates and implements changes to the testing plans as a result of changes in results or regulatory changes. Assists Regional BSA Officers with ongoing high-risk customer reviews.

PRIMARY & ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Conducts customer due diligence and high-risk customer reviews according to the bank's BSA/AML policy and procedures.

2. Ensures that decisions to retain or exit a customer relationship align with supporting documentation submitted for the high-risk customer.

3. Receives and analyzes monitoring and testing results of customer due diligence reviews.

4. Identifies areas of risk and make recommendations on improvement processes for the member banks for customer due diligence.

5. Seeks ways to assist the Regional BSA Officers and member banks in strengthening customer due diligence, remain compliant and improve efficiency.

6. Performs research, participates in training, and reads literature in order to become more knowledgeable about issues related to assigned area(s).

7. Monitors CDD alerts related to unidentified high-risk customers and exceeds declared behavior.

8. Maintains a high level of confidentiality when compiling information and escalating issues.

9. Maintains compliance with applicable rules and regulations related to money laundering and other company policies and procedures.

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

1. Bachelor's Degree in related field - Business, Accounting, or Criminal Justice

2. 3-5 years of banking experience

3. 3-5 years of experience in AML/BSA

4. Experience with CIP or CDD/EDD requirements, preferred

5. Knowledge of Bank Secrecy Act compliance, and various fraud and money laundering

typologies

6. Ability to maintain the highest level of confidentiality

7. Ability to work remotely with a high level of independence

8. Strong analytical skills and judgement

9. Strong organization skills

10. Proficiency using Microsoft Office

11. Proficiency using AML/Fraud software, preferred

OCCUPATIONAL CERTIFICATION:

Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) or Certified AML & Fraud Professional (CAFP), preferred

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

Time Type:

Full time

Business Analyst

Role: QA/Test Developer

Company size: 201–500 people
Company type: Private
Company: Authority Partners | No office location

Remote details

Technologies

qa

Job description

DESCRIPTION:

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our growing team! Seeking a talented individual who is passionate about using their analytical skills to understand complex systems and their quality assurance skills to ensure proven solutions for the business. As part of our team, you will work together with our delivery teams to translate the business needs into development and testing requirements, playing an instrumental role in increasing the ongoing quality and stability of the team’s work product. This position is a key link between the business and technical domains and we are looking for a “hands-on” person comfortable with brokering communications with both sides, proposing effective solutions and driving implementation of changes that will meet the identified needs.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum 2 years of direct experience of enterprise and consumer processes, online systems development and related technologies
  • Expert knowledge of analytical processes and the software development lifecycle
  • Experience in working within product development or consulting teams
  • Good knowledge of business processes
  • Understanding of Web application development
  • Experience in working with multinational and geographically dispersed teams
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, including technical writing skills
  • Knowledge of QA processes
  • Experience in collaborating with international clients
  • Excellent knowledge of English language
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented
  • Ability to work on tight schedule

BONUS SKILLS:

  • Experience using team collaboration tools/source control programs, preferably Team Foundation Server (TFS)
  • Knowledge of agile methodologies (Scrum)

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Software Engineering or Computer Science, would be of great value, but if you’re passionate and have the experience that backs up your abilities, for us, talent outweighs degree every time.
Apply now

About Authority Partners

Authority Partners is a leading and global IT services company with over 20 years of experience, serving clients within the financial, healthcare, insurance, mortgage and technology sectors amongst many others. We are committed to building relationships with IT professionals who possess integrity, dedication, teamwork, and the desire to learn and grow with us. items.content:
Bilingual Data Associate – French Canadian, English at Aerotek

Remote | Entry-level | Freelance

Job Snapshot

Employee Type: Contractor

Location: Atlanta, GA

Posting ID: 6876959

Pay Rate $15.00/Hour

Job Summary

REMOTE French-Canadian speaking Data Associate
This is a remote position. Can be worked from home, anywhere in the United States!
Pay Rate: $15/hr
Job Type: 3 Month Contract
One of our top e-commerce clients is seeking a REMOTE French-Canadian speaking Data Associateto join their data team. They are building language solutions that power one of their top products. This role focuses on language data, primarily in the areas of transcription, text annotation, and general data analysis deliverables.

It will be working with top consumer products to build the commands behind these interactive devices. They will be assessing any issues or problems that arise and sending customer feedback to the development team. The role will be responsible for heavy data processing as well as a writing development aspect.
The Associate must be capable of:

  • Transcribing and annotating high priority deliverables
  • Delivering high quality work under aggressive deadlines
  • Translating established guidelines into daily work practices
  • Working autonomously with minimal direction
  • Handling unique data analysis requests from a range of data customers
  • Contributing to process improvements to reduce handling time and improve output

In addition, the Data Associate will need to quickly understand changes to conventions deployed in response to customers’ requests and change workflows accordingly. The Associate should be able to contribute to improvements in the software tools by identifying bugs and suggesting enhancements.
QUALIFICATIONS

  • Fluency in Canadian French and English, both verbal and written
  • Experience using Canadian French in a professional setting preferred
  • Skilled with computers and experience using computers in a professional setting
  • Excellent written grammar and attention to detail
  • Able to work with audio content (wearing headsets) for a portion of the day

About Aerotek:
We know that a company’s success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual’s success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek’s people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek’s 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.

items.title: Uscreen: Creative Growth Marketer
items.content:
Creative Growth Marketer

Ready to create some magic? Are you a smart, motivated individual seeking to jump into an awesome growing company within the video space?

Our marketing team is growing and we’re looking for amazing talent to join our pack. This position is best suited for a creative junior marketer who goes outside traditional marketing and really get’s creative and finds ways to build awareness.

Our team is incredibly passionate, smart, supportive, skilled, open to learning, happy to take constructive criticism and use it to level up. We’re looking for someone who can match that energy and help us scale.

Our mission is to help creators monetize videos.

Here’s what you will do:


  • Come up with creative ideas to help promote the Uscreen platform.

  • Use different mediums from video, social media, content, and other platforms to help create and build awareness.

  • Work with the marketing team to perfect and improve processes and bring new content ideas to the table.

  • Be involved with the product team to deliver ideas and improvements to better the platform.

  • Have a deep understanding of the industry and the product and find various ways to promote the product.

We’re looking for someone with:


  • Thinks out of the box, outside of transitional marketing.

  • Prior experience in marketing and also an understanding of marketing and buyer behavior.

  • A strong understanding of SAAS and ways to market SAAS businesses.

  • Smart and motivated.

  • Independent but can also work in a team environment.

  • Full time availability.  We love contractors but want someone to be part of our team and in our culture.

Here’s what you’ll get if you join us:


  • Work from anywhere, we are a remote team

  • Growth & competitive salary

  • Annual retreats with all expenses paid.

  • Full-time (40 hours per week) remote job with contract. We want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance / part-time position you can do in tandem with other professional endeavors

  • 20 paid days off per year (eligible after the first 6 months with the company)

How to apply:


Before applying, please note:

  • Apply using the link below

  • We review the applications and email candidates who qualify for the second round

  • The qualified candidates will be asked to do a test task: usually a video of yourself answering a few questions

  • After we review the submissions, we will organize a Skype interview with the successful candidates

Heads up! Due to the high volume of applications, we are thrilled to receive, at this time we are only able to respond to successful candidates.

APPLY HERE

items.content:
*Business Analyst*

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our rapidly expanding team. Your role will be involved in functional system requirements gathering, documentation of requirements, quality assurance, end user testing and implementation.

*Main purpose of the role:*
* Understand and input into functional system business process management and requirements of our core platform
* Document requirements using agile artefacts (EPIC, User Stories) and analyse information and data as required
* Evaluate information gathered through workshops and surveys, business process description and task analysis
* Effectively communicate with internal and external clients to deliver functional requirements e.g. UI, screen and interface designs
* Acting as an interface between business units, technology teams and support teams
* Maintains up to date knowledge on business related issues through research and fact-finding
* Works with the more senior team members, to understand and resolve technical systems and applications issues
* Implementation and release planning


*The Candidate:*
* 2 - 5 years’ Business Analyst experience
* Public Sector experience (ideally in Health Care)
* A communicative team player
* Understands the ‘start-up’ life
* Agile software development methodology
* Technology-focused
* Process-orientated
* Able to meet deadlines
* Able to articulate a clear vision and road map for service delivery and link to business objectives


*Culture and Personality:*
* Willing to work hard but also have fun
* Good sense of humour
* Entrepreneurial spirit
* An appetite to achieve great things and to help many vulnerable people remain independent in their own homes
* An appetite for learning
* A passion for technology of all types
* An interest in health and wellbeing
* Enjoys a social office atmosphere


*Benefits:*
* 30 days holiday + your birthday + Public Holidays
* Fruits, Coffee, Tea and breakfast all are in office
* Remote working possible
* Private Health Insurance
* Pension scheme
* Office dog (hypoallergenic)
* Relaxed startup environment - your input matters
* Company laptop


*About MySense*
MySense is a wellbeing AI platform that learns an individual’s behavioural patterns and can quickly identify declining health or immediate care needs. We use data from 11 fixed passive sensors placed around an individual’s home and a wearable device. Each sensor picks up a key activity such as toilet usage, sleep patterns, heart-rate and drinking / eating habits (approximately 5,000 data points). This is where our AI kicks in. Our machines learn a personalised weighting model that can alert to indicators of dehydration, malnutrition, declining mobility/ independence and onset of poor physical or mental health.
We sell B2B. Our customers are Councils, Retirement Communities, Housing Associations and Care Providers. The alert notifications and corresponding datasets are shown via a dashboard so they can effectively manage emerging care needs before they escalate. The end user can also nominate carer’s or family to receive notifications via an app.
We’re different because our AI isn’t an after-thought, it’s what has driven us for the start. We collect action-based data and our data scientists and clinical researchers build and refine our algorithms in house. We’re Web 3.0 ready, end users own their own data and can share it with whomever they choose.

Check us out:
"Website":https://www.mysense.ai
"LinkedIn":https://www.linkedin.com/company/mysense

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

items.title: Close: Product Marketing Manager (100% Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=16, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager (100% Remote)

About Us 

At Close, we're building the sales communication and collaboration platform of the future. With our roots as the very first sales CRM to include built-in calling, we're leading the industry in sales automation—helping companies to close more deals, faster than ever. Since our founding in 2013, we've grown to become a fully profitable, 100% globally distributed team of 34 high-performing, happy people that are dedicated to building a product our customers love.

We are seeking a Product Marketing Manager that will be instrumental in defining our product and market positioning and will take ownership of growing our customer base and platform adoption through a wide range of marketing efforts. 

This position requires a highly motivated individual with previous experience leading product marketing and GTM strategy, and who is comfortable in a fast-moving  environment. The successful candidate will be customer-oriented, self-motivated and results-driven.

About You

You have a knack for understanding people. You ask a lot of questions. You’re decisive.

As Product Marketing Manager at Close, your primary job is to understand our customer— what motivates them, what makes their job difficult, and what simply delights them. You will take these constant and ongoing learnings and deftly apply them to the way we position our brand and product to the world. After all, product marketing is at its very core, “people marketing”. 

Your previous experience creating successful go-to-market plans (from high-level strategy down to tactical execution) will enable you to oversee the rollout of all new products and feature updates.  

Sometimes you’ll be looking at our product marketing from a high level view—say, determining our key objectives for the quarter or the year. Other days, you may be down in the weeds yourself, writing landing page copy or working with others on the marketing team to run A/B conversion tests on site. You’re comfortable—and happy—doing both.

What you don’t know, you’ll openly admit, but then you’ll get to work figuring it out (asking others for help and/or digging deep on your own). Your self-motivation and a relentless drive to learn/do more are appreciated by all. You pride yourself on being a “clever thinker”.  You’re comfortable talking with and working alongside our product, sales, development, and customer success teams. You understand your critical part in the overall machine, graciously accepting thoughts and feedback from others while offering your own expertise where you can. You pride yourself on being “overly communicative” -- keeping everyone up to date with the latest product marketing wins, losses, and initiatives.

You are comfortable working remotely as part of a small team, with a high level of autonomy. You can devise your own schedule and effectively manage your workload based on the biggest opportunities and company objectives.

When you’re in the wrong or make a mistake you can admit it. You can articulate why it happened and how you’ve learned from the experience. 

You are in a European or American timezone.

Above all, you understand that your success—and our success—hinges on the satisfaction and loyalty of our customers. 

About The Role

You will be responsible for championing the features and benefits of the Close sales platform through our marketing messaging and market positioning. You’ll work closely with Danny (Director of Marketing) and our motley crew of marketing crushers. 

Just some of the things that will come across your [metaphorical] desk…

Main KPIs

  • Product marketing impact on new trial signups (On-site testing and website updates, email marketing campaigns, increase inquiries from software review and industry sites)
  • Product adoption (free to paid + user activation within app)
  • Product launch/update success metrics (per launch)


“Product superstar, that is what you are…”

  • Develop messaging, positioning, and competitive differentiation of our products in the SaaS/sales market. Own all on-site messaging. Devise the go-to-market strategy for all product launches and feature updates. Oversee the tactical execution of each GTM strategy.
  • Stay on top of the latest trends and tech advancements in the sales and CRM space. Communicate these learnings across the organization, including to our Product, Customer Success, and Development teams.
  • Identify new verticals and areas for business and product expansion. Champion all marketing efforts that relate to these growth initiatives.

Corner the market[ing]

  • Own the product messaging in all of our marketing campaigns and corresponding collateral, which may include, but is not limited to, email, social media, blog posts, sales enablement content, and landing pages.
  • Dive deep into our customer acquisition strategy and execution, driving new trial sign-ups via smart, empathetic product/feature messaging and content. Must be comfortable devising and executing tactics to bring customers down the sales funnel.
  • Work closely with the marketing team to ensure that these brand and product value propositions are communicated consistently across everything we do.
  • Work alongside Product and Customer Success teams to identify key verticals, customer personas/roles, and geos for nuture/expansion. Define and produce the content for SEO-optimized industry-specific landing pages, CRM comparison pages, paid/display ads, other marketing materials, to effectively reach these cohorts.
  • Identify marketing website tests and updates to increase visitor conversion rate (visitor to trial signup). This includes, but is not limited to, A/B testing via copy and messaging, videos/images, and modifications to page designs.
  • Work alongside the marketing content team to identify middle and bottom of the funnel content opportunities such as product-focused white papers, blog posts, videos, and more.
  • Develop, nurture, and execute on partnerships with other vendors in the B2B SaaS and product space (online co-promotions, co-branded content, event sponsorship, etc).
  • Champion our customers via the collection and production of testimonials, case studies, and customer profiles (determining the best way to showcase them -- images, video, etc).
  • Generate verified product reviews from our customers for product comparison and online community websites like Capterra, G2Crowd, and Quora. Monitor and ensure our visibility on these, and other, SaaS review/comparison sites.


Requirements

  • 4+ years experience working within a tech or SaaS organization (extra points if B2B, extra extra points if you can show a correlation between your work and company growth during your time there)
  • 2+ years in a product marketing role, with a track record of successfully taking products to market (devising and executing a GTM strategy)
  • Strong passion for product and ability to ‘speak the same language’ as Product and Development teams (“Scrum, Agile, Javascript, APIs, sprints”, etc, etc)
  • Project management expertise—can coordinate and juggle a variety of projects from conception through production and ensure alignment with other internal teams (Product, Customer Success, Sales, etc).
  • EXPERT command of the English language (written and verbal), with the ability to write in a wide variety of styles. Must be a copywriting pro—masterfully creating short, value-packed, relatable content to drive new conversions.
  • Foundational knowledge of common marketing analytics and campaign management platforms (analytics, popular ESPs, ad networks, social platforms, etc)

Bonus points for the following skill sets:
  • Front-end coding (HTML/CSS/JS, GitHub)
  • Design and video (editing, Photoshop, graphics creation, etc)
  • Familiarity with SaaS finance and reporting 


Why Close?

  • 100% Remote (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • 2 x Annual Team Retreats ✈️ (Lisbon Retreat Video)
  • Competitive salary
  • Medical, Dental with HSA option - 99% premiums paid (US residents)
  • 5 Weeks PTO + 6 Government Holidays + Dec 24 - Jan 1 Company Holiday
  • Parental Leave (10 wks primary caregiver / 4 wks secondary caregiver)
  • 401k matching at 4% (US residents)
  • 1 month paid sabbatical after 5 years
  • Our story and team 
  • Glassdoor Reviews 

At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practicing a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don’t have strict policies, we have guidelines. Work/Life harmony is an important part of our organization - we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self-care (whatever that looks like for you).

We come from 12 countries and 14 states; a collection of talented humans rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles, and cultures. Twice a year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. We see these retreats as an opportunity to strengthen the social fiber of our community.

This team is growing in more ways than one - we’ve recently launched 8 babies (and counting!). Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is “Build a house you want to live in.” We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our organization. At Close, we have a high care factor for one another, in making an awesome product and championing the success of our customers.  

Interested in Close but don't think this role is the best fit for you? View our other positions.

items.title: Uscreen: Marketing Intern
items.content:
Marketing Intern

Ready to create some magic? Are you a smart, motivated individual seeking to jump into an awesome growing company within the video space?

Our marketing team is growing and we’re looking for amazing talent to join our pack. This position is best suited for a creative junior marketer who goes outside traditional marketing and really get’s creative and finds ways to build awareness.

Our team is incredibly passionate, smart, supportive, skilled, open to learning, happy to take constructive criticism and use it to level up. We’re looking for someone who can match that energy and help us scale.

Our mission is to help creators monetize videos.

Here’s what you will do:


  • Come up with creative ideas to help promote the Uscreen platform.

  • Use different mediums from video, social media, content, and other platforms to help create and build awareness.

  • Work with the marketing team to perfect and improve processes and bring new content ideas to the table.

  • Be involved with the product team to deliver ideas and improvements to better the platform.

  • Have a deep understanding of the industry and the product and find various ways to promote the product.

We’re looking for someone with:


  • Thinks out of the box, outside of transitional marketing.

  • Prior experience in marketing and also an understanding of marketing and buyer behavior.

  • A strong understanding of SAAS and ways to market SAAS businesses.

  • Smart and motivated.

  • Independent but can also work in a team environment.

  • Full time availability.  We love contractors but want someone to be part of our team and in our culture.

Here’s what you’ll get if you join us:


  • Work from anywhere, we are a remote team

  • Growth & competitive salary

  • Annual retreats with all expenses paid.

  • Full-time (40 hours per week) remote job with contract. We want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance / part-time position you can do in tandem with other professional endeavors

  • 20 paid days off per year (eligible after the first 6 months with the company)

How to apply:


Before applying, please note:

  • Apply using the link below

  • We review the applications and email candidates who qualify for the second round

  • The qualified candidates will be asked to do a test task: usually a video of yourself answering a few questions

  • After we review the submissions, we will organize a Skype interview with the successful candidates

Heads up! Due to the high volume of applications, we are thrilled to receive, at this time we are only able to respond to successful candidates.

APPLY HERE

items.title: Evening/Weekend Client Relations Associate
items.content:
Evening/Weekend Client Relations Associate

Support
California or Texas
$15 per hour
Company: Abacus Credit Counseling
Part Time

Overview

NOTE: The current position is for California and Texas applicants only.

We are looking for an Evening/Weekend Client Relations Associate who enjoys helping people!

As a Client Relations Associate, you’ll play a vital role in interacting with and supporting clients over the phone and online chat as they complete our budget and debt counseling course. We’re looking for individuals who can effectively explain details about the course, answer questions, and lead clients through the process, with a positive and helpful approach. We’ll provide the necessary financial basics you’ll need to work with clients.

The current position is part-time, and would include a shift on the weekend and 1-2 weeknight shifts. In your application, please describe your schedule and availability.

The company is headquartered in Los Angeles, but our Client Relations Associates work from home. . A quiet working environment is required.

This is a work-from-home position

Responsibilities:

– Provide outstanding support to Abacus clients

– Resolve inbound requests via phone, online chat and email

– Explain technical issues to clients in a way they can understand

– Use internal tracking tools to manage client issues

– Must be available to work on 1 weekend day and 1-2 weeknights every week

Qualifications:

– 1+ year experience in client service, retail or education

– Bachelor’s degree preferred

– Strong written and verbal communication skills

– Well organized and able to multi-task

– Able to work independently and as a team player

Pay:

– $15/hour

Job Type:

– Part-time



To apply for this job please send your job application to the email below.

Please reference Jobspresso in your application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

lahart@abacuscc.org

items.title: Marketing Automation Specialist
items.content:
Marketing Automation Specialist at SmartAcre

Remote | Entry-level

– Denver, Colorado

NATIONWIDE | PENNSYLVANIA | COLORADO

Position Description:
As a member of the SmartAcre marketing technology team, you will help clients optimize and manage their marketing and sales technology stack to better align marketing, sales, and service throughout the customer journey. If you love using tools like HubSpot, Pardot, Marketo, Salesforce, Drift, Vidyard, and more to deliver great experiences to customers while transforming marketing and sales, we want to hear from you.

We reward people who can think AND do. We like to work with people who love what they do, work hard, take initiative, and aren’t satisfied with “good enough.” If this describes you, you are talented, and you are ready to join and contribute to our growing agency, continue on. Interested applicants must have 1 to 3 years of experience helping businesses implement and manage marketing automation platforms like Pardot, HubSpot, Marketo, and/or Salesforce. The right candidate understands not only the nuts and bolts for these platforms, but can also skillfully incorporate these tools into demand generation campaigns that drive results for clients.

This position will support the Director of Marketing and Sales Technology. You will actively participate on client calls, helps prepare weekly status reports as needed, and complete assigned tasks. You’ll also be super inquisitive, accurate, and continually look for ways to bring value to clients by leveraging marketing and sales technologies.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Be an agency go-to resource for all things marketing and sales technology including marketing automation, CRM, and analytics.
  • Work and contribute within the marketing and sales technology team alongside other consultants, effectively completing tasks assigned to you by your Director or Consultants.
  • Execute audit, consulting, implementation, and managed campaign projects for clients using marketing and sales technologies (HubSpot, Pardot, Marketo, and/or Salesforce).
  • Project manage agency and client MA, CRM, and campaign deliverables. Help prepare client communication and documentation and actively participate in weekly client status calls.
  • Continually stay on top of and ahead of the changing marketing and sales technology landscape, maintaining certifications and training within platforms like Salesforce, Pardot, Marketo, and HubSpot.
  • Contribute to SmartAcre’s internal marketing, branding, and growth initiatives through blogging, developing content, and executing lead generation campaigns.
  • Educate and translate requirements for sales and marketing automation projects, asset creation for campaigns, etc., to creative and development team resources.
  • Have experience with B2B lead to revenue lifecycle, including understanding opportunity stages, MA to CRM field mapping, lead attribution and reporting, and lead scoring.
  • Demonstrate solid writing skills and work with the Account teams to create marketing content like blogs, emails, web page content, and other lead generation assets.
  • Continuously monitor and optimize marketing campaigns based on KPIs and ongoing feedback.
  • Understand, track, and report on campaign performance metrics, revenue attribution, revenue influence, and ROI.

Required Experience:

  • A minimum of 1 to 3+ years experience running campaigns in at least 2 of the platforms listed in this job description.
  • Proven experience working on multiple projects at a time.
  • Working knowledge of and at least 2 certifications in marketing automation tools including HubSpot, Pardot, Marketo and Salesforce.
  • Troubleshooting, technical problem-solving skills and QA skill.
  • A passion for marketing, being challenged, and helping to make your clients win.
  • Related degree.

Compensation:

  • Salary: $50k to $70k
  • Unlimited vacation and paid holidays at date of hire.
  • Work from anywhere opportunity!
  • Great benefits, including multiple healthcare options, dental coverage, 401k.

Why SmartAcre:

  • Since 2008 we have been delivering for our clients. We are passionate and a growing team, and continue to operate with the agility and energy of a start-up, with the added benefit of job security.
  • We value and reward highly entrepreneurial people who want to contribute to their own growth, as well as agency growth.
  • You will never stop learning. You will have the opportunity to advance your certifications, attend events, and be a thought-leader.
  • Help SmartAcre continue our growth as a 2 time honoree on the Inc5000 list of fastest growing private companies.
Apply for job

items.title: Account Based Marketing Manager
items.content:
We are an Intelligent Risk Management (IRM) platform giving financial services SMEs and corporates tools to manage regulatory processes and risk in real-time.

Our platform is designed to digitise, automate and streamline processes across all customer onboarding, compliance and audit activity. By better serving the needs of back office teams (whilst integrating seamlessly with CRM systems used by front office teams) our clients can deliver exceptional customer experiences – maximising the conversion, profitability and scalability of their business.

What you’ll be doing

Working closely with our founders, as ABM Marketing Manager you’ll be responsible for developing, managing and executing account based marketing plans that support our sales objectives and drive pipeline in our target customer and prospect accounts.

You’ll work across multiple channels - including digital, direct, events & social - to drive forward integrated initiatives that meet the needs of varied account segments.

You’ll be central in educating on and embedding ABM initiatives into our growth strategy, collaborating closely with Sales and Customer Success to ensure our goals are aligned, the impact of ABM programmes are optimised.

Data will be absolutely central to your role - to inform your strategy, and build comprehensive account profiles and target personas to align the team on. We also see you as a key driver of improving and evolving our approach - including ideal customer personas and targets, strategic product messaging, and customer segmentation - alongside what systems and processes will help us succeed.

It’s a fantastic chance to have a big impact in a scaling startup.

What we need from you

You are an experienced lead generation marketer within B2B tech companies - with ideally some key account marketing experience
You’ll be able to evidence a great track record of planning, executing and delivering lead generation goals through integrated marketing campaigns - backed up by success metrics around pipeline, acquisition, and growth
An understanding of financial services in the UK is a must have (any knowledge of IT, Operations, Compliance and/or Risk Buyer personas with Financial Services would be a great bonus!)
You have a collaborative mindset, actively working together with key internal teams to inform your strategy and ensure everyone is aligned
You have hands-on data and analytics experience using CRM and/or marketing automation software
You’re looking for a dynamic startup culture - you thrive on ownership, managing multiple projects, flexing to business needs, and be a proactive problem solver.
You have a curious mind, with an appetite to learn new things.
What we offer in return

Equity! We want you to succeed as we do
Great location - we’re central to three stations and sandwiched between Brick Lane and Spitalfields market
An annual learning & development budget to spend on professional or personal development, we’re invested in both
Birthday off - relax and put your feet up
Subsidised access to mental health services
Discounts to services and products
Salary sacrifice schemes via Enjoy Benefits: including Cycle to Work and Gym Membership
Equally Enhanced Maternity/Paternity/Shared Leave pay
25 days holiday + 8 bank holiday days you can use as and when you prefer
Unlimited unpaid leave
1 week “work from anywhere”
Generous 5% Pension contributions - investing in your future is important
Pick your own equipment and kit
Biscuits… we’re a bit obsessed. We have a weekly ‘guest’ biscuit to broaden your biscuit horizons.

items.title: Product Designer UX/UI
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
At PassFort, we share a powerful vision to enable businesses & individuals to establish trust online. We currently do this by giving regulated businesses the tools they need to automate and digitalise the onboarding, verification and management of their customers - that means customers can be onboarded in real-time, without ever having met in person.

And this is just the beginning - our technology allows us to define what ‘trust’ means across the digital economy. Our long term aim is to create a single network where people and businesses can share their digital identity securely and interchangeably - whether they’re applying for a mortgage, listing on the stock market, or applying for a new job. We're transforming how trust is established online, in the same way that Salesforce transformed sales, Stripe transformed payments and AWS transformed DevOps.

What you’ll be doing

You’ll work with other designers, product managers and engineers to help solve complex user-software problems. You’ll be a voice for our users and their needs. An internal champion for exceptional product quality and the need for cohesive experiences.

On a day-to-day basis you’ll be involved in all parts of the design process. You’ll take part in user research, uncovering and documenting under served user needs. You’ll go wide in looking for solutions to user problems, generating multiple low-fidelity potential solutions.

Using your inclusive, open and transparent approach to work, you’ll seek out feedback from users, stakeholders and colleagues throughout the design process, receiving in good faith and using new insights to inform the direction of your work.

Your solutions will be simple and elegant and make use of the PassFort design system which you will help to maintain and evolve.

What we’re looking for

Excellent interaction design skills: You’ll have an understanding of multi-step and cross-platform flows. Proficiency in sketching and wireframing features and user journeys, and an understanding for the need to design for different potential states (errors, successes, dead-ends).
Strong visual design skills: layout, visual hierarchy, colour, typography, and iconography.
An understanding of how user research fits into the design process: You’ll be aware of different methodologies and when to use them.
Desire to continually learn, develop your skills and evolve as a designer and have the confidence and maturity to experiment with new research and design approaches as well as new methods and tooling.
Strong attention to detail.
Ability to be comfortable with, and embrace ambiguity.
Working knowledge of Sketch.
A portfolio showing your process and decision-making skills, as well as the final deliverables.
The Perks!

Equity! We want you to succeed as we do
Great location - we’re central to three stations and sandwiched between Brick Lane and Spitalfields market
An annual learning & development budget to spend on professional or personal development, we’re invested in both
Birthday off - relax and put your feet up
Subsidised access to mental health services
Discounts to services and products
Salary sacrifice schemes via Enjoy Benefits: including Cycle to Work and Gym Membership
Equally Enhanced Maternity/Paternity/Shared Leave pay
25 days holiday + 8 bank holiday days you can use as and when you prefer
Unlimited unpaid leave
1 week “work from anywhere”
Generous 5% Pension contributions - investing in your future is important
Pick your own equipment and kit
Biscuits… we’re a bit obsessed. We have a weekly ‘guest’ biscuit to broaden your biscuit horizons.

items.title: Toggl: Product Marketer
items.content:
Product Marketer

Toggl is an easy to use and flexible time tracking tool that helps 3+ million users see where their work time goes, so they can focus on the projects that really matter. It also works on all your devices, and integrates with over a 100 tools. 

Our team is looking for a product marketer to help us bring our tools in front of new audiences.

The role
You will be working alongside our marketing and product teams on promoting our apps and their features to new audiences via paid media campaigns as well as through our blog and social media. You will be the key player between our product and marketing teams, making sure our audiences understand the key benefits of the different Toggl offerings.

About you
You'll fit in well at Toggl if you appreciate freedom and like to take ownership of your work. You know how to work together with others and how to solve problems in a group. Toggl is also the perfect place for you if you like to bringing your own ideas to the table!

About our team
Toggl is a distributed team of 80+ people working remotely from 30 countries. We take pride in our professional, learning-oriented and friendly working environment that values work-life balance and constantly doing our best in every aspect of our work. You can work from anywhere in the world, because we know great people do awesome work wherever they are. Every few months we travel to meet up somewhere in the world and spend some quality time together. Our business is profitable with a healthy margin and we’re built with no outside investments, so you can count on a stable working environment.

Some benefits
  • Freedom to choose when and where you work from.
  • 28 calendar days of paid time off a year, plus your local holidays.
  • 2 company retreats plus 2 team meetups a year (expenses covered) for team-building.
  • Laptop and a €2,000 budget to set up your home office.
  • Reimbursement for co-working space rent or internet service at home.
  • Opportunities to attend trainings, workshops or conferences.
  • Monthly reimbursement for gym membership, massage and other things to improve your health.
  • Support for buying a phone, eyeglasses or tools you need for doing your best work.

The salary for this position is EUR 45,000 annually.

APPLY NOW
All it takes to apply is answering a short skills test that assesses your expertise and no other biased criteria. Please note that only candidates who take the test will be considered.

Free Toggl t-shirt for those who do well on the test!
