tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Marketing Analyst

Marketing
Various US States
Company: Creative Market
Full Time

Overview

 is the world’s marketplace for design — a platform where creators across the globe buy and sell digital design assets. We’re passionate about building tools and experiences that make beautiful, effective design simple and accessible to everyone. Our platform is used by millions and we’re growing rapidly. We need your help to continue to craft our product with purpose and intention.

Creative Market

Data is integral to Creative Market’s decision-making processes and learnings-driven culture. As our Marketing Analyst, you’ll help us dramatically increase the number of people who buy and sell on the marketplace by discovering insights from large quantities of data and partnering closely with marketing and cross-functional teams. You will be fluent in data analysis tools (esp. SQL) and will be able to serve as a technical expert, leader, and champion for marketing analytics at Creative Market.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead efforts to define and build success metrics for Marketing programs and campaigns.
  • Manage campaigns on existing prospect channels for Creative Market to increase discoverability and conversion.
  • Own campaigns from end to end: manage creative process, targeting and segmentation, planning, execution, reporting, and optimization.
  • A/B Test campaigns to trial new ideas for effectiveness.
  • Leverage data/analytics to continuously improve and make sound business decisions.
  • Anticipate and define marketing reporting needs. Work with existing analysts, engineering, product, and marketing teams to produce high-quality raw data, and build reporting processes to make that data valuable to stakeholders across Creative Market.
  • Run exploratory analysis uncover new areas of opportunity, generate hypotheses, and quickly assess the potential upside of a given opportunity. Monitor, optimize, and report on marketing and growth metrics and split-test results. Make recommendations based on analytics and test findings.
  • Maintain a culture of high-quality output, learnings, and exceptional customer service.  Ensure that work gets done well and on time, respond effectively to changing priorities, and reallocate resources as necessary.
  • Effectively present and communicate analysis at all levels to guide understanding and efficient, high-quality decisions.

    • Required Qualifications:
    • Minimum 2+ years of proven work experience in a marketing-focused data analytics role within a B2C company.
    • Exceptional SQL skills at scale. Your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be the key to your success.
    • Ambitious self-starter with excellent follow-through skills.
    • Experience working with marketing tools including email, web analytics, and CRM.
    • Familiarity with SEO/SEM and Google Analytics and strong analytical abilities.
    • Knowledge of technical data tools and methods, including data engineering, descriptive and predictive statistics, experimentation, and data visualization.
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills on quantitative topics for technical, non-technical, and executive audiences.
    • Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving ability. An ability to answer unstructured business questions and work independently to drive projects to conclusion.
    • Capacity to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
    • Strong knowledge of statistics. This includes experimental design for optimization, statistical significance, confidence intervals, and predictive analytics techniques.
    • Must be self-directed, organized, and detail oriented as well as have the ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced, distributed environment.
    • Active team player, positive attitude, and good work ethic.
    • Problem-solver. Must come up with creative solutions to business challenges.
    • You come up with creative solutions to challenging problems.

      • Desired Qualifications
      • Experience with SQL, Segment, Amplitude, and/or Looker.
      • Experience working alongside marketing and data science teams.
      • Experience working in a marketplace or e-commerce business.
      • Experience working at a high-growth startup.
      • BA or BS degree in a quantitative field such as economics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering.

        • Creative Market actively encourages applicants from all backgrounds, races, gender identities, and orientations, because we believe that diversity makes for better companies.

        We’re a 40-person Series A startup that works remotely with employees in Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Idaho, Minnesota, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Texas, and Washington.

        Apply for job

items.title: Paid Marketing Manager
items.content:
Paid Marketing Manager at Highrise

Remote | International

REMOTE

MARKETING

Highrise is a casual mobile game and community where people make avatars, design art and environments and meet new friends. We are building on the spirit of applications like Animal Crossing, The Sims, Habbo Hotel and Second Life.

Over 3 million people create avatars, chat and make friends in Highrise. We are a fully remote team of 20 backed by YCombinator, Bessemer, Maveron and other leading investors.

About the Role

We are looking for our first paid marketing manager. You will own the entire paid marketing function at Highrise. This is our first full-time marketing role and comes with a wide variety of responsibilities: scaling our marketing infrastructure, establishing marketing best practices, selecting and testing various ad networks, and managing artists to generate high performing creatives. You’ll be working closely with our CEO, product designers and artists.

This role will give you the opportunity to…

  • Build an entire marketing infrastructure for creating, managing and tracking performance ads
  • Work with a wide variety of ad technologies and publishers
  • Establish processes and best practices for segmentation, targeting and creative
  • Work closely with the CEO to establish ROAS and growth KPIs
  • Long-term, grow the paid marketing team with full-time hires and interns

To be successful in this role, we’d expect you to…

  • Have 3+ years experience managing UA for a successful mobile application
  • Know how to craft a story with marketing while…
  • Analytically assessing marketing metrics like ROI, ROAS, CPI, CPA, etc.
  • Have some experience integrating ROI-focused analytics into mobile products
  • Have some experience with mobile attribution analytics
  • Communicate effectively with both artists and product managers
  • Know how to write clearly and succinctly, as this is a fully remote position

Within 3 months you’ll…

  • Evaluate our marketing infrastructure and spec out improvements
  • Evaluate our analytics infrastructure and spec out improvements
  • Evaluate our current marketing efforts and define a roadmap for running yield-focused hypotheses
  • Develop a working relationship with artists, engineers and product designers at Highrise
  • Develop a deep understanding of user motivations in Highrise after conducting dozens of user interviews

Within 6 months you’ll…

  • Implement a sustainable, long-term marketing and analytics infrastructure
  • Execute on a performance marketing roadmap that might involve paid social, paid search and influencer marketing
  • Tracking ROI and ROAS on a continuous basis
  • Work closely with artists and animators to develop a creative pipeline

Within 12 months you’ll…

  • Manage a marketing budget of $1M+/month
  • Hire user acquisition analysts and interns to improve operations
  • Hire artists, animators or agencies to scale marketing’s creative team
  • Contribute to the strategic direction and vision for the company and its products
Apply for job

items.title: Product Manager (f/m/div) // Perdoo
items.content:
Product Manager (f/m/div) // Perdoo

Company: Perdoo

Tags:

As our Product Manager, your primary responsibility will be ensuring we ship the right features. You’ll be conducting customer research, designing features and planning their implementation in close collaboration with our CTO & Engineering Team.

We expect you to solve the complex task of feature design & prioritization by interfacing with all departments, our founders and most importantly our customers, to make the right decisions. Goal management is a brand new category of software, so you’ll need to be both highly creative and analytical to make this happen.

About Perdoo

We’re an ambitious team of entrepreneurs excited about building the next big thing in B2B. Perdoo helps companies turn ambition into reality with our SaaS tool which is based on OKR, a goal management framework used by top-achieving businesses like Google and LinkedIn.

By focusing companies around common objectives, we help them fix the broken link between strategy and execution so that everyone can work together on a clear path towards success. Many well-known companies throughout the world already trust us and our product.

As our Product Manager you’ll:

  • Decide what gets built
  • Ensure that what we ship is awesome and has a real impact
  • Conduct customer research & prioritize our product pipeline for maximum impact
  • Design features, write up the requirements and make sure everyone is clear on what we’re building and why
  • Plan sprints and coordinate with our Engineering Team
  • Continuously analyse and monitor the features that we’ve shipped, and most important, the overall UX

Required Skills / Experience

If you care a lot about what you do, creating the workplace of tomorrow and having a real impact on the company’s success, then Perdoo is the right place for you.

  • You love what you do and believe in what we’re building here at Perdoo
  • 2+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally with knowledge of software products
  • You solve problems by combining your creative and analytical skills
  • You’re a good listener and can get to the essence of requirements
  • Native or fluent English language skill

What we offer

  • Contribute to a real-life product, used by hundreds of high profile companies
  • Work in a dynamic, exciting and fun startup environment where every person has a voice and can have a real impact on company success
  • Flexible working hours, frequent team events and exceptional co-workers
  • Beautiful office in the heart of the city with an awesome rooftop, with catered lunch and regular after-work drinks & BBQs
  • A fully stocked kitchen
  • A competitive base salary, benefits and employee stock option plan
  • Team retreats twice a year to a remote location. Last time we took the team to Lanzarote!

If you are interested, please apply right here: https://www.perdoo.com/careers/#job-293033

Apply for this position

items.content:
We are searching for creative, bold, funny Intern who can help us with our social media. The internship would include proofreading of content and thinking of some crazy ideas on how to promote our business.

About us

Remote Bob is connecting remote employees from Croatia with London based start-ups. We have a team in London and in Croatia, our co-founders are both serial entrepreneurs with an MBA.

We are enabling London based start-ups to outsource their projects and departments to Croatia without
compromising on quality. Here, in Remote Bob, we can reassure all our clients that the delivered work will be exceptional. Our remote employees are based in the EU, and we are offering local support; recruitment, people management, training, quality check and payroll. With our help, working with a remote team has never been easier!

Our team is relaxed, friendly bunch of enthusiasts with a business background and vision to change the world.

Benefits

A chance to be a significant part of creating the biggest hub with remote employees in Croatia, gaining knowledge from co-founders and to earn a competitive salary.

items.content:
Drops

Social Media Manager and Copywriter


EU-only
If you have a soft spot for bootstrapped, profitable, hyper-growth startups with a meaningful product, you might quite like this rare opening with a flexible work environment at Drops. You also have a knack for writing intelligent, witty copy; you probably take photos in your free time, dabble with Lightroom, and your IG game is beyond strong.

**About us:**

Drops’ goal is to turn language learning into a delightful, effective game. Our primary app, Drops, has been in the App Store for over 3 years, teaches 33 languages, and was featured by both the App Store and Play Store multiple times. It was Google’s Best App of 2018. We are a small, passionate remote team mainly spread across Europe, with a small outpost in California. We mostly work synchronously, so working hour overlap does matter for us. The company is still run by the founders. We communicate via Slack, Git, and Trello. We want to be the no.1 app for vocabulary learning and we are getting there quickly with our current user base of 14 million, a monthly active of >1,500,000 and an average store rating of 4.7.

You can find us here: http://drops.app.link/



# Responsibilities
**You will:**

Be responsible for all social media, with major emphasis on Instagram.
Edit all content, as well as writing a good bit of it.
Make all content written by another team member sound almost as witty and brilliant as your own.
Develop and pitch creative campaigns with indisputable success metrics.
Ideate and collaborate with our product and marketing teams on all projects that involve social media or content marketing, and any other projects you find interesting.
Persuade our product developers and marketing team to integrate social media.
Strike envy in the hearts and minds of the social media managers of our competitors.
You will work with our legal advisor to execute influencer contracts.
Strike envy in the hearts of the social media managers of our competitors.

# Requirements
**You have:**

* A proven social media and content management track record - including executed, impactful creative campaigns.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and the ability to work well cross-functionally.
* You are native in these softwares: G-suite (docs, spreadsheet, etc), Slack, Trello, Planoly, Excel/Numbers, Words/Pages, Adobe Creative Suite
* Project management experience (everyone is managing projects at Drops)

**Our Ideal Candidate:**

* You live in Europe, or within the GMT time zone + or - 2 hours.
* You speak and write native English.
* You’re a social media maven. You have undeniable examples of how you elevated your brand—or the brand of a company—via creative social media engagement--especially through Instagram
* You’re sufficiently well spoken—and well written—in long-form and social media lingo. Your editing skills are as good or better than your writing skills.
* You hate useless punctuation, but love full stops.,
* You detest inconsistent capitalization You know that true em dashes are always better than --.
* You love finding the perfect post or campaign that sparks a fire.
* You love tracking and measuring just how intense that fires gets.
* You don’t just know and use best social media best practices but blaze trail with never-been-seen ideas.
* You can make that fire spark another. Maybe you’re not a maven. Maybe you’re a social pyromaniac.
* You stalk the most unapproachable of influencers and can negotiate anything for a free license.
* You’re a perfectionist re: all media you use--prefer creating your own visual assets, but can cost-efficiently manage in-house or outsourced designers for the bigger stuff.
* You love proving - preferably with numbers - to engineers that social media and content do matter. In acquisitions, in retention, in $.
* You love language learning, whether you’re good at it or not. At the very least, you’re willing to obsess over what makes language learners tick.
* We’re building a small, but super capable team. You’re naturally more interested in the fate of the product & driven to grow professionally, than in managing people.
* We are looking for a missionary rather than a mercenary.
* We value clear and honest communication and transparency - it’s the linchpin of our culture and current success, and freedom. You will be involved in both high and low level decision making, and will be available during European working hours (9AM - 6PM GMT).





#Location
- EU-only

items.title: Revenue Cycle Analyst (Remote)
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Job Description

This position can be a remote, 100% work from home opportunity. Our home office is located in the Chicago land area but the role can be either home based or in office.

Job Description:

We offer payment and revenue integrity solutions that help health payers improve revenue, avoid costs, and enhance the member experience. We offer a unique combination of deep healthcare expertise and analytics-powered technology solutions to help our clients improve operational efficiency, achieve financial integrity, and generate measurable results.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:

The Revenue Cycle Specialist is responsible for preparing and submitting submissions to clients, identifying discrepancies and analyzing issues to ensure inventory moves from operations to the client in a timely fashion. In addition, this person will work closely with management and the client services team to improve response times and revenue conversion. Other responsibilities include: working with finance to ensure revenue is recognized, processing electronic requests, development inventory reporting, preparing and submitting spreadsheets to management and clients.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & JOB FUNCTION:

Complies with HIPAA regulations as well as We s HIPAA and Information Security policies and procedures, including required training and incident reporting

Prepare and review weekly/ monthly import and export files to ensure accuracy and format in accordance with client requirements

Analyze open inventory to identify areas of concern and strategize with the We leadership team to help move forward

Work with client services team and operations management on improving conversion rate and response times

Develop key reporting metrics to help ensure the health of our pipeline and conversion

Assist with client requested reporting and other ad hoc reporting requests from We leadership

Required Skills:

Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Access) and system databases required

Excellent organization skills and the ability to multitask required

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Job Location:

Remote

Job Type:

Full-Time/Regular

Required Experience:

Bachelor s degree in finance, accounting or business or three (3) years of accounting/finance/analytics experience required

Knowledge of basic accounting or finance practices; previous experience in a finance, analytics or accounting role preferred

Company Description

We are a leader in providing solutions, consulting, and analytics for healthcare clients.

items.title: Paid Media Specialist
items.content:
Paid Media Specialist at Litmus

Remote
  • United States
  • Full Time
  • Marketing
  • Mid Level

Who is Litmus:

Major global brands across every industry and vertical trust Litmus to make email better, including 9 of the top 10 ecommerce brands, 7 of the top 10 technology companies, and 23 of the top 25 US ad agencies.

Backed by $49M from Spectrum Equity, the Litmus email creation, testing, and analytics platform empowers marketers, designers, and agencies to confidently deliver customer experiences that ensure brand alignment and quality, as well as maximize performance and deliverability.

What would I do at Litmus?

Litmus is looking for a performance marketing specialist. This person will be responsible for launching, developing, managing and optimizing campaigns across all media channels.

Responsibilities include:

  • Own paid media efforts across all channels (including paid search, paid social, and display)
  • Maintain agency, vendor and contractor relationships, ensuring timely deliverables and strong performance
  • Plan, execute and consistently optimize campaigns across multiple account types
  • Develop and manage landing page optimization strategy across all campaigns
  • Deliver campaign reporting to stakeholders
  • Forecast budgets and monitor spend, pacing and results in partnership with the VP of Marketing

What is Litmus looking for in a candidate?

  • 3-5 years of marketing experience in media planning, buying, or analytics
  • Experience with optimizing paid search, ideally for a B2B marketing organization
  • Experience with Salesforce and Google Analytics
  • Knowledgeable about SEO and conversion rate optimization best practices

Why should I choose Litmus?

We offer everything you’d expect from a financially successful and profitable startup, and we’ve been going strong for ten years.

  • Great salary and stock options, comprehensive health care benefits, and a generous retirement plan match.
  • 28 days of paid vacation—that’s on top of team retreats and public holidays.
  • Remote-friendly culture. No matter where you are, you’ll feel connected to the team. Over half of our employees work remotely. Your work experience is just as exciting, entertaining, and engaging wherever you choose to work from.
  • Family friendly. Flexible schedules along with generous maternity and paternity policies.
  • Fantastic professional training to keep your skills sharp.
  • The best tools and technology money can buy. Top of the line hardware, software, and whatever else you need to be awesome.

It’s the company you keep. The people at Litmus are truly amazing, each in their own way. With outstanding profitable growth and the trust of more than 250,000 marketers you know you’re part of a winning team.

Apply for job

items.content:
Job Title:Performance Marketing Manager

Company:Maddox Events

Department:Marketing

Location:Kennington Park Business Centre, 1, 3 Brixton Rd, London SW9 6D

Reporting to:Head of Digital Marketing

Working Hours:09:00 – 17:30 – (Monday to Thursday) / 09:00 – 16:00 (Friday)

___________________________________________________________________

About Maddox Events
Maddox Events is the UK’s fastest growing events company that is tripling in size year on year. In 2019 we are targeting £15 million in total revenue. We aim to deliver exceptional experiences and thought-provoking content to our audiences. To build thriving global communities around our event portfolios and in doing so, irreversibly changing the landscape for professionals and cementing Maddox Events brand at the forefront of the Diversity and Inclusion conversation. The company owns the world leading Women in Technology brand which is attracting over 16,000 participants in eight locations in 2019 alone. This is the fastest growing conference series on the planet and the flagship event, Women of Silicon Roundabout, which takes place in London, will be welcoming over 6,000 delegates for the biggest Women in Tech event in Europe. On the back of the huge success of the Tech summits and in order to broaden the reach and impact of their events, the company is now also running Women of the Square Mile, Women in Law, Women in Sport and Women in Sales events.

Main Purpose
Reporting to the Head of Digital Marketing the Performance Manager will be a key part of the Marketing across digital channels for all conferences within the Events portfolio.

Responsibilities
End to End Acquisition Marketing Campaigns including Paid search, Display, Paid social and Organic Search.
Reviewing, implementing and managing web tracking across all websites including using Google Tag Manager in addition to Google analytics and different ad platform tracking.
Managing marketing automation processes
Working with the Web Development and Content Marketing teams on SEO.
Working with the Creative team to create and test assets.
A/B Testing and conversion rate optimization.
Monitoring and reporting on a comprehensive list of KPI’s related to digital channels.

Educational Level/Experience
Essential
3+ years proven track record in digital marketing.
Strong experience across performance marketing channels i.e. Search, Display, Paid Social.
Practical knowledge of SEO best practices and how to implement them.
Advanced Proficiency in Google Analytics, Tag Manager, Google Ads and Facebook Ads & LinkedIn Ads.
Strong copywriting skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel.

Desirable
Experience with Google Data Studio
Experience of automation tools and CRM systems.
Educated to Degree Level.
Experience with Outbrain

Personal Skills
Strive for achievement by doing the best you can.
Act with respect towards your colleagues and work collaboratively to help the organisation succeed.
Work with enthusiasm and take pride in who we are and what we do as an organisation.
Ability to support colleagues and appreciate our diversity.
Take responsibility and ownership for your own work.
Flexible, can-do attitude with the ability to react calmly in a pressurised situation.
Attention & accuracy to detail.
Strong business acumen and commercial awareness.
Desire to develop as a strong sales professional.
Excellent research skills and able to make strong commercial decisions based on analysis.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Ability to work to tight deadlines and prioritise workload.
Results driven yet customer focused.
Ability to own and follow-through on projects required and issues raised.
Excellent organisational and time management skills.
Problem solver.
Ability to maintain and build strong business partnerships with colleagues and third-party organisations.
Approach everything with integrity in what you do.
Deliver excellent customer satisfaction and living our Maddox values.
Promote strong team ethics.
Sales and target driven.

Benefits
Work for the UK’s fastest growing events company.
25% off Virgin Experiences.
Early finish on a Friday.
Pension scheme.
Gym membership.
Possibility of international travel to some of the world’s best cities.

If you believe that you are a suitable candidate and are looking for a fantastic opportunity to work at the fastest growing events company in the UK with year on year growth of 250% then please apply now

items.title: Human Resources Business Partner - Remote / Home Office possibility
items.content:
We are seeking a Human Resources Business Partner to join our team! items.title: Instana: Senior Product Designer – Monitoring & Performance
items.content:
Senior Product Designer – Monitoring & Performance

We’re seeking a Senior Product Designer who can empathize with technical users to define the future of performance management of modern technologies and businesses. As part of a small team at a quickly growing startup, the role requires involvement in all steps of the design process.

This role involves close collaboration with product management and engineering, from product discovery to implementation. And as one of the early members of the design team, there is the opportunity to define and establish the design practice and workflow.

Ideal Candidate

  • Facilitates and establishes user-centered, problem driven design with all disciplines
  • Has a technical background in software engineering and/or operations and experience in solving problems for software developers and/or operators
  • Works as part of a cross-functional delivery team
  • Develops and maintains understanding of customers, stakeholders, users, their pain points, and workflows
  • Builds wireframes, mockups, prototypes to communicate, develop, and challenge ideas
  • Produces user interfaces and visual assets for implementation
  • Understands and continuously influences product analytics from product capability
  • Works lightweight user testing and short iterations into day-to-day
  • Incorporates business constraints into design decisions and continually pushes to overcome these constraints
  • Is fluent in written and spoken English

Location

We have a partially remote team, and are currently hiring from:

  • Austria
  • France
  • Germany
  • Netherlands
  • Serbia
  • Spain
  • UK

If you prefer to work out of an office, you're welcome to join us in one of our product hubs in Düsseldorf, Munich, or Novi Sad.

We look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: SaaS Content Marketer

items.content:
SaaS Content Marketer at Crossbeam

Remote | Freelance

REMOTE · Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States · Marketing

DESCRIPTION
Crossbeam is growing fast. We’ve developed a new category of software that allows companies to build more valuable partnerships through private and secure data sharing. We’re rapidly onboarding customers and are ready to show the rest of the business world who we are. That’s where you come in.

You will work with our executive team to build and run the “category creation” playbook that makes Crossbeam into a respected thought leader in SaaS. Your work will span whitepapers, blog posts, research reports, social media, marketing emails, customer communications, and more.

Your job is to embody the voice of the company, and that means you have a strong passion for what we do, how we do it, the customers we serve, and the markets in which we work.

REQUIREMENTS
You think and move a bit faster than those around you. You’ve done something like this before, but think you can do it even better this time. You’re excited to learn the ins and outs of Crossbeam and spread our message in fun and inventive ways.

These are some of your traits:

  • You are an exceptional writer and consider it an enjoyable, high-leverage use of your time to create written content.
  • You know the world of B2B SaaS very well and can wield the language of the industry naturally.
  • You can conduct research that enriches your content, validates points of view, and adds credibility. This may include tactics like data analysis, surveys, and web scraping.
  • From whitepapers to tweets, you are comfortable across a wide variety of formats and audiences.
  • You can switch gears from big-picture strategy to execution and back again, all in the same day (or hour).
  • You speak your mind, have no issue raising concerns with other company leaders, but are also able to “disagree and commit” when things don’t go your way.
  • You believe in the value of Crossbeam and are excited to share it with the world.
  • You just read this whole list and got more excited than concerned.

BENEFITS
This is a full-time, contract-to-hire role starting with a three-month contracting engagement. If we continue forward with a full-time relationship after that engagement, you will receive full-time benefits including:

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Flexible PTO Policy
  • Free Food & Snacks
  • Stock Option Plan

This role can be based in Crossbeam’s Center City Philadelphia Headquarters, or remote anywhere in the US.

ABOUT CROSSBEAM
Crossbeam is a collaborative data platform that helps companies build more valuable partnerships. Our team is headquartered in Center City, Philadelphia, with some team members working remotely.

Our Values
Trust is Our Business: We create value by building trust in our company, our team, our technology, and our network. Never let anything compromise that trust.

Feed the Network: Our customer network is our most valuable asset. Prioritize its growth.

Equity: We will build a workplace that ensures everyone access to the same opportunities to share in our success.

This is Fun: Few people are lucky enough to do what we do. Follow the fun in every step of the journey.

Apply for job

Job Role Summary

  • Responsible for formulating HR plans in partnership with the business. Provides HR support to line management. Acts as a consultant for specific HR related activities and programs.

Purpose:

  • Responsible for day-to-day administration of relocation/assignment/immigration services.
  • Serves as liaison between affected professionals, internal functional stakeholders (such as Legal, Payroll, Accounts Payable or Tax), internal business line leaders (such as HR Business Partners, Project Managers, etc.) and third-party vendors.
  • Managing and implementing global mobility support to clients of the organisation and providing guidance on ways to effectively deliver on global mobility
  • Subject matter expert on the full life-cycle processes and protocols related to a variety of non-relocation and relocation resourcing models, locations, and policies

Scope - Job Specific

  • Oversees maintenance of GEMS and shared drive files for relocation/assignment/immigration tracking and related reporting for identified population.
  • Per Global Mobility policies, authorizes and approves third party vendor services.
  • Reviews and approves mobility-related allowances, invoices, wires, check requests, expense reports, cost estimates and tracking payments.
  • Reviews and approves relocation/assignment letters and related documents.
  • Monitors trends in the mobility industry.
  • Develop and improve policies and procedures

Level Guide Statements - General:

Main Responsibilities:

  • Oversees maintenance of GEMS and shared drive files for relocation/assignment/immigration tracking and related reporting for identified population. Coordinates mobility processes including: capturing, entering and maintaining data, preparing communications such as assignment letters and cost projection requests.
  • Establish and maintain relations with vendors, assignees, payroll, and finance. Preparing required documentation to facilitate the processing of international assignments and US work authorizations. Research and validate documents and data reports. Manage mobility and tracking spreadsheets.
  • Provide global customer service, address and respond to requests and inquires in a timely manner. Per Global Mobility policies, authorizes and approves third party vendor services. Reviews and approves relocation/assignment letters and related documents.
  • Must be able to effectively communicate and consult with HR Business Partners and/or Recruiters across the globe. Ad-hoc projects, reports, presentations and other duties as assigned
  • Manage the domestic relocation function and processes for approximately 75+ North America transferees and new hires (both renters and homeowners). Monitors trends in the mobility industry.
  • Assist permanently transferring inbound US international employees with their relocation needs.
  • Responsible for resolving and approving exceptions and transferee issues. Working with HRBP and HRVP in providing guidance and influence amongst many other responsibilities. Reviews and approves mobility-related allowances, invoices, wires, check requests, expense reports, cost estimates and tracking payments.
  • Oversee the Candidate Experience Process in conjunction with the Global Talent Acquisition Team
  • Provide high-touch level of service for new hire senior executives, consisting of real estate tours, school tours, temporary housing arrangements, etc. Develop, educate, administer and communicate relocation policies/services to employees and managers. Provide full service to employees on all relocation logistics, issues and concerns.

Main Responsibilities:

items.title: Chief Marketing Officer - Volunteer
items.content:
Job Title: Chief Marketing Officer
Team: Marketing
Location: Remote
Reporting to: CEO
Staff Management: Marketing Team (between 4-8 volunteers)
Job Type: Volunteer
Time Commitment: 8 hours minimum per week (plus any more time you are able to offer)

Main Purpose of the Job
To inform, inspire and empower people to change the world through engaging, innovative and distinctive marketing.

Overview of the Role & Team
This position will involve overseeing all of the organisation’s marketing activities and initiatives. This will involve coordinating the activity of the team as well as contributing to the various areas of marketing, including social media and PR, where necessary. Working in collaboration with people from across the organisation and reporting to the CEO, this role is key to increasing the awareness of the organisation and its activities.

Responsibilities
Providing effective leadership to the Marketing Team.
Coordinating and organising the activity of the Marketing Team.
Support the Social Media Manager in executing a social media strategy that will inspire people to take action to support the causes they care about.
Work with the Bloggers to create fun and engaging blog content, ensuring content is posted regularly.
Engage with NGOs from around the world to develop content for social media, blogs and PR.
Work with the PR Officer to plan, develop and implement PR strategies and campaigns.
Developing good working relationships with the media.
Collaborate with other members of the We Make Change Team to manage reputation, identify key players and coordinate actions.

Requirements
Professional experience working in social media, marketing or PR is required.
Excellent writing, editing (photo/video/text), and communication skills.
Knowledge of online marketing and good understanding of major marketing channels.
Positive attitude and detail oriented with good multitasking and organisational ability.
Fluency in written and spoken English

items.title: Podia: Video Content Marketer
items.content:
Video Content Marketer

Do you want to help creators earn a living from their passion?

At Podia, we’re building the most creator-friendly platform on the planet to help people sell online courses, memberships and digital downloads to their audience.

The online business content world is a noisy one, overflowing with clickbait content promising quick riches for little work…as long as you buy today.

We do things differently.

When you join our content team, you’ll:

  • Protect online creators from shallow, predatory content
  • Show them what they’re actually capable of achieving
  • Help them do the work required to move forward, whether they’re building their first product or planning their 50th launch
  • Remove the obstacles standing in their way, and lead our creators to success

You’ll do that by creating extraordinary, rich, actionable, uncompromising video content; we expect every video we publish to be the best of its kind on the internet.

If you share our passion for helping creators earn money doing what they love, and you’re excited by the idea of spending your days creating video content to extremely demanding standards, then we’d love to chat!

Here’s what you’ll do:

  • Work directly with our CMO to build our YouTube content roadmap
  • Grow our YouTube channel’s followers, views, session watch time and other engagement metrics
  • Script, record, edit and publishweekly YouTube videos 
  • Incorporate SEO keyword research, like this, into your video plan and content
  • Coordinate with our Marketing and Customer Success teams to create product videos for our users as needed
  • Write SEO-friendlydescriptions for every video you publish
  • Repurpose the video content you create with clips for Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.
  • Engage with our community of creators to do research for your video content, promote new videos and respond to feedback

We’re looking for someone with:

  • Experience with scriptwriting, video production and marketing
  • A public track recordcreating engaging, high-quality, SEO-friendly YouTube content  
  • Full-time availability. We love freelancers, but this is a full-time job for someone who wants to be a key player on our team for the long-haul  
  • A deep understanding of what makes video content extraordinary, and of the role that video content marketing plays in a business

It’d be REALLY great if you also:

  • Have created and/or sold an online course, membership or download before
  • Have experience working remotely  
  • Have worked with digital creators before

Here’s what you’ll get if you join us:

  • Competitive salary
  • Equity in a rapidly-growing company  
  • Health insurance and other medical benefits(US-based employees)  
  • Work from anywhere with an internet connection
  • TBD
  • Annual team retreats with all expenses paid

Sound like you? Want to be part of a smart, nimble, motivated team working hard to build something big?

We’ve been around since 2014, are backed by some of the best investors in the business, have the greatest customers in the world, and a team that will stop at nothing to help our creators win.

If that sounds like something you want to be part of, we want to hear from you

items.title: Strategic Partnerships Prod. Mgr
items.content:
Strategic Partnerships Prod. Mgr at Democratic National Committee

Remote

REMOTE

TECHNOLOGY

FULL-TIME

The Democratic National Committee’s Tech team is hiring a Product Manager to help us build world class tools to help candidates win elections and to empower progressives across the country by providing them with access to high quality data and tools they need to win.

We need an experienced Product Manager to oversee key partner relationships with NGP VAN and other political tech organizations such as Hustle, GetThru and MobilizeAmerica. Key to this position is the ability to work across DNC product teams to scope requirements and drive and implementation of technical solutions to support vendor integrations with our data warehouse, ‘Phoenix’.

Who we are

The Tech team is a small, diverse team that provides the technology used by candidates and organizers in all 50 states and all 3,413 counties across the United States to analyze data, organize campaigns, raise money, and get out the vote on election day. But there’s more to do. So we’re hiring product managers, engineers, researchers, designers, security experts, IT professionals, and data scientists who can use user-centered design and rapid iteration to develop a rich technology ecosystem for progressives—building tools ourselves as well as partnering with other companies and organizations.

The Product

Our data warehouse and analytics platform is our product (‘Phoenix’). We are deeply committed to equipping candidates and campaigns around the country with the resources they need to win, and we are seeking a Product Manager to evaluate our ecosystem partners to see how and where we might leverage them to improve users’ end to end experience with democratic data.

Our users range in technical skill and it’s our mission to build tools that help analysts and data scientists uplevel their analytics game by providing features and functions that seamlessly integrate with our data warehouse.

You will..

  • Work across DNC tech product teams to identify, scope and prioritize feature requests and enhancements to VoteBuilder—both front-end UX and back-end data flow to/from our data warehouse, Phoenix.
  • Working closely with the Votebuilder/VAN team on requirements and roadmap prioritization.
  • Ensure that all DNC product teams are thinking deeply about the the connection between VoteBuilder and Phoenix in order to provide a seamless and easy-to-use analytics environment for campaigns.
  • Collaborate with the DNC community team to streamline customer support processes between the DNC and VoteBuilder.
  • Understand ambiguous, complex problems and define/drive high-quality, innovative, and robust solutions.
  • Influence product roadmaps both internally across our three engineering teams and externally among our ecosystem partners.
  • Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management and make tradeoffs.
  • Find ways to maximize business benefit while identifying and managing cross-team dependencies.
  • Work relentlessly to ensure that we are providing data syncs from vendors, back into Phoenix in order to deliver comprehensive data for all democratic data teams.

You might be right for this role if you..

  • Have a minimum 6+ years of relevant work experience in fields such as product management, management consulting or engineering.
  • Have a Bachelor’s degree in business, technology, computer science or a relevant field of study. Experience with agile or other program management methodologies.
  • Are a self-starter comfortable working with ambiguity.
  • Can take an idea and develop it into a broader vision, gain buy-in from stakeholders, influence the team and seamlessly deliver upon it.
  • Have the balance to drive your initiative forward quickly while keeping stakeholders looped in and identifying new opportunities.
  • Are an effective communicator and can clearly articulate your vision and ideas to both a technical and non-technical audience including vendors, DNC senior leadership, engineers and product managers.
  • Have excellent customer intuition by demonstrating success in identifying, prioritizing and delivering product capabilities to customers.

Nice to have..

  • NGP/VAN or other political data experience.
  • Proficient in SQL and/or PythonExperience working with Google BigQuery, Attunity, AWS Redshift.
  • Experience managing numerous stakeholders and large cross-functional teamsExperience working with a remote team

Do you want to..

  • Secure the future of our country? Right now a lot is at stake in our country and our team has a huge opportunity to make a real difference.
  • Work with amazing people? We’re building a diverse, distributed team, hiring the best people we can wherever they are—alumni from past Presidential campaigns working out of DC and New York, experienced product developers from the SF Bay Area, and more.
  • Never stop learning? There are people who know about politics and people who know about technology and a few who have figured out some things about how to combine the two, but we are blazing new trails and you should be comfortable exploring and learning from everyone you can.

This is a full-time role. We are a remote team with a concentration of folks in Washington, D.C., San Francisco Bay Area, Boston and Chicago. If you are coming from industry, however, be aware that some things are different in the world of politics: while we’ve done some budget hacking so we can be competitive when it comes to salaries we know we can’t beat Google or Facebook. On the other hand, you might legit help save the world.

The Democratic National Committee (DNC), is committed to diversity among its staff, and recognizes that its continued success requires the highest commitment to obtaining and retaining a diverse staff that provides the best quality services to supporters and constituents. The DNC is an equal opportunity employer and it is our policy to recruit, hire, train, promote and administer any and all personnel actions without regard to sex, race, age, color, creed, national origin, religion, economic status, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity or expression, ethnic identity or disability, or any other legally protected basis. The DNC is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in the hiring process and on the job, as required by applicable law. The DNC will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination and any such conduct is strictly prohibited.

Apply for job

items.content:
Product Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps, Product Manager
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Platform.sh | No office location

Technologies

agile
cloud
saas
devops

Job description

Mission

We're looking to growing our Product group with experienced Product Managers to join new product teams focusing on scaling our product. The ideal candidate will help us grow our practice, is technically minded and has a strong focus towards driving impact as Platform expands. 

You will engage with a variety of initiatives such as reimagining pricing,  building up internal tooling, and launching new product features as you work with a  dedicated cross-functional team, part of the larger product organization. 

Your mission will be supported by a strong group of engineering, designers and marketing specialists - delivering on a roadmap that helps to enable our product to evolve so it becomes ever more scalable, stable, joyful.. and profitable for our developer audience.

In the next year this will you will start up a new initiative, form a team, talk to customers, manage many competing ideas, define a clear scope and delivery paths. All while ruthlessly prioritizing your teams efforts in line with the key goals in order to deliver the impact you're looking for.

Responsibilities

  • Drive the product team's strategy and enable all the teams around you to work together to deliver it
  • Focus on features that help grow our revenue,  streamline our operations and give more visibility and control to the different internal stake holders and develop the KPIs and feedback loops that allow us to continuously improve those.
  • Work hand in hand with engineering and design to make sure we always keep our eyes on the ball, maintain at all times a critical path to delivering value fast. Work with other product managers to be sure we focus on the big-picture.
  • Turn feature releases into a repeatable process that can deliver quality results time after time
  • Participate in tasks including market research, prototyping, usability testing, customer feedback loops and data analysis
  • Write key documents including: roadmap documents, feature briefs, release notes
  • Maintain the right balance between effective processes and autonomous workflows

Qualifications

  • You have 3+ years as a Product Manager or similar role.
  • Demonstrated experience leading cross-functional remote teams 
  • Iterative mindset with a bias toward action and improvement 
  • Familiarity with both design and development agile methodologies
  • Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Familiarity with developer engineering workflows
  • Strong troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills
  • Preferred is strong experience in SaaS pricing strategies (preferably with usage-based pricing). 
  • Preferred can also be strong experience in cloud environments, continuous integration workflows and infrastructure observability. 

This is a remote job. Work from anywhere!

We are a worldwide distributed team and are looking for a product manager who can perform well working remotely. You’ll need to be able to effectively collaborate across time zones while being given a high level of independence and autonomy.

Apply now

About Platform.sh

Platform.sh is an idea-to-cloud application platform that simplifies cloud infrastructures.

We give developers the tools they need to experiment, innovate, get rapid feedback and deliver better-quality features with speed and confidence thanks to our unique rapid cloning technology.

Platform.sh serves thousands of customers worldwide including The Financial Times, Gap, Magento Commerce, Orange, Hachette, Ikea, Stanford University, Harvard University, The British Council, and Lufthansa.

We want people who are passionate, open, multicultural, friendly, humble and smart to join us and help this fast-growing, award-winning company to revolutionize the tech industry.

Benefits

  • Work from home, wherever you are
  • Safe and friendly working environment
  • Stock options for everyone
  • Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

items.title: Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Title: Marketing Manager
Location: Digitally nomadic (Can be based from anywhere, UK preferred)
Salary: Starting on freelance basis and then moving to full time paid position. (Hourly rate TBC)
Benefits: -

__Mission for role__
*To head up all aspects of marketing for Eco Companion, focusing in particular on specific KPIs that matter to the business - most importantly increasing sales made through our new booking engine!*

We’re now looking for a new marketing manager to come in to take charge of all aspects of our marketing efforts! We have already made great progress, in particular with social media where we now have a following of over 150,000 on our own network and also a community of content creators called Eco Companion Journalists we work with. We also have a good starting point of a mailing list to be built on. You will have free reign to work alongside me (Max the founder) in particular to work on driving more people down the funnel towards ultimately making a booking through the Eco Companion website.

Eco Companion is now over 4 years old and has pivoted now into a tailor made eco tourism tour operator. So we’re building a higher end experience for people looking to travel to the natural world in a way that sincerely does improve the world!

We are barely yet making bookings as we’ve focused on developing the core experience delivered through our website. This work is largely done now though and so we’re eager to push the marketing and advertising. Though with a very small budget initially.

We represent high risk as you will be working for a startup that’s only just gone professional. So don’t expect big pay cheques straight away (and if you’re just in it for the cash then this isn’t the role for you). However, what you will find whilst working for Eco Companion is a much faster rate of growth for you as a person than you could ever hope to achieve within a larger corporate enterprise.

Eco Companion has a big goal: to become a global leader in travel and change the world for the better along the way through delivering the highest standards in sustainability and ecotourism! If this gets you pumped and excited then this could be the family for you!

Read more about us here: https://www.ecocompanion.com/about_us
Read more about our world rating system here: https://www.ecocompanion.com/world_rating_system

__Outcomes__
Build our business based around our KPIs. In particular driving overall bookings through the site. We’re currently still burning cash each month so are in the process of trying to cut away at that through delivering more and more sales (selling holidays).
Manage our content marketing strategy using our content calendar.
Manage all of our social networks including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Pinterest.
Manage our ever-growing email mailing list.
Conduct regular user research to develop the website, our product, to become more and more effective.

__Role-based Competencies__
Scientific mind. Constantly look to be creating tests and analysing results to deliver sustainable continuous improvement.
Salesman in copy. Be able to write to directly appeal to a specific audience, in order to generate sales for each ad you create or interaction you have with our audience.
Organisation. Be able to manage your own time effectively, managing a complex content strategy.
Creativity. Be unique! Come up with interesting alternative ways to solve problems and write pattern interrupting copy so we’re a step above the rest!
People-person. Be able to deal with, and relate to other people, and understand what people want.
Resourcefulness. You won’t have a big budget, so you’ll need to be resourceful and deliver results without lots of cash at your disposal!

__Culture-based Competencies__
Ambition. Aspiring to achieve something great from your life rather than settling and stagnating. You don’t join a startup to make gradual incremental increases in salary. You do it to change the fucking world and make something of yourself along the way!
Hard work ethic. Always trying to push yourself beyond your comfort zone, working sometimes long hours to get the job done.
Curiosity. Eager to learn and develop yourself and your skill sets constantly. In particular through consuming content as a daily habit through reading, audio books, blogs etc.
Positivity. Maintain a positive mind-set, and a ‘can-do’ attitude.
Innovative. Always introducing new ideas, original and creative in your thinking.
Long-term visionary. Think of the long term mission and goals of the business and how each decision ties into them.
Selfless. Always willing to sacrifice personal gains for the best interest of the team.

__Essential hard skills and experience required__
At least two years experience in a marketing based role already.
At least some basic knowledge of the travel industry. (Don’t tell me you travel a lot! ;) ).
Experience with Google Analytics.
Experience with Adwords.
Experience with social media marketing.
Experience with managing a content marketing strategy.
High standard of written English.
Experience of using Google docs and Microsoft Office. In particular you need to be proficient with Excel.

__Bonus points__
Experience in the travel industry.
Experience in e-commerce.
Experience in particular with growth hacking.
Worked in startups.
Used Slack / Trello.
A level of understanding/knowledge about ecotourism, or other sector specific knowledge.
Personal experience of nature tourism, conservation projects, etc (beyond that you went travelling that one time).

items.title: IGotAnOffer: Lead PM Instructor
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
Lead PM Instructor

The role has the potential to grow into a VP of Content or VP of Product as the company expands. This is a full-time role either remote or based in London.

Hi there!

We are looking for someone who is passionate about creating high quality content and excited to help people land their dream job. If you’re excited to be employee #3 at a high-growth, profitable bootstrapped start-up and to work directly with our founding team, then read on.

About IGotAnOffer

At IGotAnOffer, we’re building the recruitment marketplace of the future. One third of your life is spent at work. By helping you land your dream job, and better manage your career, we believe we can help you live a more fulfilling life.

Since we started, we’ve been busy building the best course and coaching service available in the world to land a job in consulting. We have now helped more than 30,000 people get an offer and are in the process of expanding into other industries and building relationships with employers.

We are a bootstrapped, profitable business that’s growing at an extremely high pace (2x year on year). You’ll be leading our new vertical that focuses on helping people land PM jobs and we are planning to continue growing the team over the coming months.

About you

  • You are a PM. You have spent at least 2 years as a PM for an established company (e.g. Google, Amazon, Facebook, etc). You have interviewed at different firms and understand what it takes to get an offer.
  • You love crafting high quality content. Most of what you’ll do each day will be to plan, structure and create content (e.g. blog posts, courses, videos, etc) to grow our audience and increase the number of people we help getting a job in product management.
  • You have experience writing. You speak and write perfect English. You love the process of writing. From structuring your content, to doing in depth research and perfecting the flow of your sentences and paragraphs.
  • You are commercially minded. You will lead the development of our Product Management vertical.Most of our revenue growth in 2020 will depend on the decisions you make. After some time with us you could become our VP of Product.
  • You’re empathetic to users. You’re interested in whether what you build will really make a difference for the user. You love keeping things simple and building as few features as possible to keep things manageable.
  • Doing things efficiently. The work you do will have a disproportionate impact on the business. You constantly look for opportunities to automate tasks and to improve processes.

Things you might do

IGotAnOffer is a small, fast-growing company, so you’ll likely get experience on many different projects. That said, here are some things you’ll probably do:

  • Structure and develop our PM interview course
  • Build and execute our content pipeline (i.e. blog posts, videos, etc.)
  • Lead the development of a peer-to-peer interviewing platform with our tech team
  • Interview customers and implement feedback to improve our products
  • Experiment! This is a start-up so things can and will change quickly

Benefits: the whole package

  • Location: Remote or London

If you want to work remotely that’s great. If you want to work near others that’s cool too. If you decide to work in London our office is at Huckletree in Shoreditch.

  • Competitive salary: We don’t use remote as an excuse to pay less
  • Holidays: 30 days a year, plus bank holidays
  • Flexible working: this role can be full time or 4 days a week
  • Equity: We believe in our employees sharing in our success

    Application process

    Our interview process is designed to discover if we would enjoy working together and if the role is a good fit for your career. We will be respectful of your time and let you know ASAP if we feel it’s not a match.

    • Step 1: Complete the application form below and tell us why this role and company is a good fit for you.
    • Step 2: We’ll invite you to a phone call with Max our CEO so we can learn more about your goals. You’ll also be able to ask any questions about the company and role.
    • Step 3: We’ll send you a take-home assessment to do in your own time. This assessment will take less than 2h of your time.
    • Step 4: You’ll then discuss that assessment over a 1h phone conversation with Max. And you’ll also have a 30mins chat with one of our team to make sure our values align.
    • Step 5: You get an offer!

items.title: Revealbot: B2B SaaS Marketing Manager
items.content:
B2B SaaS Marketing Manager

About Us
Revealbot is the next generation digital ads automation platform that is used by over 500 agencies and brands around the world. We empower our users to automate campaign management routine and optimize ads efficiency using advanced automated rules.

Launched in 2016 as a Slack chatbot, today Revealbot is one of the most advanced ad optimization tools. In 2019 Revealbot has become Facebook Marketing Partner and Google Premiere Partner. And now we’ve grown to a fully profitable, globally distributed team of 15 people winning a huge digital ads market.

What to do:
  • Develop content marketing strategies and goals together with a founder and product teams;
  • Produce high quality posts for our blog (revealbot.com/blog/) and reach top search positions for the relevant keywords;
  • Educate our users with engaging articles, videos and tutorials (we have a pretty complicated product, so education is the key for our growth);
  • Promote and feature content using social media, communities, influencer marketing and other tactics;
  • Find and manage content writers to scale our content production process;
  • Collaborate with our founder, product, engineering, and support teams to generate new content ideas and educational materials.

What we expect from you:
  • Deep expertise in Facebook/Google Ads market (ideally if you already used our product in your previous job);
  • Ahrefs, Moz and Semrush are the common tools in your daily routine. You know how to research keywords, attract high-quality links and traffic at scale;
  • Understanding of how to create a community and drive engagement through the most relevant social networks;
  • You managed a team of freelancers, writers or content researchers;
  • You are metric driven and continuously measure performance of all marketing activities;
  • Experience in the B2B SaaS space, ideally in a marketing focussed tool;
  • You love content and generating it is like building a digital product for you.

Our perks:
  • A fully remote and diverse team.
  • Flexible vacation and sick leave.
  • Company retreats.
  • Travel and device perks.
  • Informal and fun working environment

items.title: Email Marketing Manager
items.content:
Email Marketing Manager at Creative Market

Remote

U.S.

MARKETING

FULL-TIME

Creative Market is the world’s marketplace for design — a platform where creators across the globe buy and sell digital design assets. We’re passionate about building tools and experiences that make beautiful, effective design simple and accessible to everyone. We’re growing rapidly, and need your help as we continue to scale the platform.

We’re looking for a hard-working, self-sufficient email marketer to join our growing marketing team. As Email Marketing Manager, you’ll assist with customer acquisition and retention efforts at Creative Market so we can put great design in everyone’s hands, ultimately helping the Marketing team drive company growth. This is a strategic & performance oriented role with lots of opportunity to help build our business, reporting directly to our Senior Manager of Digital Marketing.

Responsibilities

  • Manage the company’s email campaigns and overall email strategy, including content calendar
  • Analyze current email campaigns and make recommendations for improvement
  • Work closely with Brand Content Strategist & Senior Brand Designer to develop compelling email content that drives high engagement & GMV
  • Track and report on email campaigns in order to guide improvements
  • Develop & implement drip email campaigns throughout the customer lifecycle to maximize GMV
  • A/B Test on various email campaigns to establish the most effective approach
  • Work with analytics team to flesh out personas & segment our database for personalization as well as develop a clear CRM strategy
  • Reporting to the senior manager of digital marketing on OKRs such as GMV, Conversion Rate, Open Rate, Click Rate, Unsubs, etc.
  • Ensure all email campaigns comply with current email best practice in the industry

Qualifications

  • 3+ years Email Marketing or Content Marketing experience. Marketplace business experience is a plus
  • Comprehensive knowledge of email and mobile marketing best practices to maintain list health, improve open rates, CAN-SPAM, etc.
  • Strong creative problem-solving abilityMeticulous attention to detail
  • Results driven, with a demonstrated track record of leading and measuring performance across entire Email channel
  • Strong communication and highly collaborative, able to effectively report results and explain strategy at all levels of the company
  • Adaptable and curious, you’re someone who picks things up on the fly and is always looking for solutions to customer or market problems

Creative Market actively encourages applicants from all backgrounds, races, gender identities, and orientations, because we believe that diversity makes for better companies.

We’re a 40-person Series A startup that works remotely with employees in Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Idaho, Minnesota, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Texas, and Washington.

Apply for job
