items.content:
Social Media and Project Designer

Do you have a unique ability with creating beautiful design? Are you able to make eye-catching, well-branded, impactful social media posts that make people want to view and share them with their friends? Are you interested in working with an expert content team – and making use of your visual skills to deliver powerful, emotional, practical content to an audience of millions?

Well, then, you might be the design superstar we’re looking for.

In this role, you’ll work closely with our social media team to take the lead in crafting visual posters and video banners for all of our social media content. This will involve designs for our company’s Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram posts, as well as video banners for clips to be posted on all social platforms.

Qualities of our superstar include:

- 1-3 years experience designing social media content, including Instagram story sequences & templates, title banners for IGTV and Facebook, quote cards, YouTube thumbnails, motion graphics, and website graphics

- An understanding of major social media platforms and a passion for creating powerful, eye-catching visuals that draw an audience’s attention to the message being conveyed

- Fast, reliable communication and organization to keep on track with a regular content posting schedule

- A ‘team player’ who is responsive to constructive feedback and able to edit posts quickly when changes are required

- Prior experience as a freelancer preferred

- Experience with web design is a plus; we have other projects in this area that we’ll be looking to get started on shortly, so let us know if you have website production skills especially

Responsibilities include:

- Working with the social media manager and content team to turn written content into eye-catching posts, most notably designing 3-5 Instagram stories and templates per week

- Meeting deadlines and keeping to a schedule for daily posting

- Communicating reliably with the social media team to keep on track with new assets that require designing as they arrive

- Flexibility + availability during the hours of 9 AM to 12 PM Eastern time business hours for a quick turnaround time on revisions when requested

Why Join Us?

You’ll work remotely with a lot of flexibility and independence. We are 100% remote, with team members based in LA, NY, the UK, Eastern Europe, and the Philippines. We don’t care where you work from as long as you deliver results.

Make an impact – help women level-up in their relationships, self-esteem, and happiness.

Be part of a positive, upbeat team that deals with each other with respect and gratitude.

Hours

This position starts as part-time freelance for 10-15 hours per week. You should be available to work flexible hours, with overlap with Eastern Time business hours every weekday morning. Hours have potential to increase.

To be considered, please send a cover letter to recruiting@howtogettheguy.com as to why you’d be a good fit, and include a link to your website or to a work portfolio. Include the letter and the links in the body of your email; do NOT attach anything to the email. Letters with attachments will automatically not be read. We prioritize culture fit, attention to detail, and quality writing when selecting candidates.

About Us

Get the Guy is an online dating and relationship advice company that helps women get the results they want in their love lives – but we don’t stop there. Nothing stays at the surface with us; we go deep and show our customers how to transform their confidence and self-esteem to live happier, more fulfilling lives overall.

Find out more by watching our CEO Matthew Hussey’s massively popular YouTube videos. (Be sure to tell us in your letter which one you liked best.)

You’ll be testing and interviewing with our Operations & Customer Experience Manager, Rachael Mare. Her favorite color is blue, so she’d love it if you put the word “blue” somewhere in your subject line. 

Looking forward to meeting you!

items.title: SEO Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
SEO Analyst at Learning House

Remote

Req Id: 36488 – Marketing – Job Posting Region (United States) – Job Posting Location (US Remote)

Job Description

The Learning House, Inc. a Wiley Brand, helps people improve their lives through education. As an Academic Program Manager, we offer a full suite of education services, including: Online Program Management (OPM), Corporate Solutions, The Software Guild, Learning House International, and Advancement Courses. Built on a foundation of data-driven decision-making, thorough market research, and robust technology services, Learning House is focused on delivering high-quality, relevant just-in-time education services to meet the needs of a dynamic, global market. Through its partnerships, Learning House helps universities acquire more students, produce more graduates, and deliver better outcomes and helps companies attract, develop, and retain a happier, more skilled workforce.

General Purpose:

The SEO Analyst will lead the development and execution of search engine optimization strategies for our partner institutions and business units. Candidates should be well versed in user experience and SEO best practices, as they will be working with other teams within the marketing department to generate and execute quarterly marketing campaigns, build and redesign websites, as well as assess, analyze and report on client performance.

Role Qualifications:

Minimum: Bachelor’s Degree with 1-3 years experience in digital marketing/SEO

Position Responsibilities:

  • Work with Content Marketing Leads to generate and execute quarterly Campaign Plans for all business units and Online Learning Campus (OLC’s) websites.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive keyword and SEO strategy for all business units and OLC’s.
  • Work with Content team to generate high-potential keywords to use for articles and resource content.
  • Draft and publish site content to website.
  • Perform backlink research and solicit new links for program pages on OLC’s.
  • Audit the websites of new prospects, highlighting opportunities and challenges.
  • Onboard new clients by developing OLC sitemaps, creating redirect maps, leading content meetings, and completing initial site optimization. Review content written by copywriters during initial OLC development for SEO.
  • Audit clients’ EDU websites for SEO best practices and linking strategies. Collaborate on help facilitate on .edu redesign projects with manager.
  • Analyze the performance of client OLC’s and marketing campaigns.
  • Investigate peculiarities with lead data and compare it against analytics data when necessary.
  • Manage 301 redirects.
  • Monitor issues in Search Console. Intervene to correct problems and site issues.
  • Setup and configure tagging strategy for Google Analytics.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Essential Skills and Experience:

  • Ability to collaborate across multiple teams, including the ability to provide feedback and lead campaigns
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to professional communicate reports and data to stakeholders
  • Strong organizational and analytical skills to catalogue and track keyword ranking regularly
  • Critical thinking skills to make decisions regarding their partner institutions’ marketing strategies
  • A desire to stay abreast of SEO best practices and suggest projects to implement innovations (ie. structured data, schema)

Physical Requirements and Work Environment:

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here represent those that the employee must meet to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable an individual with a disability to perform the essential functions:

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of the job, the employee is occasionally required to sit and stand.

Work Environment: This job is performed in a general office environment with standard office equipment available. Work is generally sedentary in nature, but may require standing and walking. The working environment is generally favorable. Lighting and temperature are adequate, and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer at Hanno

Remote | Freelance | International

Become a shipmate

All our vacancies are fully remote and on a contract basis (with a possibility of future hire)

We’re looking for an experienced designer who wants to create the next generation of digital health products.

Who we are / what we do

At Hanno, we’re dedicated to helping organisations of all sizes transform themselves and the healthcare industry. For us, this means rethinking what it takes to design, build and launch the next generation of digital health products and services—whether their goal is improving patient care, treatment compliance, clinical diagnostics or surgical precision—these are serious challenges, and they need seriously good solutions.

More than a consultancy, we’re also an in-house product team—we are effectively building and launching new startup propositions for our clients and ourselves. To do this we need an amazing team of designers, engineers, strategists, and roles we haven’t even created yet.

We don’t work like an agency, or a consultancy, or even a product studio. We work with our clients as if we were part of their team. We join them in the trenches. We treat the unseen aspects of their product as if they were on full display. We go above and beyond the brief to maximise the impact and success they have on the market and the users they serve.

To live up to this, everyone in our team relentlessly drives towards the same goal—to improve the health and wellbeing of people all over the world.

If that lights a fire in your belly, come on board.

What you’ll be doing

You’ll be the custodian of everything the user touches—defending their interests and needs (to the death) and solving serious design challenges with elegant, intuitive and, if needs be, unconventional solutions, with a touch of personal flair. In practical terms, you’ll be working on greenfield projects, collaborating closely with UX directors, art directors and the best engineers, strategists and “tier 1” clients to create engaging user experiences; building prototypes, designing beautiful and polished interfaces, leading other designers, and helping ensure smooth handovers.

  • You use design best practices that work – You have great taste in interfaces. You keep abreast of what works and what doesn’t as our medium continues to evolve. You can instantly recognise the tools and methods required to achieve results in any given situation.
  • You can work fast, and slow – Having worked in both fast-paced start-up environments and more process-driven corporate settings, you understand how to balance lean design principles with corporate governance and signoff processes.
  • You’re willing and able to go beyond the conventional – Digital products can lack personality, style and risk-taking. We never compromise accessibility or performance but we do push the creative boundaries of what’s possible to create unique, engaging experiences. You’re not only comfortable with this but crave the opportunity to create original concepts and new UI systems.
  • You’ve found balance – You know how to balance a product’s design with what your peers would applaud and what your client and their users really need. You know when to strive for pixel perfect, when good is good enough, and when polished interactions and animations serve a purpose, and when they are simply a pursuit of vanity.
  • You have a sharp eye for detail – You have highly developed organisational skills and the ability to prioritise tasks. You strive for quality not only in your final deliverables but also in the working assets you use along the way.
  • You over-communicate with the team about your priorities, choices, tradeoffs, and the rationale behind the design decisions you take.

You’ll have

  • Several years experience in product design with experience leading other designers
  • A portfolio of projects that you can talk us through: the end result, the process you took, trade-offs you had to make, the inspiration and design systems you used
  • A deep understanding and appreciation of the various design systems and guidelines that dominate app and web interfaces, and where and when they should be used
  • Strong UX capabilities: you’re able to interrogate and understand a product’s users and commercial goals and make sure our work drives towards these
  • Expert UI skills: you have a rich understanding of UI principles and can apply these to polished, interactive designs
  • A proactive mindset: if there’s something you don’t understand, or a task/process tweak that’s needed, you seek to address it rather than relying on others to
  • Fluency in spoken and written English: accents are fine, but we work on tricky projects across multiple time zones so great communication is a must
  • Willingness to get overlap with the team: they’ll be on a European time zone, so you’ll need to arrange for at least 4 hours of overlap each day

Bonus if you also have

  • Experience doing all of the above 100% remotely!
  • Achieved mastery of; type hierarchies, interaction language, intuitive navigation, modality, card-based component design, and data visualisation
  • Knowledge and experience of designing products for patients and clinicians
Apply for job

items.title: Sr. Business Process Analyst - US Telecommute
items.content:
The Business Process Analyst will provide daily operational support for the business to ensure Broker & Employer Services (B&E Services) is delivering accurate, timely and outstanding service delivery. This role will provide business process support and expertise in analysis with respect to applications and process flows by identifying process improvements and recognizing any gaps for all B&E Services businesses. The Business Process Analyst will use data to provide end-to-end insight into operational trends, reporting and/or improvements opportunities across. This role will also support peak season open enrollment preparation and reporting of performance.



You-ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:

  • Analyze complex business situations and develop innovative solutions
  • Assimilate, integrate, and interface technical knowledge with business/systems/reporting requirements
  • Demonstrate understanding of business requirements to ensure needs are being met for all B&E Services
  • Engage and provide subject matter expertise and process knowledge expertise on projects
  • Collaborate with business and technology departments to define deliverables and develop solutions that are reusable across the organization
  • Coordinate and collaborate with E&I Operational teams to keep process knowledge up to date and provide feedback as needed
  • Collaborate with Broker & Employer Operational teams to assess support needed to drive business forward
  • Build strong relationships with internal business partners including National, Key and Small Business sales teams
  • Diagnose potential risks/issues and provider proactive feedback upward and across B&E Services
  • Work independently and as a team in a virtual environment
  • Collaborate with reporting, product leads, testing and marketing on reporting enhancements, talking points and remediation
  • Act as SME resource for leaders on reporting questions and/or activities
  • Complete project work as assigned accurately and within specified deadlines
  • Participate in relevant training opportunities that will enhance partnerships
  • Other projects and tasks as delegated by leadership




Required Qualifications

  • Undergraduate Degree or equivalent work experience
  • 3+ years of work experience in a corporate healthcare environment
  • 2 + years of work experience within healthcare operations or service teams
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, competent in presentation of materials
  • Project management skills and customer centric attitude
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 6 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near-obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, military families and veterans where ever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life's best work. SM



*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group-s Telecommuter Policy.






Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.





UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

items.title: Paid Social Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
About Us

Mous is a young, disruptive and rapidly growing lifestyle accessory start-up. We provide smart solutions centred around protection and functionality that hold design and craft at their core. We’ve grown from a guerrilla crowdfunding campaign to an internationally recognised brand, shipping to almost every country in the world. We’ve made it our mission to disrupt the saturated lifestyle accessory market, whilst constantly pushing the boundaries of what it means to be an engaging brand. We knew that in order to achieve this, our products needed to be three things: stylish, functional and protective. After months and months spent designing and testing, we created our unique AiroShock technology and paired it with raw materials to launch our signature Limitless case.

…that was in 2016. Since then, we have rapidly developed and expanded our product range, offering a multitude of cases with an array of add-ons! We’ve also picked up numerous awards along the way, including best ‘UK Crowdfunded Business of the Year in 2017’ and coming 3rd in The UKStartups100’s in 2018!

After going from strength to strength (we hit annual revenue of £8.5M last year!), we are continuing to exceed the limits of what we can do and there has never been a busier time for us. We are looking for a bright and dynamic Paid Social Executive to support our ever-growing Digital Marketing team. We’re seeking those who challenge, who question, and who always look for new ways to improve products and solve problems.

About the Role

As a Paid Social Executive at Mous, you will become an integral part of our Digital Marketing team, as you help to drive the performance of our Facebook and Instagram paid campaigns. Alongside our current Paid Social Executive, you will own the end-to-end management of our campaigns from implementation to optimisation, reporting and data analysis. We’re looking for someone who is obsessed with Paid Social and is willing to embrace the ongoing changes to best practice on the platform. What’s more, you’ll have the creative flair to craft unique ideas coupled with the analytical ability to generate meaningful insights from various data sets. In this exciting role, your core responsibilities will include:

* Management of our paid social campaigns:
- Campaign creation – including idea generation
- Ad creation and asset management
- Audience segmentation & targeting/re-targeting
- Executing regular A/B tests on all campaigns
- Reporting & analysis on both campaign and content performance
- Managing daily campaign budgets
- Participating in weekly cross-departmental meetings to share insight and recommended solutions
- Identifying new opportunities for improvement in paid social strategy
- Working alongside Creative team ensure campaigns align with overall Brand strategy
- Staying up to date on new developments within paid social

* Supporting on our Retention Marketing strategy, including:
- Email marketing
- Email acquisition strategy testing
- Email flow reporting
- Ad-hoc campaign support
* Referral marketing
- Customer review generation
- Maintaining post-purchase communication planning

* Supporting on our expansion into secondary paid social channels, including:
- Creating, implementing and optimising campaigns for channels including Snapchat, TikTok and Reddit.

* Managing content needs across the entire Digital Marketing department

About You

* You'll have graduated with a 2:1 degree from a top University
* You’ll have at least one years’ experience in creating, implementing and optimising paid social campaigns with an understanding of targeting and audience segmentation
* You’ll have a strong working knowledge of Facebook Ads Campaign Manager and Google Analytics
* You’ll have a knack for numbers and will be confident making sense of large, complex data sets
* From the data, you’ll be able to formulate meaningful insights and make recommendations from improved performance of our campaigns
* You’ll be obsessed with the detail and won’t settle for anything less than perfection
* Confident managing multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously
* Confident using Excel and/or Google Sheets to produce solid reports that can be used across the wider business
* A strong communicator with the ability to manage multiple stakeholders and work cross-departmentally
* Most importantly, you’ll be eager to learn and develop whilst pushing the boundaries of what we can achieve with our paid social campaigns!

What We Offer

Based at our East London offices at a WeWork, you’ll be working in modern open plan offices surrounded by young creatives and innovative businesses. With our own beer taps, happy hour Thursdays and regular on-site activities (including puppy therapy!), you’ll have the opportunity to play hard as well as work hard.

• A competitive starting salary with 6-month reviews
• A steep learning curve with the chance to make a tangible impact within a growing business
• Outgoing and sociable team with monthly company socials
• Charlie HR perks package including discounts on hundreds of high street brands and services
• 25 days holiday, plus bank holidays and team away days
• Employee Pension Scheme
• Employee Assistance Programme
• Discounts for F&F on Mous products
• Huge opportunities for career progression in a high-growth start-up. Dream big, work hard and make things happen!

Want to know more about life at Mous? See what our employees think by following this link: https://app.escapethecity.org/organisation/mous-1537991021288x415861537214368600

Before you carry on with your day, check out some of videos here:


Our unusual story:
https://youtu.be/Wwp8O8n7Z1M

We sent a phone to space:
https://youtu.be/PywmDoENqdE

Drop Tests in Sydney, Hong Kong and London:
https://youtu.be/KLe2shFrWB4

items.title: Trade Marketing Manager
items.content:
Trade Marketing Manager

United Kingdom, Lancashire
Company: Stopgap

Overview

Are you a driven, product marketing professional? Opportunity for a trade marketing manager with B2B/B2C experience.

Trade Marketing Manager – Up to £50,000 (DOE) – Greater Manchester

THE COMPANY
This company is a household name and known for its exciting portfolio of products and services in the automotive industry. A FTSE listed enterprise with extensive automotive industry experience; this is a great career opportunity to work on exciting, new disruptive propositions. Based in Manchester.

THE ROLE
A highly driven and talented Trade Marketing Manager is required for this role. Your responsibilities:

– Work closely with product teams to develop value propositions, messaging, as well as implement communication strategy using owned, earned and paid channels
– Define and implement marketing plans to deliver new and existing products
– Develop strategies that ensure customers are targeted based on their needs and potential ROI
– Develop messaging to support commercial objectives
– Own all product communications (operations, sales, trade websites, intranet etc.)
– Align messaging to TOV and work with creative team to develop your approach
– Act as brand guardian – ensuring all communications are of the highest quality

YOU
To apply as Trade Marketing Manager you will need:

– Extensive industry related experience in manufacturing/ franchise/ dealer background (or related automotive services)
– Stakeholder management skills are essential
– Excellent copywriting skills
– Proven B2B marketing experience
– Campaign management (planning, execution and optimisation) as well as demonstration of data and interpreting results
– A motivated self-starter and natural collaborator
– Ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders

If this sounds like you, then apply now!

Trade Marketing Manager – Up to £50,000 (DOE) – Greater Manchester

If this role isn’t what you’re looking for don’t worry. At Stopgap we cover all permanent and freelance marketing positions, with specialist industry sector teams. You can check out all of our roles on our website and sign up for job alerts so you’re the first to know about a new opportunity . Marketing Recruitment – The Stopgap Way.

Apply for job

As a member of the AmaZix Marketing and PR remote army, you will be in contact with experts in every time zone, bringing together solutions from a myriad of creative and analytical skill sets.

You will actively help us determine and execute marketing and communication strategies for some of the brightest lights in the industry, without the restrictive limits of conventional working spaces. You will never get bored. No day will ever be the same.
Content to blow us away? Social media wizardry? PR savant? Creative designmonger? Or something we’ve never heard of? Are you the one we’re looking for?

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) QM -Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP QM specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong QM experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Quality Management (QM) modul
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the QM modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment, several S/4 HANA implementations under your belt.
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of QM and experience with S4/HANA
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP QM specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

items.content:
Emailing Marketing & Content Expert for Software Industry

Before you read on - only apply if you have email marketing experience with the proven ability to book appointments for your clients. 

If this is you, thank you for checking out our post!

Above all, at Softsales we are not looking to hire an employee, we are searching for a person to work as our partner to support our ability to generate more leads that turn into closed deals and generate software sales income. Your role is to be a generator.

"If you want to go fast, go alone; but if you want to go far, go together"

Potential African Proverb

This position will start ASAP. We currently have over a dozen clients. And we have more interested, this is where you come in. You will handle 10 of our clients and run this email marketing department as your own department, inside the system we’ve built.

A bit about me:

I live a mindful life and have a strong commitment to my spiritual practices and inner work. This is a startup and I believe this is a spiritual path. I consciously co-parent two teenage boys and practice yoga/workout daily. I believe in family, authentic relating, evolved economics, finding one's unique path, being grounded, abundance and flow. I am an entrepreneur, salesperson and creative. Here is my LinkedIn profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/briantsuchiya/

A bit about you:

You first and foremost are doing your inner work. You have a similar lifestyle and our values align. I care most about who you are as a person.

You must have experience with LinkedIn, email campaigns, content writing and web and mobile software sales. Software lead gen and marketing background is required.

In your recent work history you have demonstrable success in web and mobile software lead generation. You thrive off of researching & creating custom content, generating leads, nurturing leads and booking appointments for our clients. You are creative and systems driven. You have amazing oral and written communication skills with a strong marketing foundation. 

You own a Mac in good working order, as all of our systems are Mac. You have a suitable home office, with Vonage compatible modem on your Internet service...

Your Role:

We have clients that want us to sell lots of software development for them in the US. Your focus is to generate leads for them using the system we have developed, plus the skills and creative talents you possess. 

This is fulltime and flexible work from home opportunity. You will create all email marketing campaigns for up to 5 initial clients, and eventually 10 as you master your role. You manage the relationships with our clients, create reporting and metrics for the clients and also consult with the clients on inbound marketing strategy when necessary. 

Some tasks will be email campaign administration, custom content curation, appointment management, data entry into CRMs, report generation for our clients and weekly lead gen meetings. We work in multiple CRMS, like Hubspot, Pipedrive, Zoho and Highrise with our clients, so your core skills need to be lead generating and marketing!

Your Compensation:

You will be paid as a contractor on a 1099 and will have flexibility with your full-time hours. Many of our clients are overseas however, so it’s important to note that your weekly meeting hours will need to accommodate their schedules.

You can expect a base of $4000/mo, but you can expect to double this number with monthly bonuses if you’re hitting your targets. With your skills, this should come naturally. Plus it is how we all ultimately make money, generating software sales for our clients.

Our Company:

We sell custom web and mobile development to US and Canadian customers for offshore and nearshore companies. Our clients whom we vet and select pay us commission on closed deals and pay monthly for lead generation services. Our clients hire us to be their sales and marketing US based office.

We are working with companies in India, Central/Eastern Europe and LatAm. We sell all major technology stacks, RoR, Python, Java, PHP, .NET and Mobile.

This opportunity is to support our ability to spend as much time as we possibly can in lead generation, lead conversion and sales for our clients. Ultimately talking with customers in the US and Canada about their software projects, this is how we create value for our clients and generate revenue.

This is a unique opportunity and will require you to be full time to join us. We care about who you are as a person first and then we will look at what you have done professionally.

We have a substantial database of Indian, Central/Eastern European and Central/South American companies. We have the systems, deck, contract, experience, success stories, the credibility and the market knowledge. 

If you are interested please answer the following questions. We will only reply to candidates that do.

1. Who are you?

2. Why do you want to pursue this opportunity?

3. Why are you an ideal match for this role?

4. Please provide feedback on this ad.

5. What is alive in your world right now?

6. What do you think would be your biggest challenge in this role?

Please send your Linkedin and any CV or resume you may have.

Namaste and have a great day. Brian & Carolyn

items.title: Lifecycle Content Marketer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Lifecycle Content Marketer at Clearbit

Remote

SAN FRANCISCO, CA (OR REMOTE, US TIMEZONES)
MARKETING
FULL-TIME

Hello future Lifecycle Content Marketer!

Here at Clearbit, we’re building the marketing data engine for all your customer interactions. Our products enable businesses to understand their customers, find future prospects, and personalize how they communicate.

Today, Clearbit powers more than 1,500 enterprise customers and 500,000 individual marketers, engineers, and sales reps. It’s an exciting time to join Clearbit. We’re a profitable, rapidly growing SaaS company (> 100% ARR last year), full of can-do people who care about craft, collaboration, and our customers.

We’re looking for a creative marketer and sharp writer to help Clearbit communicate value to its customers, prospects, and the world — from developing Clearbit company and product narratives to providing resources for helping busy marketing and sales teams thrive in their jobs.

About the Role
As a Lifecycle Content Marketer, you’ll work closely with our Head of Content and be part of our scrappy growth team. The team works across 5 realms — conversion, analytics, demand, product marketing, and content — which led to the idea that we’re like a Captain Planet team, with different expertise areas coming together to create great work. Content is Earth — creating foundational resources to help us grow. (If you’re interested in this team, you hopefully enjoy a little metaphor.)

Content at Clearbit is not driven by eyeballs, which is, let’s face it, a little gross. We want to connect with the brains and emotions of actual, whole people — to educate and inspire, make them go “aha!” and go think and work on something they read about. To do so, you’ll be writing and creating collateral around how to use data to do better sales and marketing.

Here’s an idea for some of the things you’ll be doing:

  • Create useful content that will help Clearbit become a go-to resource for our target communities and customers. You’ll create blog posts, email copy, and other collateral — as well as experiment with different formats and mediums — to help inform, encourage, and market to customers across different stages of their lifecycle. This might involve managing and editing contributions from other employees, freelancers, partners, and community members.
  • Drive distribution, according to team and company goals: Part of the job of creating content is telling people that it exists. Otherwise, it’s the whole tree falling in the forest thing. Promotion and distribution tasks may include creating newsletters, using social media, or coming up with experiment ideas.
  • Keep us on message: You’ll pitch in to wordsmith marketing copy and review content for clarity and brand consistency, style, tone, and voice across the company. For instance, you might be pulled in to provide feedback on a survey or to copy edit a presentation. Writing is hard! And you’ll be one of our resident experts.
  • Help us learn and grow through reporting and analysis. Again, content here isn’t driven by vanity metrics but we are informed by data to understand how we’re doing and how we can improve. Our content (and overall growth team) strategies are always rooted in specific business and quarterly goals — so it’s good to know the health of how we’re doing. Currently we use tools like Google Analytics, Mode, and Tableau — have support from a super analytics team.

What will you bring to the table?

  • You’re an excellent writer and editor. You can explain complex concepts clearly, tell a compelling story, and write with personality. You think editing is integral to the writing process.
  • You have a history of marketing or editorial success. Ideally you experienced some of that success working for a SaaS or media company. We’re looking for someone who can show how they’ve had a direct hand in building an audience, helping customers succeed, teaching and educating, and/or moving hearts, minds, (and wallets).
  • Your content is deliberate — driven by an understanding of why it’s being created and who it serves. You’re opinionated when it comes to making decisions about what makes content interesting or helpful — and how it fits in strategically. You’re a believer in talking with and knowing your audience.
  • You’re curious and quick to learn, and you love to do so through the writing process. We’re not necessarily looking for someone to come in the door with domain expertise, but you’re eager to dive in, talk to people, do research, and then share what you’ve learned. You like to ask questions like “why?” and “what if?” and follow through to find the answers.
  • You thrive when able to self-direct. You’re looking to work with a startup where you’ll be responsible for the impact you make and have a lot of freedom. The growth team is fully remote, so you work well with autonomy and are a proactive communicator.

When applying, please include:

  • A description of your work history (whether as a resume, LinkedIn profile, or prose)
  • Links to a portfolio or at least 3 writing samples
  • This is a content position — a great cover letter will help you make your case
Apply for job

items.title: Senior Product Manager, Enterprise
items.content:
Senior Product Manager, Enterprise

Marketing
Anywhere
Company: Mattermost
Full Time

Overview

At Mattermost, we believe that the future of collaboration is open source. As messaging becomes more entwined in day-to-day workflows, we strive to create a solution that enables teams to do their best work while maintaining their privacy and security.

Our flagship product, Mattermost, is a team messaging solution used in high trust sectors all over the world. With customers across a wide range of industries, Mattermost is used daily for everything from building electric cars to ensuring national security.

Learn more at .

https://mattermost.com/

About this Role

As a product manager at Mattermost you are responsible for owning a part of one of the world’s largest and most popular open source projects. A focus on our users is at the heart of what we do, and every day you’ll be interacting with both customers and open source contributors.

For this particular role, we are seeking someone with a background working on enterprise applications. If you’re highly skilled at building customer relationships, and making tough decisions about what to say “yes” and what to say “no” to, this role could be a good fit for you.

Note: This is a remote role, working with Product Managers, Developers, and Designers who are also remote. Travel may be required up to 2-3 times per year for team meet ups.

Responsibilities
  • Work with developers and designers to build enterprise-grade product features
  • Develop a deep understanding of customer needs, and use it to shape product roadmap and team objectives
  • Prioritize ruthlessly, maintaining a laser focus on work that drives improvement on Product KPIs
  • Analyze data to determine if shipped features and experiments had the desired impact
  • Act as a spokesperson for the product, communicating value internally and externally through demos, roadmap presentations, documentation updates, forum discussions, product marketing and events

    • Requirements
    • Product management experience working on B2B products with large enterprise customers (bonus if you’ve worked on areas such as LDAP, SAML, eDiscovery, compliance reporting, data retention)
    • Effective communicator, with the ability to converse at both a technical and business level
    • Highly detail-oriented, with the ability to gather complicated requirements from customers and turn them into simple solutions
    • Strong analytical skills, with a data-driven approach to decision making
    • Capable of turning ambiguity into action, and driving meaningful change in a fast paced environment
    • Embrace our values:
      • https://mattermost.com/about-us/#leadership-principles
      Apply for job

items.content:
Marketing Communications Specialist

Read more about our company fire here: https://naturalforce.com/pages/about

Follow us here: https://www.linkedin.com/company/naturalforce/

Marketing Communication Specialist

Natural Force is looking for a passionate Marketing Communication Specialist to join our fast-paced, growing team; and to help us rapidly scale our customer conversion efforts and increase customer LTV. The Natural Force MCS leverages multiple digital touchpoints to turn customers into raving fans. The MCS is responsible for developing and implementing strategy, tracking KPIs, and reporting solutions to the VP of Marketing.

Position Status: Full-time

Location: Remote, US-based

Salary Range: $50,000-$55,000 plus benefits (health insurance, 401k, paid vacation time)

The ideal candidate for this position possesses the following traits:
Excellent communicator and storyteller
Willing to work “in the clouds” (idea generation) as well as “in the dirt” (idea execution)
Curious, loves learning
Passionate about serving customers
Health/Wellness conscious

Relevant experience includes:
Building and Managing CRM Campaigns
Creating Email-based Customer Acquisition and Conversion Funnels
Copy Writing
Consumer Packaged Goods
Remote Work

Technical proficiency in the below skills will be required:
CRM - Klaviyo preferred
Ecommerce – Shopify, Bold, and Amazon Seller Central preferred
App Automations – Zapier preferred
MS Excel
Basic HTML

Position Responsibilities Include:

Manages and oversees all Natural Force company email sends.
Develops email creative (copy, photographs, and video).
Sets email list building goals and sets out to meet those goals with clearly defined plans and timetables.
Monitors KPIs such as campaign revenue generated and deliverability.
Maintains list quality by regularly performing list clean-up activities, reengagement campaigns.
Segments email list into organized, actionable groups.
Regularly promotes new products, product sales, special events, and merchandise to email list.
Partners with complimentary brands to organize list-building/list-sharing promotions.
Works with Affiliate Manager to build Affiliate onboarding email series.
Works with Digital Marketing Manager to build post-purchase follow-up campaigns that systematically drive customers towards "Wow!" experiences and increase up-sells, cross-sells, and recurring orders.
Works in conjunction with VP of Marketing to design and build high-converting landing pages.
Works in conjunction with Natural Force Digital Marketing Manager to build customer acquisition and conversion funnels around keystone products and offers.
Perform ongoing CRO by A/B testing landing page copy, colors, images, etc.

Example Email Sequences to be Built:
New customer onboarding and brand indoctrination (general)
Post-purchase follow-up (product specific)
Product launch

Example Landing Pages to be Built:
Naturalforce.com product pages
Amazon product pages and A+ content
Influencer offers
Display advertising offers

items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager at Fertility Bridge

Remote | Part-time

“We’re looking for a data-obsessed, analytically-driven digital marketer who has a passion for communicating with the infertility community and who loves staying up to date on the latest developments in digital marketing.” – Griffin Jones, Founder

Location: Remote

About the Position

Using Your Passion For Data to Help Build Families

You will work directly with the entire Fertility Bridge team, as we continue to build Fertility Bridge into the team of marketers who are better than anyone on the planet at listening to people dealing with infertility. Your role is very multi-faceted, and will continually evolve. You will be responsible for digital advertising, Search Engine Optimization, marketing automation, and reporting of every kind. Your job is to help both us and our clients reach our clients and patients more quickly, effectively, and efficiently. You have to make our reporting easier to understand. You have to find the best stories from our data and you have to find more and better data to make our work more effective. The role requires more flexibility than a rubber stretch-arm strong doll, because Fertility Bridge is constantly growing! In fact, you will very likely be creating many of the process that you and others follow.

Who are you?

You are extremely creative, even-tempered, respectful, and have solid experience in social media marketing, content writing, video, and design. You are also flexible and eager to play a creative role in the growth of Fertility Bridge as a company.

Core Responsibilities

  • Analytics
  • Marketing Automation
  • Reporting
  • Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
  • Search Engine Marketing (SEM)/Paid Search
  • Paid Social Media

The tasks at hand for this role:

Assist in creation of detailed SEO recommendations

  • Develop keyword strategies for optimal on-site performance
  • Provide detailed site analysis
  • Provide actionable competitive analysis
  • Develop detailed recommendations for site changes
  • Develop a comprehensive backlink strategy
  • Execute recommended SEO optimizations
  • Prioritize initiatives by difficulty and impact

Monitor progress and adjusting the optimization strategy accordingly

  • Establish SEO audit baselines
  • Establish SEO performance baselines
  • QA all SEO recommendations, before and after launch
  • Monitor client site and competitor site changes
  • Analyze monthly search engine performance reports to determine impact of previous optimization and if new optimizations are needed
  • Manage multiple clients’ PPC accounts on Google AdWords across various industries and geographies
  • Develop accounts and campaigns from scratch using the SKAG and SPAG methodology
  • Perform daily, weekly and monthly optimizations based on the performance of the account and the client’s goals
  • Provide recommendations on opportunities identified based on the client’s goals and performance
  • Conduct comprehensive AdWord audit to identify areas of strength weakness and opportunities
  • Collaborate with other team members to continue to meet and exceed the client’s goals
  • You are expected to be able to provide counsel, digital marketing ideas, or solutions to any challenges that may arise.
  • You don’t need to be a coder, but you do need to know your way around WordPress
  • We will teach you what we know. It is your job to stay abreast of the rapidly changing marketing landscape, and help us update our processes.
  • You may perform any of these tasks for Fertility Bridges’ content properties, as the phrase “the shoemaker’s kids walk barefoot” is sometimes a fair jab.
  • We’re a teensy tiny company and probably will be for a while. You will likely be asked to fill other roles.
  • Anything else the founder dreams up

Key Questions

  • Do you have:
    • a minimum of 3 years of experience running and managing AdWords campaigns
    • Google AdWords certification
    • Excellent client service & communication skills
    • Quantitative and analytics skills, with the ability to draw conclusions based on data
    • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and deliver to expected deadlines
    • Fundamental knowledge of ad targeting methodologies
  • Are you self–motivated and able to take initiative to get the job done?
  • Can you communicate easily, credibly, and pleasantly with anyone under the sun?
  • Do you have high emotional intelligence and are capable of delicately communicating with people struggling with infertility?
  • Are you at ease interfacing with other experts such as designers, coders, writers, and managers?
  • Are you at ease interfacing with clients?
  • Can you observe, analyze, and understand the data from Google Analytics, Facebook, and other digital advertising reports?
  • Are you comfortable thinking through greater marketing and business objectives while still managing the day to day project management aspects of accounts?
  • Can you manage your own time effectively and work well with a team to make sure projects stay on schedule and budget?
  • Are you comfortable having brave conversations with your boss to express your own concerns and feedback as well as receive them?
  • If you’re not sure about your answer to any of these questions, are you excited by the challenge of learning how to develop these new skills?

If you answered “yes” to these questions, we want to meet you!

If you’re not sure about your answer to any of these questions, are you excited by the challenge of learning how to develop these new skills? If you answered “yes” to these questions, I want to meet you!

At Fertility Bridge, we are committed to deeply understanding the needs of people dealing with infertility, and knowing what clinics need to do to meet those needs. We live by our values. We maintain our Learning Culture by continuing to explore the needs of fertility clinics, people coping with infertility, and invest in training and education.

Our Hiring Process

We’re excited to have the right people be a part of Fertility Bridge. We like to work first with independent contractors so that we don’t have to be your only client and vise-versa. This way, you exchange your time in hours and we exchange an hourly rate while we see if the relationship is a good fit for both of us.

If both of us decide that we would like to pursue the prospect of full time employment, our process consists of several interviews, an analysis of your career history, and in-depth reference checks. We respect your time and appreciate your participation in our process. We want you to find the ideal position for your skillset and strengths.

How to Apply
If you feel you can contribute to a dynamic, growing company, please begin your application process by sending an email to Griffin Jones at careers@fertilitybridge.com with your resume, a brief cover letter, and which of our core values resonated the most with you.

Thank you for your interest in serving the infertility community through a creative, business-centered approach!

Apply for job

items.title: Growth Machine: Associate SEO Strategist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Associate SEO Strategist

Growth Machine is expanding quickly, and we need your help to continue being the best SEO and content marketing agency on the internet.

We're hiring an Associate SEO Strategist to work with our content planning and link building teams to do the research and competitive analysis they need to provide the best strategies for our clients.

You'll be in charge of identifying good keyword opportunities, running technical site audits, assessing competitor strengths and weaknesses, and tracking the results of the work we're doing. Your efforts will directly impact as many as 15-20 clients, and millions of monthly readers.

If you're someone who gets excited about figuring out the mysterious inner workings of Google, testing new things, and seeing your work lead to huge increases in customers and readers, this is the perfect role for you.

Who You Are

  • You Love SEO: You read up on the latest updates, follow the thought leaders in the space, and are always looking for new (white hat) things to try to boost your rankings.
  • You're Data Driven: Spreadsheets are one of your favorite tools, and your comfortable working with large amounts of quantitative info.
  • You're Self-Motivated: You've grown something on your own using SEO, whether it's a personal blog, affiliate site, side project, etc.
  • You're an SEO Tool Whiz: You should be very comfortable with Ahrefs and Google Analytics, and any other SEO tools you use in your stack.
  • You're Organized: You love setting up new systems, you keep your cool if things get chaotic, and you can juggle lots of projects and requests at once.

Your Responsibilities

  • Keyword Research: You'll be in charge of doing strategic keyword research for planning out our client's SEO strategy.
  • Competitor Analysis: You'll handle assessing our client's SEO competition, and identifying weak areas we can target.
  • Technical Audits: You'll run technical SEO audits for our new clients, and monitor the technical health of their sites.
  • Tracking: You'll manage our tracking tools such as Ahrefs, Accuranker, and Google Analytics to make sure we and our clients have up-to-date stats on our projects.
  • Reporting: You'll assist in compiling our weekly updates to clients showing how they're performing from an SEO standpoint.

Benefits of working with us

  • Remote Work: We’re a 100% remote company, so you can work anywhere that's in a US timezone. A few of us are in Austin, but you don't have to be.
  • Health Insurance: Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance for you and your family.
  • Profit Sharing: Each quarter we're profitable, a portion of that profit is split amongst the team.
  • Team Retreats: Three team trips per year to cities like Austin, LA, Chicago to get some time together in person.
  • Flexible Hours: Want to go to the gym in the afternoon or prefer working later in the day? Not a problem as long as your work is done.
  • Vacation and Holiday: 20 days paid vacation time, and we take off all major holidays, including a week over the New Year.

items.content:
In Marketing We Trust

 

Digital Analyst

verified
Worldwide, APAC
The Position Summary

Title: Digital Analyst

Location: Remote. Based in APAC

Remuneration: Up to $7,000 AUD per month for the right candidate

Reports to: Managing Director, Frederic Chanut

Works on: Clients' projects and internal projects

Key objectives: Contribute to and grow our conversion research and testing services.

Skills and experience required:

Great experience with Google or Adobe analytics. (certification is a great plus)

Experience in using data to identify actionable opportunities or insights

Love numbers and a passion to use numbers to improve business performance


Skills and experience (good to have):

Experimental mindset - love to push boundaries and try new things

Experience in planning, conducting and analysing experiments result in a digital environment

Some knowledge into experiment framework


The Company

We are a digital analytics Agency and we are very good at Analytics, SEO, CRO, Data Science. Find out more about our services


Our motto: Traffic is nice. Revenue is better.


We have the most fun doing it in competitive environments such as finance, education, jobs, insurance, automotive and many more.


We strive on being an extension of our client’s team and providing tailor-made, return-focused work.

We are picky about the clients we bring on-board and very protective of our reputation. We won’t engage with a firm unless we believe we can make a difference to their business and help them Get Stuff Done!


This stops us from taking on board demoralising projects and having us hating our jobs and our clients.

We think the current agency model is broken and we really believe we can build a better alternative. But we need great people to help make this happen and that’s where you come in!


We are a bootstrapped company, we grew exponentially in the last few years and now seating at 60 people working with us.

We are built to be remote from day 1, but if you want to say ‘Hello’, our office is 78 meters from the beach in Sydney. Make sure you bring your swimwear!



The Role

You'll take responsibility for end-to-end optimisation coverage; you identify opportunities through analytics data, analyse customer journeys to understand customers’ behavior and estimate potential uplift of proposed tests. Working across multiple projects and clients, you will be responsible for analysing test results on a regular basis, supporting the wider CRO team through your insights and recommendations.




The Opportunity

We are looking for a passionate Digital Analyst to join our growing team. The Digital Analyst will work on multiple client projects in support of our broader team to contribute to and grow our conversion research and testing services.


You will need a mix of creativity and strong analytical skills to identify website optimisation opportunities for our clients. You will support to develop and execute strategies and help turn those ideas into an optimisation and testing plan.


You should have enough statistical and analytical abilities to help us understand data in a way that results in actionable suggestions for our clients.


If you have a great understanding of how traffic and audiences are built, of what it takes to incrementally drive improvements to user experience and conversion rates, we want you!

Responsibilities
You'll have a data-driven approach to optimisation, with a solid technical understanding of web analytics and CRO tools, your day to day activities will include:

Analyze quantitative and qualitative data including web, CRM, user testing, polls etc.

Use your findings to present actionable recommendations and test ideas to drive the best possible user experience
Interpret data, identify key findings, and make recommendations based on testing results.

Understanding customer journeys and struggles through analysis like purchase funnel analysis and heat mapping
Identify potential areas of improvement on the website based on Adobe/Google Analytics data

Help define and recommend measurements, strategies, and reporting using data to drive valuable business decisions

Collaborate with CRO team on strategy, testing roadmaps and test hypotheses

Support in designing A/B and Multivariate tests including quality assurance process.

Monitor and continuously evaluate your ideas and designs through development and production phases

Effectively communicate and demonstrate your ideas and concepts to all stakeholders, this could include both technical and non-technical audiences



Ideal candidate

Experience running analysis using web analytics tools like Google Analytics (Adobe Analytics is a plus)

Passion in using data to understand user behaviour and pain points

Experience in extracting and interpreting tests

Good understanding of CRO (Conversion Rate Optimisation) framework

Excellent analytical skills

Ability to clearly communicate data

Detail oriented & organized

Willingness and ability to learn


Attributes and behaviours we love to see
A can-do attitude

Ownership of your work

Inquisitive

Analytical

Creative in context

Results orientated

Collegiate and supportive

A sense of humour

What we offer you
Career progression is based on your ability to deliver and drive ideas and difference for both the client and the company, not your ability to play politics or by the cut of your suit (in fact, we have a no suit policy).



A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you a unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.



We even fly the team each year to our awesome TrustEDConf event. The last one was in October in Borneo.

An important point that is often overlooked: you will be truly part of a team. For most remote workers, you can easily feel isolated from what's happening in the business. We take good care of our teammates. So much so that a person who joined our team late November told us recently that she has felt more part of a team, than when she was working in an office.



Don't take our word for it. Check what our teammates are saying on glassdoor (yep, 2 reviews are not great, but most are).



The Application Process
-----------------------

Fill up the form. Submission is generally reviewed within 3-5 working days.

Submit the answers to our short pre-interview assessment.

Do some short tests (typically 1-3 hours max), live case scenarios giving you an opportunity to see exactly what we do and how we do it

Review of tests

Interview with CRO Lead and Managing Director

Offer and Contract drafted, review signed, Happy dance ensue

Now, here is step 1, time to tell us a bit about yourself.

#Location
- Worldwide, APAC

items.title: Independent Agent $75k-$250k
items.content:
Job Description

Are you seeking an entry level position in sales with lots of room for upward mobility?
Do you understand that relationships matter and people must come first?
Is your ultimate goal to earn a six figure income and gain more time with your loved ones?
If you feel these are things you are searching for this may be an ideal opportunity for you.
As a state licensed insurance field underwriter you will help families protect their homes and their retirement through 30 plus top tier companies in the industry. Now this opportunity is not just a job, it s a pathway to becoming a business owner with a substantial residual income that you can pass on to your family. In addition, we only speak to warm market prospects. Some of the other perks include:
Flexibility to come on full time or part time
Set your own schedule to work as much as you want.
Work from home with very minimal resources needed to get started.
Uncapped commission and incremental promotions for consistent producers.
Earn free yearly trips through our carriers to stunning locations.
The capacity to positively change client s lives.
The chance to help your team develop and reach their goals
At the Wayland Group, we utilize a proven sales system that allows our agents to plug in daily for great training and sales tips through conference calls, training audios, product documents from all our carriers, power point presentations and annual in person training conferences. If you are willing to put in the time, you can become highly skilled in a short amount of time. Furthermore, we only contact families that have asked for our help by filling out a form, so NO COLD CALLING.
We have an outstanding culture at our company that is dedicated to helping each other out, committed to personal development, growth and leadership. This is a system you will have a chance to emulate when building your own team. We will assist you in getting your Life and Health license in your state if you do not already have it, as well as provide you the resources and knowledge necessary to be successful with us. That being said, no prior insurance or sales experience is necessary.
If you are ready for a change and looking for an opportunity to compensates you for your work ethic and passion please apply to this ad or contact Justin at 470-###-#### to set up an interview today. Please leave a professional voice mail and we will reach out to you within 48 hours.

Company Description

We were established with the goal of helping to bring balance to the professional and personal lives of independent agents and agency builders across the country.

By focusing on a more balanced distribution of commissions, we are truly committed to sharing the wealth of opportunity with you, all while delivering high levels of service and training to our sales force.

Combining our Lead Program with business values of trust, reliability, and integrity, we are committed to ensuring your personal goals and objectives can be successfully defined and subsequently achieved over the short, medium, and long term.

If you're looking for the ability to make a great living while helping people, this could be the opportunity for you!

items.content:
What we do

We’re a tech for good business, making care easier for everyone – care workers, agencies, people receiving care and their families.

At our core, we make care management software. Our dedicated mobile app helps care workers to manage all of their schedules, reporting, and client information quickly, so they can spend less time on admin and more time with their clients.

Our web tools helps care agencies to make their operations more efficient, safeguard their clients and care workers, keep data secure, and keep the regulators happy.

Finally we keep the care recipient's family closer to their loved one's care with text message updates, and their own login to review all the care notes as the visits happen.

However, for us this is just the beginning. We want to become a global brand and software platform, supporting the care industry in the UK and around the world. To do that we'll turn our 'software as a service' business into a marketplace for care, helping providers to market themselves, and families to find care that's right for them in their local area.

We've come a long way already: we're now live with over 100 care providers around the UK, but we still have an incredibly exciting journey ahead of us. Join us on our mission to transform the care market through technology!

A day in the life of our Product Designer

We need someone who's keen to tackle some big design challenges, solve real-world user problems, and do some good for society along the way. You'll take responsibility for leading all design activities, primarily development of the product (mobile and web applications), but also owning and evolving the company’s brand identity and tone. Essentially you'll be owning everything that design touches, including:

• Prototyping and final product design
• Owning and evolving the brand and design/style guides
• Website design
• Marketing materials and business cards
• Customer communications
• Growing the design team

You'll love working with us if

• You take pride in working on tech that does real good in the world
• You enjoy working in a relaxed environment but don’t compromise on deadlines
• You are excited about pushing the limits of traditional systems and old ways of thinking
• You want to be part of a small but dedicated team of problem-solving experts with an open communication culture contributing to the wider business goals
• You’re great at managing your own time, as well as coordinating and communicating with others
• You spot where things need to be improved and take initiative to find ways to make those improvements
• You can tolerate occasional puns that are so bad they need to be explained, and you don't hate Beyoncé

What we offer

• Competitive compensation package
• Onsite restaurant-style break area with free coffee and refreshments
• Free team lunch on Fridays
• Flexible work environment with opportunity to work from home once per week
• All the tech you need to get your work done including a MacBook Pro
• High degree mentoring with our CEO through your own tailored development plan
• 32 days of holiday (incl. bank holidays)

Design skills

We’re looking for an inquisitive risk-taking designer, who can lead the design activities across the product and business, shaping both what we do and how we do it.

• Expertise in modern design tools, predominantly Sketch
• Ability to produce rapid prototypes in appropriate fidelity for the situation
• Ability to consider the end to end user flow, but critically the ability to
then design the final user interface to make that flow a reality
• Ability to condense complex processes into simple, clean designs
• Ideally been involved in or led brand development efforts and bringing
brand values into the product and service design
• Ideally has previously taken products from conception to release and
beyond

Communication skills

• Ability to create quick 'best-guess' designs when time is short, and apply more detailed research when more research time is available
• Experience leading user testing efforts and distil outputs and data into tangible actions
• Experience involving engineering and product in design discussions

Leadership skills

• Interest in new design trends and styles
• Ability to prioritise work to hit deadlines
• Evangelism and thought leadership within the design community

If you want to be known for the products and brand that revolutionised elderly care, then we want to speak to you.

We are seeking smart, analytical debators to join our Research Analyst Program. The role is designed to be a paid, 12 week, part-time, remote role.

items.content:
Performance Marketing Manager – FinTech

United Kingdom, London
Company: Corporate Recruitment Solutions

Overview

DESCRIPTION – Performance Marketing Manager – FinTech

Currently recruiting in London

My client is a fast-growing FinTech that is on a mission to make running a small business simple. Their vision is that every small business has their accounting and banking in one place. They are a challenger bank and an early stage start-up with ambitious plans for growth. They have just closed their Series A funding. This is not a corporate environment, and you can expect to be exposed to many areas of the business, with opportunities to improve and impact how they work.

This is a fast paced role, which comes with a good level of responsibility from day one, so you’ll be a competent digital acquisition professional who thrives in a busy, target driven environment. The team you’ll be joining contributes a huge amount to the overall turnover of the business, so you must be results-driven and focused on generating a strong ROI. This is the first in-house Performance Marketing role so is perfect for somebody who is looking for their next step up. Progression opportunities include having a direct impact on business strategy & scaling a team.

Key Accountabilities for the Performance Marketing Manager – FinTech

  • Responsible for the optimisation and growth of all performance channels
  • Analysing current and ongoing campaign performance to identify both incremental and step changes in performance and ROI as well as driving new areas of growth
  • Set, manage and execute PPC and Paid Social strategy, planning, tracking, optimisation and reporting, analysis and optimisation
  • Identify opportunities to improve and scale performance through new techniques, technology and efficiency gains
  • Help solve challenges around attribution
  • Design and run experiments to prove hypotheses
  • Forecasting channel performance and costs

Key Requirements for the Performance Marketing Manager – FinTech

  • Passionate about Digital Marketing and passionate about making a real contribution to a growing business
  • Obsessed with data and able to combine your strong analytical skills with commercial and creative flair.
  • 3 or more years experience within a similar role – PPC campaign management, SEO etc
  • You have ideally worked in a start-up/ Tech / FinTech
  • You are hands on but also interested in aligning your marketing strategy to a wider business strategy

You will be paid a competitive salary of up to £55,000

Not only will you have the opportunity to make a huge impact at one of the UK’s leading Fintechs, you’ll also have access to

  • Share options after 6 months tenure
  • 32 paid days holiday and the ability to work from home
  • Based in Huckletree West, with an interesting mix of other startups and an extensive programme of talks and events available
  • Regular Thursday team socials as well as celebrations for milestones

Apply for job
