items.content:
Marketing Manager – IT Distribution

United Kingdom, Yorkshire
Company: Wallace Hind Selection

Overview

We are Europe’s leading specialist trade only IT Distributor. We currently require an experienced Marketing Manager to manage a team of 10, look after key vendor relationships and create campaigns across the UK & Europe. Based in London or Harrogate

SALARY: £50,000 – £55,000

BENEFITS:
· Plus Bonus circa £4,000
· 22 Days Holiday
· Pension
· Healthcare
· Cycle to Work Scheme
· Childcare Vouchers and much more

LOCATION: London or Harrogate

COMMUTABLE LOCATIONS: Milton Keynes, Watford, Hemel Hempstead, London, Camberley, Harrogate, Leeds, Ripley, Wetherby

JOB DESCRIPTION: Marketing Manager – IT Distribution : London / Harrogate

You will be the driving force behind the marketing team, leading, motivating and supporting the team to success.

You will work side by side with the Marketing Director, helping to maximise productivity.

Based in either Harrogate or London, managing the teams across both sites.

Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to:
· Vendor Management
· Marketing Development
· Content creation and management
· Lead Management
· Finance
· Analytics

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Marketing Manager – IT Distribution : London / Harrogate

· Ensuring quarterly plans for all business units are created and executed
· Maintaining vendor performance on a monthly basis
· Working closely with Vendor Partner Managers to ensure all vendor messages, product updates and launches are communicated internally
· Creating technology focused marketing collateral (emails, web content, PPC, presentations, SEO)
· Ensuring leads are generated through marketing activity and are tracked and reported to vendors and resellers
· Using Google Analytics to monitor campaigns, identify campaign issues, measure traffic, conversions and provide campaign reports

PERSON SPECIFICATION: Marketing Manager – IT Distribution : London / Harrogate

We are looking for a highly motivational Marketing Manager, someone who has lead a team to success and who thrives in a fast paced client side marketing environment.

· Additionally you will have the following skills and experiences:-
· Proven marketing management experience leading a small team (Minimum of 5)
· Experience working for either an IT or Consumer electronics (Vendor, Distributor or Reseller)
· Excellent campaign creation and execution experience
· A strong mix of both traditional and digital marketing
· Strong relationship management

It is highly likely you will have worked in any of the following roles and/or markets, and worked with the following products and/or services: Marketing manager, Marketing, Channel Marketing Manager, Channel Marketing, Marketing lead, Head of Marketing,

INTERESTED? Please click apply. You will receive an acknowledgement of your application.

Please Note : Wallace Hind Selection have been chosen as the recruitment partner of our client and therefore any direct applications to our client from candidates or agencies will be forwarded on to us direct.

REF: ZC

Apply for job

items.title: Community Engagement Specialist, Social Media
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Community Engagement Specialist, Social Media at Twilio

Remote

Location: Remote

Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Where and Why

Twilio is looking for a passionate digital connector to help us create compelling content and build community with our growing audience of developers and customers on social media. This person will help us amplify the Twilio story and help us expand our reach on new and emerging digital platforms. This individual will join a growing global Corporate Communications function that’s sharing the creative ways developers are building great customer experiences with APIs.

Who?

  • Enjoys engaging and building community on social media.
  • Has 2-3 years experience running social media in B2B or B2C.
  • Has experience with Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, reddit, HackerNews, Quora, and other developer platforms.
  • Keeps up-to-date on what’s #trending and can have complete conversations with emojis and gifs.
  • Demonstrates strong written and verbal communication skills and is able to express complex thoughts or ideas in 280 characters or less. (again, emojis and gifs are a plus).
  • Loves to collaborate with a diverse team and work toward common goals.
  • Is passionate to connect people and deliver timely, empathetic responses.

What?

Twilio’s presence on social media is undergoing a major transition as we build our strategy to engage with our growing community of customers and developers that span the globe. You’ll get to play a part in shaping how we communicate on social media and partner with teams across our company to help spread the Twilio Magic. As with most social media roles, each day can be wildly different and bring you new opportunities to flex your social media skills. An engaging day includes:

  • Proactively listening to and engaging in conversations that are happening about Twilio and our products on social media.
  • Being alert of trends on social and coming up with creative ways we can engage with them.
  • Strategizing with product and marketing counterparts for how we communicate product releases, news, and updates.
  • Working with our support team to triage customer issues and questions, ensuring we’re delivering timely and helpful responses.
  • Developing and designing creative assets.
  • Collaborating on editorial calendars and managing posts on our social media channels.

Why?

Driving awareness to a broad audience is a key element of Twilio’s marketing strategy and social media plays a large role in that. In addition to our own platforms, we’ve invested in equipping our entire company with tools and best practices to be our advocates on their personal platforms. Twilio is a dynamic and fast-paced culture where continually innovating and creating new strategies for growing awareness is required.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we’re dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

While working remote, you will still enjoy our incredible perks: monthly Kindle book reimbursement, monthly gym reimbursement, unlimited PTO, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world’s communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer’s toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Apply for job

items.title: Estate Agent Administrator
items.content:
General Summary:
Join a team that is transforming estate agency in the UK.
The role of the Country Administrator for eXp UK is ideal for the candidate who is a self-starter and can manage many projects and details simultaneously. The candidate should be comfortable working in a fast-paced, forward-thinking technology environment. Must possess strong verbal and written communication, be able to establish and nurture personal relationships and help solve problems with a start-up approach. Great opportunity to get in on the ground floor, have a career path, be a stock owner* and grow with the company.

Duties & Responsibilities
- Coordinate meetings with prospective agents looking to join eXp UK
- Supports agent onboarding (need to see to what extent PEO can help)
- Tracks eXp UK systems for transactions, financial and back office reporting for UK and US
- Creates a culture across eXp UK that meets each of our eXp core values
- Ambassador eXp UK staff in providing first-class service to our agents
- Respond quickly to agent questions and resolve for overall positive agent experience
- Assist with the management of local events
- Manages all accounting functions including GL, accounts payable, accounts receivable, revenue and accounting customer service.
- Ensures exchange of contracts paperwork is accurate and complete

Additional Accounting/Finance Support:
- eXp UK Audit
- Support eXp UK Financial Reporting
- Assist with budgeting/ Forecasting
- Coordinates with PSO to ensure income tax, VAT compliance
- Assists with Transaction processing as necessary

Knowledge and Skills Requirements:

Education:
Completed A-levels

Experience:
- 3+ years of experience in an administrative support role, ideally in estate agency
- Experience with Google Suite highly recommended
- Experience in working remotely strongly preferred
- This person must have strong verbal and communication skills, strong teamwork ethic
- Experience working with international companies a plus

items.title: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer

New York City

full-time

About Us

Truly premium content. At true scale. Only CBSi. CBS Interactive is the premier online content network for information and online operations of CBS Corporation as well as some of the top native digital brands in the entertainment industry. Our brands dive deep into the things people care about across entertainment, technology, news, games, business, and sports. With over 1 billion users visiting our properties every quarter, we are a global top 10 web property and one of the largest premium content networks online.

Check us out on The Muse to get an inside look into #LifeAtCBSi through employee testimonials, office photos, and company updates.

CBS Sports, one of the largest premium US sports properties, is seeking a talented Senior Product Designer. Someone who is excited about designing cross-platform experiences with immense visibility for millions of passionate sports fans. We are presently at a formative period of innovation, pushing into new markets, extending our digital streams, experimenting with AR and redefining world-class sports fan experiences.

Is this you?

You are passionate about making delightful, innovative work and committed to growing the talents of more junior team members. You relish the challenge of a white piece of paper, driving novel concepts and developing a strong creative vision. You love design systems, work daily to stay current with the industry (nobody can ever get to the end of their design reading and podcast lists!) and love continually poking/pushing visual design forward year after year. You know strong relationships are core to launching world-class products. Furthermore, you are endlessly motivated by seeing your work make it into the user’s hands and follow your designs every step of the way.

What You Bring
  • 5+ years of Visual Design experience working on consumer-facing mobile and web experiences.
  • A creative portfolio of previous design work, demonstrating empathy for users.
  • Strong beliefs, loosely held; with a willingness to defend your design decisions yet also have your opinion changed.
  • Strong visual design sense, clean command over interaction design, typography and usability.
  • You have the ability to communicate design decisions clearly and effectively across all functions and levels.
  • Desire or experience collaborating, iterating, and testing with Product and Engineering to discover the solutions that exceed user expectations.
The Team

CBS Sports has a nimble creative design team distributed across NYC, Kansas City, Cameron Park, Nashville, and Fort Lauderdale. We span multiple brands under the CBS Sports umbrella including Max Preps, 24⁄7 Sports, Sportsline, Sports HQ & Fantasy. We believe in strong design systems and continually iterate our collective design DNA. User research is at the center of everything we push and work tirelessly to continually improve our understanding of our users.Sport is entertaining, passionate, fun and exciting. We try to emulate the same experience in our office culture. We believe designers have a core seat at the table and carve out time each week for innovation/self-led design projects.

Couple of exciting things we’re working on:- Roku, FireTV and connected TV Apps for our new digital streaming experience.- CBS Sports iOS and Android Apps.- Data-rich sports game tracker and scoreboard experiences.- Personalized sports video tools.- Design partnerships with Apple, Google, Roku and Amazon on large scale projects. Shh!- Interesting design opportunities across our fantasy games.

The team doesn’t stop there! We are part of the larger CBS Interactive family that extends across CBS News, Entertainment, CNET and Gamespot teams, plus many more exciting brands. We meet regularly, exchange ideas, discuss industry-wide challenges and take part in company-wide hack-days/design-days. This extended family allows for endless growth opportunities both within the company and the wider design community. We want all CBS designers to be industry leaders and will support speaking opportunities, workshops and company organized meetups.

Our Culture

We pride ourselves on being a great place to work. Whether that’s team social events within the sports group (company sporting events, after work meetups) or the wider CBS family with monthly company events (the last one was a pride celebration), free bagels in the office on Friday, popcorn Wednesdays, movie screenings (psst: advanced screening for Avengers: Endgame!)and cold coffee on tap all summer long! Furthermore, we offer fantastic benefits from weeklong winter breaks, to paid-time off, summer Fridays, tuition assistance, wellness programs, and even perks for your four-legged friends.

All candidates must successfully complete a background check prior to starting employment at CBS Interactive. CBS Interactive is an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or status as a veteran. CBS Interactive complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Apply for this job ↬

items.title: Marketing Analyst at Hotjar
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=19, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Marketing Analyst

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Data & Analytics, SaaS, Web Technology
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Hotjar | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Amsterdam +/- 2 hours

Technologies

r
sql
python
mfitzp Python Developer at Hotjar 11k 5 34 55
Rory O'Keeffe Full stack web engineer with a passion for learning and creating cool things 201 1 5
eKIK 896 9 6
Jonathan Vella Director of Design at HotJar 1

Job description

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are only considering candidates based within European or African timezones.

We’re looking for someone who loves to turn data into insights and communicate findings fearlessly. You want to help teams make data-informed decisions and take data-informed actions, you have a curious mindset and are motivated to understand our business better.

You will work within our marketing team to make data-driven recommendations on strategy and keep a finger on the pulse of our business. You will analyze the effectiveness of our paid and content campaigns, analyze lead and customer segments and cohorts, assure our marketing tools are communicating effectively, and much more.

You will:

  • Evaluate the performance of our go-to-market strategy by analyzing funnels and metrics

  • Analyze data from multiple systems to provide a full funnel view of the performance of marketing channels and the content we promote.

  • Monitor the state of marketing initiatives and produce data-driven hypotheses and communicate insights

  • Help the marketing team to better understand their functional areas, improve familiarity with and use of data, set the bar for analytics

  • Present analysis based recommendations to project leaders and teams to shape decision making

  • Build data models to accelerate the business by providing deeper insights into visitor and customer behaviours, and feed the team’s hunger for actionable insights

  • Select and integrate new technologies to promote better segmentation and attribution

  • Work with lead and customer data to create impactful visualization and insight reports to fuel demand projects.

  • Understand our marketing tool stack, assure seamless communication and align it with our needs to improve data collection and quality.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of work experience in analytics/data science or a directly related field – some of which is in a technology environment

  • Experience initiating and delivering applicable analyses/recommendations to guide impact

  • Experience with building predictive data models to provide deeper insights

  • Excellent skills with analytics tools, fluency with BI/visualization tools such as Mode, and knowledge of Excel, R, Python,  SQL, or other analysis tools

  • An understanding of SaaS business models and essential metrics

  • Experience implementing and integrating a marketing automation platform

  • Critical reasoning skills, including the understanding of common pitfalls of data analysis

  • A desire to work in a respectful, transparent, and transparent work environment, following Hotjar’scompany values, culture and ways of working

  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third-party


What we offer

  • A remote and accomplished diverse and international team.
  • An opportunity to positively impact people’s experience online and make the web a better place.
  • Annual learning and development budget.
  • Several perks designed for your well-being and a healthy work-life balance. (Holiday Budget, Wellbeing Allowance, Working Together Budget, 16 weeks paid parental leave, and much more).

Compensation

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €50,000 - €70,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to our new team member will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta and Germany (for candidates who don’t require visa sponsorship). All other new team members will join as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

Apply now

About Hotjar

Hotjar is a rapidly growing startup that is giving thousands of website owners the tools needed to discover how their visitors are really using their website. We are looking for passionate and ambitious developers who can help us shape the product and company while growing with us.

Culture at Hotjar:

Headquartered on the beautiful island of Malta, in the “heart” of the Mediterranean, Hotjar is a young startup that embraces remote working and personal development.

Hotjar’s culture is driven by transparency, respect, open discussion, collaboration and blunt and direct feedback. In fact, we’re obsessed with communicating with our users as well as within the team. We hate bureaucracy and slow moving organizations – but we’re suckers for well-defined processes. We love lean, iterative improvements and success is measured by the value we create for our users.

The Perks:

  • Remote & Flexible. Work from anywhere within a European timezone. 
  • Ample Time Off. All team members get 40 days of paid planned leave/year, plus 10 sick days/year and time off to attend conferences / events.
  • Collaborate with prestigious organizations. Imagine what it will feels like to be part of a product that is used by companies like Time Inc., Nintendo, Lloyd's Bank, Pingdom, Booking.com, Intuit and the Red Cross.
  • Only the best hardware and software. Mac, PC or Linux – we will get you equipped with the best hardware and software available, of your own choice.
  • Home Office budget. Every Hotjar team member receives a €4000 home office setup budget, with a yearly €500 top-up thereafter. Upgrade your desk, chair, screens or buy any peripherals you might need.
  • Personal Development budget. Everyone receives a free Kindle as well as direct management of their own personal development yearly budget of €1,000. Buy books, short courses or magazine subscriptions.
  • Holiday budget. A spend of €2,000/year for each team mate to spend relaxing and recharging on holiday.
  • Work Together budget. Even though we're remote, we don't underestimate the value of getting together in person sometimes. Each team member has €2,000/year to spend on travelling to work with other Hotjarians.
  • Working Space Allowance. Decide how you want to spend your monthly €200, whether it's on a co-working space, working from a coffee shop, getting your favourite coffee delivered to your home office, etc.
  • Wellbeing Allowance. €200/month to spend on your wellbeing, be that physical, mental or spiritual.
  • Work with a very talented team. Our team has an impressive background building and optimizing products and businesses around the globe.
  • Make a difference. Hotjar is ‘democratizing’ site analytics and feedback by making them affordable and easy to use for everyone around the world. We call it the ‘Hotjar revolution’.

Benefits

  • €4,000 Home Office Budget, topped up €500/year
  • 100% Remote
  • Free Kindle Paperwhite, Fitbit, Headset and Reading Pack
  • €1,000 Annual Personal Development Budget
  • €200 Monthly Well Being Allowance
  • 40 days leave annually
  • Two company retreats each year
  • €2,000 Annual Holiday Budget
  • €200 Monthly Working Space Allowance
  • €2,000 Annual Work Together Budget

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
TYPE: Contract full time would consider part time

LOCATION: remote work can be London or New York based

RATE: Depending upon experience

ROLE

This is for a CoStartup & Go Client directly

The Marketing and Communications Executive will build awareness for and support the promotion of Di product offerings by generating engaging marketing and communication content.
This is to help with the internal development of a digital platform to host a suite a digital products used by the client’s customers

WHAT IS EXPECTED
• Creation and maintenance of online & offline marketing communications content and collateral such as pitch and sales content for digital products, internal business development decks etc, for use by local in-country business development and sales teams in promotion of the Digital Interact platform
• Promote the brand, campaigns and activity internally through presentations and communications, in collaboration with other internal stakeholders
• Development of common language and messaging hierarchy to ensure consistency across regions
• Ensuring content usage is maximised by deconstructing and repurposing for use across a variety of channels and media
• Ensure that content has the maximum buy-in and up-take across the region
• Responsible for collecting submissions for and creation of case studies/ success stories and white papers
• Co-ordinate copy translation through translation agencies
• Support with client communications and implementation activities
• Drive for tangible and measurable results (e.g. faster time to market, increase in reach, awareness and conversion)

WHAT IS EXPECTED OF THE MARKETING EXECUTIVE
• Candidates will ideally have a well-rounded background that includes digital marketing planning and marketing workflows
• Excellent copywriting skills
• Excellent project management skills
• Preferably you will be educated to degree level in Business/Marketing/Communications/Media with a CIM qualification a distinct advantage
• Proactive and dynamic individual with excellent communication skills (written, verbal and interpersonal)
• An excellent grasp of English and proven experience in developing targeted written communication
• Customer focused - able to take information and translate it into customer driven benefits, with effective internal and external communication messages
• Experience of dealing with managing translations

items.title: Demand Generation Manager
items.content:
Demand Generation Manager at Visible

Remote

You will be held to fair but ambitious growth goals and will be expected to analyze and report on the results of all demand generation efforts. As a key contributor to Visible’s success, you’ll be held to high standards and will have a strong voice in the overall vision and direction of company growth. This role reports to our Chief Growth Officer.

What You’ll Do:

  • Drive qualified traffic to Visible pages
  • Own a monthly trial quota and use a variety of demand gen approaches to meet and exceed it
  • Use your domain expertise to optimize search, social, PPC, retargeting and display campaigns
  • Discover new demand gen opportunities for Visible
  • Identify and manage content distribution and thought leadership opportunities
  • Develop programs to nurture visitors and prospects through the stages of our marketing funnel
  • Analyze and report on all demand generation efforts

Who You Are

  • A confident demand gen marketer with a proven playbook, but the ability and desire to try new things and pivot when necessary
  • At least 3 years of experience in a demand gen role at a B2B SaaS company
  • A planner who knows how to concept, execute on and measure program effectiveness from start to finish
  • Able to easily shift between strategic thinking and smart execution
  • A strong, proactive communicator
  • Accountable for the success of your efforts and accustomed to owning specific KPIs
  • Opinionated, but willing to listen and learn

Bonus Points For

  • Previous experience in a startup environment
  • Previous experience at a remote company
  • Previous experience marketing a trial-based product
  • Understanding product virality and how it can affect new trial growth
  • Familiarity with Intercom, Segment and/or Hubspot
  • Having a few certifications to your name (Google Ads, Analytics, Hubspot, etc)

Why Work at Visible?

  • We’re a small company with a big vision. Your work will have an immediate impact and your voice will be heard.
  • Our product helps 1000s of startups engage their investors and grow their businesses. If you love the pace and possibilities of the startup world, you’ll feel right at home.
  • We have offices in Indianapolis and Chicago, but we’re a remote company. Work from the place where you’re most comfortable and productive.
  • Competitive salary with benefits like medical/dental/vision, technology and coworking stipends, equity options, etc.
  • Unlimited PTO

To learn more about working for Visible, check out our Careers page.

Paid Advertising Manager

We are looking for an expert in paid search advertising and conversion. Our main paid advertising channels are Google and Facebook. Your job will be to create entire campaigns starting at paid advertising, going through landing pages and ending in sales.

To achieve your goals, you will have authority over and responsibility for campaign goals, budgets and return on investment.

You need to master:

  • What makes people act

  • Creative writing

  • Landing page optimization

  • Google Ads

  • Facebook Ads 

  • Analytics

We are a fully-remote company. We develop WordPress plugins, which our clients use to build websites.

For this role, we are looking for a marketer in European time-zone (to work with the rest of the team), speaking native English. Did we already mention experience? You will need to demonstrate past experience and accomplishments to apply for this job.

items.title: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
What's the opportunity?
-----------------------
We're looking for an experienced Product Designer to help us support the way businesses, do business. You will be joining a very product focused team and will own design throughout the product development cycle - from new ideas all the way to implementations. If you’re passionate about the craft and process of building an exciting product from the ground up and working with great people, you’ll fit right in.

Who are we?
-------------
CreditDigital allows vendors to provide an instant finance option to their business customers at online checkout or point-of-sale. Business customers can then design their own terms to fit their budget and cashflow. We are trying to solve a massive problem in the B2B world and we are very excited to be amongst the first ones tackling it.

What will you be doing?
------------------------
As the first designer in the company, you will have the opportunity to set up the standards in how the design process works. As a product team, we trust each individual to be autonomous and work towards are shared goals. We are fully committed in supporting one another in any way possible.

* Act as a champion that drives product ideas from start to completion: from research insights, to workflows all the way to visual designs.
* Sketch and prototype ideas to quickly access viability, and design the fine grained details of interactions.
* Iterate based on feedback from the whole team.
* Work closely with engineers as they build and ship ideas.

What skills and experience do I need?
------------------------------------
We are looking for product designers that have done this before. You will be designer #1 which is very exciting and you will get to set the tone of our product.

* Experience designing digital products and systems (styleguides), not just websites. You have helped ship products.
* An appreciation of the entire product development process, from problem solving through to detailed UI and visual design.
* The ability to create mockups of your designs.
* Excellent communicator that can articulate the thought behind proposals.
* Able to collaborate with the engineers and the wider company on strategy and delivery.

Where will I be working from?
-----------------------------
Normally you will be working from our Angel offices (right next to the station) but we are a remote friendly bunch so you can adjust your schedule as you see fit.

What would I be paid?
----------------------
Our pay is within the top 10% of the industry, for the matched role and experience, based on London rates. According to the market at the moment, we aim to pay £70,000 for the role.

Salary is not everything. Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a life well lived away from work. We don't offer free beers or Coke on tap but rather:

* 25 days off per annum plus bank holidays.
* 35 hours / week. Normal working hours are between 10am – 6pm.
* Work from home whenever. If you prefer to come to the office everyday that’s great, if you prefer to work from home 4 times a week that’s fantastic. Whatever works for you. As a team we will make sure you are not missing out by pushing remote first practices. Flexibility to adjust your daily hours. Visiting friends and family in another country, going to the bank or the gym, you only need to have an overlap between our core hours (12am – 4pm) for 6 hours. As an example, you can start at 8am and finish at 4pm or 12am and finish at 8pm.

How to apply?
--------------
Where you have previously worked does not really matter. If you have a Linkedin profile, just to have a more general idea, send it through, no CV is needed in that case. Instead, send us through a cover letter where you explain more about your experience. We would like you to express:

* What have you worked on that you are the most proud of?
* What do you enjoy working on the most?
* How do you approach the design process?
* What would you like to work on here?

In the interview process we will go through a particular piece of work (your choice) that you have delivered, detailing the approach around it, challenges and learnings. We're looking for a feature/research that clearly outlines the problems you were tackling with your design work. It should touch on the process you applied to tackling the challenges, rather than focusing just on visuals and landing pages. We would like to go through from inception to interactions and the visual design. The work should ideally focus on designing software products.

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company.

items.content:
JOB DESCRIPTION

This position will be working with Amazon's Alexa Data Services Team (ADS). ADS organization provides data creation, curation, and analytics services to help develop, test, and train the Alexa AI. They work closely with internal customers like Machine Learning Science modeling teams, providing the critical data they need to improve Alexa's Automatic Speech Recognition and Natural Language Understanding models and domain features.

Location: Able to work remotely

Hours: Mon-Fri 9:00am-5:00pm (EASTERN STANDARD TIME)

Duration: 3 Month Contract-From there it will depend how the project is going as well as how your performance has been to see if there is room for an extension or not.

JOB MISSION

  • Amazon is hiring Data Associates to work with their remote team on transcriptions of audio files for Automatic Speech Recognition, semantic annotation for Natural Language Understanding, and dialogue evaluation for improving overall customer interaction with Alexa.
  • You will focus on speech and language data, primarily in the areas of transcription, text annotation, and general data analysis to meet the internal customer's request.
  • Driven by your passion for data, you show proactive behavior in solving issues with efficiency and accuracy. Your ability to concentrate and your high attention to details help you deliver high-quality work.
  • In this role, you're comfortable with, and understand, the changes to the conventions deployed in response to internal customers' requests. You demonstrate ability to adjust your workflows accordingly. You prioritize strict compliance with regulatory requirements, and contribute to improvements in the software tools by identifying bugs and suggesting enhancements.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Maintaining strict confidentiality and follow all applicable Amazon policies for securing confidential information
  • Transcribing and annotating high priority deliverables
  • Translating established guidelines into daily work practices and processing data in order of priority
  • Delivering high quality on deadlines
  • Getting the job done and work autonomously with minimum direction
  • Contributing to process improvements to reduce handling time and improve output

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Native-level proficiency in FRENCH CANADIAN AND ENGLISH, both verbal and written skills
  • Comfortable working with speech from various dialects and accents of FRENCH CANADIAN
  • Willing to work with audio content (wearing headsets) for a portion of the day
  • Experience with business software
  • Capable of working in strict compliance with internal guidelines
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills, detailed-oriented, highly collaborative
  • Comfortable working in an ever-changing, highly collaborative and dynamic work environment
  • Willingness to support several projects at one time and to accept re-prioritization as necessary
  • Continuous efforts to deliver the high quality data such as self-analysis




About Aerotek:

We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.



The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-###-#### or email accommodation@aerotek .com for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

items.title: Digital Marketing Manager
items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager at WriterAccess

Remote

WriterAccess, an award-winning content creation platform connecting thousands of businesses with freelance writers, editors, and content strategists, is looking for a Digital Marketing Manager to help us continue our growth in the marketplace. You’ll find us on the Inc 5000 List as a 5 Year Honoree with 59% growth in the last 3 years, without even a smidge of investment or VC funding. Join our team of remote employees that keep the content orders flowing and revenue growth going year after year.

The Job In a Nutshell

  • 100% Remote, Part-Time or Full-Time
  • Lead, manage, motivate the marketing team(Staff of 4+)
  • Create, direct and oversee all creative campaigns
  • Manage, guide and oversee PPC agency
  • Host, manage and promote webinars, podcasts and live event
  • Crank out one major lead generation asset/month

What You Do

  • Manage MarTech stack and marketing tools
  • Develop Organic and paid campaigns
  • Oversee search and landing page optimization
  • Develop and manage email marketing campaigns
  • Develop and manage lead and click funnels
  • Manage digital and print vendors
  • Promote annual content marketing conference
  • Advance thought leadership and speaking opportunity
  • Manage social media and support team

MarTech Chops Required

  • At least one year of remote employment experience
  • 2-6 years of digital marketing experience
  • Enthusiastic, creative and committed
  • Self-directed, motivated and proactive
  • Proficiency in marketing tools and automation
  • College degree Marketing Integration or Computer Science
  • Advanced email marketing knowledge, strategies, and tactics
  • Ability to test and derive meaning from data
  • Ability to interpret marketing data from Google Analytics and AdWords
  • Portfolio of proven results
  • Demonstrated analytical skills
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Detail-oriented and organized
  • Happy employees that love work, travel, and no commute

What You Get

  • Work from home or anywhere you travel
  • Flexible schedule to work around your needs
  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience
  • Bonus plan based on individual and company performance
  • Health plan and other benefits and incentive programs
  • Gathering at our annual content marketing conference
  • More time with your family, friends, and pets too

Why Choose Us

Our leaders are passionate about the business, fun and easy to work with, and proven professionals with track record’s a mile long. Our 15,000+ freelancers all work remotely and we treat like gold with transparent pay rates, fair price mandates and free tools, courseware and online learning to help them advance their career. Our employees are motivated by our organic accomplishments, positive culture and genuine commitment to career development. And best of all, our small staff is motivated to enhance our world-class software that helps remote freelancers find clients, earn income, and spend more time with family, friends, and travel.

Apply for job

items.content:
Content Marketing

Ready to create some magic? Are you a smart, motivated individual seeking to jump into a company and learn a whole bunch?

Our marketing team is growing and we’re looking for amazing talent to join our pack. This position is best suited for a junior content marketer, with a strong desire to grow their skills. The right person will help us execute our content strategy by supporting our lead Content Marketing Manager’s everyday tasks: from content planning to publishing. 

We need someone ready to start contributing without a steep learning curve, so this position isn’t suited for entry-level applicants. SaaS experience is preferred, but not a dealbreaker. We use WordPress for our blog, so a working knowledge of the WordPress platform is a must.

Our team is incredibly passionate, smart, supportive, skilled, open to learning, happy to take constructive criticism and use it to level up. We’re looking for someone who can match that energy and help us scale.

About the role:

Our future Jr. Content Marketing Manager will support our lead Content Marketing Manager by splitting the workload. You’ll be focusing your time on research, creating content for landing pages, publishing content on our website using WordPress as well as working with Mailchimp for our newsletters, and of course email marketing campaigns. The remainder of your time will be working with our marketing team, and also helping with other inititaves, launching campaigns and other interesting initiatives to help drive in leads. And of course we are a video company so any interest with video is a plus.

This is a full-time remote position, and is not suited for a digital nomad lifestyle. We require a steady internet connection and a mandatory overlap of working hours with the rest of the team.

Requirements:

Must have:

  • 1+ years of experience writing (with writing samples to support)

  • 1+ years of experience managing content

  • Working knowledge of WordPress

  • Basic HTML knowledge

  • Impeccable sense of grammar and punctuation (American English)

  • A fully functioning workstation and a quiet place to work (with their own laptop)

  • Genuine interest in the video market

Must be:

  • Able to overlap at least 4 hours with our distributed team: from 6AM to noon ET

  • Quick to learn and able to understand audiences

  • Able to work independently

  • Native or near-native English speaker

  • Confident researcher who loves facts, hard evidence and numbers, with source info to prove it (‘Trust me bro’ doesn’t count)

  • Overall a kind and fun person :) 


Our ideal candidate will also have:

  • Experience with Mailchimp or similar email marketing system is a bonus

  • Experience in SaaS industry / team

  • Degree or relevant experience in Marketing Communication, Journalism, or similar

  • Knowledge of OTT or video industry in general (Nice to have but not a deal-breaker)

  • Good sense of content trends 

Benefits:

  • Full-time (40 hours per week) remote job with contract. We want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance / part-time position you can do in tandem with other professional endeavors

  • Join an amazing, creative and motivated team

  • Advance your career and progress within the team

  • Work from anywhere (OK, almost anywhere…), as long as you have regular overlap with Eastern Time business hours and reliable internet connectivity.

  • 20 paid days off per year (eligible after the first 6 months with the company)

  • Budget for personal development

How to apply:


Before applying, please note:

  • Apply using the link below

  • We review the applications and email candidates who qualify for the second round

  • The qualified candidates will be asked to do a test task: usually a video of yourself answering a few questions

  • After we review the submissions, we will organize a Skype interview with the successful candidates

Heads up! Due to the high volume of applications, we are thrilled to receive, at this time we are only able to respond to successful candidates.

APPLY HERE

https://bit.ly/2NCp0PR

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) MM/PP - Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP MM/PP specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong MM/PP experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Materials Management and Production Planning (MM/PP) modules
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the MM and PP modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment,
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of MM/PP
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP MM/PP specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

items.title: Outbound Cold Email Prospecting
items.content:
Outbound Cold Email Prospecting at HelpFlow

Remote | International

Location:

We are looking for an experience SDR (sales development rep.) to join our established virtual company. This is open to candidates from anywhere in the world as we are a global virtual team.

What does “established” mean?

  • We have 50+ employees
  • a proven high ticket monthly recurring service delivered to 100+ clients
  • and a great company culture.
  • The marketing and sales dept. is not yet strongly established but everything else is. So… you have a lot of potential to grow.

As SDR, you’ll ultimately be accountable to (lead metric) hitting a weekly quota of new prospects added to the cold email prospecting campaign and (lag metric) the # and $ value of qualified new sales opportunities passed from your efforts to the Account Executive.

How you’ll do this:

  1. Manage the Prospect Researcher to identify contacts from our list of target companies (you will NOT be doing the data research to identify companies, contacts, etc.).
  2. Queue new prospect emails to email outreach campaign, using reply.io (similar to persistIQ, outreach.io, etc.).
  3. Process all prospect responses to email outreach campaign
  4. Complete qualification process of new leads, via email AND via phone. You’ll be provided with a basic framework for this, but telephone communication skills are required.
  5. For qualified prospects, you’ll book a Discovery call with the Account Executive who will be responsible for moving the sales opportunity forward in the sales process and closing the deal. By the way, in your job application response, cover letter, or email application, start with “colorful unicorn” so we know you read all of this.

Requirements

To be successful in the role, you should meet the below:

  1. (required) High speed reliable internet with ability to conduct voice calls over the internet (we use ringcentral.com).
  2. (required) Ability to work in US timezone for first 3-6 months of the role, specifically in US PST. Specific schedule will be discussed during interviews.
  3. (required) Experience working virtually full time for at least 6 months (in any role)
  4. (required) Natural western US english text written AND PHONE communication skills
  5. (required) At least 2 years of experience in similar lead generation role involving outbound emails and calls (not data research or data entry).
  6. Preferred Experience with Reply.io, Pipedrive.com, (rare) Airtable.com, Asana.com

Benefits

  • To be discussed during the interview.
Apply for job

Healthcare organizations all across the country use our proprietary software-as-a-medical-device platform, the eGlycemic Management System®, to deliver personalized diabetes therapy management and insulin optimization. Track, report and triage/classify all interactions.Maintain existing and prospective customer database, including extensive online research to secure or validate titles, roles, organizational affiliations and other information; scrubbing/cleanup and multi-layered segmentation. Assemble resources as needed for various presentations, demonstrations and engagements.Continually seek ways to improve results by monitoring and analyzing key metrics, benchmarking against industry norms and best practices, and formulating salient recommendations.Perform ongoing collection and dissemination of market and competitive intelligence. Help curate daily news content from several dozen media outlets.Help coordinate logistical details associated with company’s involvement in conferences and events. Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, business administration, information technology or related discipline.Four or more years of post-college experience in Internet and digital marketing administration, to include data management.History of demonstrable success in areas of primary responsibility listed above, either at a technology company, healthcare-related organization or digital agency.Hands-on expertise in setup and maintenance of marketing automation platform such as Hubspot, Pardot, Marketo, Act-On or ActiveCampaign.Above-average proficiency with Microsoft PowerPoint, Word and Excel.Superior prowess with web analytics.Strong copywriting, editing and proofreading skills.Knowledge of the healthcare provider industry and the fundamental workings of hospitals and health systems.Extraordinary organization skills and attention to detail. Preferred Qualifications:Healthcare knowledge garnered through education or on-the-job experience.Experience in sales administration, account management or customer service.Graphic design/mixed media skills (i.e., proficiency with Adobe Creative suite applications, such as Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Fireworks, Flash and Premiere).Proficiency with CRM (salesforce, Netsuite, Zoho, Sage, SugarCRM, Microsoft Dynamics or similar).Knowledge of SaaS-based business models. items.title: Senior Product Manager (Price Comparison)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Product Manager (Price Comparison)

United Kingdom, Nottinghamshire
Company: Experian

Overview

A new exciting opportunity for Experian HD Decisions, we are looking for a strategic product leader to join our Nottingham (City Centre) team. We are currently recruiting a Head of Product for our Price Comparison product . This is a brilliant opportunity for someone with strong analytical competencies who wants to broaden their career within a FTSE 50, market leading organisation.

T he role


As the Head of Product, you will be responsible for a number of areas which include, being accountable for the strategic development of the product roadmap by ensuring it is clearly defined, updated in line with market needs. Ensure that good client / consumer outcomes are at the center of all your decision making. Develop and effectively implement ‘Go to market’ plans, working cross-functionally to ensure successful execution.

You will own and drive the product plan, pricing strategy, development budget and roadmap. Take reasonable steps to ensure that the business area complies with the relevant requirements and standards of the regulatory system and develop trusted relationships across the wider Experian organisation is key as you will need to facilitate the execution of the product strategy.

Could this be the role for you?

This is a great opportunity for an experienced product leader to manage and launch new products, and have an influential role across our business.

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about shaping the future success of rapidly growing FinTech area of Experian. It is essential that you can demonstrate relevant experience in a senior portfolio/product management role, with a track record of commercial and/or technical achievement, revenue growth and cost reduction. You must have significant experience in managing products and launching new. You will need to be a strategic thinker and able to define the maintenance and development of the roadmap for your product. Being able to build a business case, using financial models is required. It would be a bonus if you have previous experience of P&L management and able to own the analytical/insight agenda that underpins your product.

Why choose us?
Our colleagues’ health and wellbeing is a top priority for us, that’s why our reward, benefits and wellbeing programmes are designed so you can come to work feeling your very best self. Our benefits focus on health, money and lifestyle so you can tailor your benefits to your own personal needs. Whether it’s your physical and mental wellness, getting to work or planning for the future, we have a range of flexible options to have you covered!
We are committed to building an inclusive culture and to creating an environment where people can balance successful careers with their commitments and interests outside of work. Our flexible working practices support our belief that this balance brings long-lasting benefits for our business as well as our people. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, and if this is important to you, we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

Who are Experian?
We unlock the power of data to create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. At life’s big moments – from buying a home or car, to sending a child to university, to growing a business exponentially by connecting it with new customers – we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence so they can maximize every opportunity.
For more than 125 years, we’ve helped consumers and clients prosper, and economies and communities flourish – and we’re not done.

Our 17,000 people in 37 countries believe the possibilities for you, and our world, are growing. We’re investing in new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow.

Could this be the role for you? Apply now to start your journey with Experian.
To learn more about our culture and what it’s really like to work here, check out our LinkedIn and social media channels using the hashtags #ExperianLife and #ExperianWay.


Apply for job

items.content:
Job Title: Product Manager with IAM Experience

Location: Nashville, TN/Alpharetta, GA/Remote opportunity -(Remote working with once a month travel to client location)

Duration: Fulltime

Position Summary: The technical product manager (TPM) for Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) will work with internal users, development and implementation teams to gather and manage technical product requirements. The TPM will collaborate with peers to ensure that the product roadmap is aligned with company s strategy and goals. The role is responsible for guiding requirements based on prioritized technical needs, contributing to the product backlog, and collaborating with cross functional teams to ensure successful development and roll out of new features for CIAM.
Job Responsibilities:
Create product vision and strategy, product roadmap, and deliver product requirements and workflows.
Work closely with technical internal teams, including engineering and development, to write user stories and requirements.
Help facilitate sprint planning and grooming using SAFe/Agile development framework.
This position will be the main interaction point for other Change Healthcare teams to discuss CIAM technical capabilities from product management perspective.
Work with multiple stakeholders to define and manage technical and organizational readiness for product rollouts.
Work with CIAM implementation team to understand requirements and prioritize for productization.
Work with Program Manager and Product Owner to ensure there is a project plan for each initiative or release, monitor and mitigate risks, keep each capability on track, and provide communication with all teams to ensure alignment.
Build and share domain knowledge. Act as product evangelist, drive best practice research and benchmarking to build best-in-class solution.
Travel Minimum Requirements:
3-5 years of experience is required in IAM in software development/consulting/product management.
Critical Skills:
Experience in one or more of the following is highly desired: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
Exposure to any IAM standards such as OAuth, Open ID Connect, SAML
Development and/or implementation of Identity and Access Management solutions
Demonstrate technical proficiency and effectiveness working closely with Software Engineers, Architects and QA.
Experience in Agile development methodology. Knowledge of Atlassian toolset.
Must demonstrate a strong ability to drive execution of complex and enterprise level technology solutions (e.g., move projects forward with unknowns and anticipate and mitigate risks.)
2+ years of experience working within a matrixed organization/environment.

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) QM -Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP QM specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong QM experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Quality Management (QM) modul
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the QM modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment, several S/4 HANA implementations under your belt.
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of QM and experience with S4/HANA
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP QM specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.content:
Product Marketing Manager

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: The Democratic National Committee
Full Time

Overview

The Democratic National Committee’s Tech team is hiring a to help us build world class tools to help candidates win elections and to empower progressives across the country by providing them with access to high quality data and tools they need to win.

Product Marketing Manager 

We need an experienced Product Marketing Manager to help us define and communicate our value proposition for our data warehouse and suite of self service analytics tools we are building for our growing community of data analysts and data scientists in state parties, campaigns, sister committees (like the DCCC), and vendors.

This role is the glue that binds our product strategy to the tactics we need to drive success in marketing and communications to achieve results. You will be the product evangelist and will play an integral role in organizing product releases and linking arms with our community team to ensure consistent and clear customer messaging and support.

Who we are

The Tech team is a small, diverse team that provides the technology used by candidates and organizers in all 50 states and all 3,413 counties across the United States to analyze data, organize campaigns, raise money, and get out the vote on election day. But there’s more to do. So we’re hiring product managers, engineers, researchers, designers, security experts, IT professionals, and data scientists who can use user-centered design and rapid iteration to develop a rich technology ecosystem for progressives—building tools ourselves as well as partnering with other companies and organizations.

The Product

Our data warehouse and analytics tools is our product (‘Phoenix’). We are deeply committed to equipping candidates and campaigns around the country with the resources they need to win, and we are seeking a Product Marketing Manager to collaborate with our product and community teams to identify the highest value opportunities to improve users’ end to end experience with democratic data.

Our users range in technical skill and it’s our mission to build tools that help analysts and data scientists uplevel their analytics game by providing features and functions that seamlessly integrate with our data warehouse.

You Will..
  • Define our value proposition – With your deep understanding of the needs and challenges that our customers are facing today, you will define differentiated value propositions to accelerate the adoption of Phoenix.
  • Develop strategy and execution for all customer communications. This includes product releases, weekly updates and much more.
  • Influence our roadmap – Influence the product strategy and in-product communications through relevant consumer and product insights, driving alignment across teams when needed.
  • Showcase our solution – Build ‘wow’ and ‘how to’ content and go to market activities to excite, delight and onboard presidentials, state parties, sister committees and vendors to Phoenix.
  • Support and coordinate the efforts of internal cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Data, Engineers, Community, UX Design, and others.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our products and the development work that is happening each sprint.
  • Be a key resource for customers such as state party data directors, sister committee analysts and presidential data teams.
  • Develop relationships with customers across the political tech ecosystem.

    • You might be right for this role if you..
    • Have a minimum 5+ years of relevant work experience in fields such as product marketing, integrated marketing, product management, management consulting, communications or technical pre-sales.
    • Have a Bachelors degree in marketing, business, technology, computer science or relevant field of studyHave a demonstrated track record in crafting compelling positioning and marketing content.
    • Have experience partnering with, influencing, and driving buy-in from product teams (Product Management, Design, Engineering, UX Research, Data Science).
    • Comfortable with one or more of the following: SQL, data architecture, data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Periscope, Google Data Studio).
    • Have strong written and verbal communication skills, and experience distilling key functionality and benefits into product marketing message.
    • Are curious, collaborative, and humble – ready to work with a diverse, distributed team to solve interesting problems together
    • Deep knowledge of and passion for technology products.

      • Nice to have..
      • Electoral campaign experience, and specifically experience with political data, is not required, but is definitely a plus.
      • Experience with front-end programming
      • Experience managing numerous stakeholders and large cross-functional teams
      • Experience working with a remote team

        • Do you want to..
        • Secure the future of our country? Right now a lot is at stake in our country and our team has a huge opportunity to make a real difference.
        • Work with amazing people? We’re building a diverse, distributed team, hiring the best people we can wherever they are—alumni from past Presidential campaigns working out of DC and New York, experienced product developers from the SF Bay Area, and more.
        • Never stop learning? There are people who know about politics and people who know about technology and a few who have figured out some things about how to combine the two, but we are blazing new trails and you should be comfortable exploring and learning from everyone you can.

          • This is a full-time role. We are a remote team with a concentration of folks in Washington, D.C., San Francisco Bay Area, Boston and Chicago. If you are coming from industry, however, be aware that some things are different in the world of politics: while we’ve done some budget hacking so we can be competitive when it comes to salaries we know we can’t beat Google or Facebook. On the other hand, you might legit help save the world.

          The Democratic National Committee (DNC), is committed to diversity among its staff, and recognizes that its continued success requires the highest commitment to obtaining and retaining a diverse staff that provides the best quality services to supporters and constituents. The DNC is an equal opportunity employer and it is our policy to recruit, hire, train, promote and administer any and all personnel actions without regard to sex, race, age, color, creed, national origin, religion, economic status, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity or expression, ethnic identity or disability, or any other legally protected basis. The DNC is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in the hiring process and on the job, as required by applicable law. The DNC will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination and any such conduct is strictly prohibited.

          Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Designer
Anywhere
Company: Shopify
Full Time

Overview

At Shopify, we care deeply about making commerce better for everyone. This mission began when our founders started an online business selling snowboards. Existing software was expensive and so hard to use that it made their dream of entrepreneurship feel impossible. So, they changed their focus and started developing Shopify to enable anyone with something to sell to easily start, run, and grow their business.

Today, Shopify empowers more than 800,000+ merchants from all over the world to succeed at entrepreneurship. Our mission is ambitious and we’re looking for great people to join us. You’ll join Shopify’s growing UX team of 450+ Designers, Content Strategists, UX Researchers, and UX Developers, who play a key role in building understanding and empathy for merchants.

About the role:

As a Senior Product Designer, you will be responsible for end-to-end UX projects within the Shopify Home team under our Core Foundations group. Core teams are focused on building the Foundations of everything Shopify does to make both the platform and other teams at Shopify work better, faster, stronger. The Home team is responsible for the first interface a merchant sees when they log into our software.

This is a multifaceted role, where you’ll be responsible not only for product design (including sketching, wire-framing, low and high fidelity prototyping) but also contributing to the product vision and roadmap, working on synthesizing and summarizing findings across multiple data sources, helping and working closely with content strategist on content tasks (the product you’ll be working on is all about communication), and stewarding product and UX conversation with senior leadership.

What you’ll be working on:
  • Owning projects from start to finish while leading various UX initiatives including planning, content mapping, sketching, wire-framing, low and high fidelity prototyping and leading stakeholder reviews
  • Collaborating with a multidisciplinary team of designers, content strategists, UX researchers, developers, and product managers to explore, prototype, test, and ship the best possible experience for our merchants
  • Working with our data scientists and UX Researchers to identify optimal methodology and tooling based on project objectives and constraints
  • Being data-driven; synthesizing and summarizing findings to inform product and UX decisions
  • Mentoring others across various UX disciplines, levelling up the team and helping evolve our tools and best practices to continually grow and improve the discipline.
  • Collaborating with content strategists, defining and evolving editorial, voice and tone, standards across our product.
  • Identifying, championing and developing opportunities for new product functionalities to continuously improve future iterations of the product.
  • Sharing and reviewing designs based on peer feedback, user research, testing, and merchant feedback

    • Requirements for the role:
    • Passion for solving product problems while balancing all facets of UX (strategy and research, information architecture, interaction design, data analysis, content modelling, and high fidelity visuals)
    • Experience collaborating closely with product, engineering, content, and research
    • Ability to provide high-level design strategy and visionEmploy a user-centered design process to support the overall business strategy
    • Seek out and leverage the insights from our research and analytics teams to inform your designs
    • Experience with organizing large amounts of information to ensure it’s easy to understand, find, and interpret on any device
    • Experience working closely with content strategy, information architecture, and/or editorial processes
    • Ability to clearly communicate insights and provide recommendations to various stakeholders including, but not limited to, senior leadership
    • Experience working in a fast-paced experimental or start-up environment collaborating with remote team members
    • Proficiency with current industry design and collaboration tools such as Sketch, Figma, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite, Github
    • Ability to step away from technology for sketching ideas and lo-fi prototypes
    • Staying on top of emerging UI standards and trends.

      • We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. Holly is looking forward to reading your application. If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce around the world, send us a few samples of your work: portfolio, wireframes, UX flows, publications, or whatever represents what you do best.

      This posting will close on 

       July 15th at 9 am EDT.

      At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

      Apply for job
