items.title: Technical Product Manager
items.content:
Technical Product Manager at Aledade

Remote
  • Technology / Data Analytics
  • Bethesda, MD, USA

We are actively recruiting for a Technical Product Manager who works within our Product Management team. The ACO Management Technical Product Manager is a key member of the team that helps to design technical, analytic and process solutions to support Aledades internal ACO management organization. Who also works alongside business owners, data analysts, designers, engineers, and stakeholders to define tech-enabled problems, solution design, implementation approach and rollout plans. They are the interface between strategic business owners and execution team and ensure that Aledade creates a high-quality product with the ability to scale

Within Aledade, we are a team of business owners, software developers, designers and product managers that build, implement and maintain a web-based application that transforms data from multiple sources into high-value, actionable insights. This application is used by strategic leadership, internal ACO executive directors, and the field support teams to monitor and manage ACO and practice performance in the realm of value-based reimbursement.

This position will be full time, and includes full benefits and an equity option. We are open to remote, US-based candidates.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with ACOM business owner and stakeholders to cultivate a shared vision for the problem space, constraints, priorities and ideal end state, and be able to articulate and advocate for this perspective.
  • Work with internal teams and end users to develop a deep understanding of requirements, perform thoughtful solution design, use data to test hypotheses, and support teams throughout execution.
  • Write detailed user stories for new projects, capturing detailed descriptions of business rationale, requirements, and success criteria that are defined by measurable outcomes.
  • Participate in daily stand ups, demo days, sprint retros and PM/PO coordination meetings.
  • Develop short- and long-term roadmaps that deliver maximum value with minimum risk and assume ongoing iteration.
  • Review support issues related to projects and monitor utilization and expected outcomes.

Basic Requirements

  • Minimum of 5 yr product management experience in technology, technology-enabled services industry, or a SaaS product.
  • Experience using data and primary research to inform solution design and build internal business understanding.
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills, with an emphasis on problem-solving and building subject matter expertise.
  • Experience with and understanding of the software development lifecycle and software development methodologies. Preferably experience with participating in Agile / Scrum teams.

Preferred Experience

Product development experience in the context of the development of a healthcare technology product, especially with clinical and staff end users.

  • Product management experience in the context of an account management or client performance product, especially geared towards financial, sales or operational efficiency goals.
  • Knowledge of healthcare administrative and clinical data sets, including demographic, financial and clinical data.
  • Basic understanding of healthcare administrative or clinical workflows for inpatient, ambulatory or ancillary services.
  • Experience working with population health or CRM products, such as Salesforce.
  • Experience with clinical quality measurement and corresponding data sets.
  • Knowledge of SQL, ideally with PostgreSQL experience.
  • Knowledge of alternative payment models related to primary care such as MSSP ACOs, Pioneer ACOs, commercial insurance shared savings programs, PCMH.

Who is Aledade? We are a healthcare services startup, backed by Venrock, ARCH Venture Partners, Google Ventures, Biomatics Capital Partners, and the Maryland Venture Fund. We are intent on creating healthcare that is better for patients and doctors, at a lower cost. We assist independent primary care physicians in managing the transition to value based care, initially through the creation of accountable care organizations. We are public health-motivated, data-driven, and relentless. We are creating a state-of-the-art cloud based technology stack to foster population health in our practices.

At Aledade, we dont just accept differences, we celebrate them. We strive to attract, develop, and retain highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities where we live and work. Aledade is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Employment policies and decisions at Aledade are based on merit, qualifications, performance, and business needs. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical condition related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity or expression, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

Apply for job

items.content:
Growth Marketing Manager // Skoove

Company: Skoove

Tags:
  • SEO
  • Facebook
  • Content
  • ASO

    • At Skoove, we want to unlock the magic of making music for everyone who dreams of playing an instrument. With more than 1 million users today, we make interactive apps to learn piano and guitar. With our team of 20 certified music nuts, we combine music learning science, audio technology, and machine learning to build a unique company in the music tech space.

    We are looking for a key player at Skoove! In this very broad mid-level role, you will drive customer acquisition and conversion initiatives from conception to completion – rapidly growing our North American and European customer base. This role leads our paid acquisition and CRM and is responsible to report on performance across all channels and for the entire funnel from first touch to sale.

    Our ideal candidate is a result-driven customer growth professional, with a 5+ years track record in a similar broad role in the app economy. You love an analytic and strategic approach to customer growth and can’t wait to translate your conclusions into results, tests, and iterations. Have what it takes to join our marketing team? Come, join the band!

    YOUR JOB

    • Paid advertising: Run ROI positive campaigns on Facebook, Apple Search Ads, and content networks. Coordinate the creation of creative assets.
    • CRM: Constantly optimize onboarding and re-engagement campaigns and ensure high engagement with large email audiences.
    • Partnerships: Initiate and close partnerships and implement campaigns with artists, brands, and other partners.
    • App Store Optimization and SEO: Work with App and Play stores and our external agencies to constantly optimize store page conversion, app, and web rankings.
    • Reporting: Constantly test, measure, and optimize across all channels. You serve as the central information resource for our growth metrics.
    • Marketing Tech: You manage the relationships with our marketing service partners and select the best in class services together with our CEO and CTO.
    • Management: Select and manage marketing interns; control the marketing budget.
    • Works closely with our internal content team and external creatives.
    • Report directly to the CEO.

    WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

    • Join an exceptional multinational team of 20 and shape the future of music making
    • Enjoy a positive and purpose-driven working atmosphere in our office in Berlin Friedrichshain
    • Invest your time and energy into a meaningful and beautiful product that improves the lives of people
    • Your work will make a difference and will be recognized inside and outside the company.
    • Enjoy flexible working hours and occasional remote work

    YOUR PROFILE

    • Minimum of 5 years of experience in hands-on customer acquistion and conversion role at small or medium web / app developers.
    • Energetic and tenacious personality with entrepreneurial approach and strong closing skills; used to deliver results independently
    • Track record of developing and executing very cost effective customer acquisition campaigns including paid advertising
    • Hands on proficiency with marketing tech stack: Facebook BM, Google Adwords, Appsflyer, Mixpanel, Braze, iTunes Connect,…
    • Music and technology lover with broad musical knowledge and understanding of music making.
    • Experience managing suppliers and implementing partnerships
    • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, or other related area.
    • Very good English language skills, German a plus
    • EU work permit
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Arabic Speaking SEO & Content Manager


KaFe Rocks is one of the leading affiliate companies operating within the iGaming space. Our success-to-date is the result of the ongoing efforts of the collective minds of our exceptional Rocketeers.

With a portfolio of 30+ sites, in 8+ languages, across 20+ countries, we have scaled at pace and generate thousands of leads each month for our carefully selected iGaming partners. With an entrepreneurial, ambitious, and driven mindset flowing through the company, we will continue to push forward, growing organically within both current and new territories.

We also believe that spending time commuting …is a waste of time! Meaning, our team of 40+ employees works remotely, whenever, wherever!

As we push forward through 2019 and beyond, we are expanding into the Arabic speaking markets, and we are looking for someone to set up and build a team for this!

You’ll fit in perfectly if you:

  • have a high Affinity to the Internet;
  • have basic knowledge in WordPress and or other CMSs;
  • are fluent in English (German is a plus);
  • are native Arabic speaking;
  • love creating outstanding Content and you have excellent writing skills;
  • have a great work ethic.

What you get in return:

  • Everything you need to conquer the Arabic speaking market!
  • Competitive Salary based on your level of experience!
  • SEO training from SEO veterans!
  • A reliable company that values its employees!
 

We’re looking for friendly and bright people who can develop a great product! If you think you are the right person for this job, write us a detailed email to jobs@kafe.rocks why you are the one, in English and in Arabic!

items.title: Product Owner (m/f/x) // Visable Labs
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Product Owner (m/f/x) // Visable Labs

Company: Visable Labs

Tags:
  • Agile
  • SCRUM
  • product manager
  • Product Owner

    • At Visable Labs we strive to connect demand and supply in the digitized B2B world. As a laboratory for innovative solutions in tech, product and marketing we help purchasers to stay ahead of the game on all platforms of the Visable Group. With a reach of more than 3.7 million B2B purchasers per month, the Visable Group is operating the leading B2B marketplaces in the D-A-CH region “Wer liefert was” (wlw) as well as the European B2B platform EUROPAGES in 26 countries.

    As part of the Visable Group, we are backed up by a proven business and as a separate entity, we work in cross functional teams, agile and at full speed like a startup. Our headquarter’s in Hamburg and offices in Berlin and Paris make us a truly European company.

    As a Product Owner at Visable Labs you will lead a full product feature specific team. You will own the complete product life-cycle for parts of the product; from evaluating new concepts, iteratively refining and launching them.

    We provide you with challenges.

    • Fully understand the user, our market and the competition
    • Conciliate the user needs with strategic business goals
    • Evaluate new features based on qualitative and quantitative data
    • Manage all stakeholders and get them on board for what you want to implement
    • Communicate product ideas through mockups and wireframes
    • Articulate product requirements across tech teams
    • Together with your team and our CPO, you create the product roadmap

    We provide you with perspectives.

    • The opportunity to shape the future of online B2B business and build a European champion
    • A unique job opportunity that covers distributed work through Berlin, Paris and Hamburg
    • A multinational team with diverse backgrounds and languages
    • An experienced management team of serial entrepreneurs who know how to build a fun, fair and successful company
    • Regular team events, team breakfast, Mate, coffee & tea, snacks and much more
    • A spacious, contemporary and bright office in the heart of Kreuzberg
    • The ability to unplug from the office desk and work remotely from wherever you want by a flexible home office agreement
    • 30 days holiday policy
    • A furry feel good manager (our Golden Retriever girl ‘Coco’)
    • And lastly, an ego-less, product-focused working environment

    And that’s what you should bring with you.

    • Important: German language is a must, as many user research results are available in German only. Our official team language is English.
    • At least 2 years of experience in product development & management
    • Experiences and knowledge about agile and lean development methodologies
    • Analytical mindset for data-driven decision making
    • Understanding of technology trends, data market needs and the competitive landscape
    • The ability to tell stories with data and also the ability to speak with a non-technical audience about product strategy and development
    • A Startup mindset: taking ownership, looking for challenges and embracing a culture of failure
    • Technical experiences or database knowledge are a plus

    If you would like to work with us, we would love to hear from you!

    Please send your application with a meaningful CV, portfolio, cover letter, and your starting date to Vera Unterberg: [email protected]

    Apply for this position

items.title: Digital Marketing Strategist // CodeControl
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
Digital Marketing Strategist // CodeControl

Company: CodeControl

Tags:
  • SEO
  • Marketing
  • Online Marketing
  • Paid Search
  • Digital Marketing
  • Paid Social

    • Are you tired of the traditional work rules and hierarchies? Working 9 to 5 doesn’t spark joy? Do you want to bring a revolution to work cultures where ownership and motivation drive performance? Then keep reading, you may be in the right place.

    We’re CodeControl, and we’re here to shape the future of work. By using our product, everyone from early startups to industry titans are able to assemble amazing teams of expert technical freelancers to build their next great project. We believe in the Future of Work. So our team works when, where, and how suits them best. That means flexible working hours, the possibility to work remotely and take unlimited holidays.

    At the same time, we aren’t afraid of a little hard work. We build ideas rapidly, jump on whatever project needs support and try to surpass our own goals. We’re looking for people who believe in our vision and want to make an impact in everything they do. If that sounds like you, read on!

    Here’s what you’ll do:

    • Lead the marketing team – hire, onBoard and coach talent in your team to create a high-performance and enjoyable to work environment
    • Make strategic recommendations regarding where to reallocate investments across channels, and tactics to optimize channel performance.
    • Execute day-to-day traffic and customer acquisition programs using a mix of paid and organic channels to generate a healthy pipeline for the sales team.
    • Manage campaigns across multiple paid digital platforms (such as Google, Facebook, Linkedin, etc..)
    • Analyze landing page behaviour, set up tests and optimize for conversion rate optimization (CRO).
    • Evaluate and recommend new growth opportunities including new channels and/or media.
    • Present regular reporting, analysis, and ROI to the broader Marketing team.
    • Manage and assist relationships with 3rd party vendors and agencies.
    • Create and expand customer journey with content, email & remarketing

    REQUIREMENTS

    • Strong knowledge of technical B2B marketing, using techniques like automated lead generation
    • You like to test everything – Landing pages, ads, audiences
    • Hands-on experience with running paid social campaigns
    • Experience with digital analytics and performance reporting
    • An ‘Intrepreneur’ Attitude – you will own your projects like your own business
    • Ability to think creatively and out of the box
    • Understanding of databases (ideally SQL)
    • Mastery of common digital marketing tools and platforms (Google Analytics, Google AdWords, Semrush, etc.)
    • Good verbal and written communication skills in English
    • Experience working in a high growth startup, and a lot of enthusiasm for the startup and tech scene in general

    BENEFITS

    And here’s what we’ll give back:

    • Professional growth – we’re a fast-growing startup with secure funding and an amazing market opportunity
    • A work environment where you’re encouraged to take ownership, propose ideas and get things done
    • Being part of an exciting journey of improving the future of work and helping clients to find well-qualified talent to build business success
    • Competitive Salary
    • Remote Work
    • Unlimited Holidays
    • Flexible Working Hours
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Location: New York
Role and job type:   Design / Product   Full-time

Job Description

You will represent all stakeholders (external clients, executives, other product managers, sales, and client solutions) when working with the engineering team to design solutions for the platform.

We work in a fast-paced environment and are seeking someone who is self-motivated, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a distributed team. This is an ideal opportunity for an individual with a passion for solving complex business and technical challenges.

Qualified candidates should have 2-3 years of experience in the financial or online ad-tech industry working as a Product Manager.

Candidates will be responsible for creating business and technical product feature requirements for the NYIAX platform. You will address both short and long-term product objectives and features by working with technology and business team members to ensure success. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.

Job Qualifications

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop a deep understanding of the needs and business objectives of internal and - external stakeholders, and engage at a detailed technical level to derive product requirements
  • Evaluate opportunities, design solutions based on analysis, and work with multiple internal teams to implement solutions and iterate
  • Drive feature prioritization, process improvements, and product requirements to improve product effectiveness and usability
  • Ability to effectively interact with various levels of personnel from C-level managers to functional business users as well other product and development teams
  • Proactively provide customer and business context to engineering team
  • Express novel ideas and complex concepts clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing

Required Qualifications

  • The ideal candidate is a passionate product leader, who is both detail oriented and customer oriented with experience building workflow solutions and complex, highly integrated software solutions
  • 2-3 years of experience in a product management role, with a successful track record of designing, building and launching products with real business impact
  • Fluency in Agile development and experience with human-centered design processes
  • Knowledge of display advertising technology is preferred, specifically ad serving and/or monetization systems
  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree (preferably in computer science or engineering)
  • Strong problem solving and business modeling skills with ability to form key, succinct insights and recommendations from comprehensive analyses
  • Strong communicator with the ability to develop rapport and trust with clients and internal teams across many job functions
  • Passion for improving existing business practices and processes
  • Exceptional quantitative and analytical thinking, and the ability to develop and present product and solution recommendations to internal teams and to clients / prospects
  • Professional, outgoing, confident with sound written and oral communication skills

Desired Characteristics

  • Strategic and tactical, creative and disciplined, enjoys working at the big picture and product pixel levels
  • Driven, self-starter; comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment
  • Impeccable work ethic, humble but confident
  • Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
  • Highly accountable; takes ownership and drives sense of urgency
  • Impeccable written & oral communication skills
  • A product evangelist, who is able to inspire and drive consensus
  • Self-starter and extremely proactive with a strong bias for action; naturally inquisitive; desire to continuously improve current business practices/processes
  • Organized, detail-oriented, ability to multi-task and thrive within a fast-paced environment

Salary range

Competitive

items.title: Blockchain Developer Community Manager
items.content:
Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type:   Trading / Crypto Research   Full-time

Job Description

As the developer community manager, you will be responsible for growing awareness and adoption of the open core to VMware’s blockchain products as well as the programmatic adoption of VMware Blockchain. You will engage with developers through hack-a-thons, meetups, conferences, workshops, and online campaigns. You will work closely with engineering and product management to drive features into the product to make it easier to consume and use for developers. You will work with partners and customers to help their developers come up to speed on consuming VMware Blockchain.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Help connect with developer communities through meetups, conferences, workshops, hackathons and online digital campaigns.
  • Moderate forums for developers to engage and build applications on top of VMware Blockchain.
  • Communicate developer pain points to engineering and product management.
  • Curate VMware {Code} site with sample code and apps and documentation.
  • Support and inspire developers to build on top of VMware Blockchain.
  • Identifying and working with bloggers, influencers and communities to help extend and optimise product awareness.

Experience Required:

  • 5+ years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. MBA is a plus.
  • 2+ years of developing blockchain applications.
  • Familiarity with open source projects, committing to them, and growing the project adoption.
  • The ability to operate effectively in a rapidly scaling, dynamic environment, be able to manage multiple stakeholders and groups simultaneously.

Salary range

Competitive

items.title: Product Owner & Release Coordinator with OSS Experience
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type:   Full-time

Job Description

We are looking for an extremely proactive energizing person who can be both supportive and a driver toward success. You will coordinate with all of the development teams in Holo as the Product owner and PM for Holochain our open-source distributed application framework. Through this you will gain a deep understanding of what Holochain is enabling in the world.

What you will do:

  • Ensure that the dev team goals are clear and the vision is aligned with business objectives
  • Support daily technical coordination with our dev team to ensure that team is clear about priorities and dependencies
  • Encourage and synchronize with open source community activities based on organization objectives
  • Coordinate business and technical requirements, prioritisations, and timelines between our Holochain Core dev team and downstream teams to ensure priorities match needs. This includes developing schedules and understanding the critical path
  • Manage risks and resolves issues that affect release scope, schedule and quality - own issue resolution, and recommend corrective actions & implement changes.
  • Measure and monitor progress to ensure application releases are delivered on time and within budget, and that they meet or exceed expectations
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to manage expectations, provide timely communication and resolve conflicts in support of driving successful delivery of releases
  • Define and develop detailed project plans based on the given requirements and scopes
  • Communicate release details and schedules to the organization as required
  • Coordinate with QA and Delivery to plan and align all non-dev release activities
  • Support process improvements in the release process
  • Work with devops to improve and ensure reliable automations, releases, and dashboards
  • Provide hands-on detail work - ie. making sure README’s are updated, etc.

What you’ll need:

  • 2+ years of product owner, scrum master and/or technical project management experience, (prefer Telecom, IoT, OS or other complex software system)
  • 8+ years of experience in software business and systems analysis or development
  • Experience in Open Source team coordination
  • Previous experience as a hands-on technical contributor or engineering
  • Proven ability to coordinate with open source community activity
  • Familiarity with distributed system design and understanding of the difficulties and problems of distributed computing strongly preferred
  • Knowledge of statically typed programming language strongly preferred
  • Formal training in agile project management practices preferred
  • Familiarity with waterfall and agile development methodologies and their associated quality assurance methods.
  • Advanced knowledge and experience with the software development lifecycle
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward task completion
  • Demonstrated effective leadership and analytical skills
  • Advanced written and verbal communication skills are a must
  • Broad understanding of computer-science and software development principles and practices suitable for senior level contribution in an exceptionally complex project
  • Knowledge of networking principles and protocols preferred
  • Comfort and knowledge of advanced cryptographic techniques and security protocols would be a bonus
  • Ease and familiarity in coordinating distributed work using git & Github in a Continuous Integration context
  • Able to quickly learn and contribute in a fast-paced remote distributed working environment, sharing knowledge and seeking feedback
  • Comfort and experience with remote team operations is a must

Some details about what we offer:

  • Generous salary (National Currency)
  • Generous crypto pay program (HOT & Holo fuel)
  • Supportive team trial period
  • Regular team meetings (video and in person)
  • Collaborative and inspiring culture
  • Flexible work schedules and vacation
  • Motivated, passionately engaged and evolutionary global teammates
  • Holo is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate our diverse, creative, and collaborative team.

Salary range

8,000 USD

  • Raising brand awareness by driving community engagement via contests, interactions, Bounty campaigns etc
  • Identifying content marketing campaigns (on-site, social, and guest posting), sharing of press communications and market insight opportunities
  • Identifying and executing creative campaigns to increase the visibility of Noozzle community, and create a top of funnel process for growing the Caspian community
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends (FinTech, Crypto etc.) and tie them to our company and community
  • Work with the Email Marketing team to make sure that the website is optimised for customer use
  • Work with the Product team to present the product news to Noozzle community
  • Provision of analytics and performance metrics such as monthly/ weekly dashboards and campaign tagging. Reporting on a monthly basis to the Noozzle team

We’d like to see at this position the person with:

  • 3-4 years of experience in digital marketing, community management or marketing lead position.
  • Background/or interest in Crypto markets is desirable.
  • Experience using a marketing automation and optimisation systems
  • Must have excellent listening, verbal and written skills and be able to communicate effectively to a diversity of constituents with varying degrees of understanding of Financial Technology, Asset Management and Crypto.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit: strong interpersonal skills and ability to work across teams to make things happen.
  • Takes pride in their work with a good eye for detail.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Confident working in a fast paced and dynamic environment

Salary range

2000 USD

Billtrust | Lawrenceville (NJ), Denver and Boulder (CO) | Onsite | https://www.billtrust.com

Billtrust helps businesses accelerate invoice-to-cash. We provide a flexible, automated, cloud-based product portfolio that speeds cash application through tailored invoice delivery, secure multi-channel payment enablement, and intelligent matching and payment posting. Backed by Goldman Sachs, Riverwood Capital & Bain Capital, our platforms process $15B+ annually and help companies like Kraft Foods, New Balance Athletics, and Ferguson Enterprises get paid faster and more efficiently.

To learn more about our engineering culture & values here: https://www.keyvalues.com/billtrust

Current open positions include:

* Software Development Manager (Lawrenceville, NJ)

* Lead Software Developer (Lawrenceville, NJ)

* Software Developer (Lawrenceville, NJ)

* Test Automation Engineer (Lawrenceville, NJ)

* Lead Data Engineer (Lawrenceville, NJ)

* Associate Scrum Master (Lawrenceville, NJ)

* Senior Business Analyst (Denver, CO)

* Senior Salesforce Developer (Lawrenceville/Denver/Chicago/Remote)

* Java Software Developer (Boulder, CO)

Tech Stack: Across our product portfolio we leverage a variety of languages, frameworks and tooling though much of code is written in C#/.NET Core 2.x and Angular 6+ for the frontend on the newer products. Many databases to store our 200TB+ of production data including MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB, DynamoDB & RDS. We have some monolithic applications though new products & platforms are built using microservices running Docker containers on AWS ECS with some footprint in Azure. We leverage many AWS services – Lambda, CloudWatch, S3, EC2, Route53, IAM, SQS, SNS and more. We also use Terraform for configuring infrastructure, Jenkins for CI, and Git/GitLab for source code.

Apply or reach out directly to Marc Spiron (Lead Talent Acquisition Partner) at mspiron@billtrust.com.

items.title: Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
Marketing Manager at Gatsby

Remote

About Gatsby

Gatsby is an open-source, modern website generator that builds performance into every website by leveraging the latest web technologies such as React and GraphQL. We make it easy for developers to create fast, compelling websites without needing to become a performance expert. We are a VC-backed startup with a solid open source community (over 30,000 stars on Github). Our core values include transparency (we work in public most of the time); creating a safe, high-trust team; building incredible developer experiences; maintaining a healthy working environment; and helping deliver web experiences that feel amazing to use on every device and connection type.

We provide full-time employees with full benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage with available coverage for spouses or domestic partners and children, stock options, 401(k), generous holiday and sick paid time off, and 3 months of parental leave covering both adoption and foster placement.

Details of this role:

  • Type of work: Full-time
  • Start date: Immediately
  • Location: Remote
  • The Role: Gatsby is looking for a marketing generalist who can manage marketing operations, plan events, and write copy. This is a hybrid role that requires knowledge about general marketing best practices and flexibility to jump in and help out as needed. This person should be flexible and enjoy working on a small and agile team. Work will include creating scalable processes that ensure best practices in lead generation and database management. You will also conduct data analyses that will be used to inform strategic decisions by stakeholders from across the company. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects at once. Some event planning and content writing is required. You should know the principles of lead management and nurturing. Hubspot and Salesforce knowledge is a plus.

Why we’re hiring

Gatsby is growing fast, and we’re building out the marketing team to support this growth. We need an agile marketing manager to join a small team that will embrace the sometimes chaotic and fast paced nature of a startup.

What you’ll do on a day-to-day basis:

  • Marketing Automation Manage and build landing pages, lead capture forms, lists, and workflows in Hubspot. Salesforce knowledge is a plus.
  • Event planning Organize events including sourcing venues, managing sponsorships, promoting, and capturing leads.
  • Campaign Management Manage various campaigns to increase lead generation such as events, webinars, etc. Support these campaigns with landing pages, follow up emails, management of registration lists, etc.
  • Scalable processes Establish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices in campaign and lead management.
  • Reporting Create and maintain metrics reports in Salesforce on marketing activities, effectiveness, and business impact. Analyze marketing and sales data to develop insights and make recommendations on areas for optimization.
  • Data Quality Monitor and maintain data quality within the marketing database.
  • Marketing Systems Manage technical aspects of key marketing systems (marketing automation, CRM) used to generate, distribute, and report on leads.

Requirements:

  • Ideal candidate has experience working at a technology company and is familiar with website development tools
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with reporting and data analysis
  • Proficiency in marketing automation systems
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment
  • Technically capable, excellent communicator, and a desire to improve processes
  • Experience working with a Content Management System (Contentful) is a plus but not required

The best parts of this job

  • You’ll be at the cutting edge of website development — working at one of the fastest-growing website building frameworks on the market, learning about Gatsby’s innovative build system and modern tools such as Node, React, and GraphQL.
  • You’ll be part of a high-performing team at a VC-backed startup. The potential for growth and development is great.
  • You’ll get the chance to build something from the ground up. You set the priorities and determine the best way forward (with input from the team).
  • You’ll be working in a safe, open environment of talented marketers, engineers, and project managers who have a broad range of experience.

The worst parts of this job

  • We are still learning how to manage processes at scale, so things are a bit chaotic at times. We don’t have all our systems written down yet.
  • Startups like Gatsby are fast-paced and high energy which means we move quickly and adjust often. That might feel overwhelming at times.
  • You will likely have to chase someone down to get answers on occasion.
  • Because we’re all remote, it can be challenging to stay connected to the team.
Apply for job

items.title: Content Marketing Editor
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Marketing Editor at Animalz

Remote | International
  • Remote Worldwide
  • Full-Time

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies grow by producing high-quality, strategic content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (executives, managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the B2B SaaS/tech field.

We are looking for an editor who specializes in online content and who can help our writers improve over time and across clients in structure, tone, style, and on-page SEO. As much teacher as teammate, this person will review every piece of content at least twice — from the outlining phase to the nearly final draft — and use each review as an opportunity to encourage the writer and drive their continued growth in the craft.

“A real editor isn’t just someone you work with; they are your guide. They see your brain doing its thing and learn its weaknesses and abilities, and if they’re really good, they figure out what you need to hear to compensate for the former and accentuate the latter.” – Ariel Levy

An ideal B2B tech/SaaS content editor at Animalz:

  • has a proven track record of successful writing and editing for the web, particularly in B2B/tech/SaaS
  • can communicate why changes should be made, not simply fix errors or improve writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves coaching writers
  • understands the business side of writing & editing
  • is deeply passionate about good content and approaches editing with a creatively curious mindset
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future

Requirements:

  • Proven writing and editing ability
  • Mastery of on-page SEO and how to apply it to each piece of content to provide guidance for writers
  • Ability to understand content strategy and edit content to align with it
  • Desire to help writers improve their craft and elevate their content to the highest quality
  • Experience successfully working with writing/editing customers
  • Basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social media function, how they can work together to get results, and the different writing/stylistic requirements of each
  • Strong interest in the tech/SaaS field and a thorough knowledge of the top content and thought leadership in the field
  • Work in North America’s Eastern time zone to support our writers there and in Europe

Responsibilities:

  • Edit ~15 B2B articles and outlines per week (~1,500 words each), ensuring they comply with the customer strategy and optimizing them for performance
  • Educate our writers around good content in both form/structure and technical aspects (like SEO)
  • Provide support and constructive feedback to writers to help them improve their craft

About Animalz

We’re a remote, eclectic team of current and former scientists, journalists, operations folks with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the position

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote job. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is not a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors.

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like (during EST business hours)
  • Company-sponsored health insurance covering 80% of premium for medical and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year (including holidays)
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy a lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and conferences
Apply for job

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Amazon Product Expert at Mobile Nations

Remote | Entry-level | Freelance

Austin, Texas, United States

Contract

Allows remote

Mobile Nations is looking for someone who lives and breathes Alexa, who has a Fire TV plugged in to every TV, and who can’t leave the house without grabbing their Kindle. We need an Amazon pro to join our team, and share their knowledge with our readers!

What kind of work is this?
We’re looking for someone who knows everything there is to know about the Amazon product library.

This includes:

  • Alexa Platform (via Echo and third party)
  • Alexa Ecosystem (connected home, and how it works)
  • Fire TV, Stick, and Recast
  • Fire Tablet
  • Kindle

As our Amazon Product Expert, your job will be to talk about every product Amazon makes, and everything that integrates into the Alexa ecosystem. You will be our Go-To person for all things Amazon.

Specifically, we need you to:

  • Explain how to use the best Alexa features
  • Demonstrate how connected home tech integrates into the Alexa Ecosystem and how it improves your life
  • Compare Alexa services and hardware to the competition

Is this assignment for me?

  • This position is designed for someone who is eager to write a lot about the Amazon ecosystem. This is a large product list with even more unique features, and we want to talk about all of it with our audience. This includes the occasional review, but most of this writing has to do with explaining individual features and helping out audience determine if those things are worth it for them to invest in Amazon over other connected home ecosystems.
  • This position is supported by the entire Mobile Nations staff. Alexa content lives on all of our websites right now, so you’ll be working with folks from Android Central, Windows Central, iMore, and CordCutters to create the best list of things our audeince needs to know. It’s not a requirement for you to own every Amazon product right now, either, just be very familiar with the ecosystem and ready to learn as much as you can while you work with our teams.

How much work is available?

We’re looking for someone willing to contribute long term, covering a wide assortment of products and accessories and discussing how they interact over time. This will include creating new content and maintaning it over time so it remains relevant to our audience. While there is no upper threshold on how many articles can be submitted, we do ask applicants commit to a minimum of four articles submitted per week for this particular assignment.

Are you ready? Come work with us!

Apply for job

items.content:
*Intro*

Interested in working with an exciting young tech-startup that uses Machine Learning to create a high quality marketplace community…to become the Amazon of peer to peer? vendi is an AI-assisted marketplace to buy and sell quality products. We are starting with phones. We use AI to list and verify the phone for you in seconds.

This is an awesome opportunity to work with a young and dynamic team and get a good foothold in a fast expanding startup company. You will have a possibility to grow within the team, playing a crucial role in taking the companies design to the next level. Perfect for anyone who is interested in the tech industry and even more of a plus if you have an interest in AI and Machine Learning.

*About the role:*

We are looking for a Marketing Manager who can support our team in our office in central London. We will also offer the opportunity to work remotely. This internship is a unique opportunity to gain insights into a new venture during the early stages of growth.

The main contents of the role is to help expand the model around London and get more users to the App! We are expanding the model and need support to manage the growth of buyers and sellers around the city!

*Your Skills*

* Understand different traction channels to tackle
* Organized, analytical, and creative.
* A plus if you are knowledgeable about marketplace startups.
* You are driven and have a “hands-on” mentality;
* You feel comfortable handling different and multiple tasks on a daily basis;

items.title: Enhancv: SEO & Content Marketing Manager 🍭🍭

hiringOrganization.name: QwilrFull-TimeAustralia, NZ or PST only LeadfeederFull-TimeEurope/North AmericaLeadfeederFull-TimeEurope

items.content:
SEO & Content Marketing Manager

At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 10-person team spread across Europe , Asia and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We are looking for a passionate and results-driven content marketing manager to grow our organic search traffic. The market is huge and the question is -- are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

Well, here’s what you’ll be doing

You’ll drive organic traffic to millions of searches per month. Literally. And will be the team expert.
You’ll do it all -- 1️⃣ produce content yourself, 2️⃣manage 10+ content writers to drive organic acquisition, 3️⃣ ensure team members follow best practises and 4️⃣ monitor and improve content quality. 
✈️ You’ll be equally responsible for content management and content production.
♂️ You’ll work in a competitive industry at a fast pace. Just check our competitors and what they are doing

Ideally, you’re no stranger to these

You’ve scaled to 1M+ views per month with content marketing.
♀️You’ve managed a team of freelancers, writers, or content researchers.
You love to write about things you don’t know the first thing about and can produce content about it in a day or two instead of a week.
Ahrefs, Moz, Semrush and such are not just in your bookmarks. You use them daily to navigate your efforts. You read between the lines (mention your favorite ice-cream flavor in the typical day question of the application to let us know you saw this).
♂️You love content and know the difference between good and bad. You bring evidence and make sure content marketing is done right.

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia , or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

Work remotely.
Market salary based on location and results you produce.
♂️ 22 days of paid leave.
⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
️♂️ Sports allowance.
Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
Transport allowance.
✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.

How to join us

1️⃣ Apply and fill out the short form. 2️⃣ We'll review your application and invite you for an online interview to get to know you better. 3️⃣ If we like each other an assignment follows. 4️⃣ Finally, we'll make an offer if we feel you are the best fit for the position.

(view full job posting and apply here https://enhancv.com/content-marketer/)

--------
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.content:
Nickleby Capital is a private investment firm, providing capital to accelerate growth in high potential companies. We are a small team of entrepreneurs who take a more creative approach to investment and play an active role growing the businesses we invest in.

Since launch in 2015 we have invested in and created 6 businesses, we are now looking for a research support for the team as we look for new investment opportunities and significantly grow the business.

Responsibilities

We are looking for someone who is passionate about business and happy to get stuck into research tasks. You’ll be working with entrepreneurs in a fun and fast-paced environment. Your core responsibility will supporting the work of our Head of Research:

- Research: building up databases of companies that match with our search criteria using a combination of online searches and tools.

- Market analysis: reading industry reports and collating key points into one page summaries.

About you

This role would suit anyone with commercial awareness and a can-do attitude looking for a flexible work opportunity over the summer. In the role you will be working closely with entrepreneurs so you can expect to receive advice, mentoring and plenty of opportunities to develop in the direction you want.

Specifics

- Flexible, remote-working opportunity. We would like to work with someone based in London so that we can occasionally meet face to face but you will mainly be working remotely and autonomously.

- We imagine there will be 15 - 20 hours / week over the first three months working together.

- Opportunities for growth and progression based on performance.

You’ll drive organic traffic to millions of searches per month. Literally. And will be the team expert.
You’ll do it all -- 1️⃣ produce content yourself, 2️⃣manage 10+ content writers to drive organic acquisition, 3️⃣ ensure team members follow best practises and 4️⃣ monitor and improve content quality. 
✈️ You’ll be equally responsible for content management and content production.
♂️ You’ll work in a competitive industry at a fast pace. Just check our competitors and what they are doing

Ideally, you’re no stranger to these

You’ve scaled to 1M+ views per month with content marketing.
♀️You’ve managed a team of freelancers, writers, or content researchers.
You love to write about things you don’t know the first thing about and can produce content about it in a day or two instead of a week.
Ahrefs, Moz, Semrush and such are not just in your bookmarks. You use them daily to navigate your efforts. You read between the lines (mention your favorite ice-cream flavor in the typical day question of the application to let us know you saw this).
♂️You love content and know the difference between good and bad. You bring evidence and make sure content marketing is done right.

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia , or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

Work remotely.
Market salary based on location and results you produce.
♂️ 22 days of paid leave.
⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
️♂️ Sports allowance.
Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
Transport allowance.
✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.

How to join us

1️⃣ Apply and fill out the short form. 2️⃣ We'll review your application and invite you for an online interview to get to know you better. 3️⃣ If we like each other an assignment follows. 4️⃣ Finally, we'll make an offer if we feel you are the best fit for the position.

(view full job posting and apply here https://enhancv.com/content-marketer/)

items.title: German Speaking eCommerce and Marketing Assistant
items.content:
We are a fast growing start-up that helps the most exciting brands launch in Europe. We cover and manage the entire end to end process from logistics, D2C sales and Amazon Europe management.

We work with crowd funded brands coming from the US that have raised millions of $ on Kickstarter and Indiegogo. Learn about start-up life, ecommerce, logistics and marketing.

We are looking for a German speaking admin and marketing assistant to support the team in the day to day running of the company. Roles range from forecasting and processing orders on Amazon – the world’s largest e-commerce, to owning relationships with influencers from all over Europe, to managing warehouse relationships – as broad as it sounds. Our largest growth area is in Germany at the moment so we’re looking for someone to learn about retail and marketing and bring their own style to the team.

You will be given a lot of responsibility from day one. We are looking for someone with amazing attention to detail and great organisational skills.

Key Responsibilities:

Day to day management of Amazon with duties including:
Stock forecasting
Order processing and chasing
Building content and ensuring its kept up to date
Assistance with marketing services, learning about Amazon marketing. Building DE marketing campaigns.
Weekly sales reporting duties
Customer support
Managing Amazon seller support queries for UK/DE/FR/IT/ES

Warehouse/Logistics
Processing orders with our UK warehouse.
Owning relationship with warehouse to manage shipments
Managing returns processes with warehouse and brands
Analysing data to see for improvements
Creating Goods in notices

Marketing Support
Working with CMO to drive various elements of marketing
Building a database of influencers, working with them to publish content for partners
Learning about Digital Marketing and supporting in German marketing plans.
Supporting with content creation
Learning about Facebook, Instagram, Google ads, email marketing and more

You will also be expected to support in other adhoc roles. As a small fast growing team we all muck in and do lots of things, your role will be no different!

To succeed in this role you should:

Be able to speak German fluently.
Have excellent copywriting and communication skills
Be interested in learning more about how industries like ecommerce and marketing work
Be creative with outstanding attention to detail
Be highly organised and self-motivated
Be driven and able to work proactively by yourself

Our benefits include:

You MUST be eligible to work in the UK and have strong written and verbal English communication skills.

items.title: An All-Star Ghostwriter Needed (Long-Term & Ongoing Work)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
An All-Star Ghostwriter Needed (Long-Term & Ongoing Work)

Company: Alpha Investors
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Freelance

Description

Do you have a passion for writing in different niches/verticals and the ability to write engaging content? If so, this job might be perfect for you.

My name's Andrej and I'm the CEO of Alpha Investors. A PE fund that helps people build, buy, or sell their online business.

We're looking for an all-star content writer/creator who can deliver well-researched and fact-checked content on a regular basis. This is not a one-off type of a gig. We're looking for someone to join the team and (eventually) fill the Head Of Content position.

What's Expected Of You:

  • 10,000 - 15,000 words of researched content per week
  • Editorial quality standards are consistently exceeded
  • Writing systems and processes are continually improved
  • Minimal spelling and grammar corrections are required

Base Requirements:

  • A strong understanding of how to research and create exceptional content for the large variety of industries (outdoors, sports, home and garden, insurance, etc.)
  • Attention to detail
  • Native English speaker with impeccable written English
  • Data-driven mentality
  • Strong research skills
  • A sense of ownership and responsibility
  • Ability to work across virtual teams
  • The ability to continually improve quality and systems

This is a long-term role and you will be paid per approved word.

What You'll Get:

  • Work with an extremely high performing team
  • Access to our training, resources, and network
  • We don’t create boring content
  • Ability to become an essential part of our growing organization

How To Apply

  • Send an e-mail to [email protected]
  • Use "Writer Application for AI" as the subject line.
  • Tell us about yourself in no more than 4 sentences.
  • Attach (read: no links) two documents to the e-mail of your previous work.
  • Please write a 100-word overview in the email body on the best home remedies for a cold.

 

Note: We're looking for writers who are willing to charge up to $0.035 per word ($35 for 1,000 words). No need to apply if your rates are higher than that.

items.title: Biteable: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product Designer

Yoohoo. Biteable here. We’re on the lookout for a Product Designer to help us make the world’s simplest video maker even better. With millions of users, and millions more to come, we need someone that knows how to design products worth falling in love with. That’s you, right? 

All about you

You’re customer-centric.  You’re big on customer research and user experience. And you champion the user’s needs wherever you go.

Design is in your DNA.  UX and interaction design are your bag. You understand iterative processes like design thinking. And you can feel it in your tum-tum when the pixels sit just right.

You’re an architect. You’re skilled in information architecture design which means your designs are not only beautiful, but purposeful too.

You understand people. You’re collaborative, inclusive and empathetic. You’re calm and confident when challenges arise. And you've got a sense of humor that you share generously.

You do data. You’re nifty with data analytics and metrics. You don’t wear a white coat, but you’re comfortable designing and analyzing experiments.

You listen. You’re open to new ideas and you share your own openly. You involve others in ideation and you like criticism as much as praise.

You think critically. You ask ‘why’ often and you like to dive deep on problems and solutions. You don’t take things at face value. Except for this job ad.

All about the role

You’ll be joining an established design chapter and you’ll be working with autonomous teams.

We imagine you’ll do stuff like on this list. You’ll decide your actual tasks in collaboration with those around you.

  • Interface and UX design all the way through from ideation to release

  • User interviews and surveys to understand pleasure and pain points

  • Persuade and influence product direction

  • Lead workshops and showcases to encourage collaboration

  • Involve functional teams (like engineering, marketing, and product) in the design process

  • Use systems to improve effectiveness and efficiency

  • Move some pixels about 11 places to the left and 3 up

All about us

We are Biteable, a tech start-up that makes (jaw-dropping) videos possible for everyone. We stand apart in our market thanks to our dedication to studio-quality content and our passion for simplicity.

Since our launch in 2014 we’ve:

  • Created a community of over 4.6 million users

  • Rendered 9.6 million videos

  • Raised $3.9 million in venture capital

We’re growing fast and have offices in Melbourne and Hobart, Australia, with remote team members scattered around the world. We’re informal, structurally flat and fun to work with.

All about our culture

We believe in giving everyone a fair go. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We like it when everyone feels supported and free to create.

Our team members genuinely care about each other and define themselves as rigorous, respectful, open, supportive, honest, and egoless. Here are a few quotes that we didn’t make up:

“Biteable's team of smart, funny, engaged and caring people makes my work here enjoyable, every day. Being close to decisions and decision-makers helps me make an impact on our work.”

“The development team is a great group of people. They’re smart and interested in doing high-quality work, but foster a social and supportive atmosphere, too.”

“I’m thankful for the flexibility Biteable gives me around my family commitments. I really like that my team is open to new ideas and processes. And I enjoy that I get to work on a variety of problems with a mix of people with diverse areas of expertise.”

How to apply

We want you to start soon, so our application process is quick. To apply, send us your CV and a short cover letter about why you and Biteable fit together like the Eameses and Herman Miller.

We’ll review it and get back to you quick smart. We’ll then do two rounds of informal interviews. If it feels right for all of us, you’ll be on board faster than you can say ‘intuitive interface’.

items.title: CAD Analyst (Security) - Non-remote position located in Sunnyvale CA
items.content:
Area of Responsibility

New Account Activities
  • Review AutoCAD drawing files and prepare plans for redlines from Design Engineers.
  • Ensure all CAD files are correct, complete, and most up-to-date for review.
  • Create new _Arch, _Floor, and _Riser Diagram drawings.
  • Ensure that all security assets are marked per Design Engineer?s redlines and accounted for.
  • Properly place security assets on plans with correct direction and legibility.
  • Ensure that all documents are in compliance with Security standards and layering formats.
Maintenance Account Activities - Project Revision
  • Review new AutoCAD drawing files and prepare plans for redlines from Design Engineers or Project Managers.
  • Ensure any and all changes from previous backgrounds are captured and presented accordingly.
  • Ensure all CAD files are correct, complete, and most up-to-date for review.
  • Create new versions and modify any and all existing _Arch, _Furn, and Riser Diagram drawings as needed.
  • Ensure all new and existing security assets comply with new architectural backgrounds.
  • Ensure that all security assets are marked per Design Engineer?s redlines and accounted for.
  • Cloud in red all revision changes with delta numbers and notes for explanation.
Maintenance Account Activities - Project Submission
  • Submit through email finished security drawing to the Security Team.
  • Establish and maintain a library of master drawings accessible to CAD Security Team.
  • Update and maintain a library of PDF drawings to be shared with Google Security.
  • Change final revision into as-built after project / building FDOB.
  • Update security tracker as completed.
Maintenance Account Activities- Special projects and/or any other CAD related service
  • Create new security legend blocks for use in AutoCAD as needed.
  • Maintain the plotter in good working condition for the Security Team.
  • Provide different size prints as needed in plotter for review and submission.
  • Any and all other duties and tasks assigned from a Program Manager.
Education/training
  • Associates Degree - Drafting
  • Degree in Engineering or Architecture
Years of relevant experience
  • 1-3 years of CAD/CAFM Technical and Project-Related experience in a Corporate Real Estate environment. ?Strong understanding of occupancy planning, architectural design.
Skills and knowledge
  • A strong working knowledge of CAD/CAFM Systems.
  • Excellent MS skills inducing: Power Point, Excel, Access, Word.
  • Excellent understanding of CAD/CAFM systems and experienced in using its data to deliver projects.
Other abilities
  • Experienced in managing multiple projects from different Project Managers simultaneously and remotely.
  • Strong written and verbal skills
  • Ability to communicate ideas in a concise and summarized manner without personal bias.
  • Outstanding interpersonal and relationship building skills.
  • Program management skills coupled with the ability to profitably execute and deliver.
  • Must have a strong understanding of the architectural and furniture plans.
  • Have great attention to detail.
  • Ability to self-govern and make sound decisions.
  • Ability to facilitate conflict resolution - internally and externally.
  • Ability to develop relationships that can lead to long term assignments.
  • Strong ability to collaborate with others.
  • Understanding of and experience in implementing quality assurance and continuous improvement programs.
  • Understanding of and experience in construction drawings and documents a plus.
  • Experience in security design field and application skills a plus.
Physical work requirements and work conditions
  • Work is to be performed in a remote office environment with periodic visits to local JLL offices for meetings and training. ?Ability to work and coordinate a remote team is critical. Travel will be approximately 25%.
  • To ensure accurate reporting of information and foster critical relationships between various individuals and organizations, communication channels will exist with:
  • Client Security Managers and Directors,Program and Project Managers, Design Engineers, Programmers, Field Technicians, Mountain View Locks.
  • Jones Lang LaSalle CAD / CAFM Management Team.
JLL Privacy Notice
Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL?s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.

For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement .

For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here .

Jones Lang LaSalle (?JLL?) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities.? If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process ? including the online application and/or overall selection process ?? you may email us at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] . This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

items.content:
Marketing Operations Analyst

Marketing Operations Analyst

The Marketing Operations Analyst will own the analysis of Fastly marketing efforts and their impact on pipeline, revenue, and customer lifetime value. You’ll leverage data across product, sales and marketing systems to reveal trends and provide insights to optimize marketing efforts. Good insights are only possible with good data, so you’ll also create processes to improve and maintain data quality & hygiene.

The perfect candidate loves to solve difficult data problems, is not afraid to challenge assumptions, and enjoys building processes and standards. They’re great at translating complex information in an understandable way to their less technical teammates, and enjoy working in a truly global role with a remote team.

What You'll Do

  • Analyze performance of all marketing programs, and work with stakeholders across marketing to advise on the return and optimization of their programs
  • Improve decision making by building and refining reports and dashboards in Domo, Salesforce, and ad hoc reporting needs.
  • Build connections and gather insights from Fastly data sources using data across product, marketing and sales
  • Evaluate and improve data quality and cleanliness in Eloqua, Salesforce, and other systems

What We're Looking For

  • Experience with B2B marketing KPIs & attribution models
  • Deep knowledge of Salesforce.com data structure & reporting
  • Experience writing SQL queries and ETL procedures. Expert Excel skills.
  • Experience working with data warehouses and data visualization/BI tools (Domo, Tableau, Birst, PowerBI, etc)
  • Strong self motivation and ability to work autonomously with a mostly remote team
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to document and present findings results for audiences of all levels.
  • Team player; ability to establish trusted relationships with other Fastly team members.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision, maintain a high level of accuracy and integrity, and have excellent time management skills.
  • At least five years of experience working in an analytical role, ideally focused in sales or marketing

Perfect for anyone who is interested in the tech industry and even more of a plus if you have an interest in AI and Machine Learning.


*About the role:*

We are looking for an enthusiastic social media manager that is capable of building a stronger brand presence in the main platforms like Facebook, Twitter, Insta...in our office in central London. We will also offer the opportunity to work remotely. This internship is a unique opportunity to gain insights into a new venture during the early stages of growth.We need someone who learns fast, is self-motivated, proactive and multi-disciplined.

** You are reliable, organised, and pay attention to detail;
** You are driven and have a “hands-on” mentality;

tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Calling all Technical Email Marketing Managers, Email Administrators, or technical support people looking to transition to a cyber security position. We offer flexible hours and the opportunity to work from home and grow your career.

We are a cyber security start-up incorporated in 2017 with offices in the UK and Singapore. We serve corporate clients across Asia and in the UK.

We are seeking a new member of our team to deliver fully managed email phishing simulations and security awareness training programmes. You will have sole responsibility for the execution of these campaigns from start to finish. Full support will be provided where needed.

A large part of the job will be project management and liaising with multiple clients. In this capacity you will manage schedules, mailing lists, email creation and ensure that recipients have whitelisted our sending servers. You will then execute and oversee the delivery of phishing campaigns, providing statistics and final reports to clients.

You will assist in the delivery of Security Awareness Training via our LMS assisting clients in setting up scheduled delivery of courses.

We value experience, problem solving skills, positive attitude and willingness to learn. We are looking for a new addition to our team that wants to grow with our company. We offer the opportunity for the right candidate to expand their role and develop their career.

Please provide a cover letter outlining your suitability for this role along with your CV and salary requirements.

Position Overview:
• Contractor leading to potential to full time
• Work from home
• Flexible hours
• Asia Time Zone (preferred)

Responsibilities include:
• Liaise with clients to manage project timelines and deliverables
• Schedule and oversee the delivery of email phishing campaigns
• Source, create and/or modify phishing emails and basic HTML pages
• Troubleshoot delivery issues (mostly whitelisting recipient side)
• Prepare and deliver project results reports

Knowledge and Skills Required:
• Basic HTML and CSS
• Excel
• Technical knowledge of mail servers, email deliverability
• Project management experience
• Highly organised
• Good writing and reporting skills
• Good client communication skills
• Interest in Cyber Security
• An Asian Language is a bonus

items.title: Animalz: Content Marketing Editor
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Marketing Editor

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies grow by producing high-quality, strategic content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (executives, managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the B2B SaaS/tech field.

We are looking for an editor who specializes in online content and who can help our writers improve over time and across clients in structure, tone, style, and on-page SEO. As much teacher as teammate, this person will review every piece of content at least twice — from the outlining phase to the nearly final draft — and use each review as an opportunity to encourage the writer and drive their continued growth in the craft.

"A real editor isn’t just someone you work with; they are your guide. They see your brain doing its thing and learn its weaknesses and abilities, and if they're really good, they figure out what you need to hear to compensate for the former and accentuate the latter.” - Ariel Levy

An ideal B2B tech/SaaS content editor at Animalz:

  • has a proven track record of successful writing and editing for the web, particularly in B2B/tech/SaaS
  • can communicate why changes should be made, not simply fix errors or improve writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves coaching writers
  • understands the business side of writing & editing
  • is deeply passionate about good content and approaches editing with a creatively curious mindset
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future
Requirements:
  • Proven writing and editing ability
  • Mastery of on-page SEO and how to apply it to each piece of content to provide guidance for writers
  • Ability to understand content strategy and edit content to align with it
  • Desire to help writers improve their craft and elevate their content to the highest quality
  • Experience successfully working with writing/editing customers
  • Basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social media function, how they can work together to get results, and the different writing/stylistic requirements of each
  • Strong interest in the tech/SaaS field and a thorough knowledge of the top content and thought leadership in the field
  • Work in North America’s Eastern time zone to support our writers there and in Europe
Responsibilities:

  • Edit ~15 B2B articles and outlines per week (~1,500 words each), ensuring they comply with the customer strategy and optimizing them for performance
  • Educate our writers around good content in both form/structure and technical aspects (like SEO)
  • Provide support and constructive feedback to writers to help them improve their craft
About Animalz
We’re a remote, eclectic team of current and former scientists, journalists, operations folks with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the position
This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote job. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is not a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors.

Benefits
  • Work from anywhere you like (during EST business hours)
  • Company-sponsored health insurance covering 80% of premium for medical and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year (including holidays)
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy a lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and conferences
Application deadline: midnight ET 07/14/19
