items.content:
Demand Generation Specialist

Marketing
North or South America
Company: Percona
Full Time

Overview

Percona is a leader in providing best-of-breed enterprise-class support, consulting, managed services, training and software for MySQL®, MariaDB®, MongoDB®, PostgreSQL® and other open source databases in on-premises and cloud environments. Our services and software accommodate rapid growth and application development, help companies develop and deploy agile solutions and improve your ability to keep up with customer needs.

Percona open source database expertise helps businesses avoid downtime and outages, meet customer experience expectations, foster operational and developer collaboration and manage enterprise risks through sound database architecture frameworks.

Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, and help solve some of the most challenging customer problems. We offer flexible hours, competitive salaries, the ability to work remote and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.

Description

Percona is looking for a remote (work from home) candidate located within North or South America that is hands-on and energetic Demand Generation Specialist to help build our global marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate will have responsibility for executing targeted marketing activities at key targeted prospects and targeted accounts.  This person will also have an analytical mind that uses data to measure and adjust our marketing efforts to maximize our team’s efforts. You are responsible for partnering closely with marketing ops, product marketing, and marketing programs to drive high-value, high-engagement, personalized go-to-market programs. You will report to the current marketing program manager and work closely with cross-functional peers to build to specific account-level and target audience level campaigns.

What will you be doing?
  • Partner with marketing ops to maintain database of named contacts to align marketing and sales in defining the target audience to improve data quality, reporting, and segmentation. Execute and manage campaigns in HubSpot.
  • Work with marketing programs to identify gaps in key personas and contact information within strategic accounts. Develop data and insight strategy to add key personas and contacts within these accounts.
  • Collaborate with marketing peers to understand our market and buyer personas, refine messaging and campaign offers.
  • Develop, execute, and optimize targeted email and nurture campaigns in HubSpot. Run A/B testing on subject lines, images, copy and design.
  • Execute lead & account acquisition strategy through multi-channel targeted lead generation / ABM campaigns, including paid & organic social marketing, digital ads, industry partnerships, events and more.
  • Analyze metrics and reports to determine effectiveness of program activities and thought leadership content consumption. Monitor, track and communicate campaign performance (from email results all the way to MQLs, opportunities and closed deals).
  • Create, manage and execute campaigns
  • Identify opportunities to improve go-to-market strategy & tactic effectiveness through better audience segmentation, marketing techniques and processes.
  • Works closely with Senior Marketing Manager on demand generation efforts

    • Requirements
    • Proficient and excellent English written and verbal skills
    • 3+ years in marketing within software, technology, or XaaS industries
    • 3+ years of experience in a demand generation role for a fast-paced B2B technology company (preferably SaaS.)
    • Must have hands on experience with HubSpot campaigns set up, execution and reporting
    • Experience with supporting events including  industry trade shows with planning and logistics
    • Self-starter who can work independently and proactively to resolve issues, take ownership of projects and processes.
    • Proficient knowledge in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
    • Ability to participate within a cross-functional team and act autonomously as necessary
    • Verbal and written skills in English
    • Able to work and train in a remote environment
    • Deeply analytical, able to report on performance metrics while also able to dig in and identify opportunities for improvement.
    • Proficient with marketing automation tools (Hubspot a plus), CRM systems (Salesforce a plus) and social platforms.
    • Experience with list management, database segmentation and email delivery (and anti-SPAM implications.)
    • Working knowledge of SEO, Google Analytics and Google AdWords campaigns
    • Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS and web development tools

      • What to Expect Next – Our hiring process includes the following steps:
      • Pre-employment aptitude and personality screening
      • Interview with a Percona veteran to assess cultural fit
      • Minimum of one phone screen with the hiring manager, comprised of behavioral interview questions and an opportunity for you to ask questions about the position
      • Minimum of one in-house interview with the hiring team (if local to Raleigh, NC USA)

        • Location / Time Zone: Remote work from home in any location within the Americas.

        We believe that there is nothing more critical to our success than assembling the right team. At Percona, you will have the opportunity to work side-by-side with a team dedicated to our core values of honesty, humility, exceptionalism, hard-work, and commitment. We believe we are building something great and if you believe the same thing, please apply below if you are ready to the join the #PerconianFamily.

        Remote work from home openings require consistent and strong internet access.

        HQ is in Raleigh, NC.  Staff members should be available if there is a need for any onsite trainings and/or events at any time.

        Note that your legal agreement will be with Percona Staffing LLC, a USA corporation and a subsidiary of Percona LLC.

        Please review our .

        Percona GDPR Privacy Policy
        Apply for job

items.title: Performance Marketing Specialist
items.content:
Performance Marketing Specialist at Remote Year

Remote | International
  • Remote Worldwide
  • Full-Time

The Performance Marketing Specialist role at Remote Year will be focused on getting the message out in order to find new Remotes (customers) to join the Nation (broader Remote Year community). Starting at the top of the funnel, the Performance Marketing Specialist will be responsible for optimizing ad spend on a daily basis across campaigns, audiences, platforms and ad creatives. They will collaborate to make sure that we’re getting the best bang for our buck with our media spend while also staying true to brand in an ongoing and iterative fashion. The Performance Marketing Specialist will also be the owner of the entire UX for all users from traffic to lead, working to improve the experience at all stages to optimize the yield from our digital funnel. This is a highly executional role and will require you to get down in the weeds as an individual contributor, and has the potential to eventually become a manager role.

Responsibilities

  • Build and scale cost efficient paid digital campaigns spanning multiple channels and objectives
  • Drive higher yield from paid media by optimizing the website experience for both paid and organic traffic
  • Partner with creative team to build and iterate on creative for use in campaigns
  • Create, run, and analyze A/B testing to various parts of the funnel and formulate new hypothesis on an ongoing basis to test and iterate on
  • Summarize and report on digital marketing performance using our suite of analytical tools and methods
  • Leverage analytical ability to look beyond the numbers in our paid marketing channels and understand how our traffic interacts with our website to grow the business

Qualifications

Required

  • 3-5 years of hands-on experience in performance marketing at a fast-growing start up
  • Deep expertise with Facebook, Instagram, and Google ad platform for lead acquisition
  • Familiar with industry best practices in inbound marketing, demand generation, paid/organic search
  • Proven ability to build accurate campaign budgets and campaign forecasts
  • Proven track record of driving creative consistent with company brand positioning to improve ad performance
  • Strong data evaluation skills with the ability to extract and interpret data from various sources to offer creative marketing solutions.
  • Extraordinary analytical skills (Google Sheets / Excel fluency is a requirement; SQL fluency a nice-to-have).
  • Experience/passion for A/B testing
  • Experience with Pardot (preferred) and Salesforce (a plus)

Nice to have

  • Experience building out analytics technology stacks to support marketing efforts
  • Experience for a small high growth startup
  • Experience in a startup creating a new space / industry
  • Experience in other channel / ad platform experience (ex. Google Adwords, Linkedin, Youtube, etc.)

**This is a fully remote position that can be done from anywhere in the world**

Apply for job

items.title: Chili Piper: Demand Generation Manager

hiringOrganization.name: Healthy Hemp OilContractRemoteLoom Network Inc.Full-TimeAsiaFiles.comFull-TimeNorth America Only

items.content:
Demand Generation Manager

Chili Piper is looking for an experienced Demand Generation Manager. This role plays a critical part of the success of the lead generation programs, wear many hats, and interact with various roles inside and outside of the marketing department. You are a strategist, an analyst, a project manager, and a campaign manager. If you eat, sleep, and breathe creating lots of qualified leads for the Sales team driven from marketing campaigns, then we want to meet you! 

Ultimately you are self-motivated and have a proven track record of effectively working across multiple departments to create campaigns, programs, and processes that drive qualified leads to Sales. 

The ideal candidate for this position will have significant experience in demand generation, inbound and outbound marketing strategy and execution, and experience with Salesforce and marketing automation systems (Marketo, Pardot, Hubspot, etc...). 

Qualifications


  • Generate a robust marketing pipeline and effectively track and understand marketing funnel KPIs. Own the funnel for various campaigns.
  • Create and execute effective marketing campaigns and programs that drive large lead volumes to support new customer acquisition targets 
  • Collaborate with sales to produce relevant content that meets the needs of both prospects and customers. Map content and marketing collateral to the buyer's journey and create conversion paths on websites and landing pages.
  • Develop a marketing and sales SLA and work with marketing operations to optimize the lead conversion process. Collaborate with SDRs to help drive leads through the marketing funnel.
  • Drive SEM, SEO, keyword, and list or segmentation strategies.
  • Develop display marketing campaigns, paid social, and other sponsored content plays as needed.
  • Develop and implement marketing campaigns for conferences
  • Build and optimize current nurture programs for various inbound marketing activities.
  • Own and take full accountability of life cycle email, direct mail and high-touch event marketing programs from strategy to execution including some direct marketing writing.
  • Develop and analyze key marketing metrics to ensure campaigns are meeting engagement, Experience building campaigns, analyzing key marketing metrics, and developing strategy for prospect and existing customer marketing programs.
  • Organized, self-starter, with strong interpersonal skills to work effectively and build strong relationships with cross-functional business partners.
  • Experience in authoring and building targeted marketing campaigns and presentations to support strategy.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and related communications simultaneously and within budget.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

    Experience/Skills


    • Minimum 4-6 years of relevant work experience managing inbound and outbound marketing campaigns.
    • Hands-on marketing automation platform experience preferred.
    • Experience marketing SaaS and/or technology offerings in B2B.
    • Bachelor's degree in marketing or related field

items.content:
Content Marketing Strategist for Health & Wellness Brand

Hey Teammate :)

Are you passionate about educating people on how to live happier and healthier lives? Do you enjoy flexing your “strategic” brain muscles? Would you like to work with a highly talented content team (designers, editors, writers & more?)?

We’ve got a thriving e-commerce business in a rapidly growing industry, and we are looking for a content strategist to improve our content process from end to end.

Since 2014, we’ve used our blog to educate millions on the powerful benefits of CBD. Join us to flex your content strategy skills and make a big impact at our company. 

In this work from home position, you will lead the planning and management of our teammates to deliver of all aspects of our blog’s content lifecycle, including:  

1. Pre-Production
  • Research: User Analysis / User Needs: Personas, Scenarios, Surveys, Content Inventory / Audit, Content Gap Analysis, Competitor Analysis, Search Engine Optimization Research, Content Aggregation / Data Sourcing
  • Editorial Strategy: Voice / Style / Brand Guidelines, Idea / Concept Development, Development of Themes / Messages / Topics, Establish Workflow: People, Ownership, Roles, Processes, Content Plan: What, When, How (Short/Long Term)
  • Management: Information Architecture (Establish Metadata Frameworks, Implement Taxonomies and Classification Schemes, Develop Site Structures), Content Management Tools and Practices, Content Migration, Content Conversion, Configuration, Establish Content Backup / Versioning / Archival Practices

2. Production
  • Content Creation: Copywriting, Asset Production, Tagging / Classifying
  • Content Optimization: Search Engine Optimization, Accessibility Optimization, Proofreading / Editing / Fact Checking
  • Content Delivery: Encoding / Converting for Web, Distribution Processes and Tools

3. Post-Production
  • Promotion: Monitoring / Reacting (e.g. Social Media, Comments, Moderation), Social Media Submission / PR / Marketing / Syndication
  • Evaluation: Analytics Analysis, Success Evaluation, and Learning

Job Details:
  • This is a full-time role, but it might take a month or so to get fully ramped up. There is also the possibility of working more than 40 hours per week, but that is up to you. 
  • We are flexible on when you work as long as you are responsive and get the job done.

***To be considered, click the apply button, and tell us three online brands who are crushing it with their blog content - and why you think they are so great.

Cheers,
Brandon

CEO of Healthy Hemp Oil
https://healthyhempoil.com/

P.S. I encourage you to read some of the products reviews on our website to see how our products have positively impacted people's lives. We strongly believe in our products and hope you do too.

items.title: TaxJar: Integration Partner Manager

hiringOrganization.name: HotjarFull-TimeEMEATelemetryTVFull-TimeOn the planet Earth. HealthifyFull-TimeEast Coast

items.content:
Integration Partner Manager

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 15,000 businesses. Our mission is to make ecommerce easier for everyone.

Our core values

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 90+ people is growing fast. We’re currently looking for an Integration Partner Manager who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs.

*This is a full-time remote position based in the US only.

REQUIREMENTS

As an Integration Partner Manager you will

  • Coordinate and manage the implementation and onboarding of integration partners
  • Act as liaison between integration partners and TaxJar’s platform integrations team, managing integration review and certification process
  • First level escalation contact for integration partners and internal departments with questions related to integrations
  • Support analysis/business reviews for partner optimization and yield improvement
  • Develop ad hoc reporting as needed per internal and external requests
  • Collaborate directly with our partnership team to identify, streamline, and support all go-to-market initiatives to develop and execute a revenue generating partnership based off partner tier and scope we see for each integration partner
  • Automate partner tiering process with TaxJar’s partner portal with access to joint content, sales enablement tools, joint campaign material, and onboarding activities for our partners
  • Lead partner marketing activities to meet quota attainment and strategic company objectives. Collaborate with sales to review sales metrics for partnership QBR’s and tiering assessments
  • Evaluate the ROI of partner marketing activities and recommend actions to improve lead generation and quality to drive leads to opportunities
  • Creation and updating of messaging for solutions tailored to fit each integration partner (integration options, market differentiations from competition, size of addressable markets, etc.)
  • Manage and track spending, lead generation, and ROI for the partner activities and campaign performance
  • Identify industry events to drive partner development through messaging and brand awareness (user groups, associations, industry meet-ups)
  • Create and/or seek opportunities to execute on joint webinars through integration partnerships to drive messaging through the channel
  • Collaborate with internal teams to best train our employees about our integration partnerships, messaging, product functionality, marketing assets available, and joint marketing activities

You have

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or related field
  • Organizational and self-management ability – Must be able to independently manage several projects at once
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills; analytical background
  • Project management skills preferred to monitor projects and keep them on track
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
  • Must possess exceptional problem-solving, analytical, and research skills
  • Able to make independent choices and recommendations without immediate supervision
  • Travel and participation in events and after-hours meetings with partners as required

You’ll be a great fit for TaxJar if you

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity / 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

items.title: Marketing Manager – Enterprise Solutions
items.content:
Marketing Manager – Enterprise Solutions at Pearson

Remote

Marketing Manager – Enterprise Solutions Expansion/ABM

Description

At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.

SUMMARY

Marketing managers focusing on account-based strategies, plan, organize, and execute programs that generate new business and advance existing opportunities within specific, targeted accounts. They create programs and engagement that help connect high-value customers to our brand.

Pearson is seeking a Marketing Manager to join our organization, specifically supporting our account-based management initiatives within Pearson’s North America Marketing organization. Combining audience and modern marketing disciplines, the focus of this role will be to partner with the sales and product teams to develop 1:1 and 1:few tactics designed to engage with targeted accounts. This role is critical in reaching the marketing pipeline goals set by Pearson, aligned to the sales revenue targets.

The ideal candidate should have a proven track record of creating marketing programs that can be delivered across digital/inbound and outbound channels to drive engagement. This position requires a high level of creativity and innovation, as well as the ability to use data-driven insights to create and optimize multi-touch marketing programs. A successful candidate will have a passion for taking the complex and making it simple and should be detail-oriented, agile, and committed to meeting tight deadlines.

GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with subject matter experts and sales teams to understand the business priorities and incorporate the needs of the business into an integrated 1:1 and 1:few marketing plan
  • Proactively engage with the sales and product teams to coordinate, communicate, and prioritize the impact of marketing activities
  • Integrated marketing campaign planning, development and execution. Delivering on KPIs and communicating results.
  • Oversees the planning, implementation, development of campaigns to support our enterprise solution offerings.
  • Identify opportunities to improve marketing effectiveness through better audience segmentation, marketing techniques, and processes
  • Partner with internal marketing teams to measure and analyze marketing campaigns and demand waterfall and establish a regular reporting cadence with marketing and sales counterparts.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, business, or related field required
  • Minimum 5 years of B2B experience in account-based marketing models
  • Account-based marketing certification from a reputable marketing association is preferred
  • Prior experience in successfully working with transformational sales team to achieve mutual results
  • Ability to think strategically, prioritize tasks, and execute with attention to detail
  • Knowledge of best practices in modern account-based campaign messaging and persona-centric content creation
  • Energetic, high performer with a willingness to take initiative and be resourceful
  • Creative thinker who is adept at working on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment, and comfortable adding new ideas
  • Excellent ideation and strategic problem solving skills to guide team discussion and problem solving with consideration of multiple factors and stakeholders.

Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Work Locations: US-Remote Remote

items.title: Junior Facebook Advertiser (Remote)
items.content:
Job type: Junior Facebook Advertiser
Contractor: 1-3 days per week
Pay: £150 per day
Location: Remote
Period: 1 month trial
Start: Immediate
Apply here: https://paintgun.typeform.com/to/llnqG5

About Us:
We are the #1 remote mobile user acquisition agency. We partner with series A start-ups and brands, for which we manage the paid social on: FB, Insta, Snap, AppStore (more soon). We have a solid track record of bringing down CPA on large budgets - as we work in a scientific and data-driven manner. Paintgun clients get a smart dashboard, so they can track live performance data. We also promote sustainable advertising by creating non-fear/anxiety-based advertising, but instead use social currency to draw attention and we also commit 7% of our revenue to giving back to the planet.

Our clients:
We typically work for high performance tech-start-ups, latest b2c consumer apps, who are under pressure from investors to deliver. Current client is: https://www.meetcleo.com/ (competing with Revolut & Monzo)

The role:
We are growing fast and need help from someone who's methodical, structured and excels under uncertainty - to run Facebook experiments to bring down CPA. We work via the Growthhackers.com method of "high tempo testing", testing hypothesis to see what works and feeding this information back into the acquisition strategy and we also have a creative team in house with whom we coordinate and strategise. We are looking for an excellent performance marketeer who's a team player and can help us scale Paintgun.

items.title: Credit Risk Analyst
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=24, ruby=0, apple=0, java=5, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
*Nimbla* provides a first of a kind invoice protection solution so that Britain’s SMEs continue to trade with confidence. We are building the future of small business protection, and are on high growth trajectory having just closed our first super seed round. A Barclays Techstars Alumni we have the backing from Munich RE, the world’s leading insurers’.

The Credit Risk Analyst will be someone who wants the freedom to build something different and help us keep the thriving small business enterprise alive. This is the opportunity to help shape the direction of one of the most promising FinTech startups in the UK. This is a commercial risk role where you will be expected to balance risk against the commercial ambitions of the business. We will count on you to make a significant contribution to our success and will support yours in the process.

*About You:*
You are a highly innovative Credit Risk specialist who will build on Nimbla’s Credit Risk function by driving change and improving our overall risk management and risk measurement and prediction.

Driven by a desire to learn as well as supporting a growing business, you are looking for the opportunity to use your understanding of credit risk and analytical skills to shape the vision and the future of the organisation. This is a commercial risk role where you will be expected to balance risk against the commercial ambitions of the business. You will understand traditional credit risk methods but have a passion to use data to bring credit risk forecasting and modelling to the next level. You are keen to help us improve our business practices, drive our growth and expand our portfolio. You will have the support of our data science team to enhance existing models and build new models to test and learn from. Together you will source new data and methods that are the foundation of our revenues.

With a passion for high-quality innovative businesses, you will be experienced in developing risk models, setting limits, testing hypothesis and monitoring the trends across our user base to identify how macro events impact our portfolio. You excel in an open environment where you have the flexibility to work in a way that suits you best.

*You will:*
* Develop and improve the current credit risk monitoring tools, including portfolio credit risk monitoring and credit stress testing
* Provide analysis and insight into the Credit Risk profile and maintaining robust reporting suite
* Build NPV models to inform insuring decisions and overall strategy, and understanding their limitations
* Report and escalate material risk events, including conduct risk events and conflicts of interest, or losses
* Use analytics to produce an insurance risk limit, manage our insurance risk strategy
* As a result of the above, advise on the best pricing structure for all our insurance products
* Ground the loss/default assumption to be used in acquisition or customer management decisions
* Change, remove and add insuring policy rules
* Generation of key management information to support business direction and ensure Risk Appetite objectives are met

*Your Experience:*
* Python, R, Scala, Java or Matlab in a data science context (Propensity models, segmentation or solving complex problems using optimisations techniques)
Ability to interpret complex data and apply numerical techniques is key, and familiarity with statistical methods is expected;
Conceptual thinking – ability to find innovative ways to solve analytical problems
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well within cross-functional teams

*Bonus Points For:*
* Previous Risk Analytics experience in a Financial Services Organization
Experience of working within a regulated industry
Experience or interest in Credit Risk Analysis

*What You’d Expect*
* A competitive salary
* Equity
* Full auto-enrollment workplace pension for all employees with 2% employer contribution.
* Bike to work scheme
* Tech purchase scheme
* Comfortable and trendy Rise London workspace, a stone’s throw from Silicon Roundabout
* Unlimited coffee, tea and fruit every day
* Holidays: we offer 28 days of holiday per annum, plus bank holidays off.

*Work-life balance*
* Autonomy and empowerment: What matters is that the job gets done and that we help each other in accomplishing our vision and goals. Once the goals are set, how you achieve results is up to you.
* Radical Candour: We all want to grow, and we help each other do so by maintaining candid, open conversations, especially when it's hard. Be kind, and be opened and honest
* Dynamic working hours: We trust you to establish an effective working pattern that allows you to excel in your role. This includes working from home, of course.
* Learning & Development: Books, courses, and £1,000 budget to spend as you wish for your personal development.
* Dogs in the office.
* Daily talks and meet-ups presented in the building by the Barclays Innovation team.

*At Nimbla We Believe In:*
* *Fairness:*
* For our customers: We aim to make Business a fairer place by protecting SMEs from bad debt.
* For our team: together, we create an environment in which everyone is comfortable developing within their roles and within the business.

* *Learning:*
Aim to learn something new every day, big or small to grow personally and bring about positive change

* *Creativity:*
We each strive to be creative, support innovation and wonderful experiences to our users

* *Measuring performance more than time:*
This position is being offered on a flexible work-week basis with no compromise on salary

* *Flexible working:*
We are based in the comfortable and trendy Rise London workspace, a stone’s throw from Silicon Roundabout. We will love to see you there, you will also have the opportunity to work remotely and balance your life and your work as works for you.

items.content:
Do you want to join an exciting start-up in the IoT health space? Do you like supporting devices, software, and apps? Do you dream about real-world experience supporting large-scale applications connecting people and devices together using a variety of technologies? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment? We’re looking for a Service Analyst to join our team.

The Role:

The Service Analyst will have the following attributes:

Previous experience in a 1st Line Support position (minimum 1-year experience)
Experience working with a Windows environment
Computer hardware knowledge is beneficial
Troubleshooting experience
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
Be able to think analytically and solve problems quickly
A good understanding of Health and Wellbeing in the UK



As the Customer Service Analyst your main duties will include:

Answer incoming calls and emails to log and escalate correctly
Support clients with any issues remotely, over the phone and email
Troubleshoot to resolve issues
Supporting other colleagues within the team where needed
Escalate issues to technical support desk
Coordinate field service appointments

Skills we're looking for are:

Strong communication skills written and verbal
Possess a confident and approachable manner
Commitment to service excellence and customer experience
Understanding of software and App installations
Previous technical support experience would be an advantage
Previous knowledge or health and care qualification

Culture and Personality:

An appetite for learning
A passion for technology of all types
An interest in health and wellbeing
A desire to enable vulnerable people to remain independent in their own homes
Enjoys a social office atmosphere

Benefits:

30 days holiday + your birthday + Public Holidays
Remove working possible
Private Health Insurance
Office dog (hypoallergenic)
Relaxed startup environment - your input matter
company laptop
Check us out:

https://www.mysense.ai

https://www.linkedin.com/company/mysense

About MySense

We are digital start up with big plans. Our team has extensive experience with data and technology in the health and care sector. Our main focus at the moment is a product that ingests, analyses, and learns patterns of behaviour from fixed and wearable IoT devices to help identify triggers for wellbeing decline in a customer/patient, or identify immediate care needs. We have distribution partners that will see our product being used with 20,000+ individual customers over the next 24 months.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

items.title: Writer needed for longform consumer product testing & review website
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Writer needed for longform consumer product testing & review website

Company: Your Best Digs
Location: Telecommute
Job Type: Freelance

Description

Your Best Digs is a fun product testing and product review company and we're expanding! YourBestDigs.com is a subsidiary of Siege Media, a content marketing agency named one of the Fastest Growing Companies in San Diego in 2017, Inc 5000 Fastest Growing Companies in America and San Diego's Best Places to Work. We're looking to add a motivated, remote freelance writer to help write superb content solely for YourBestDigs.com.

Responsibilities:

  • Write 5,500-6,500 word in-depth reviews on specific types of home products after TESTING them. Categories will likely span small appliances, electronics, bed, bath, yard, etc.
  • Research and determine what makes a good product
    -Methodically and thoroughly test a group of products for all the features and details the average and not-so-average consumer would care about
  • You'll work from home, but will be responsible for shipping products to/from our headquarters in California.
  • Important: There will be rigid due dates to finish writing reviews. Do not apply if your schedule is too unpredictable.

The *perfect* candidate will:

  • Have experience writing product reviews or technical content, with a touch of personality
  • Have discerning tastes and strong attention to detail when it comes to using and buying products
  • Have effective communication skills
  • Be experienced with the internet, social media
  • Be able to quickly and accurately type, to write reviews and e-mails
  • Have excellent command of the English language, not requiring grammar edits
  • Have experience publishing web content on WordPress or similar CMSs
  • Be organized and have a superb attention to detail
  • Be familiar with webmail, gmail
  • Get along well with our team members. We're a relaxed, yet "get stuff done" type of group.

Bonus skills (not required):

  • Have photography or videography skills
  • Have an existing social presence to help distribute written reviews and also establish credibility as a reviewer

This is a freelance, telecommuting, contractor position, and we prefer that you're able to commit at least 15-20 hours a week to this as we can provide as much work as you can handle. We are looking for people who plan to have at least 6 months of availability on this project to make the training time worth it for both of us. Pay rate is DOE. We are looking to hire as soon as you're ready.

Reminder: There will be rigid due dates to finish writing reviews. Do not apply if your schedule is too unpredictable.

To apply: E-mail your CV, examples of writing you've done, a cover letter with 'Your Best ProBlogger' in the subject line, address why you would be a fit for each of the "responsibilities" section above, and why you'd want this position. Do NOT send short product reviews you've written about books/products/services you didn't actually use.

Application Instructions

E-mail your CV, examples of writing you've done, a cover letter with 'Your Best ProBlogger' in the subject line, address why you would be a fit for each of the "responsibilities" section above, and why you'd want this position. Do NOT send short product reviews you've written about books/products/services you didn't actually use.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Sales and Marketing Manager

United Kingdom, London
Company: - The Resourcing Hub

Overview

Sales and Marketing/Opportunity: Customer Acquisition Manager (Tourism Sector)

Global Digital Transformation Consultancy

Digital Transformation Programme – Government Dept.

Location: Remote and Some Travel – Infrequent

Salary: Up to £80,000 plus 20% bonus and Benefits.

It’s not often an opportunity like this comes knocking

Do you have experience in the tourism sector? Are you looking for your next challenge and make your mark in this industry?

The Opportunity:

We’re looking to complement a newly created delivery team with a Senior Customer Acquisition Management professional with experience of the tourism sector. The aim of the role will be to support a high-impact/high profile project for a widely known UK Government organisation, via a prestigious consultancy, by leveraging a newly developed product – a unique and exciting online digital marketplace’. This newly created role is the result of long-term contract being awarded to our client, and make no mistake, this opportunity will see you at the start of a revolution in this multi billion-pound industry!

We require those who can bring passion and expertise to a team of energetic, smart and capable delivery professionals, whilst supporting the consultancy in its mission to deliver business solutions and user-centred, digital transformation to this widely known end-client, across the tourism sector.

Our client’s product teams are small, multidisciplinary, often remote and focused on getting things done. Our client follows an agile approach but knows the difference between the dogma and what’s actually required to work together successfully! And here’s your opportunity to be a part of it

Interested?

Do you have what it takes?

You will experience a highly engaging environment and be the type of professional with a strong commitment to, and enjoys, providing pragmatic, sleeves-rolled-up delivery to your customer base. You will be passionate about the tourism sector and a strong advocate of technology, thus embracing the many possibilities technology can bring to your role and the end-customer. When you think that you’ve seen it all before, this role might just shatter that thought as you embark on a role that will see you making, not only your mark as a professional, but also widely contributing to raising the profile of UK Tourism to the global market.

We’re keen to speak to professionals with a background in and/or working within:

  • Organisations that supply tourism products to the market (ie accommodation, events, attractions and tours)
  • B2C vendors that buys products and sell to consumers or B2B vendors who buy products, provide packages who sell to other businesses who may choose to sell to other businesses or consumers in the value chain
  • IT vendors who provide management software’ to the market (ie reservation management systems, tour management systems, property management systems, channel management solutions)

What we’re looking for

With your tourism sector experience, which forms an essential component of the role, to succeed you will have:

  • A degree or possess the equivalent industry experience
  • Proven and demonstrable track record of customer acquisition and/or account management, developing long term customer partnerships
  • Experience in tourism product marketing and with some direct sales exposure
  • A proven track record in providing inspirational leadership and acting as a role model in all interactions and engagements.
  • Experience in successfully delivering strategic marketing and communications strategies, evaluating the performance of marketing and media agencies.
  • Experience of setting, monitoring and reviewing complex budgets with a strong focus on value for money and ROI.
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal.
  • Experience of working within multidisciplinary teams.
  • Well-adjusted to navigating ambiguity and challenging environments.
  • Possess the ability to manage and develop relationships with senior stakeholders within an organisation.

So, what‘s on offer?

Along with a generous salary and bonus package, you will also be a key and valued representative of an acclaimed Global Digital Transformation Consultancy working with a high-profile Government client. You’ll be working with some of industry’s most acclaimed professionals and have the chance to deploy the latest and most advanced technologies in the role…

Our Client really is different to most. It’s a place where you can make the hard things happen for clients, working alongside colleagues who value doing the right thing and not the easy thing. It’s a place where they trust in you to flourish. Because they know you value flexibility, they’ll leave it to you to decide where you wish to work – at home or onsite with clients – and you’ll be judged on outcomes and not location. Equally they value life-work balance as much as you do, focusing on output more than input.

This is a very real opportunity to make your mark in industry and advance your career too, so if this sounds like your next move, please contact us today with your up to date CV.

*BY SUBMITTING THIS APPLICATION YOU AGREE TO THE RESOURCING HUB’S PRIVACY POLICY ON OUR WEBSITE AND YOUR DETAILS BEING ADDED TO OUR DATABASE.*

Apply for job

items.title: German Speaking eCommerce and Marketing Admin Assistant - Working With Start-ups
items.content:
We are a fast growing start-up that helps the most exciting brands launch in Europe. We cover and manage the entire end to end process from logistics, D2C sales and Amazon Europe management.

We work with crowd funded brands coming from the US that have raised millions of $ on Kickstarter and Indiegogo. Learn about start-up life, ecommerce, logistics and marketing.

We are looking for a German speaking admin and marketing assistant to support the team in the day to day running of the company. Roles range from forecasting and processing orders on Amazon - the world’s largest e-commerce, to owning relationships with influencers from all over Europe, to managing warehouse relationships - as broad as it sounds. Our largest growth area is in Germany at the moment so we're looking for someone to learn about retail and marketing and bring their own style to the team.

You will be given a lot of responsibility from day one. We are looking for someone with amazing attention to detail and great organisational skills.

Key Responsibilities:

Day to day management of Amazon with duties including:
Stock forecasting
Order processing and chasing
Building content and ensuring its kept up to date
Assistance with marketing services, learning about Amazon marketing. Building DE marketing campaigns.
Weekly sales reporting duties
Customer support
Managing Amazon seller support queries for UK/DE/FR/IT/ES

Warehouse/Logistics
Processing orders with our UK warehouse.
Owning relationship with warehouse to manage shipments
Managing returns processes with warehouse and brands
Analysing data to see for improvements
Creating Goods in notices

Marketing Support
Working with CMO to drive various elements of marketing
Building a database of influencers, working with them to publish content for partners
Learning about Digital Marketing and supporting in German marketing plans.
Supporting with content creation
Learning about Facebook, Instagram, Google ads, email marketing and more

You will also be expected to support in other adhoc roles. As a small fast growing team we all muck in and do lots of things, your role will be no different!


To succeed in this role you should:

Be able to speak German fluently.
Have excellent copywriting and communication skills
Be interested in learning more about how industries like ecommerce and marketing work
Be creative with outstanding attention to detail
Be highly organised and self-motivated
Be driven and able to work proactively by yourself

Our benefits include:

Your birthday off and 20 days holiday per year
Lunch out on the company each month!

NW London office meters away from Golders Green station.
If we sound like the kind of company you’d like to be a part of, then we would love to hear from you!

You MUST be eligible to work in the UK and have strong written and verbal English communication skills.

items.title: Sked Social: Social media spicy meme master / Content writer / Junior Marketing all-rounder
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}

hiringOrganization.name: HealthifyFull-TimeEast CoastTutukaFull-TimeMiddle East, South East Asia, EuropeFollow Up BossFull-TimeU.S.A

items.content:
Social media spicy meme master / Content writer / Junior Marketing all-rounder

Make social media marketing tools vaguely-not-rubbish again!

Sked Social helps companies from small businesses to huge global brands do a better job managing their social media, particularly Instagram.

We've been doing this for over 5 years now, and continue to grow as more people discover the power of our visual marketing platform.

Our team of ~25 is spread across the world, so we can hire the best talent no matter where you are or want to be.

Our marketing team is looking for a junior/mid-level all-rounder, with a focus on writing and social media management/community management.

About you:


  • You love social media and technology. You'd inject Twitter or Instagram into your veins if you could (please do not try this). You get into the depths of all the weird parts of the internet, and you're not afraid by it (maybe a little).
  • You understand the social media sphere: you know what's trending before it trends, and you know how companies succeed and fail when using it. You're either excited or confused about MoonPie on Twitter.
  • You've got some marketing know-how and experience. That might be a course, but it might be professional through marketing or any related field (journalism, advertising, PR, communications…).
  • You can write like a boss, and understand the idea of having an editorial voice. You know what it's like to write with someone else's voice as well as your own.
  • You aren't afraid to speak up and have opinions. Our company is all about ensuring the best outcomes for the team and customers, and the best ideas are not limited to seniority or role.
  • You pay attention to the little things – making sure that things are done right, and not leaving the little things behind.
  • You understand the balance of being data-driven and having creativity, because one doesn't always trump the other.
  • You're relatively new to marketing – we're aiming to hire someone who is new(ish) and wants to join a growing company and learn by doing.


Your responsibilities:


  • You'll manage our social media accounts – Facebook, Twitter, Instagram. You'll know when to jump on a trending meme and when doing so will feel a bit "how do you do fellow kids".
  • You will work on establishing a consistent voice for Sked (and our mascot Quirky the Quokka).
  • You'll build a community around the Sked brand through our existing customers as well as attracting new ones.
  • You'll write for our blog about Instagram, the latest social media news and broadly social media strategy. You'll do this when news breaks, when customers need to understand part of the ecosystem or just because you've found something you are fascinated with.
  • Finally, you'll help our team across all other areas of marketing – both just to help the team, but also because you want to learn and our successes are a shared effort. That might include reporting, SEO, paid advertising, email newsletters and more.

You will need to have at least 4-5 hours overlap each day with Melbourne, Australia time (8am-6pm MEL hours). Otherwise, you can be located anywhere in the world.

This is a full time role (ie we aren't looking for someone working 5 other jobs) with a 3 month contract to start with.

How to apply


Apply online through our portal (link below!).

Include a cover letter with brief (essay not required but any format accepted) answers to:

  1. Why do you want to join the Sked team for this role? What makes you a good fit?
  2. What is your favourite social network, who do you think is most important to follow and why?
  3. What's the biggest news in the Instagram ecosystem you've seen recently?
  4. What do you think the worst thing is about social media today?

The salary guide for this role is USD$40k - we also have a profit share program, paid time off and more.

items.content:
SEO strategist and "chief do-er", lover of SERPs and all things organic search

We are a B2B software as a service tool that helps people schedule content on social media.

We are looking for someone to lead our more specialised SEO efforts internally, on a full or part time (at least 2 days a week) basis, with an initial 3 month contract.

What we're looking for


We are looking for someone who:

  • Lives their day inside Ahrefs/SEMrush/Clearscope etc
  • Loves to take a very technical and metrics-focussed approach to SEO
  • Wants to take on a challenge, with competitive keywords
  • Can lead the efforts internally from strategy to execution.
  • Has experience in the B2B SaaS space, ideally in a marketing focussed tool.

We would like to find someone who is willing to get their hands dirty and can manage the SEO process end-to-end so that you can keep the feedback loops fast.

When/if you run out of time to DIY, we can talk about adding extra people or contractors to be able to free up your time.

For us it's important though that you aren't afraid to get your hands dirty and that you have recent experience "doing the work", not just setting strategy.

You will need to have at least 2-3 hours overlap in working hours (8am-6pm) of Melbourne, Australia time, but otherwise our team is fully remote distributed around the world.

What you'll work on

Your first 1-2 weeks will be focussed on auditing our existing activities and identifying what the quick wins might be for the best keywords to generate revenue.

Then you'll work on implementing your thoughts alongside our team, with a focus on a keyword list of 10-20 high quality and high intent keywords you have researched that you think will create the best ROI for us.

You'll regularly report on progress as we climb up the SERPs, and likely contribute to various other campaigns and projects our team works on.

Salary guide

We're pricing this role at US$55-60k per annum (pro-rata if you work part time) – we also have a profit share program, paid time off and more.

To apply


Visit our application page linked from this ad.

items.title: Skillshare: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=14, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=6, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Full-time
New York, NY
Remote job
Relocation assistance
Startup
Posted Today – Accepting applications
At Skillshare, we’re building a global community of curious, lifelong learners. Our Mobile Team plays a key role in our ability to scale by building apps that make our classes and learning community available to anyone, anywhere. We design for users around the world, in various contexts—whether sitting on a train, or their couch in front of the TV—with the goal of making learning seamlessly accessible.
 
We’re excited to welcome a seasoned Senior Product Designer who will design our mobile efforts across iOS, Android, and TV. Working closely with Engineering, Product, and as a member of the Design Team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the mobile user experience with a highly collaborative team and by conducting/leading your own user research.
 
The Mobile Team is poised to grow significantly over the next year and you’ll help lead the charge. We’ll look to your expertise in designing consumer-facing mobile products and your ability to work seamlessly with teams across the company, champion the user, and drive real impact as we scale.

What you’ll do:

    • Work closely with Engineering, Product, and Design leaders to develop ongoing mobile strategy and roadmaps
    • Maintain and design new product features in our iOS and Android apps
    • Design and launch new TV apps experience (Apple TV, Android TV, Roku, etc.)
    • Own mobile design while working closely with web teams to unify the brand’s user experience, design system, and working towards feature parity between our web and mobile apps where applicable
    • Work with Product to interpret large bodies of qualitative and quantitative data on customer usage patterns to uncover new product insights and ideas

Why we’re excited about you:

    • 5+ years of experience designing web and mobile applications, ideally in a startup working in an Agile environment
    • Deep knowledge of app design and UI conventions across both iOS and Android (experience building TV apps a plus)
    • A digital portfolio showcasing your skills in UX, Visual & Motion design
    • Ability to own Design from a brainstorming session, user research, prototyping, usability testing, and working with Product & Engineering to build and ship successful products
    • You are continuously honing your craft as a Product Designer by learning new skills, adopting new tools, and sharing your efforts to the benefit of a stronger Design team
    • “Details are the design” is your mantra

Why you’re excited about us:

    • Impact: Mobile is a major company priority and you’ll have the chance to lead the charge.
    • Our team: We have a passionate, talented team that is a lot of fun to work with.
    • Our mission: We’re doing work that matters – connecting lifelong learners around the world and empowering them to pursue their creativity.
    • Flexibility: We believe that doing your best work means living a full life. That means different things for everyone, so we optimize for trust, invest to support remote teams, have an unlimited vacation policy (with a required minimum!), and encourage work-life balance.
About Skillshare:
 
Skillshare is an online learning community whose mission is to connect curious, lifelong learners everywhere – and, in so doing, build a more creative, more generous, and more prosperous world. Today, our community has grown to millions of members who come to Skillshare to learn creative and entrepreneurial skills, network with peers, and even teach a class themselves. We are backed by Union Square Ventures, Spark Capital, Amasia, Spero Ventures, and Burda Principal Investments.
 
Skillshare is committed to building a diverse team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We work to ensure a consistent interview process, fair compensation, and inclusive work environment for all.

items.title: Demand Generation Manager
items.content:
Demand Generation Manager at Chili Piper

Remote | International

Location: Brooklyn New York United States
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description:

ALL ROLES AT CHILI PIPER ARE REMOTE SO YOU CAN WORK FROM ANYWHERE

Chili Piper is looking for an experienced Demand Generation Manager. This role plays a critical part of the success of the lead generation programs, wear many hats, and interact with various roles inside and outside of the marketing department. You are a strategist, an analyst, a project manager, and a campaign manager. If you eat, sleep, and breathe creating lots of qualified leads for the Sales team driven from marketing campaigns, then we want to meet you!

Ultimately you are self-motivated and have a proven track record of effectively working across multiple departments to create campaigns, programs, and processes that drive qualified leads to Sales.

The ideal candidate for this position will have significant experience in demand generation, inbound and outbound marketing strategy and execution, and experience with Salesforce and marketing automation systems (Marketo, Pardot, Hubspot, etc…).

Qualifications:

  • Generate a robust marketing pipeline and effectively track and understand marketing funnel KPIs. Own the funnel for various campaigns.
  • Create and execute effective marketing campaigns and programs that drive large lead volumes to support new customer acquisition targets
  • Collaborate withsales to produce relevant content that meets the needs of both prospects and customers. Map content and marketing collateral to the buyer’s journey and create conversion paths on websites and landing pages.
  • Develop a marketing and sales SLA and work with marketing operations to optimize the leadconversion process. Collaborate with SDRs to help drive leads through the marketing funnel.
  • Drive SEM, SEO, keyword, and list or segmentation strategies.
  • Develop display marketing campaigns, paid social, and other sponsored content plays as needed.
  • Develop and implement marketing campaigns for conferences
  • Build and optimize current nurture programs for various inbound marketing activities.
  • Own and take full accountability of life cycle email, direct mail and high-touch event marketing programs from strategy to execution including some direct marketing writing.
  • Develop and analyze key marketing metrics to ensure campaigns are meeting engagement, Experience building campaigns, analyzing key marketing metrics, and developing strategy for prospect and existing customer marketing programs.
  • Organized, self-starter, with strong interpersonal skills to work effectively and build strong relationships with cross-functional business partners.
  • Experience in authoring and building targeted marketing campaigns and presentations to support strategy.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and related communications simultaneously and within budget.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Experience/Skills

  • Minimum 4-6 years of relevant work experience managing inbound and outbound marketing campaigns.
  • Hands-on marketing automation platform experience preferred.
  • Experience marketing SaaS and/or technology offerings in B2B.
  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field

Additional Information:

How We Work

  • Freedom and flexibility.Were a 100% distributed team working from around the world.Our team members can work from wherever they want in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.
  • Solve interesting problems.The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.
  • Autonomy and ownership.Working on a distributed team means you dont have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure youre getting things done. Were a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.
  • Be helpful.Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

The Perks

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Generous Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • WeWork membership so you can work from anywhere
  • Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job
Apply for job

items.content:
Prezzroom is a health and wellness-focused public relations firm currently seeking an experienced media-savvy Account Executive with 2-5 years of agency or in-house experience to join its UK-based team in London. The current team is energetic, passionate about health and wellness, and is progressive in how we operate and execute on behalf of our many global clients. With offices in London and New York, we are growing rapidly and looking for someone with a roll-up-your sleeves mentality who is both creative and execution-oriented to oversee multiple consumer brands across food, drink, beauty, fitness, and tech.

We need someone with impeccable communication and interpersonal skills who demonstrates strong writing and editing capabilities with a passion for all things health and wellness. The Account Executive reports directly to our UK Director of Business Development, working collaboratively with other international team members to assist with the day-to-day of client accounts.

Come join us and be a part of building our company from the beginning! Our dynamic and flexible work ethic means we're always looking for people that are eager to grow with the company and expand their roles.

Responsibilities

- Drafting and editing press releases, pitches, and media briefing documents to create a compelling narrative on behalf of clients
- Establish frequent communication with press to develop exciting and engaging story ideas and features for clients
- Researching information, summarising findings and organising large media target lists, keeping track of conversations with press
- Responsible for creating fascinating and compelling pitches to secure press coverage for clients
- Attending client meetings, participating in client brainstorming sessions, compiling ad hoc client status reports, developing/maintaining timelines
- Managing client trackers, tracking client press coverage and ensuring that all information is up to date

Qualifications

Experience: minimum of 2-5 years PR and communications experience within an agency or in-house setting, preferably within the world of health and wellness or food and drink
- University graduate, preferably with a bachelor’s degree in communications or journalism
- Experience in the health and wellness industry, with a clear understanding or passion to learn about industry drivers and upcoming trends
- Ability to perform well under pressure, meet tight deadlines and support team members
- Existing relationships with editors, bloggers, and reporters
- Track record of securing press coverage on behalf of clients
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills for client and media relations as well as within the internal team
- Strong work ethic

Skills

- Writing – copy (including newsletters, presentations, proposals, etc.); press materials (releases, one-sheets)
- Computer – Google Suite, Gorkana, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Muckrack or Cision
- Management – time and project management are tantamount to your success as much of our team works remotely. Additionally, client expectations management is a key component of this role
- Creativity! We’ve said it before and we’ll say it again. We need someone who’s got their creative juices flowing
Requirements

Please include your CV and a cover letter.

items.content:
Senior Product Manager

The Senior Product/Project Manager will join our PM team and lead a new mobile or web initiative we’re launching with one of our US-based clients. For this position, we’re seeking someone who’s successfully managed native mobile applications and also has e-commerce experience.  
This position can be performed remotely or from our offices in Barcelona. Our working hours are 11am to 8pm BCN time. Only candidates who are based outside of the US will be considered for this role.  
This role requires excellent writing and presentation skills in English.  Ideally, you are a native English speaker or have spent many years working with a US, UK, or Canada-based company.

In this role, you will:

  • Align with the client  on key business goals and customer needs
  • Partner with executive-level stakeholders and the development team to deliver the roadmap
  • Own the evolution of the  product from inception through launch and iteration
  • Manage scope and trade-off discussions to achieve maximum business value within budget constraints
  • Define and communicate detailed user stories and lead the team’s grooming and sprint planning sessions
  • Collaborate with the UI/UX team to create engaging and dynamic user experiences
  • Use analytics, surveys, competitive analysis, and user interviews to identify areas of opportunity or improvement
  • Lead stakeholder meetings and communicate regularly with the Whitespectre executive team on progress and the client relationship
 
We work on fast iteration cycles and tight deadlines using an agile/scrum methodology. Depending on your skillset and project portfolio you may be focussed on the native mobile app product or a complex web application.

We’re excited about candidates who are:

  • Excellent collaborators and communicators.  You consider the perspective and priorities of each stakeholder in advance when you communicate.  You’re clear, specific, and engaging. You’re skilled at building trust and group alignment, even in tricky situations
  • Excellent organizers; able to catch and juggle competing priorities while understanding the bigger project management picture to make yourself and your team successful.
  • Self-directed and efficient. You take pride in your ability to prioritize and get things done.
  • Intellectually curious and passionate about continuous improvement.
  • Seeking a long-term, growth opportunity.  While our work is fast-paced, we also work consistent hours and value stability. If you’re a ‘Digital Nomad’ and/or looking for something short-term, then we’re not the right fit for you.  
 
Required Experience/Skills:

  • At least 3+ years in a Product  Management role, working daily with a development team
  • At least 1+ years of experience managing native mobile apps.  Ideally, you have experience with both IOS and Android.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to craft strategy presentations as well as deliver updates for an executive audience.
  • Experience using analytics platforms and enough experience with data analysis to know how to track KPIs and what questions to ask

items.title: Senior Digital Strategist
items.content:
Senior Digital Strategist at Hirsh Marketing

Remote | International

Advertising – Austin, Texas

Hirsh Marketing is looking for a talented and seasoned Senior Digital Strategist who can bring creativity, strategy, and digital brilliance to the team.

Who we are:

Hirsh Marketing is one of the fastest growing marketing companies in North America with clients from the US, Canada, South Africa, Malaysia, Great Britain, Australia and others all over the world.

Our team is fully remote and extremely dedicated to delivering the best experience for our clients who are industry leaders and influencers in their respective niches.

What makes us special:

  • We are PROCESS-DRIVEN and believe in correcting the process, not the person.
  • We believe in INITIATIVE and succeed through innovations and ideas.
  • We’re big on ACCOUNTABILITY and everyone owning their part.
  • We strive for BALANCE and want our team to work smarter, not harder.
  • We’re huge on COMMUNICATION and want overcommunication both internally as a team and externally with our clients.
  • We love COLLABORATION because we succeed through collaboration and teamwork.

Who you are:

  • You’re ready to work somewhere where your voice is actually heard.
  • You have management and digital marketing experience and can lead and mentor a team of Ads Managers
  • You work hard but have fun too.
  • You have a stellar attention to detail and prioritization skills and love producing results for world-changing influencers to help them grow their business through effective and innovative digital marketing strategies.

Does that sound like you? Awesome! Then come join us at Team Hirsh!

We are looking for someone who can:

  • Communicate with and assist their team of Ads Manager with all of their problem client accounts
  • Troubleshoot and strategize with Ads Managers when necessary on client accounts that are struggling
  • Approve and oversee team client emails and reports as needed
  • Respond to client emails with expert level support as needed
  • Hire and train new Ads Managers using our training program as needed
  • Assist and perform client strategy and check-in calls
  • Stay abreast of changing programmatic marketplace and landscape for Facebook.
  • Perform a weekly check-in on client accounts your ads managers are overseeing
  • Help the team troubleshoot client or tech issues when necessary
  • Cover for an Ads Manager on the rare occasion they are sick or on vacation
  • Provide an extra level of support for the Ads Managers on the team
  • Work with the ads team to bring creative and innovative ideas to client accounts as needed
  • As needed provide support during monthly ads team trainings
  • Conduct monthly self-assessments for your team of Ads Managers and the FB Reporting & Pixel Admin assigned to your team

Results:

  • Increased client results because of a second person with eyes on their account, who has an extremely high-level strategy
  • Increased client retention rate
  • Increased team momentum and productivity
  • Increased confidence in the ads team with the extra support and attention being put into their clients and work
  • Decreased time the CEO has to spend on client accounts or communicating
  • with clients
  • Increased level of space in between CEO and client issues/communication

The ideal candidate has:

  • 9am to 5pm availability (North American time zones)
  • Expert level Facebook ads and advertising and digital marketing strategy knowledge (minimum 2-3 years experience)
  • Experience leading and managing internal team members, preferably in advertising
  • Ability to participate in all team strategic meetings
  • Extreme attention to detail and time management skills
  • Superb communication skills
  • Ability to take initiative and constantly strategize on how to better lead their team
  • Excellent internet access with a quiet appropriate space for client and team meetings

Awesome perks:

  • 100% remote
  • Starting annual salary of $60,000 DOE
  • Paid sick leave (dependent on state)
  • 2 weeks of PTO
  • $150/mo health stipend after one month of employment
  • Annual team retreats
  • Paid holidays (New Years, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day)
  • Team environment with an organization fostering a people-first culture

Department

Advertising

Employment Type

Full-Time

Minimum Experience

Mid-level

Compensation

$60,000

Apply for job
