items.title: Social Impact Fellowship for Career Growth — Join from anywhere!
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Apply to our career acceleration program to find more purpose in your work and make a positive impact with your career.

The Program

Designed for professionals working fulltime as well as those in transition, this mostly remote program starts with an in-person training where you’ll get to meet face-to-face with the MovingWorlds team as well as your cohort of Fellows from around the world. For the next 6 months, you’ll stay connected and supported as a virtual community as you embark on your own next steps to a more meaningful and impactful career.

To kick things off, we’ll spend an inspiring, informative, and energetic weekend together learning social impact frameworks and deepening your understanding of human-centered design. You’ll finish the weekend by setting your goal short-term and long-term goals and building the accountability system to help you achieve them.

After our in-person weekend, you’ll return home, but will stay very engaged with your cohort as you continue to explore insights directly from industry leaders on human-centered design, shared-value, social enterprise, network leadership, social intrapreneurship, and more.

In tandem, you’ll receive professional coaching, peer support, and mentorship as you further explore your own purpose drivers and develop as a world-positive leader. And no matter where you live, you’ll then have the chance of a lifetime to go Experteering to support real social innovators in the field on an immersive short- or long-term project (you get to choose your own availability).

All said and done, the Fellowship will help you build the skills, confidence, experience, and network to accelerate your impact career.

 

Over the course of the following 6 months, you will:

  • Receive ongoing coaching and support.

  • Receive mentorship support to help you build your network and develop your skills.

  • Engage in weekly discussions in our online community.

  • Join monthly webinars with industry leaders and emerging social innovators.

  • Work with your accountability partners to complete your learning, discovery, and networking goals.

  • Find, plan, and go on an Experteering trip that matches your unique skills, requirements, and preferences — one that builds on your current skills, but also stretches you to grow

  • Read, watch, and listen to curated content that aligns with your learning goals.

  • Get access to industry leaders to learn best practices across all sectors.

  • Get personalized feedback on designing and achieving your purpose-driven impact career.

  • Receive guidance on telling your professional story and resume.

  • Develop your own capstone project that you can use to enhance your resume and portfolio.

 

Who we’re looking for:

We’re looking for early and mid-career professionals that have work experience and are looking for the best way to contribute to building a better world. If you’ve ever thought your career could be more meaningful and that you might be able to contribute to the greater good, we’d love to talk to you!

Our next cohort which will kickoff in San Francisco, USA, and applications close on July 31st – Learn more and apply here!

items.title: Downstream Impact, Inc: Senior Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Marketing Manager

 Senior Marketing Manager Remote Full-Time Position in the U.S. with on-site options in Seattle, WA 

Are you a talented and experienced Marketer looking for the opportunity to help shape and execute the Go to Market (G2M) strategy for a rapidly growing Seattle tech company?  Are you excited about joining a well-funded, Techstars startup and owning our marketing strategy?  Do you want to be at the vanguard of the greatest advertising disruption since the invention of paid search?  
 
Who Are We? 

Downstream is building software that uses advanced analytics and machine learning to programmatically manage and optimize advertising campaigns on Amazon.com.  The Downstream founders are Amazon veterans from the domains of marketing and software development. 
 
What you will be doing? 

We are seeking a Senior Marketing Manager that will assume end-to-end ownership over Downstream’s marketing strategy. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, have a track record demonstrating strong technical, analytical, project management, interpersonal, and content generation skills. This important position will own and execute the marketing strategies for all channels, including: Downstream’s website, blog, email, social media, and paid advertising. This hire will also be responsible for generating sales enablement collateral (white papers, case studies, one-pagers, video) in order to drive new customer acquisition. This person will be responsible for creating and executing a content marketing plan, requiring that they establish clear content creation processes, have strong creative writing abilities, high attention to detail, and be a stickler for proper spelling, grammar, and style. Working directly with our customers and Downstream evangelists, the Senior Marketing Manager will create and publish compelling content for consumer brands and agencies. The ideal candidate is comfortable with ambiguity, highly effective operating with autonomy, and uses data to prioritize the highest return on effort activities. 

  • Produce and publish content, including blog posts, landing pages, newsletters, white papers, videos, and sales collateral, to support awareness, thought leadership, and demand generation efforts 
  • Build and manage a rich content/editorial calendar that attracts a qualified audience to Downstream’s website 
  • Ensure all content is on-brand, consistent in terms of style, quality and tone of voice, and optimized for search. 
  • Constantly monitor content effectiveness, establish key analytics and success metrics and continuously refine the strategy as needed Communicate product updates to customers and stakeholders with extreme attention to detail 
  • Maintain expertise of the Amazon ecosystem, user behaviors, and long-term trends
  • Working closely with sales to shape and implement Account Based Marketing (ABM) plan and ABM outreach content.
  • Analyze accounts and take data-driven approach to developing and customizing sales enablement assets and initiatives that align with the customer journey, stages, and support the G2M plan 

Own and drive all paid marketing efforts; SEM, Social, events, etc. partnering with Sales to drive acquisition 
Own weekly traffic reporting, measuring and detailing KPIs for all marketing channels 

Qualifications 
  • BS or MS in Business, Journalism, English, Creative Writing, Communications, or a related field 
  • 4+ years experience in online marketing role; digital experience preferred 
  • 2+ years experience with email and content marketing and/or copywriting experience 
  • Experience analyzing, interpreting, and leveraging data to make business decisions 
  • Ability to juggle multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment 
  • Strong organization skills and attention to detail 
  • Strong editorial/content background, proofreading skills, and ability to distill complex concepts into simple messages. 
  • Strong bias for action and a proven ability to initiate and drive projects to completion in an ambiguous environment with minimal guidance 

Additional Preferred Qualifications 
  • Experience with SEO and SEM 
  • Experience working remotely and working with remote business and/or technology teams 
  • Experience with startups or software as a service (SaaS) marketing 
  • Experience with performance advertising and/or Amazon retail

Content Marketing Specialist at iPEC Coaching

Remote

United States

Full-time

Allows remote

Department: Marketing

Location: Flexible – Remote

Salary Range: $45 – $55K

The Content Marketing Specialist will be responsible for the ongoing publishing of data-driven content, curating and managing contributors and optimizing the content created for search (related KWPs) and social Specifically around blog, video and podcast. CMS should also have skill ins creating lead-converting resources, and shareable creative. This role will also have a need for strong organizational and content planning skills.

Key Goals for the Content Marketing Specialist:

  • Attracting organic (Inbound/search driven) website traffic and social followers
  • Driving new leads for admissions team
  • Creating greater brand awareness and harnessing the engagement of our community
  • High quality content output
  • eBook and other lead gen content creation (and related lead generation)

Key Responsibilities:

  • Conceptualize, research, and outline relevant content within the provided SEO (ex: Topic Cluster) Strategy.
  • Co-develop (with Marketing Head) an editorial calendar that includes a consistent flow of content creation that fits within the provided Topic Cluster Strategy.
  • Curate and manage outside blog and podcast contributors to maximize reach
  • Drive a thoughtful Social Influencer Strategy
  • High quality Content writing and editing weekly
  • Collaborate with Marketing Data Analyst to review organic traffic data results of published content and make data-driven recommendations to adjust/enhance SEO strategy.
  • Support thoughtful KWPs research and plan or attack
  • Collaborate with key Co-Owners among the Marketing, Admissions, and Executive Teams, as well as iPEC’s Coach Community or Alumni to collect topics to be produced into relevant content that contributes to key goals.

Requirements:

  • 3 – 7 years of Content/Marketing equivalent working experience.
  • 2+ years of Social Media Marketing and Management skills
  • Proven and visible marketing experience in creation of content and helpful if in the coaching, mindfulness or greater personal development categories
  • Ability to edit and improve grammar, content structure, and overall quality of content.
  • Organizational skills and attention to detail ensuring that all content is on-brand and consistent in terms of style, quality, and consistency of voice.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Team player but capable self-starter that can work remote

items.title: Shogun: Senior Product Manager
items.content:
Senior Product Manager

We are: Shogun, a powerful page builder platform for eCommerce stores, and we're on a mission to empower anyone to easily create high converting eCommerce pages, through a delightful product experience.

We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we’re backed by Initialized Capital, and we have over 10,000 active paying clients.

We are looking for: A Senior Product Manager to join our team and help drive the design of our product.

We need someone that is comfortable being hands on with the entire design product development process, identifying problems and championing them through the design and development process. You will work closely with our Director of Design on conceptualizing and implementing changes to our product that will drive an increase in trial conversion, and customer success.

Responsibilities
- Understand our business strategy and deliver features/products that Shogun clients love.
- Deeply understand the product problems that you are tackling through user research and speaking with clients. Define and re-frame user problems for the team.
- Manage the roadmap—understand and prioritize potential projects from various inputs (user research, client support data, competitive analysis) so the team is always working on the most impactful projects.
- Collaborate with the founders, designers, and engineers to imagine the future and define solutions to big problems.
- Define a product scope that is focused on the most important use cases with a focus on getting it into users hands as quickly as possible.
- Define quantitative and qualitative success metrics and constantly evaluate if your solutions have solved the problem through these measures, both before and after it’s released.
- Deliver world-class software—maintain the quality of the product that your team is responsible for.
- Motivate a group of committed, smart people to do the best work of their careers.

Requirements
- Have experience in a Product Manager role.
- Have a strong design background, be able to think deeply about product design decisions and have an understanding of how to create simple user interfaces.
- Be a clear communicator of product decisions and the rationale behind them.
- You have experience working with both qualitative customer insights, and quantitative customer data to inform decisions. You’ve conducted user research, a/b tests and have worked closely with design researchers and analysts (or have analyzed data yourself).
- You’re entrepreneurial—you're self-driven and you default to action.
- You’re organized, not ad hoc.
- Be able to easily switch between thinking creatively and analytically.

We offer:
- Competitive salary
- Competitive equity
- Benefits (Health and PTO)
- A highly skilled and dedicated team that is fun to work with.
- Remote work – We are a fully distributed team that works from anywhere with good internet.

Sounds interesting? Send an email to [jobs@getshogun.com](mailto:jobs@getshogun.com) and include:

- Examples of your product work that impacted real results.
- A short note explaining why you're a good fit for this role.

Please Note:
- Our team is fully distributed and global (check out our team page). We have no office. You should be comfortable with remote work.
- Sometimes we hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location.

items.title: Human Resources Associate
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Human Resources Associate at Your Other Half

Remote | Part-time

About Your Other Half

Your Other Half is a human resources and operations firm that helps small businesses grow. We partner with business owners to create happy, profit-generating teams through effective human resources and people operations practices.

We are a young, entrepreneurial, creative team of five, looking for someone who loves recruiting, human resources process management, and client communications to join our team and serve our clients.

About the Human Resources Associate Position

The Human Resources Associate will work with the CEO and Human Resources Project Manager to provide human resources services to small business clients across the US.

The Human Resources Associate will be responsible for:

  • Full-cycle recruiting, including:
    • Writing, editing and posting job descriptions, as well as recommending posting places;
    • Reviewing candidate submissions for open recruits; and
    • Performing phone screens for candidates for open recruits;
    • Managing candidate flow and communications, including temperature-checks and rejections.
  • Drafting, updating and editing Human Resources documents, such as job descriptions or postings, employment agreements, employee handbooks, and organizational charts;
  • Preparing, sending and reviewing Human Resources on-boarding and hiring documents, using web-based software;
  • Maintaining digital Human Resources files on behalf of our clients, in accordance with Human Resources best practices and applicable laws;
  • Managing the benefits quoting process with insurance brokers, payroll companies and PEOs, including gathering census data and required documents;
  • Preparing and processing payroll, using web-based software;
  • Managing Human Resources data, including client HRIS systems, as well as Human Resources calendars, spreadsheets and timelines;
  • Managing distribution and recording of required data, such as sending annual notices and recording employees’ receipts;
  • Liaising with internal staff and clients to manage client Human Resources needs pro-actively and professionally; and
  • Time permitting, contributing to the research and writing for web-based Human Resources products.

Position type: This a temporary, part-time position, approximately 10-20 hours per week, from July 1-September 30. If the candidate is successful in the temporary position, a full-time position may be offered at the completion of the temporary position, but this is not guaranteed.

Start date: Immediate (no later than July 15)

Position compensation: $16-19 per hour, commensurate with industry standards and experience.

Position Location: This is a remote position, but employee must be based in the U.S.

Number of positions available: 1

Reports to: CEO

About You, the Candidate

A strong candidate will be:

  • A current or former Recruiter, Human Resources Specialist, Generalist or Manager, Operations Manager or Office Manager with at least three (3) years of demonstrated experience in a small business setting (ideally in a company with 50 or fewer employees);
  • Experienced in the workplace, having worked in at least two office settings previously;
  • SUPER detail-oriented, with the ability to ensure accuracy and high quality across multiple responsibilities;
  • Someone who delights in highly repetitive but still high-concentration work;
  • Comfortable managing multiple responsibilities at once, and prioritizing amongst them with ease;
  • Calm under pressure and unflappable in the face of timely or urgent requests;
  • A team player, with a positive, optimistic attitude, and the ability to recognize and celebrate wins of all sizes;
  • Highly self-motivated with the ability to take initiative without direct supervision;
  • Able to not only do the work, but also think about how it could be better and more efficient;
  • Confident to make recommendations and push back when changes are needed in workflows or systems;
  • Ability to learn new things quickly, especially web-based softwares and apps;
  • Able to provide clear information in a timely way to support internal or client decisions;
  • Able to quickly and naturally draft correspondence, and have a demonstrated ability to write and edit adeptly;
  • Able typing at least 60 words per minute, and possess strong working knowledge of Google/G Suite;
  • An openness to constructive, supportive feedback and a commitment to consistently improve; and
  • Someone who enjoys working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

The ideal candidate will:

  • Be a superb communicator, with excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Possess a strong working knowledge of Human Resources law, statutes and practice in at least one of the following states: New York, New Jersey or California;
  • Possess a strong working knowledge of federal Human Resources law, statutes and practice;
  • Hold a Human Resources Certification (SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, PHR, SPHR) or Degree;
  • Be experienced in an entrepreneurial environment, preferably within the first five years of a company;
  • Be experienced in working for multiple bosses or projects at one time;
  • Be experienced with online tools including at least three of the following: Asana, Toggl, Tallie, Bill.com, Docusign, Echosign, RingCentral, UberConference, HRIS systems, BambooHR, web-based payroll systems, PEO software, Google Hangouts and Zoom; and
  • Be experienced in a Mac environment.

Why work at Your Other Half?

  • 100% remote (we believe in trust and self-management)
  • Set your own schedule (we have a team call weekdays at 11 AM, and ask that all our employees be responsive on Slack from 9 AM-6 PM ET; other than that, you set a schedule for yourself as agreed with the CEO)
  • We are committed to our team’s professional development, and have team-lead professional development sessions twice per month.
  • We have fun in our work every day, celebrate wins often, and view failure as an opportunity to grow better together.
  • If successful in this role, you may have an opportunity for a full-time role at our company, which provides the additional benefits of:
    • Unlimited paid time off
    • Paid holidays
    • Full-time schedule of 25-35 hours per week (also self-set)
    • Medical, dental and vision benefits
    • Annual professional development fund, to earn education, certifications or skills for your growth.

How to apply

To apply, please send a cover letter, resume and writing sample.

Due to the volume of applications we receive, we are unable to respond personally to every applicant. Your Other Half, LLC carefully reviews each application within one month of application receipt. If you do not hear from us within this time, we encourage you to apply again for another position in the future, and thank you for your interest in YOH.

Your Other Half, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, disability, sex, gender identification, sexual orientation, genetic information, national origin, race, religion or any other protected class.

Location: US Locations Only

Apply to: info@yourotherhalfsolutions.com

Apply for job

items.title: Content Marketing Manager ð  ­ð  ­
items.content:
Content Marketing Manager


Enhancv

 verified
At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 10-person team spread across Europe , Asia and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We are looking for a passionate and results-driven content marketer to grow our organic search traffic. The market is huge and the question is -- are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

**Where you'll work**

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia , or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

Work remotely.
Market salary based on location and results you produce.
♂️ 22 days of paid leave.
⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
️♂️ Sports allowance.
Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
Transport allowance.
✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.




# Responsibilities
**Well, here’s what you’ll be doing**

You’ll drive organic traffic to millions of searches per month. Literally. And will be the team expert.
You’ll do it all -- 1️⃣ produce content yourself, 2️⃣ manage 10+ content writers to drive organic acquisition, 3️⃣ ensure team members follow best practises and 4️⃣ monitor and improve content quality.
You’ll be equally responsible for content management and content production.
You’ll work in a competitive industry at a fast pace. Just check our competitors and what they are doing.

# Requirements
**Ideally, you’re no stranger to these**

You’ve scaled to 1M+ views per month with content marketing.
You’ve managed a team of freelancers, writers, or content researchers.
You love to write about things you don’t know the first thing about and can produce content about it in a day or two instead of a week.
Ahrefs, Moz, Semrush and such are not just in your bookmarks. You use them daily to navigate your efforts. You read between the lines (mention your favorite ice-cream flavor in the typical day question of the application to let us know you saw this).
You love content and know the difference between good and bad. You bring evidence and make sure content marketing is done right.

#Salary
$40k-$90k


#Location
- Remote

items.title: Senior UX/Product Designer - Visualization Technologies at Falkbuilt
items.content:
Senior UX/Product Designer - Visualization Technologies

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Designer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Cloud Computing, Construction, Design
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Reactions to this job

0 0 0 0 0 0
New! How do you feel about this job listing?
Company: Falkbuilt | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-07:00) Mountain Time +/- 8 hours

Technologies

user-experience
user-interface
mobile
augmented-reality
graphic-design

Job description

Falkbuilt is a technology driven start-up venture.Founders include Mogens Smed and Barrie Loberg. With digital intelligence we will revolutionize the construction industry.

Our work leverages video game design, making it real with data to build a physical replica from the virtual. Based in Calgary, Canada (MST), we are putting together a top-shelf team of developers to build a state-of-the-art visualization and design platform. It will be a small, tight, clean-coding group of professionals working remotely from the comfort of their home offices. 

We are looking for a senior UX Designer. We use 3D AR/VR/FPS and 2D visualizations for collaboration in the design, architecture, and construction industries. Our founders are visionaries, and you will be enabling them by bringing their visions to life.

You will spend half your time designing the user experience for our software, the other half building dynamic marketing material and mockups for communicating the same software vision with a long view.

Requirements

  • Know best design practices and when to break them.
  • Ability to choose-and-use the best prototyping tool for the job at hand.
  • Comfortable building mockups for any device or platform.
  • Demonstrable experience with designing interfaces for 3D visualization technologies. We will need to see some examples.
  • Attention to detail and consistency across platforms.
  • Demonstrable experience designing UX for collaboration.
  • Experience designing for mobile, web, and desktop 3D applications.
  • Production experience with modern game engines and their unique implementations of UX.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with the application video game technologies outside the video game industry.
  • Experience designing for AR and VR headsets (HoloLens, Magic Leap, Vive, Oculus, etc).
  • Experience with UX testing, performance studies, and feedback capturing.

Why work for Falkbuilt?

  • Our founders have a record of successful start-ups generating more than one billion in value.
  • Work remotely from the comfort of your own home. No commute.
  • We provide you with the tools you need to succeed.
  • Take pride in building something real from the ground up.
  • You will participate in creating meaningful change in one of the world’s biggest industries.
Apply now

items.title: Falkbuilt: Senior UX/Product Designer - Visualization Technologies
items.content:
Senior UX/Product Designer - Visualization Technologies

Falkbuilt is a technology driven start-up venture.  Founders include Mogens Smed and Barrie Loberg. With digital intelligence we will revolutionize the construction industry. 

Our work leverages video game design, making it real with data to build a physical replica from the virtual. Based in Calgary, Canada (MST), we are putting together a top-shelf team of developers to build a state-of-the-art visualization and design platform. It will be a small, tight, clean-coding group of professionals working remotely from the comfort of their home offices. 

We are looking for a senior UX Designer. We use 3D AR/VR/FPS and 2D visualizations for collaboration in the design, architecture, and construction industries. Our founders are visionaries, and you will be enabling them by bringing their visions to life.

You will spend half your time designing the user experience for our software, the other half building dynamic marketing material and mockups for communicating the same software vision with a long view.

Requirements
  • Know best design practices and when to break them.
  • Ability to choose-and-use the best prototyping tool for the job at hand.
  • Comfortable building mockups for any device or platform.
  • Demonstrable experience with designing interfaces for 3D visualization technologies. We will need to see some examples.
  • Attention to detail and consistency across platforms. 
  • Demonstrable experience designing UX for collaboration.
  • Experience designing for mobile, web, and desktop 3D applications.
  • Production experience with modern game engines and their unique implementations of UX.

Bonus Points
  • Experience with the application video game technologies outside the video game industry.
  • Experience designing for AR and VR headsets (HoloLens, Magic Leap, Vive, Oculus, etc).
  • Experience with UX testing, performance studies, and feedback capturing.

items.title: You Need A Budget (YNAB): Humbly Confident Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=12, go=9, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Humbly Confident Product Manager

YNAB is growing, and so is our product team. We’re a software ecosystem that includes personal budgeting apps for web, iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, and Android phones. Our mission is to help our users take total control of their money—not just by using an app (if only it were that easy!), but changing habits and ways of thinking.

You’re the one we’re looking for if you’re collaborative, results-oriented, creative, and disciplined. You love solving complex problems both internally and for our users, and know what it means to build a mature, evolving product. You’re customer-centric and have a knack for developing a deep understanding of their needs. You could say the same about understanding the needs a SaaS business like YNAB faces and the larger market landscape, too. You probably organize things in your sleep, and enjoying making sense out of seeming chaos — but you’re also comfortable living in spots where messy is THE place to be. You communicate for a living and you know it, so you understand the language of development and design, marketing and support—and you do it well in all mediums, from face-to-face, to long-form, to comments in a Figma file. You expound on decision-making strategies for too long at summer barbeques, but somehow keep people listening.

Requirements (these are real, actual requirements):

  • You must have at least five years working in the software industry, three of which you've been in the role of a product manager. Complex or data-rich applications are a plus.
  • You must have experience in cross-functional product development. And we really mean that cross-functional part.

That’s a super-brief intro to what you’ll be working on. But first, you need to know if you’ll even like working with us. We think you will.

A Bit About Us

We build YNAB (or “You Need a Budget” if you have a lot of extra time on your hands), the best budgeting software around. For more than a decade, people have been buying YNAB and then telling their friends what a difference it has made in their lives. (Google us, or read some of our reviews on the app store, and you’ll see what we mean.) We love building something that has a huge positive impact on people’s lives.

We’re profitable, bootstrapped, and growing. YNAB started in 2004 and we haven’t taken any outside funding—we’re in it for the long haul.

We have one overarching requirement when it comes to joining our team: our originalCultural Manifesto has to really click with you. If you’re nodding emphatically while reading it, you’ll probably fit right in, in which case, we can’t wait to hear from you!

First, let’s talk about life at YNAB and then we’ll go into detail about what we’re looking for.

Who you'd be working with:

We’re talking product manager here, so you’d be working with a lot of different people. We can’t even list them all, really.

You’ll be reporting to Todd, our Chief Product Officer. He obsesses about continuously improving our products and the experiences they enable—especially any magic to make YNAB simpler to adopt and more powerful in the long run, too. He’ll have any conversation where he has the chance to learn something, loves greyscale to an irrational extent, and enjoys ideas for their own sake. He likes long gaps of silence and very loud music, running ultramarathons, and wants to disappear someday to make hand-crafted furniture.

And as we said above, you’ll also cross paths with--well--probably everyone else. People like Buffy and Sebastian (a couple of our developers), Alan (a designer), and Angela (our Director of Customer Support). Also, our other new product manager, who we haven’t met yet, either.

How You'll Work at YNAB

We work really hard to make working at YNAB an amazing experience. We have a team full of truly exceptional people—the kind you’ll be excited to work with. Here’s how we operate:

Live Where You Want

We’re a distributed team, so you can live and work wherever you want. Proximity doesn’t influence productivity. Taylor, our CTO, was traveling who-knows-where for a couple of years before he bought a farm. Up and move to France for a year? Sure, Todd did that. Don’t like France? How about London, where Janelle trotted off to. Tulsa Remote? Can do. Or if you just love LA or Baltimore or Buenos Aires, we’ve got people there, too.  Not all of us move around, but the fact that these folks have is totally okay because we’re all adults. Just make sure you have a reliable internet connection.

No Crazy Hours

We rarely work more than 40 hours per week. There have been a few occasions where things got a little crazy and people had to log some extra hours. But then they took some extra time off, so it all balances out. We work hard and smart but we’re in this for the long haul, no need to go crazy on the hours.

Take Vacation (Seriously)

We want you to take vacation. In fact, we have a minimum vacation policy of three weeks per year. Five weeks feels about right (plus two extra weeks for Holiday break). It’s important to get out and do something. We’ll look forward to seeing pictures of your vacation in our internal chat room, creatively named #office_wall.

The YNAB Meetup

We get the teams together once a year to catch up on spreadsheets and powerpoints in a Best Western conference room. Just kidding. So far, we’ve done Costa Rica, a gigantic cabin in the mountains, a beach house in the Outer Banks, a ranch in Montana, and took over a hotel on Laguna Beach. We do really fun things, but the highlight always seems to be just hanging out together and having a blast.

Up Your Game

We’re serious about helping you improve your craft. We budget for it (hey-o!). Think conferences, online courses and subscriptions, dedicated time away from work to learn something new… it’s really up to you and your manager. But we love to see our people growing.  

International is Absolutely Okay

If you are Stateside, we’ll set you up as a W2 employee. If you’re international, you’ll be set up as a contractor. Employee or contractor, it’s all the same to us. You’re part of the team. (We are spread all over the world: Switzerland, Scotland, Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, Germany, Canada, and all over the United States.)

If You’re Stateside…

You’ll be a W2 employee with fantastic health, dental, and vision insurance, where we cover 100% of the premium for you and your family. (No need to check your vision, you read that right, 100%. Although if you did need to check your vision, no big deal, we’ve got you covered!)

We also have a Traditional and Roth 401k option. YNAB contributes three percent whether you choose to throw any money in there or not. It vests immediately. (Are you a personal finance junkie like our founder Jesse? He set up YNAB’s 401k to have the lowest fee structure possible, where all plan costs are paid by YNAB, not your retirementnest egg. The investment funds available are fantastic, passively-managed, ultra low-cost index funds. You’re not a PF junkie? Trust us, it’s awesome.

Other Tidbits

  • Once you start, we DEMAND (in a friendly, ALL CAPS IS YELLING way) that you fill out your “Bucket List” spreadsheet with 50 items. (That’s harder than it sounds!)
  • The bucket list really helps in deciding what we should give you for your birthday and Christmas: No gift cards here. We tried that. Super boring.
  • We have a bonus plan based on profitability. You’ll be in on that from day one. YNAB wins, you win. That kind of thing.
  • We’re all adults. There’s no need to punch a clock, or ask for permission to take off early one afternoon to go see the doctor (health insurance premium 100% covered!). We look at what you accomplish, not how long you sit (have you tried standing?) in front of a computer.
  • We want you firing on all cylinders so we’ll set you up with a shiny new computer and replace it every three years.
  • Did I mention we make a huge, positive difference in people’s lives? You may not think that matters much, but then a few months down the road you’ll realize it’s made your job really, really enjoyable. Don’t underestimate this one!

If this sounds like your ideal environment, read on because now I want to talk about you. You will play a big, big part in helping YNAB customers achieve success. You will change lives. I’ll only say that six more times.

Now, back to you, our new Product Manager...


What Success Looks Like:

At YNAB, our goal is for every user to achieve life-changing financial control. No small thing, right? In 2019, we’ll focus intensely on making YNAB effortless and helping new budgeters get started effectively, from their very first experience...Success means you get the best ideas and the best outcomes out of our cross-functional teams, and regularly ship real value to our users.

You’ll also help us develop systems and processes to more efficiently deliver top-notch, dare we say life-changing, experiences to our users. We’ve been growing. A lot. And that means an evolving product structure—you’ll work closely with Todd, our CPO, and with another new-to-YNAB product manager to continue building that structure out, blending the best of who we are with who we can be.

You’ll need to:

  • Understand the user journey, not just as they use our apps, but in the real world as they seek to take control of their financial lives.
  • Understand deeply that “cross-functional” isn’t code at YNAB for “designers and engineers.” We’ve doubled down on our best ideas coming from anywhere, and Support, Marketing, and Education are equal members of our flat product teams.
  • Along those lines, you’ll learn the design principles and financial logic of our apps like the back of your hand. You’ll learn our engineering processes like the back of your other hand. Then you’ll find another hand or three for internalizing our brand, marketing strategies and support ethic.
  • Shepherd your team’s work from discovery to ideation to release to follow-up (because you know how much product work happens after release), documenting decisions the team has made along the way. In particular, you’ll work hand-in-hand with a product designer on your team to jointly develop vision, prioritize, and execute on strategy.
  • Synthesize and make sense of ALL THE DATA and information about our products, for yourself and to help others across the organization make better decisions. You’re fluent in quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis.
  • Be comfortable with multiple discovery techniques and strategies in your quest to make YNAB consistently better. You enjoy talking to customers in user interviews and usability testing. You have a knack for summarizing research in a concise way to share with teammates.
  • Communicate, explain, persuade, explore and otherwise get all the things done in writing. Yes, we like talking to each other, but as a remote team, much of our collaboration is asynchronous and written.
  • You’re intensely curious. Period.
  • Oh, also, not to the exclusion of anything else, but you’re intensely curious about how people learn, how they change and develop habits, and how behavior inside a product might change behavior outside it.
  • You’re comfortable speaking the language of software development and product design. If you’re also comfortable diving into HTML and CSS (or even one of the programming languages in our development stack!), that’s a plus, but it’s not a requirement. Conversant across all disciplines is key.
  • Be a curious, persistent, and a quick learner, staying ahead of new ideas, technologies and other opportunities to help YNAB users take total control of their money, even sleep better at night.
  • Manage key partner relationships, from day-to-day communication to contract negotiation and management.

Finally, your success as a product manager at YNAB hinges upon your ability to approach product development as holistic simultaneous problem solving of both user and business goals. We work collaboratively here so you’ll listen to ideas, questions, and critiques from teammates with grace and patience. That said, you know your stuff and can eloquently and logically explain decisions. You see this type of exchange as critical to the success of yourself and our users: It is through sharing ideas and being open to the brilliance of others that we arrive at the best solutions.

And, since our job descriptions are already so long, what’s another sentence or two…

YNAB is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences to be critical to our success and are passionate about creating a welcoming, supportive, and collaborative environment for all employees. All are encouraged to apply as we continue to grow a smart, hard-working, and diverse team who love working together to build something that matters.

How to Apply

  • Apply here (https://ynab.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0j9pz) by 11:59PM on June 23rd, 2019. Firm. It’s a real deadline. Like, after it is too late.
  • Attach a pdf of your cover letter. In your cover letter:
  • >>>Introduce yourself and explain why this position is of interest to you, and why you would be a great fit.
  • >>>We love someone with a perspective about product development. Tell us, in one paragraph, about the difference between a good mistake and a bad mistake.
  • >>>Include the word “mistake” somewhere in your cover letter
  • If you have a prepared resume, attach it in PDF form. If you don’t have a resume because you aren’t even sure you’re looking to change jobs, that’s fine! An informal list of your work and education history are all we’re looking for.

P.S.  If you’re not interested in or available for this position, but know someone who might be, we would really appreciate it if you passed this along!

items.title: Enhancv: Content Marketing Manager 🍭🍭

hiringOrganization.name: Healthy Hemp OilContractRemoteHotjarFull-TimeEMEAHubbard Digital Pty. Ltd.ContractUSA, Australia, Canada, New Zealand

items.content:
Content Marketing Manager

At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 10-person team spread across Europe , Asia and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We are looking for a passionate and results-driven content marketing manager to grow our organic search traffic. The market is huge and the question is -- are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

Well, here’s what you’ll be doing

You’ll drive organic traffic to millions of searches per month. Literally. And will be the team expert.
You’ll do it all -- 1️⃣ produce content yourself, 2️⃣manage 10+ content writers to drive organic acquisition, 3️⃣ ensure team members follow best practises and 4️⃣ monitor and improve content quality. 
✈️ You’ll be equally responsible for content management and content production.
♂️ You’ll work in a competitive industry at a fast pace. Just check our competitors and what they are doing

Ideally, you’re no stranger to these

You’ve scaled to 1M+ views per month with content marketing.
♀️You’ve managed a team of freelancers, writers, or content researchers.
You love to write about things you don’t know the first thing about and can produce content about it in a day or two instead of a week.
Ahrefs, Moz, Semrush and such are not just in your bookmarks. You use them daily to navigate your efforts. You read between the lines (mention your favorite ice-cream flavor in the typical day question of the application to let us know you saw this).
♂️You love content and know the difference between good and bad. You bring evidence and make sure content marketing is done right.

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia , or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

Work remotely.
Market salary based on location and results you produce.
♂️ 22 days of paid leave.
⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
️♂️ Sports allowance.
Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
Transport allowance.
✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.

How to join us

1️⃣ Apply and fill out the short form. 2️⃣ We'll review your application and invite you for an online interview to get to know you better. 3️⃣ If we like each other an assignment follows. 4️⃣ Finally, we'll make an offer if we feel you are the best fit for the position.

(view full job posting and apply here https://enhancv.com/content-marketer/)

--------
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.content:
ABOUT STACKER:

Stacker lets you build apps by simply picking and choosing the features you'd like to have, and installing them instantly.

Want a social network with news feed, user profiles, and messaging? Done. Or a car-lending platform with payments, an account review system, and a central feed of listings? Done. Or an employee onboarding portal with a user directory and a downloads centre for useful files? Done. (You get the picture.)

We're a remote startup founded by 3 British people with team members based in London, Johannesburg, Cape Town, Geneva and Malaga.

We're looking for a stunningly talented, product-minded UX designer who gets what we're doing and can't wait to get started.

THE JOB:

- Full time (we can consider part-time though)
- Remote, as long as your time zone is within 2 hours of the UK
- Awesome company culture and amazing people

YOU'LL:

- Conceive of, create, and design new app features - all the way from idea to mock-up to design
- Specify features for developers to implement them, or build them yourself using our no code app builder
- Curate a consistent design system
- Be at the cutting edge of UX and make all of Stacker feel like magic
- Design landing pages for new iterations of the Stacker product

YOU HAVE:

- Insanely high attention to detail
- Intuitive knowledge of what makes great UX
- A track record of making beautiful interfaces
- The ability to understand the bigger picture of what we're doing and work towards it
- Knowledge of CSS
- An internet connection that can easily handle video calls
- A passion for what we're making!

YOU MUST:

- Be in a time zone that's +/-2 hours from British time all year round

items.content:
Customer Happiness Agent

A customer happiness agent at Nathan James is not just responsible for answering phone calls, but is actually responsible for the customers well-being during throughout their entire shopping experience. Part of being a Nathan James customer is access to our world class service that is driven by human values, not protocol. The mission of the Customer Happiness Agent is to provide this service to our valued customers as well as to our entire online community.

 

General Responsibilities

  • Communicate clearly and professionally with customers via phone, email, and chat

 

  • Accurately document and update records in required systems

 

  • Process replacement orders by taking into account expenses, shipping time, along with any other customer requests

 

  • Capture customer comments and feedback regarding products and services

Requirements

  • Must be available between the time of 9:00 am and 5:00 pm EST

 

  • 2-3 years of experience working in a customer service/support role

 

  • Experience working remotely with the ability to manage your time effectively

 

  • Experience using Freshdesk, Microsoft Excel, and other web-based software

 

  • Exceptional spoken English, effective written English

 

  • Can effectively communicate, ask questions, receive feedback, and make decisions

 

  • Reliable internet connection with minimum 20 mbps speed

 

  • Cheerful personality who can make the best of any situation

 

  • Strong organizational and planning skills

items.content:
About Nathan James:

 

We are a design-first, home furnishing company focusing on the habits of urban dwellers and first time home buyers. We pride ourselves on the best in class customer happiness, providing the highest possible quality products that are affordable for the masses and assemble easily.

 

With the current state of technology and the desire for flexibility, we decided to build a remote company. There are no geographic restrictions, which allows us to hire the best in class people. We encourage our team members to have control over their own schedule, that being said, slippers & sweats are mandatory and sitting in traffic is not an option. Time management is super important as we all know how distracting that overflowing laundry basket can be. It would be ideal if you have experience working remotely. We embrace what is best for the company and best for our team - long-term, sustainable, healthy ways to support growth with good people.

 

Mission:

 

A customer happiness agent at Nathan James is not just responsible for answering phone calls, but is actually responsible for the customers well-being during throughout their entire shopping experience. Part of being a Nathan James customer is access to our world class service that is driven by human values, not protocol. The mission of the Customer Happiness Agent is to provide this service to our valued customers as well as to our entire online community.

 

General Responsibilities

  • Communicate clearly and professionally with customers via phone, email, and chat

 

  • Accurately document and update records in required systems

 

  • Process replacement orders by taking into account expenses, shipping time, along with any other customer requests

 

  • Capture customer comments and feedback regarding products and services


 

Requirements

  • Must be available between the time of 9:00 am and 5:00 pm EST

 

  • 2-3 years of experience working in a customer service/support role

 

  • Experience working remotely with the ability to manage your time effectively

 

  • Experience using Freshdesk, Microsoft Excel, and other web-based software

 

  • Exceptional spoken English, effective written English

 

  • Can effectively communicate, ask questions, receive feedback, and make decisions

 

  • Reliable internet connection with 30-40 mbps speed

 

  • Cheerful personality who can make the best of any situation

 

  • Strong organizational and planning skills

 

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

 

  • Desk and productivity allowance. (Get what you need to dress up your work space and be productive)

 

  • Paid health insurance

 

  • $1,000 stipend after 18 months tenure for bucket list adventure travel.

 

  • $500 donation to the charity of your choice in your name at the end of each year

 

  • $500 yearly "continuous improvement stipend for employee education and learning opportunities

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
The property industry is broken and we’re fixing it. The Housing Crisis is an issue which has an effect on all of us. We’re helping to make a systemic change in the property industry, using our software to make the sector more dynamic, transparent, and efficient.

About the company

LandInsight is a new platform that is fundamentally changing how the property industry buys land for development. It’s a big data platform that speeds up the process of finding, assessing and buying land. It comes at an important time, one of the biggest challenges for the UK housing crisis is tackling the shortage of development land. Our tech has changed the game and as a result we’ve become the UK’s fastest growing PropTech company (and we’ve got the awards to prove it!).

People are taking notice too - our user base is doubling regularly and already, tens of thousands of homes have been built on sites that were sourced using LandInsight, and that’s just the beginning.

To support and accelerate this growth we’re looking for ambitious, creative and collaborative people to join the LandInsight family.

Our culture

Our values are ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’ and we regularly hold ourselves accountable to these. The people who work here feel that they are challenged, but also feel like they have the environment and tools to succeed.

We truly believe that businesses flourish when people work collaboratively. That’s why we prioritise team building and facilitation. We are in constant contact with the company founders, so are able to learn about the conception of and running of a tech startup that is scaling. We run weekly sessions to ensure every voice is heard and empowered to grow and contribute.

We don’t just make empty gestures about our culture - we were voted as the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work at, and have also received awards for ‘Diversity Advocate’ and ‘Best at Employee Development’.


Your mission

As LandInsight’s first product marketer your mission is to communicate the unique value our products provide. You’ll be in charge of driving feature adoption and making sure the world knows about the great tools we’re building.

By defining our message, distilling features into benefits, leading launches and making sure the whole company rallies behind the same ideas, you’ll play a key part in taking LandInsight to new heights.

Ultimately, your goal is to supercharge LandInsight’s growth by bringing new users to our platform and making sure they see the benefits of staying with us for many years to come.

Responsibilities

- Define LandInsights product messaging and positioning
- Demonstrate the benefits of our products to various target audiences
Plan and execute product launches, synchronising launch calendars & timelines between the Product & Marketing Teams
- Provide Sales and Customer Success with the information they need to effectively communicate with prospects and users
- Coordinate with the rest of the Marketing Team to create product materials, including product videos, presentations, case studies, email campaigns, website copy and more
- Analyse the effectiveness of product marketing initiatives across the user life cycle

Essential criteria

- 3 years of product marketing experience
- Analytical mind and strong quantitative skills
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Experience in creating educational content
- Experience of planning and executing on product launch plans
- Understanding of different marketing disciplines, e.g. content, social media, SEO, paid, email etc.

Desirable criteria

- Experience in market analysis
- Knowledge of Hubspot and Drift
- Experience of video marketing
- Previous experience in the property industry

Why work for us?

- Flexible working hours
- Professional and personal training budget
- Competitive salary and equity options
- 25 days paid holiday (additional to bank holidays)
- Unlimited unpaid holidays
- Dog friendly office
- Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
- Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
- Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a beer/glass of prosecco with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

items.title: Senior Product Manager
items.content:
The property industry is broken and we’re fixing it. The Housing Crisis is an issue which has an effect on all of us. We’re helping to make a systemic change in the property industry, using our software to make the sector more dynamic, transparent, and efficient.

About the company

LandInsight is a new platform that is fundamentally changing how the property industry buys land for development. It’s a big data platform that speeds up the process of finding, assessing and buying land. It comes at an important time, one of the biggest challenges for the UK housing crisis is tackling the shortage of development land. Our tech has changed the game and as a result we’ve become the UK’s fastest growing PropTech company (and we’ve got the awards to prove it!).

People are taking notice too - our user base is doubling regularly and already, tens of thousands of homes have been built on sites that were sourced using LandInsight, and that’s just the beginning.

To support and accelerate this growth we’re looking for ambitious, creative and collaborative people to join the LandInsight family.

Our culture

Our values are ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’ and we regularly hold ourselves accountable to these. The people who work here feel that they are challenged, but also feel like they have the environment and tools to succeed.

We truly believe that businesses flourish when people work collaboratively. That’s why we prioritise team building and facilitation. We are in constant contact with the company founders, so are able to learn about the conception of and running of a tech startup that is scaling. We run weekly sessions to ensure every voice is heard and empowered to grow and contribute.

We don’t just make empty gestures about our culture - we were voted as the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work at, and have also received awards for ‘Diversity Advocate’ and ‘Best at Employee Development’.


Your mission

We are looking for a passionate Product Manager / Senior Product Manager to lead our flagship product, LandInsight - a tool that helps property developers understand the development potential of any plot of land in seconds. You will be the evangelist for LandInsight, take end to end ownership of the product strategy, and oversee its delivery. From research to definition, stakeholder management to design and delivery, you will design and build a product that delights our customers.

Responsibilities

- You’ll be laser-focussed on our customers and form a deep understanding of their needs. You’ll know more about our customers than anyone else in the business.
- You will be a strategist who will set the product’s high-level vision and direction, and turn it into actionable tasks.
- You’ll ensure LandInsight helps us meet our company-wide strategy, have a clear picture of the competitive landscape, and be commercially minded.
- You’ll be deeply analytical, with the ability to turn data into insight and insight into action. You will lead our tracking and visibility of product metrics, undertake robust user research, and challenge assumptions
- You will be a consummate team player, adept at managing relationships, collaborating and influencing across the whole business.
- You will help us develop an efficient product development process by identifying and removing roadblocks to realise product milestones. You will manage the product backlog, write user stories, and lead sprint planning and scoping sessions
- You will be excited about working in a rapidly growing and ever-changing environment

Essential criteria

- A proven track record of delivering a best in breed B2B SaaS product
- Experience managing a team
- You are results-orientated, a self-starter, with the ability to juggle several projects at once
- Excellent communication skills

Desirable criteria

- Experience in PropTech, design and coding skills are not required, but very beneficial!

Why work for us?

- Flexible working hours
- Professional and personal training budget
- Competitive salary and equity options
- 25 days paid holiday (additional to bank holidays)
- Unlimited unpaid holidays
- Dog friendly office
- Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
- Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
- Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a beer/glass of prosecco with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

items.title: Healthy Hemp Oil: Email Marketing Manager for Health & Wellness Brand (Work From Home)

hiringOrganization.name: HotjarFull-TimeEMEAHubbard Digital Pty. Ltd.ContractUSA, Australia, Canada, New ZealandCastosFull-TimeAnywhere - Remote

items.content:
Email Marketing Manager for Health & Wellness Brand (Work From Home)

Hey Teammate :)

We have a thriving email marketing channel (with over 250K subscribers), and it's just waiting for you to take the reins. Last year, email accounted for over 25% of our overall sales -- and we think it could be even better. 

Join us to flex your email marketing skills and make a big impact at our company. 

In this work from home position, you will lead the planning and delivery of all aspects of our email marketing channel. You'll also work closely with our team of super talented marketers, project leads, writers & designers to support our brand and help people live happier & healthier lives...

Job Summary:
  • Producing our email newsletter
  • Designing and optimizing our automated email campaigns
  • Improving transactional emails (orders status, abandoned carts, etc.)
  • Managing our list of 250,000+ subscribers, applying best practices for hygiene and growth
  • Utilizing A/B testing to maximize results
  • Creating segmentation strategies to drive engagement and run targeted promotions
  • Delivering weekly and monthly email channel performance reports
  • Executing our 2019 strategic plan for the email channel
  • Managing the email marketing schedule
  • Collaborating with the marketing team on campaign planning and scheduling

Job Details:
  • Work hours initially might be 15-20 per week and will grow from there as projects increase. This is a full-time job, but it may take a few months to ramp up.
  • We are flexible on work hours/time as long as you are responsive and get the job done. However, we do have marketing meetings (virtual) that you would attend.
  • ***To be considered, click the apply button, and tell us about your 3 favorite online brands who crush it with email marketing - and why you think they are so great.

Also, this first role is for a one month trial (at your full hourly rate), then after we both agree it's working out, we will hire you on for a longer term contract.

Cheers,
Brandon

CEO of Healthy Hemp Oil
https://healthyhempoil.com/

P.S. I encourage you to read some of the products reviews on our website to see how our products have positively impacted people's lives. We strongly believe in our products and hope you do too.

items.title: Supreme Optimization : Senior Web Strategist to Lead Marketing Retainers

hiringOrganization.name: HotjarFull-TimeEMEAHubbard Digital Pty. Ltd.ContractUSA, Australia, Canada, New ZealandCastosFull-TimeAnywhere - Remote

items.content:
Senior Web Strategist to Lead Marketing Retainers

Supreme Optimization is looking to hire a highly experienced senior web strategist to lead our marketing retainers and digital marketing account managers. You should have a strong background in digital marketing and big picture digital strategy primarily when it comes to UX, SEO and conversion rate optimization.

Role Mission:
Hiring an experienced senior web strategist who is a natural leader, innovator, team player, highly organized, proactive and has significant experience with digital marketing and marketing strategy.


Compensation:
Starting at $48,000/year - $60,000/year based on experience + bonuses.


Outcomes:
  • Meeting with key clients monthly to review retainer project deliverables digital marketing results
  • Responding to client emails/resolving any client issues
  • Delegating project work to development and SEO team members
  • Increase client retention and annual revenue
  • Lead and manage account managers and digital marketing managers internally
  • Grow into a leadership position

Daily Responsibilities:
  • Overseeing day to day client relationships
  • Innovation and improvements to the current offerings
  • Leading our internal digital marketing team
  • Strategizing digital marketing project plans and breaking projects into monthly stages
  • Conducting keyword research and writing on-page SEO recommendations
  • Analyzing Google Analytics results for areas of opportunity
  • Reviewing SEMrush, Google Search Console, and technical SEO data
  • Coordinating website changes with design and development teams
  • Leading meetings with clients to discuss results and next steps

Mandatory Skills:
  • Expert in Google Analytics and Search Console
  • Expert using SEO tools (e.g. SEMrush, MOZ, Screaming Frog)
  • Strong background in Digital Marketing, UX, conversion rate optimization 
  • Excellent written/people skills
  • Super organized and dependable
  • Easy to get along with
  • Experience managing a team and managing clients

Optional Skills:
  • Educational background in a science-related field

Core Competencies:
  • Organized
  • Tactful
  • Positive
  • Attention to Detail
  • Proactive
  • Great “people person”
  • Analytical/problem solver
  • Good communicator/listener
  • Fluency in English

If you are interested in applying for this job please do the following:
  1. Send an email to "careers@supremeopti.com" with the subject line "Science and SEO and Supreme, Oh My!"
  2. In blue font, write 2-3 sentences telling us your name, who you are and where you are from
  3. In red font, write a few sentences on why you think you would be a good fit for this job
  4. In black font, let us know about your digital marketing background. Specifically, what experience you have, types of projects you've worked on, and what SEO/UX tools you use
  5. Attach your resume to the email

items.content:
Product Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Artificial Intelligence, Behavioral Analytics, Business to Business
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Reactions to this job

0 0 0 0 0 0
New! How do you feel about this job listing?
Company: Avanoo | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

product
product-management

Job description

Who We Are

Avanoo supports people, teams, and organizations in aligning what they do with their highest ambitions for who they are.

We help organizations drive people-centered culture change at scale, using a proprietary method that includes storytelling, microlearning, and cutting-edge technology. Our unique digital solution helps people shift their behaviors and mindsets to create better lives, better teams, and better performance.

Learn more about us and our mission at Avanoo.com.

Who We’re Looking For

You are a vision-driven, growth-oriented Product Leader who thrives in high-growth startup environments.

As the Product Manager, you will be in charge of setting a product roadmap and executing against it toward achieving our high level goals as an organization. To excel in this role, you must have robust experience applying state of the art product and ux techniques to our technology efforts in a way that delivers ROI.

REQUIREMENTS

• Work with the founders and the engineering team to build, and execute on a far-reaching road map to help us achieve our goals

• Collaborate with the design team to create a streamlined, delightful experience for our clients and end users

• Conduct user research to develop a deep understanding of our clients’ needs

• Prioritize and manage the development backlog, ensuring that our development talent is always being deployed for the most critical project at any given time

• Deeply understand our industry, and consistently apply that knowledge to help us push the envelope and stay far ahead of the industry

Qualifications

• Experience building, managing, motivating, mentoring teams of product managers

• Experience collaborating with a team of engineers to deliver great product

• 5+ years experience as a product manager or product leader

• Successful examples of having taken a product or feature from conception to launch

• Proven experience delivering an innovative b2b product

• Deep interest and proven ability to learn the underlying technical details of the product you've managed

• Great communication skills

• Ability and eagerness to be hands-on

• Hands on experience with Agile

• Developing products for enterprise customers with business buyers a plus

• Strong technical foundation a plus

BENEFITS

• Competitive base salary and stock options

• Full time Employee Benefits: medical, dental, vision, paid time off, stock options.

• Strong, vision-driven culture and workplace environment - dedicated to lifelong learning, outstanding client relationships, and accelerated personal/professional growth.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply now

About Avanoo

We're a team of passionate, talented individuals who are super excited about changing the world. The CTO, Prosper is a serial entrepreneur who founded his last company and scaled its platform to support hundreds of millions of users. 

We have all of the really awesome stuff you might expect in a Bay area startup, and more. But most of all, we all get high on helping people tap a little deeper into their potential, and we love to have fun while doing it!

Benefits

  • Great culture
  • Stock options
  • High growth company, with high growth potential for all employees
  • Visa processing benefits to US & CA

items.title: UX Product Designer
items.content:
UX Product Designer

Designer
Anywhere in US
Company: The Democratic National Committee
Contract

Overview

The Democratic National Committee’s Tech team is hiring  to help us build world class tools to help candidates win elections and to empower progressives across the country by providing them with access to high quality data and tools they need to win.

a UX product designer

We need an experienced UX product designer to help us define and implement UX research and design for a suite of self service analytics tools we are building to support our growing community of data analysts and data scientists in state parties, campaigns, sister committees (like the DCCC), and vendors.

Who we are

The Tech team is a small, diverse team that provides the technology used by candidates and organizers in all 50 states and all 3,413 counties across the United States to analyze data, organize campaigns, raise money, and get out the vote on election day. But there’s more to do. So we’re hiring product managers, engineers, researchers, designers, security experts, IT professionals, and data scientists who can use user-centered design and rapid iteration to develop a rich technology ecosystem for progressives—building tools ourselves as well as partnering with other companies and organizations.

The Product

Our data warehouse and analytics platform is our product. We are deeply committed to equipping candidates and campaigns around the country with the resources they need to win, and we are seeking a UX product designer to collaborate with our product team to identify the highest value opportunities to improve users’ end to end experience with democratic data.

Our users range in technical skill and it’s our mission to build tools that help analysts and data scientists uplevel their analytics game by providing features and functions that seamlessly integrate with our data warehouse.

You Will..

UX & Prototyping
  • Develop and implement user experience design strategy for our data warehouse and analytics platform, focusing on both a macro and micro-moment design philosophy
  • Apply insights as we better understand the end users of Democratic data and build the tools that best meet their needs, from novice to experienced data analysts
  • Map out the end to end user experience (How do our users interact with DNC products? Where does the relationship start and end? Where are the pain points? Where is the experience most disjointed or confusing?)
  • Create sketches, wireframes, and interactive prototypes to fuel ideation and validate concepts with our end users
  • Collaborate with product managers to identify feedback loops in our products and pick the right metrics to measure whether we’re actually solving real problems for our users
  • Relentlessly streamline complex processes into simple and elegant experiences.

    • Research
    • Work closely with product managers to understand and synthesize research outcomes
    • Collaborate with product managers to identify research gaps; participate in research methods to inform design
    • Collaborate with product teams to develop and apply experience goals

      • You might be right for this role if you..
      • Have a minimum 3+ years of experience as an UX/Interaction Designer
      • Have a portfolio of UX work samples including interaction maps, sketches and designs. Ideally your portfolio includes at least one data product
      • Value a user/data driven approach design; ability to apply research findings
      • Have a strong understanding of usability and user experience best practices
      • Comfortable with one or more of the following: SQL, data architecture, data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Periscope, Google Data Studio)
      • Are able to create interactive experiences using HTML and/or prototyping software.
      • Proficiency in a variety of design tools such as Sketch, InVision, Illustrator, Photoshop and associated design tools
      • Have worked with cross-functional teams
      • Able to scope your work to deliver working solutions incrementally
      • Have strong written and verbal communication skills, and experience explaining technical concepts to both technical and non-technical udiences
        • a
      • Are curious, collaborative, and humble – ready to work with a diverse, distributed team to solve interesting problems together

        • Nice to have..
        • Electoral campaign experience, and specifically experience with political data, is not required, but is definitely a plus
        • Experience designing, conducting user research and integrating findings into product design is a plus
        • Experience with front-end programming

          • Do you want to..
          • Secure the future of our country? Right now a lot is at stake in our country and our team has a huge opportunity to make a real difference.
          • Work with amazing people? We’re building a diverse, distributed team, hiring the best people we can wherever they are—alumni from past Presidential campaigns working out of DC and New York, experienced product developers from the SF Bay Area, and more.
          • Never stop learning? There are people who know about politics and people who know about technology and a few who have figured out some things about how to combine the two, but we are blazing new trails and you should be comfortable exploring and learning from everyone you can.

            • This is a freelance contract position (6 months) with potential for transition into a full-time role. We are a remote team with a concentration of folks in Washington, D.C., San Francisco Bay Area, Boston and Chicago. If you are coming from industry, however, be aware that some things are different in the world of politics: while we’ve done some budget hacking so we can be competitive when it comes to salaries we know we can’t beat Google or Facebook. On the other hand, you might legit help save the world.

            The Democratic National Committee (DNC), is committed to diversity among its staff, and recognizes that its continued success requires the highest commitment to obtaining and retaining a diverse staff that provides the best quality services to supporters and constituents. The DNC is an equal opportunity employer and it is our policy to recruit, hire, train, promote and administer any and all personnel actions without regard to sex, race, age, color, creed, national origin, religion, economic status, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity or expression, ethnic identity or disability, or any other legally protected basis. The DNC is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in the hiring process and on the job, as required by applicable law. The DNC will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination and any such conduct is strictly prohibited.

            Apply for job
