items.content:
Social Media Coordinator

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: Yelp
Part Time

Overview

Do you live and breath all things business marketing? Are you the person people go to when they’re looking for the perfectly crafted tweet? If this sounds like you, the social media team is looking for a B2B Social Media Coordinator.

The B2B Social Media Coordinator will handle the day-to-day management and growth of Yelp’s corporate social media presence across numerous channels.

business-owner-facing 

We are seeking a long-term, ~15 hours per week, coordinator to support our efforts starting with Twitter with the potential to evolve into support for Instagram and Facebook. Yelp’s larger social landscape includes 300+ national and local handles across North America.

You should have a direct knowledge of the B2B social landscape, passion for building

communities of business owners online and creating engaging content on Twitter based on existing blog content. Bonus: you know how to execute paid campaigns through Twitter Ads.

Remote work is an option, however the team is in San Francisco.

Responsibilities:
  • Coordinate content calendar execution on Twitter, including copywriting and asset creation via Canva.
  • Manage social community interactions and conversations on @Yelpforbusiness.
  • Identity trends and conversations in the B2B space for content creation opportunities.
  • Utilize social listening/sentiment tools to recommend enhancements to the B2B social strategy.
  • Proactively inform other departments of potential social community issues and offer solutions.Reports to Social Media Manager.

    • Qualifications:
    • Bachelor’s Degree: Journalism, Communication, English or relevant professional experience.
    • You have 2+ years of direct, hands-on experience supporting B2B social properties in a corporate environment.
    • You have experience with B2B social media copywriting and asset coordination for multiple accounts.
    • You have experience with social community management as it relates to interacting directly with followers, accounts and the community at large.
    • You must be a creative at heart with the ability to contribute to social media content.
    • You must use and love Yelp. Full stop.

      • At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

      We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.

      Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

      We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 415-969-8488.

      Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

      Apply for job

items.content:
Ad Monetization Manager at Jaumo

Remote | International

ABOUT US

We’re looking for a new teammate in our lean company (24 people from 14 different countries, over 60% engineers), and give you the opportunity to be part of a fascinating journey. We’ve seen incredible growth over the last 8 years, driven by a talented and versatile yet small team. It worked well so far, but now we want more.

We’re looking for a passionate expert who owns ad monetization at our company. Someone who loves experimenting and trying new things, but someone who also really genuinely cares about our users. You will help build the most engaging user experience that solves customer needs and maximizes revenue.

ABOUT THE ROLE

You are an Ad Monetization Manager (f/m/d) with strong experience, and you will be an essential part of our bootstrapped and 100% remote company with a flat organizational structure. The position is full-time. This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast-growing company in a key position.

WE OFFER YOU

  • a great work-life balance – work whenever you want from wherever you are. Results – not hours. We care about what you achieve.
  • no bullshit – we are a fact- and engineering-driven company (including the founders)
  • to work on something important. A lot of businesses say they change lives, but we actually do it. We’ve helped millions of people find love and happiness.
  • 30 days paid vacation
  • a competitive salary

YOU WILL

  • be responsible for the ad monetization strategy of our award-winning apps – used by over a million active users every day
  • develop a deep understanding of our different customers and their needs; leverage this understanding to optimize our ad revenue strategy
  • be the primary point of contact on all things ad operations
  • own Mopub, Admob, Facebook Audience Network, and other partners including waterfall management, QA, reporting, optimization
  • oversee daily ad revenue
  • design, manage and analyze ad revenue experiments
  • manage and optimize digital campaigns executed in a programmatic ecosystem (supply and demand side)
  • be an active part in our cross-functional growth squad: work closely with engineers and growth marketers to uncover insights and new opportunities for growth and revenue
  • have a significant voice in our product strategy and portfolio of dating apps
  • make a difference in a small team of experts

REQUIREMENTS

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and brings bold thinking to the organization fostering an environment of innovation and experimentation. We’re looking for a person with a growth mindset that helps us lay the foundation for the next 10+ years of growth. We’re a bootstrapped company that doesn’t have millions in VC funding to drive growth at all cost. We’re building a sustainable, long-term company that our users love, and we love working for.

YOU

  • bring minimum 2+ years in the programmatic advertising ecosystem from a publisher standpoint
  • have preferably professional experience with a similar app including display, native ads, rewarded video, and offer walls
  • have experience in major ad serving platforms (DFP, AdX, mopub) and digital ad operations
  • have proven experience working with a variety of stakeholders in the ad tech space including SSPs, ad exchanges, agencies, ad verification providers, DMP’s, DSP’s.
  • are familiar with performance optimization and mobile marketing platforms like Adjust, Appsflyer, etc and ad tech dashboards like Mopub, Admob, FAN, etc
  • are proactive, resourceful and entrepreneurial, with little need for supervision and not afraid of failure
  • have done UA and Facebook campaign management as a bonus
  • have a lean, fact-driven, process and KPI-oriented mentality
  • have a high comfort with data and analytical thinking including a strong understanding of statistics. This will be a huge advantage for both being effective in the role and being a cultural fit
  • have strong project management, execution, and excellent verbal/written communication skills
  • can make things happen and you will not be here just to tell other people what to do

If this profile matches your expertise, experience, and aspirations, we’d be delighted to receive your full application, including references, salary requirements, and possible starting date.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Marketing Specialist-PPC, SEO at Zima Media

Remote | Freelance

Our team is looking for a Marketing Specialist (PPC, SEO) who has a good ability to work independently and is eager to learn new things to help take Zima Media to the next level.

In this role, you will be largely responsible for developing and driving digital marketing campaigns and strategies for a portfolio of clients.

This is a full-time contract, 100% remote position.

What you will do:

  • Manage project initiatives from conception to completion, including planning, campaign implementation, client communication, and managing deadlines.
  • Complete work independently and manage a portfolio of varying clients.
  • Plan, manage and support digital marketing plans across the web (SEO, SEM, PPC, Google Shopping, display, and retargeting ads).
  • Actively troubleshoot and contribute to the development of new policies and procedures.
  • Dig into web, campaign and traffic data – reporting on weekly performance updates, project hindsight and areas of opportunity to develop into future plans.
  • + more based on your abilities/interests.

What you bring:

  • 0-3 years of relevant experience.
  • Exceptional communication and writing skills.
  • Well-organized and detail-oriented (it goes without saying).
  • Solid computer skills, including Google Suite, marketing software and advertising platforms.
  • Google Analytics, Google Ads, SEO, and advertising qualifications preferred.
  • Interest in technology, web, and digital marketing.
  • Demonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and business intelligence tools.
  • Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, JS and web development tools desired but not required.
  • Ability to work well in a fully remote, start-up environment.
  • Ability to actively learn and take on new skills.
  • BSc/BA in business, marketing, communications or similar focus desired.

We are looking for an individual who is interested in joining Zima Media in its early days and be part of the construction and future success of the company.

Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Product Manager at Aspect

Remote

Location: Remote, US

Aspect employs a team of passionate individuals who are changing the face of customer engagement. Over our 40-year history we have empowered employees by creating an inspired community that values customer obsession, unlocked communications and relentless innovation. Our ability to think big has enabled us to continually evolve and lead the market, and to stay on the forefront with exciting technologies including cloud, mobile and artificial intelligence.

GENERAL SCOPE & SUMMARY

The Senior Product Manager, Interaction Management is responsible for design and delivery of core customer experience products and services that form the foundation of the Interaction Management portfolio. As such, he or she must work continuously with the other product managers to understand current and emerging product capabilities, and define efficient strategies for bringing them to market across Aspect’s diverse and globally distributed customer base. Working closely with R&D and the Aspect Technology Architects, he or she will be responsible for defining strategies for Omnichannel customer care and agent empowered engagement that increase insight, efficiency and autonomy while promoting consistent meaningful customer engagement.

PRIMARY ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Designs and manages designated products and services, including:
    • Aspect Agent (UIP, future cloud and Omni-Channel)
    • Aspect Zipwire
    • Shared Telephony components (UMS, SIP Phones / Provisioning, Aspect RTC)
  • Works within the Pragmatic Marketing Framework and Aspect Product Lifecycle to define new or updated products and services that effectively address the Aspect market and customer base.
  • Serves as the central resource with design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing throughout all stages of each product’s lifecycle.
  • Provides a common focal point for introduction of new shared components within the Aspect Interaction Management portfolio, defining new product initiatives, product positioning, and pricing.
  • Interacts with marketing, sales, technical support, QA, manufacturing etc. as well as external customers to ensure that products have necessary features, cost parameters, manufacturability goals, reliability targets and release schedules.
  • Participates on multiple product development teams in the company from conceptual meetings to deployment and release. Incumbents may have a varied background in engineering, marketing and/or manufacturing.

Qualifications

SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

  • Experience in senior Product Management roles in a relevant industry.
  • Customer service and workflow distribution industry expertise as it pertains to contact center best practices
  • User interface and persona based product requirements definition including agile development concepts
  • Knowledge of cloud technology, telecommunications, and associated regulatory or compliance environments.
  • Knowledge of telephony, media services, messaging, and related communications technology as it related to cloud and/or premise based contact center architectures.
  • Pragmatic Marketing Framework Certification or equivalent experience / training.
  • Strong customer service and teamwork skills.
  • Professional demeanor to maintain and enhance relationships.
  • Ability to use professional concepts in developing approaches in the solution of critical problems and broad design issues.
  • Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments and may provide guidance to lower level personnel.
  • Capability to work on extremely complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variables.
  • Ability to provide solutions that are highly creative and to exercise independent judgment in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
  • Skills required to work on problems that have long term impact on success of organization.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum 10 years’ experience full life cycle product management required.
  • Cloud software, telecom or contact center industry experience required.
  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant field required.
  • Pragmatic Marketing Framework Certification or equivalent training preferred.
  • Aspect product knowledge (Unified IP, Zipwire, telephony, etc) preferred.

*LI-KG1

Aspect is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a strong commitment to diversity. In that spirit, we are particularly interested in receiving applications from a broad spectrum of people, including women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, veterans or any other legally protected group.

Apply for job

items.title: Headway: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=4}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Full-time
Anywhere - USA
Remote job
Studio
Posted Today – Accepting applications

About Headway

Founded in 2015, Headway was born out of a passion to bring entrepreneurial ideas to market and keep them there. We work holistically with our client partners as a true extension of their product team, not just as the technical execution arm of their business. If we see something broken, whether that’s a workflow, a marketing or messaging strategy, or a needless feature, we speak up, and our clients trust us to help them fix it.

Because we’re more than just designers and developers, we achieve results that bring successful long-term partnerships and trusted referrals. We help entrepreneurs build a business ―not just an app. This approach, coupled with realistic and incremental software releases, results in a friendly, fun, and collaborative atmosphere where our colleagues and clients both have room to learn and grow.

See how our clients talk about our approach and check out some of the recognition we’ve received so far. Discover how we show our clients appreciation with unique holiday gifts each year. Or, if you’re a podcast fan, check out Seaworthy, where we explore ways to help companies grow and scale their business and ideas. We’re excited about what we’ve achieved in the last few years, but we’re just getting started. We need your help to take us to the next level!

A Day In The Life

During a typical work week, our crew members enjoy a balanced assignment of 35 hours on client projects with the ability to invest the other 5 hours on a combination of individual goals and team meetings. Each quarter, we take a full week away from client work to focus on team goals and internal project initiatives. These weeks alternate between a retreat style destination that encourages team bonding and goal setting, and a more focused week-long design and development sprint at our primary office in Wisconsin. Check out some of our team week recaps and years in review to get a feel for how much fun it is to work at Headway!

What Does Success Look Like?

During your first 2-4 weeks at Headway, you’ll receive extensive on the job training including a customized trail of technical assessments and assignments. This training covers fundamentals of our core technologies, the way we delegate tasks within a development team, our git process and workflow, testing strategies, tips for successful client interactions, and much more.

You’ll have dedicated pairing time scheduled with various colleagues to cover different skills, and we’ll even participate in several mock client meetings so your first standup or sprint planning meeting doesn’t carry with it the weight of your first client interaction. After this training period, you’ll be successfully contributing to new feature work on a client project in the context of a team. You’ll also be participating in daily standups, sprint planning meetings, and retrospectives. Welcome aboard!

Ongoing Support

Each week, you’ll meet with your team lead to ensure that you have the time and attention you need to be successful. Your needs and questions will always come first in this meeting, but other topics discussed include:

  • Individual quarterly goal progress
  • Project status / team issues / weekly retro
  • Individual responses to our weekly team health questionnaire

Quarterly and Annual Reviews

In addition to weekly touch point meetings, more formal quarterly reviews are scheduled to discuss successes and areas for growth identified over the last 3 months. We have annual performance assessments and salary reviews, though we reserve the right to provide a merit based pay raise at any time. Most crew members achieve between a 2% and 5% raise each year within their same role, but bigger jumps are possible when roles or responsibilities increase. We’re here to grow with you sustainably over the long term.

Experience and Results At Every Level

With an experienced leadership team encompassing design, development, sales, marketing, and operations, Headway is poised for an amazing 2019. Our business is guided by EOS and we have strong processes, documentation, and people to support your growth and development at Headway. As they say, “Train people well enough so they can leave, treat them well enough so they don’t want to.” For more on that, check out our benefits!

Why Should You Apply?

  • Work on exciting projects in the latest tech across a variety of industries including: Healthcare, FinTech, Education, Personal Growth & Training, Lifestyle & Social
  • Collaborate with colleagues and clients directly to ship features that users love
  • Work with appreciative clients who seek out and value your input and feedback
  • Strong leadership and top-notch colleagues to help you realize your full potential
  • Career growth and leadership opportunities

Key Benefits

  • 22 total days of PTO & Sick Time available immediately
  • 100% of health care and dental premiums paid for you and all your dependents
  • Up to a 4% matching 401k contribution based on your dollar contribution
  • $6,000 hardware on-boarding budget including $2,000 to spend however you like
  • $2,500 annual education and conference budget

The Hiring Process

If after we review your application and we choose to move forward, the following interviews will typically take place over the course of 3-5 days (depending on scheduling):

  • Work history and aspirations chat with our People and Team Strategist
  • Skills and performance discussion with our Head of Design and a Design Lead
    • Portfolio Review
    • Design Collaboration Exercise
  • Take-home skills assessment
  • Discussion with a member of the design or development team

Position Description

Headway Product Designer you’ll be working within a small multidisciplinary team of designers and developers on applications and web projects, although sometimes you’ll be guiding your own ship on a smaller adventure.

You’ll be working closely with our team and clients to challenge assumptions, create small experiments, in-depth prototypes, detailed specifications, and style guides.

With a high priority on business and user needs, you’ll help make decisions that stand up for users to solve their problems and create true value in their lives.

Responsibilities

As a Senior Designer at Headway, you are responsible for executing within the Headway design process with a focus on client and user needs including:

  1. Practicing “craft within context” and providing Designers and apprentices advice and guidance.
  2. Driving all design from the outside-in with user story mapping and MoSCoW prioritization.
  3. Assisting with design critiques and QA
  4. Participating in pairing sessions to help crewmates learn and grow.
  5. Performing QA of both internal design quality and end-user UI/UX
  6. Conducting user interviews, creating small experiments, in-depth prototypes, detailed specifications, design systems, and validation.
  7. Set project design direction and follow through with successful execution and delivery.
  8. Interfacing with clients during sprint planning sessions and retros to ensure projects are on track
  9. Leading product/project discovery sessions and workshops with necessary internal and external stakeholders

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience
  • Experience shipping applications for Web, iOS, and Android
  • Experience working with businesses at different levels of maturity
  • Professional knowledge of user-centered design, usability principles and techniques
  • The ability to present your work and stand firm for the right reasons
  • Working within multidisciplinary teams with ux designers, visual designers, and developers
  • Communicating and working with developers to solve technical challenges
  • Visualizing and prototype concepts to varying levels of fidelity to demonstrate and test ideas
  • Experience working within Agile/SCRUM processes
  • Passionate with a hunger to design and make things people use everyday
  • The ability to think big whilst being detail oriented and delivery focused
  • Organized and self-motivated
  • An excellent communicator (verbally and written), capable of inspiring colleagues and clients
  • Outgoing, personable, sociable and easy going
  • Open to criticism from your team to benefit project development
  • Always eager to learn and to share knowledge
  • The ability to deal with pressure and can work in a fast paced environment
  • ++ Ability to develop your own designs with CSS/HTML & Javascript
  • ++ Experience with interaction prototyping tools like Framer, Invision Studio, Principle
  • ++ Experience designing branding and identity
  • ++ Experience running or participating in design sprints

Expectations

  • You live by our Guiding Manifesto and embody the core values of Headway.
  • You are open to criticism from your team and are always eager to learn and to share knowledge.
  • You have the ability to think big while being detail oriented and delivery focused.
  • You are self-motivated and able to deal with pressure and work well in a fast paced environment.
  • You have an outgoing, personable, and sociable attitude.
  • You have initiative to solve challenges, meet goals, and set new directions based on data.
  • You are capable of inspiring colleagues and clients.
  • You have a passion to create useful and valuable solutions.
  • You prioritize and attend our quarterly team weeks on-site at our primary office in Wisconsin, or at an awesome TBD destination.

Next Steps

If this sounds like you, we’d love to have you apply! We’re a remote-first company so this position is open to designers local to the Green Bay, WI area, and anyone residing in and legally able to work in the US.

items.title: Content Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Overview
Unmind is transforming mental health in the workplace. We have developed a market-leading digital platform, secured funding from top-tier investors, and signed contracts with a variety of global corporations… but we’re just getting started.

We have humongous plans –and need lots of help in achieving them– which is why we’re looking for an exceptional individual to join as our first content person to lead Unmind’s content marketing efforts moving forward.

About Unmind
Unmind is a workplace mental health platform – providing clinically-backed tools, training, and assessments that anyone can use to proactively improve their mental wellbeing. Our digital platform is beautifully designed, non-stigmatising and globally scalable – helping to create healthier, happier, more human organisations around the world.

We believe that everyone has the right to a healthy mind –because we all have mental health, all of the time– and we’re striving to create a world where mental health is universally understood, nurtured, and celebrated.

The Role – Content Marketing Manager
As a team of thirty-six, everyone does a bit of everything and we’re a SUPER flat organisation –all opinions are valued regardless of role, tenure or background– so every aspect of the business is up for debate. That said, the core remit of this particular role is to:

Lead our content strategy, driving customer acquisition, activation and retention.
Fully conceptualise, write, and edit engaging content.
Leverage our existing relationships - clients and contributors - to add credibility.
Craft and own our tone of voice.
Ensure quality and consistency across different channels including online and events.
Ensure that all efforts are highly organised and systematically tracked.
Refine our schedule to align with key events, new research and product launches.
Optimise your output, considering SEO and Google Analytics.
Work with Design, Client Success and Sales to identify opportunities and deliver your vision.
Contribute to our wider communications strategy inc. PR relationships etc.
Grow Unmind into a global thought leader that is truly loved!

Responsibilities
We are looking for someone to lead Unmind’s content marketing activities. To-date most of our content has been written by different members of the Unmind team, but we feel that now is the right time to scale our efforts, professionalise our approach, and grow Unmind into a global thought leader.

This role will require working incredibly closely in collaboration with our Head of Marketing as well as our Sales and Client Success teams to ensure we are always aligned and working towards the same overarching objectives. The successful candidate will be extremely bright, unwaveringly candid, and bring oodles of insight to the table. If you’re ambitious, creative and articulate, then this is an opportunity to oversee all-things content marketing at a fast-growth, high-impact startup.

Here’s how your skills and passion will come to life at Unmind:

Build: Design, develop, and deliver Unmind’s content marketing strategy. This will include (but is not limited to): content creation and deployment; tone of voice and positioning; optimising SEO and discoverability whilst tracking progress.
Redefine: Transform the world’s perception of mental health. Unmind is changing the landscape of mental healthcare, and your input will play an enormous role in how we achieve that. You will need to create effective content that elevates the subject whilst ensuring that we always uphold our core values.
Collaborate: Harness the kaleidoscope of personal stories and professional expertise from across the Unmind team to inspire others around our mission/vision/purpose. Work with our phenomenal clients, users and collaborators to leverage their shared passion, testimonials, and insights around improving workplace mental health.
Implement: Instill analytics and reporting around all content initiatives to enhance business predictability and transparency. Help define, track and manage company KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) associated with content marketing.
Reflect: Review all content and communication activity to-date, retrospectively looking for opportunities or improvements that will enhance efficiency/effectiveness. Compile periodic reporting and insights from ongoing content efforts to aid internal planning and enhance our collective understanding of what is/isn’t striking a chord with the market.
Partner: Proactively connect with early-adopters, industry experts, and thought-leaders within the market to ensure that our messaging is always striking the right chord.
Grow: We love working with people who are naturally curious and always seek opportunities to learn. We have a hugely experienced team but none of us think we are the finished article. You shall expect to be challenged and to challenge others internally. We are striving to create something truly special so egos need to be left at the door.


Skills and Experience
As with any B2B organisation, the success of Unmind depends on every member of staff being professional, amicable, and building strong relationships – both internally and with external stakeholders. Our ideal candidate traits are as follows:


ESSENTIAL:

3+ years of content marketing experience – ideally within a tech-led enterprise environment.
Experience building a successful B2B enterprise content marketing strategy.
Ability to leverage a network of clients/experts/ambassadors.
A love for storytelling, and a natural ability to engage customers and prospects.
Exceptional writing, editing, and verbal communications skills.
Excellent editorial and copywriting abilities, including long form and short form content.
Ability and willingness to source knowledge and research topics independently.
Understand the B2B marketing funnel, including the customer's journey.
Creative, innovative and have an eye for detail.
Autonomous attitude (you *do not* require (or like) micro-management).
An ability to simplify, communicate, and sell ideas to multiple groups of stakeholders, with a relentless enthusiasm to over-deliver on targets and expectations.
Bona. Fide. Hustler. If it needs doing, you’ll get it done - somehow, some way.
Hungry to make Unmind the global category leader within workplace mental health.
Not a terrible human being… Ideally a great one. We’re a tight team and want to stay that way.

DESIRED:
Passion for mental health, tech-for-good, and generally improving people’s lives.
Prior role(s) within a B2B SaaS environment and/or HR Tech experience.
Previous startup and/or entrepreneurial experience (inc. being innovative with resources!)
Comfortable working for a small, rapid growth business with constant change/unknowns.
Bonus points for expertise in video production, graphic design, or website management.
Passionate about design, UX and beautiful brands.

The Opportunity
You will be joining an exceptionally talented core team who –in the last 24-months– have secured incredible investors, partners, clients and advocates. Our future success(es) will rely on the continuation of that momentum – of which our ability to enhance (and leverage) Unmind’s market presence will be paramount. If done right, then the opportunity for this individual (and Unmind generally) is vast, compounded and –perhaps most importantly– will genuinely improve people’s lives.

Location: Unmind’s London office (London Bridge / Borough)

Benefits
Great colleagues (personally and professionally)
Pick your own tech
Regular social company gatherings
Optional team walks, runs and mindfulness sessions
Wellbeing budget to use at your discretion
Office perks (free on-site gym, rooftop bar, wellbeing events)
A culture of continuous learning
Pension and generous holiday policy
Dog-friendly workplace

Hours: Regular 09:00–18:00 working day (with capacity for remote working and flexible hours).

Remuneration: Salary TBC - reflective of candidate experience and skill set.

items.title: Truvani: Partnership/Affiliate Manager

hiringOrganization.name: Hubbard Digital Pty. Ltd.ContractUSA, Australia, Canada, New ZealandCastosFull-TimeAnywhere - RemoteCartStackFull-TimeNorth America Only

items.content:
Partnership/Affiliate Manager

Truvani is looking for a seasoned Partnership/Affiliate Manager to join our team. You’ll be the point person for our affiliate program. You’ll be responsible for recruiting, managing, and motivating affiliates, as well as tracking, analyzing, and optimizing affiliate performance.

Our ideal candidate is a self-starter with strong prospecting skills. You must be willing to get creative in researching and recruiting new affiliates.

Our Ideal Candidate

  • The ultimate people person with exemplary relationship building skills.
  • Organized and detail-oriented. You’ll be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our affiliate program, from recruiting and onboarding new affiliates to consulting throughout the affiliate relationship.
  • A problem solver with the ability to anticipate and solve issues before they happen.
  • Proven track record in performance-based marketing models.
  • Experienced in tracking, analyzing, and optimizing campaigns.
  • Strong prospecting skills with the ability to get creative in finding new affiliate opportunities and negotiating deals.
  • A multi-tasker with strong analytic, reporting, and time management skills.
  • Has the ability to manage multiple affiliates simultaneously, set priorities, and work independently.

Your Responsibilities Include

  • Recruit, manage, and motivate affiliates / partners to promote Truvani products.
  • Research and identify potential affiliates and partners in the health and wellness realm as well as in complementary industries.
  • Oversee all aspects of our affiliate program, from recruiting to initial enrollment to consulting throughout the affiliate relationship.
  • Monitor affiliate activity, analyze performance, identify areas of improvement, and recommend ways to optimize performance and increase affiliate-generated revenues.
  • Work with marketing team to coordinate and monitor affiliate launches; provide performance feedback to marketing team.
  • Set and exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual goals for revenue - and help affiliates do the same.

The Nitty Gritty

  • Full time market-based compensation based on experience
  • Health benefits offered after 60 days
  • Paid time off and paid holidays
  • Position is available immediately and will remain open until filled

This is a permanent position with an opportunity to grow within the company (so we would like to hire someone that is awesome and is excited about being a part of our team).

items.title: Cloud Cost Analyst at Auth0
items.content:
Cloud Cost Analyst

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: Information Technology, IT Security, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: VC Funded

Reactions to this job

0 0 0 0 0 0
New! How do you feel about this job listing?
Company: Auth0 | No office location

Technologies

iaas
aws
sql
Nathan Totten Director of Customer Success at Auth0 8.9k 1 29 38
twistedstream 110 1 7
KukicAdo 3 2
eduardods 56 3

Job description

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 2.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises.Auth0 has raised more than $210 million in funding to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture. We are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries. Come join us!Auth0 is looking for a Cloud Cost Analyst to join our Cloud Platform Engineering Team. This team is responsible for making sure our Engineering department is running as efficiently as possible. As a Cloud Cost Analyst you will partner with our Engineer colleagues to help them optimize the usage of our cloud infrastructure, mainly Amazon Web Services (AWS). Successful candidates are likely experienced analysts with technical depth and expertise, along with strong stakeholder engagement and communications skills.

You will:

    • Maintain responsibility for ensuring that our costs are well understood, identifying and driving infrastructure optimization activities to ensure we are making the most out of our investments, and forecasting costs.
    • Work closely with finance to implement the cloud costs support systems needed for a continuously growing company.
    • Develop insightful views in to cost and usage data that enable executives to understand spend.
    • Create Engineering awareness and drive behavior change to make significant cost and efficiency improvements across the organization.
    • Use software tools to provide data visualization, and gather direct feedback from the respective engineering teams
    • Be the main point of contact for our cloud providers and will maintain current knowledge of relevant cloud optimization, regulations, policies, and procedures.

You'd be a great fit if you:

    • Have 5+ years of experience working in a related discipline such as a systems engineer, technical account manager, financial analyst, etc.
    • Have specific experience with IaaS (ideally AWS).
    • Have been responsible for optimizing the costs of a growing Engineering organization.
    • Have strong analytical skills.
    • Are an excellent communicator, comfortable presenting to senior leadership.
    • Have a minimum bachelor’s degree.

Bonus points if you:

    • Have a developer background, with ability to write scripts, SQL queries, and familiar with data analytics tools.
    • AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner
    • Have experience working in distributed teams and work environments.
Apply now

About Auth0

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We are transparent about how we run our recruiting process - you can read all about it here. You can also read about our company culture here.

Benefits

  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Competitive Equity
  • Top-of-the-Line Macbooks and other great tools
  • Embrace Distributed Work
  • Inclusive Work Environment
  • Annual all-expenses paid international company offsite

items.content:
Product Marketing Manager at SmashFly Technologies

Remote

Location: Anywhere in US, US

Job Type: Full-Time

Product Marketing Manager

What you’ll be contributing to:

At SmashFly, you’ll help us build the future of talent mobility. We’ve set our sights on becoming the next HubSpot, Marketo, or Pardot for recruiting — a platform purpose-built to help large enterprise organizations develop real connections with talent throughout their career lifecycle.

What we’ve created is truly best-in-class software that helps companies attract and proactively build relationships with today’s top talent — from someone’s first interaction with a brand through their first day of retirement. Our solution is used by some of the world’s biggest brands (you probably bank with, buy from, and use some of their products) — and we need talent like you to help us constantly improve our technology for them.

You’re an ideal match if:

You’re eager to be a part of a team that turns concepts, ideas, and idealistic solutions into real, functioning facets of SmashFly’s platform. You thrive in an agile environment. You don’t mind a little bit of uncertainty and can toe the line between strategic thinking and tactical execution. You love to create and control your own destiny. And you’re inspired by the mission to help candidates find their dream jobs — and companies find their dream hires.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Working hand-in-hand with our Product, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success organizations to manage and execute the product launch process from start to finish.
  • Providing competitive intelligence to the product and sales/customer success teams.
  • Creating enablement tools and collateral for the marketing, sales, and customer success teams.
  • Working closely with our VP of Marketing and CMO to bring SmashFly’s product message to analysts, customers, and strategic partners.
  • Leveraging tools like Crayon, competitive win/loss reviews, and other market intelligence mediums to create battlecards and competitive analyses on key competitors.
  • Serving as SmashFly’s internal (and external) messenger on new product features — focusing specifically on what they do and why they matter.
  • Defining and executing SmashFly’s product marketing strategy — you’ll have a lot of autonomy to help us shape what that looks like.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 3+ years experience in B2B SaaS marketing or a product marketing role for a complex consumer organization.
  • Experience planning and rolling out new product launches and working directly with the product team to convert user stories, use cases, product functionality, and technical documentation into internal / external messaging and collateral.
  • Passion for working closely with customers, partners, and other vendors to develop a comprehensive analysis of the market and deliver key go-to-market intelligence to the product, marketing, and sales organizations.
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite, PowerPoint, and other design tools to create product collateral and tools for the sales/customers success teams to use externally.

A little bit about us:

  • We are a growth-mode software startup backed by well-respected venture capital
  • We’ve delivered significant year-on-year growth since our founding — including our best Q1 on record in Q1 2019
  • We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Boston Business Journal
  • We’re the top ranked company in Boston by Glassdoor
  • We offer great benefits including an open vacation policy, stock options, weekly happy hours, and an inclusive, supportive culture that creates clear opportunity for career growth — basically, all the stuff that really matters to top talent like you.
Apply for job

items.content:
Social Media Ads Specialist

In Marketing We Trust

 Worldwide verified
**The Position Summary**

Title: Social Media Advertising Specialist

Location: Remote. Asia Pacific timezone

Reports to: Head of Growth

Works on: Company’s clients and projects

Key objectives: Build and manage social media campaigns across various platforms for Company’s clients

Experience required: 3+ years of related work experience in paid social


**The Company**

We are a digital analytics Agency and we are very good at Analytics, SEO, CRO, Data Science. Find out more about our services

Our motto: Traffic is nice. Revenue is better.

We have the most fun doing it in competitive environments such as finance, education, jobs, insurance, automotive and many more.

We strive on being an extension of our client’s team and providing tailor-made, return-focused work.

We are picky about the clients we bring on-board and very protective of our reputation. We won’t engage with a firm unless we believe we can make a difference to their business and help them Get Stuff Done!

This stops us from taking on board demoralizing projects and having us hating our jobs and our clients.

We think the current agency model is broken and we really believe we can build a better alternative. But we need great people to help make this happen and that’s where you come in!

We are a bootstrapped company, we grew exponentially in the last few years and now seating at 60 people working with us.

We are built to be remote from day 1, but if you want to say ‘Hello’, our office is 78 meters from the beach in Sydney. Make sure you bring your swimwear!


**The Opportunity**

We are looking for a passionate and creative Social Media Advertising Specialist to join our growing team. You will work on multiple client projects in support of our broader team to contribute to and grow.

You will need a mix of creativity and strong analytical skills to identify growth opportunities for our clients. You will support to develop and execute strategies and help turn those ideas in order to grow and scale the client’s paid media account.

The Specialist will collaborate across the organization, and own key agency relationships, developing ideas and strategy as it relates to paid social in conjunction with the rest of the team.

**What we offer you**

Career progression is based on your ability to deliver and drive ideas and difference for both the client and the company, not your ability to play politics or by the cut of your suit (in fact, we have a no suit policy).

A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you a unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.

We even fly the team each year to our awesome TrustEDConf event. The last one was in October in Borneo.

An important point that is often overlooked: you will be truly part of a team. For most remote workers, you can easily feel isolated from what's happening in the business. We take good care of our teammates. So much so that a person who joined our team late November told us recently that she has felt more part of a team, than when she was working in an office.

Don't take our word for it. Check what our teammates are saying on Glassdoor (yep, 2 reviews are not great, but most are).





# Responsibilities
* Analyze performance data
* Set up, monitor & manage mid to large Facebook Ads & Linkedin Ads campaigns; possibly support Google Ads too.
* Perform regular tracking and analysis on the performance of each campaign. Prepare and deliver performance reports identifying successes and opportunities for improvement
* Stay up to date with the latest social media best practices and technologies
* Drive clients social strategy forward with best practice
* Effectively communicate and demonstrate your ideas and concepts to all stakeholders, this could include both technical and non-technical audiences



# Requirements
**Ideal candidate**

* 3+ years of related work experience in paid social
* Working experience with Facebook Ads platform (FB & Instagram campaigns); experience with other social ads platforms such as Linkedin Ads, Twitter Ads, will be considered a plus
* FB management platforms such as Smartly a plus also
* Google ads & Bing experience not essential but another plus
* Good understanding of SEO and Web traffic metrics
* Clear understanding of how social media campaigns can be used in different parts of the funnel
* Detail oriented & organized
* Strong analytical skills


**Attributes and behaviors we love to see**

* A can-do attitude
* Ownership of your work
* Inquisitive
* Analytical
* Creative in context
* Results orientated
* Collegiate and supportive
* A sense of humor

#Location
- Worldwide

items.content:
Sr. Product Manager – Remote // Goodwall

Company: Goodwall

Tags:
  • Project Management
  • Product Management
  • remote

    • About Us

    Goodwall is the leading professional development network for the next generation. We guide young talent as they navigate the future of learning and earning, starting in high school and following along through the college years. Students have a medium to tell their story, get support from our inspirational community, and get connected to universities, internships, and jobs. Our top-rated app has a following of over 1 million members and our network of organizations and companies spans four continents. We are a fast growing and well-financed company that takes great pride in (and thoroughly enjoy) having a diverse team and being an equal opportunity employer. Each member of our dynamic team has a unique perspective to share–just as we know you do–and we are all incredibly passionate about our shared mission and goal: to help every member of our community become the best version of themselves.

    About The Role

    We are looking for an experienced Sr. Product Manager to own the Goodwall product roadmap across our small, global team (NYC, Geneva, and Manila). This is a remote role which may require occasional travel to our Geneva and NYC offices. You’ll be the main intersection between our COO, Engineering and Design teams with a focus on overall product priorities and strategy. We have some pretty exciting ideas on deck and you’ll be responsible for taking them through our agile product development process all the way from ideation to launch and validation. You will work closely with our engineers, designers and business stakeholders, keeping communication flowing and all teams on task. If you are looking for an opportunity to have full responsibility for defining a product from A-Z, this is the role for you!

    What You’ll Do

    • Manage new product features from inception/ideation through to implementation and then on to launch, validation, evaluation and refinement
    • Work very closely with the design department and engineers in product discovery and validation
    • As a product expert, you’ll act as an advocate for users within the company
    • Constantly monitor user feedback, user behavior (qualitatively and quantitatively), competitors and market trends
    • Work with the rest of the Product team in defining the product strategy and roadmap
    • Act as both the user and business representative on the development team during the implementation phase

    What We Offer You

    • A challenging, fast-moving environment
    • Professional growth stipends and opportunities
    • A mission that you can be proud of
    • Ability to have real impact both in the company and on society
    • A high level of autonomy in a position that will evolve according to your strengths
    • Many growth opportunities as the company is growing very quickly
    • A flexible work environment: we are open to candidates located in any location, with a preference in Switzerland or Central Europe

    About You

    • You’re a team player who can effectively lead without direct authority. You know the best way to build influence and credibility with all the members of the team
    • 5+ years experience in a similar Product role
    • Your passion for product easily inspires others
    • You know the mindset of the American culture and can use that knowledge to help us build great products for companies and college students in the US
    • You know your way around an agile product organization with a mobile product
    • You’re confident in your abilities to write and communicate user stories
    • Understanding of good vs. bad UX is second nature to you
    • You’re a talented juggler; you are constantly on the ball and enjoy having multiple points of contact
    • You realize how important both short-term and long-term planning are to reaching your product goals
    • You’ve got experience in data-driven product management, using experimentation and validation as part of the product process
    • You’re not just the Product Manager, but also the Project Manager: you can efficiently orchestrate all the moving pieces of the project and have excellent communication skills to keep the wheels of progress turning at all times
    • We’re a global team made up of many nationalities but English is our company language so you should be able to communicate fluently and effectively in English
    • Previous experience working remotely is a plus

    Diversity & Inclusion

    Goodwall is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to continuing to build a company that embraces and thrives on diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

    Apply for this position

items.content:
Location: New York
Role and job type:   Design / Product   Full-time

Job Description

You will represent all stakeholders (external clients, executives, other product managers, sales, and client solutions) when working with the engineering team to design solutions for the platform.

We work in a fast-paced environment and are seeking someone who is self-motivated, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a distributed team. This is an ideal opportunity for an individual with a passion for solving complex business and technical challenges.

Qualified candidates should have 2-3 years of experience in the financial or online ad-tech industry working as a Product Manager.

Candidates will be responsible for creating business and technical product feature requirements for the NYIAX platform. You will address both short and long-term product objectives and features by working with technology and business team members to ensure success. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.

Job Qualifications

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop a deep understanding of the needs and business objectives of internal and - external stakeholders, and engage at a detailed technical level to derive product requirements
  • Evaluate opportunities, design solutions based on analysis, and work with multiple internal teams to implement solutions and iterate
  • Drive feature prioritization, process improvements, and product requirements to improve product effectiveness and usability
  • Ability to effectively interact with various levels of personnel from C-level managers to functional business users as well other product and development teams
  • Proactively provide customer and business context to engineering team
  • Express novel ideas and complex concepts clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing

Required Qualifications

  • The ideal candidate is a passionate product leader, who is both detail oriented and customer oriented with experience building workflow solutions and complex, highly integrated software solutions
  • 2-3 years of experience in a product management role, with a successful track record of designing, building and launching products with real business impact
  • Fluency in Agile development and experience with human-centered design processes
  • Knowledge of display advertising technology is preferred, specifically ad serving and/or monetization systems
  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree (preferably in computer science or engineering)
  • Strong problem solving and business modeling skills with ability to form key, succinct insights and recommendations from comprehensive analyses
  • Strong communicator with the ability to develop rapport and trust with clients and internal teams across many job functions
  • Passion for improving existing business practices and processes
  • Exceptional quantitative and analytical thinking, and the ability to develop and present product and solution recommendations to internal teams and to clients / prospects
  • Professional, outgoing, confident with sound written and oral communication skills

Desired Characteristics

  • Strategic and tactical, creative and disciplined, enjoys working at the big picture and product pixel levels
  • Driven, self-starter; comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment
  • Impeccable work ethic, humble but confident
  • Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
  • Highly accountable; takes ownership and drives sense of urgency
  • Impeccable written & oral communication skills
  • A product evangelist, who is able to inspire and drive consensus
  • Self-starter and extremely proactive with a strong bias for action; naturally inquisitive; desire to continuously improve current business practices/processes
  • Organized, detail-oriented, ability to multi-task and thrive within a fast-paced environment

Salary range

Competitive

As the developer community manager, you will be responsible for growing awareness and adoption of the open core to VMware’s blockchain products as well as the programmatic adoption of VMware Blockchain. You will engage with developers through hack-a-thons, meetups, conferences, workshops, and online campaigns. You will work closely with engineering and product management to drive features into the product to make it easier to consume and use for developers. You will work with partners and customers to help their developers come up to speed on consuming VMware Blockchain.

Competitive

Job Description

We just launched the private Alpha version of the TruStory App to our early community and the feedback so far has been very positive. We are now seeking smart, analytical debaters to join us on TruStory Alpha and be one of the first users to debate with token incentives.
The role is designed to be a short 4 week remote engagement where we will compensate you in proportion to how much you earn by engaging on the App.

  • For every TruStake you earn you’ll receive $1; for every Cred you earn you’ll receive $3.
  • Total compensation will be capped at $500 in the form of gift card(s).

Description of responsibilities:
Research crypto claims: Research and post new claims that can be debated on our platform.
Back & challenge claims: Gather and analyze information from credible sources and post arguments to verify or refute claims.
Engage on the App: Engage in other activities including endorsing claims, posting replies for arguments etc.

Salary range

See Descriptiom

items.content:
Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type:   Design / Product   Full-time

Job Description

The role

We are looking for an experienced product designer to help us build exceptional user experience across Status products. Working with Engineers and Designers to implement our evolving design system, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of Status products and have a real opportunity to make a big impact on how people interact with the web in a new way.

Your responsibilities:

  • Distill complex features and workflows into simple intuitive experiences.
  • Continuously seek and prioritise design needs for the product and engineering teams.
  • Define and scope requirements and use cases for each design iteration.
  • Deliver carefully thought out design flows and interaction patterns, following best practices as well as proactively gathering feedback.
  • Continuous involvement with developers and product managers to find elegant and creative solutions that guide analysis of technical feasibility as well as respect technical and organisational constraints.
  • Delivery of detailed design specification in combination with conversational handoff to Engineers.
  • Ensure timely feedback loops with Engineers and QA to verify implementation and optimize designs where needed.
  • Align with design team to ensure an excellent end-to-end experience in support of key user goals: Pay, Chat, Browse, Manage.

What you bring:

  • You’ll be passionate about our guiding principles.
  • 2-3 years of experience designing digital products in an industrial environment.
  • A great portfolio that showcases your experience in designing digital products, your design process, interaction design and visual skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with an ability to explain your design decisions, the problem you are solving, your preferred solution and alternatives.
  • Experience working with Engineers, PMs, UXRs & Marketing.
  • Experience in designing cross-platform products for iOS,Android, Desktop and Web.
  • Proven capability of mapping and navigating technical limitations and finding elegant solutions.
  • Think in systems and patterns but with ability to break them.
  • Experience shipping mobile products.
  • Adopt a modern design workflow and willing to work in Figma.
  • Ability to prototype your designs with a tool of choice and appropriate fidelity (we use Framer and Principle).
  • A love for well-made user interfaces and experiences that balance form and function.
  • Interest in the principles of blockchain, the decentralized web and privacy.
  • Living in, or comfortable working in, CET ± 2h.

Bonus points:

Able to write and edit React code components.
Have used GitHub, or a similar software versioning tool, before.

Salary range

USD 70k - 90k

items.content:
Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type:   Full-time

Job Description

We are looking for an extremely proactive energizing person who can be both supportive and a driver toward success. You will coordinate with all of the development teams in Holo as the Product owner and PM for Holochain our open-source distributed application framework. Through this you will gain a deep understanding of what Holochain is enabling in the world.

What you will do:

  • Ensure that the dev team goals are clear and the vision is aligned with business objectives
  • Support daily technical coordination with our dev team to ensure that team is clear about priorities and dependencies
  • Encourage and synchronize with open source community activities based on organization objectives
  • Coordinate business and technical requirements, prioritisations, and timelines between our Holochain Core dev team and downstream teams to ensure priorities match needs. This includes developing schedules and understanding the critical path
  • Manage risks and resolves issues that affect release scope, schedule and quality - own issue resolution, and recommend corrective actions & implement changes.
  • Measure and monitor progress to ensure application releases are delivered on time and within budget, and that they meet or exceed expectations
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to manage expectations, provide timely communication and resolve conflicts in support of driving successful delivery of releases
  • Define and develop detailed project plans based on the given requirements and scopes
  • Communicate release details and schedules to the organization as required
  • Coordinate with QA and Delivery to plan and align all non-dev release activities
  • Support process improvements in the release process
  • Work with devops to improve and ensure reliable automations, releases, and dashboards
  • Provide hands-on detail work - ie. making sure README’s are updated, etc.

What you’ll need:

  • 2+ years of product owner, scrum master and/or technical project management experience, (prefer Telecom, IoT, OS or other complex software system)
  • 8+ years of experience in software business and systems analysis or development
  • Experience in Open Source team coordination
  • Previous experience as a hands-on technical contributor or engineering
  • Proven ability to coordinate with open source community activity
  • Familiarity with distributed system design and understanding of the difficulties and problems of distributed computing strongly preferred
  • Knowledge of statically typed programming language strongly preferred
  • Formal training in agile project management practices preferred
  • Familiarity with waterfall and agile development methodologies and their associated quality assurance methods.
  • Advanced knowledge and experience with the software development lifecycle
  • Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward task completion
  • Demonstrated effective leadership and analytical skills
  • Advanced written and verbal communication skills are a must
  • Broad understanding of computer-science and software development principles and practices suitable for senior level contribution in an exceptionally complex project
  • Knowledge of networking principles and protocols preferred
  • Comfort and knowledge of advanced cryptographic techniques and security protocols would be a bonus
  • Ease and familiarity in coordinating distributed work using git & Github in a Continuous Integration context
  • Able to quickly learn and contribute in a fast-paced remote distributed working environment, sharing knowledge and seeking feedback
  • Comfort and experience with remote team operations is a must

Some details about what we offer:

  • Generous salary (National Currency)
  • Generous crypto pay program (HOT & Holo fuel)
  • Supportive team trial period
  • Regular team meetings (video and in person)
  • Collaborative and inspiring culture
  • Flexible work schedules and vacation
  • Motivated, passionately engaged and evolutionary global teammates
  • Holo is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate our diverse, creative, and collaborative team.

Salary range

8,000 USD

items.title: Digital marketing manager
items.content:
Location: Remote Europe region time zone
Role and job type:   Marketing   Other

Job Description

Hello and Welcome to Noozzle Space :)

We are looking for a talented and motivated crypto oriented digital marketing manager, someone with strong experience in automation systems and crypto community marketing with management and implementation experience across all digital channels ( Facebook/ Twitter/ Telegram/ Medium/ Steemit/ BTCTalk etc )

Marketing Responsibilities:

  • Follow and develop the marketing strategy. Implement and control KPI’s of a marketing team
  • Develop and implement ideas to build strong relationships with the Noozzle community. Connections with trading and european crypto community is a big BONUS
  • Coordination of work of community manager, writers, content managers, designer etc.
  • Maintain all Nozzle community online social media channels, building out our Telegram, Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. Ideally contribute to Reddit, BTCTalk, Steemit and other crypto and financial channels.
  • Create and follow a set of KPIs and dashboards for tracking performance and expansion of the Noozzle community.
  • Create and control the content plan for different social platforms
  • Raising brand awareness by driving community engagement via contests, interactions, Bounty campaigns etc
  • Identifying content marketing campaigns (on-site, social, and guest posting), sharing of press communications and market insight opportunities
  • Identifying and executing creative campaigns to increase the visibility of Noozzle community, and create a top of funnel process for growing the Caspian community
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends (FinTech, Crypto etc.) and tie them to our company and community
  • Work with the Email Marketing team to make sure that the website is optimised for customer use
  • Work with the Product team to present the product news to Noozzle community
  • Provision of analytics and performance metrics such as monthly/ weekly dashboards and campaign tagging. Reporting on a monthly basis to the Noozzle team

We’d like to see at this position the person with:

  • 3-4 years of experience in digital marketing, community management or marketing lead position.
  • Background/or interest in Crypto markets is desirable.
  • Experience using a marketing automation and optimisation systems
  • Must have excellent listening, verbal and written skills and be able to communicate effectively to a diversity of constituents with varying degrees of understanding of Financial Technology, Asset Management and Crypto.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit: strong interpersonal skills and ability to work across teams to make things happen.
  • Takes pride in their work with a good eye for detail.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Confident working in a fast paced and dynamic environment

Salary range

2000 USD

items.content:
Communication Designer // Dalia Research

Company: Dalia Research

Tags:
  • Photoshop
  • Design
  • Graphic Design
  • research
  • communication design
  • data viz

    • Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Berlin, Dalia develops B2B/SaaS solutions to facilitate market and opinion research in >100 countries. We harness the app economy and advanced data science to distribute millions of micro-surveys worldwide to gather and analyze real-time data on consumer attitudes, public opinion, and market trends. Backed by some of Europe’s leading venture capital firms, Dalia is one of Germany’s fastest-growing tech startups with a team from 32 different countries driven by one mission: to generate information that helps us better understand the world around us.

    Dalia is on the search for a Communication Designer to invigorate all our visual marketing and communications material and instill a strong sense of brand identity.

    The journey that awaits you

    • You will design all of our externally-facing materials across print and digital mediums, bringing to life our product propositions and research with data visualisations that ‘pop’.
    • You will contribute to Dalia’s overarching design vision, conceptualize and test new content formats, and discover ways to define and enhance our visual language.

    Your challenge

    • Take ownership of visual and communication design for a range of externally-facing materials: websites, data journalistic publications, banners, client presentations, whitepapers, business cards, infographics, and more.
    • Understand & translate strategic vision into clear and understandable design solutions, negotiating with a variety of internal stakeholders to deliver the best experience that serves both user and business needs.
    • Document design guidelines for Dalia as well as our sub-brands, each of which has unique visual identities (e.g. Latana).

    Your profile includes…

    • Several years of hands-on graphics or communication design across digital and print with a strong portfolio to demonstrate it.
    • You creatively communicate your concepts verbally and visually, through the use of storyboards, mockups and prototypes; you can incorporate input from multiple sources on end-deliverables.
    • Expertise in design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (although we are tool agnostic as designers). Some experience with animation or motion design software (e.g. AfterEffects) is a huge plus.
    • Experience with comprehensive data visualisation techniques is also a major plus.
    • Autodidactic: you are driven to learn new tools and skills everyday and thrive on developing expertise independently.
    • Strong aesthetic sense: you’re able to make tasteful, on-brand aesthetic decisions without much supervision.
    • Storytelling: you bring innovative concepts and ideas into a central theme, with a natural knack for proposing multiple options to achieve end-designs.

    What else makes Dalia awesome?

    • No “ninja” culture – teamwork here is paramount, and that means others will help you when you need it. Mentorship is always available.
    • Occasional remote work is possible.
    • A well-stocked kitchen, where you can request grocery items.
    • A team boat that we built ourselves!
    Apply for this position

Senior Product Manager - Madrid

Company: Taxfix
Location: Madrid, ES
Salary: 40.000 - 60.000 €
Level: Senior
Language: English
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Product Management
  • Testing
