    • Intro



    As one of the most successful FinTech companies in Europe, Taxfix is an exciting place to work. We’re revolutionizing filing taxes – and saving people money, time and stress by putting a personalized digital tax consultant in the palm of their hands.
    In just 2 years, Taxfix has raised €42 million from some of the best investors in the world.  We achieved this by putting our customers at the core of what we do and helping them save millions of euros every week.
      
    Our Mission
    Our mission is to help people get their maximum tax refunds in a convenient, transparent and timely manner, hassle-free. Our user-friendly Taxfix App enables people to file within 25 minutes, without any prior tax knowledge or complicated forms.
    Our talented team creates products that help people improve and simplify their lives. Our diverse group of over 80 people come from over 20 nations, with a shared a passion for product development and creating an outstanding user experience. Join a team of smart, ambitious, driven people who value open communication and processes.

    We are looking for a Product Manager to join our multidisciplinary team of product managers, tax experts, designers, and data analysts to create products that people love to use.

    You will
    • Drive product discovery and development with a cross-functional team to provide the best possible experience for our users and to build a scalable infrastructure.
    • Own the backlog, roadmap and vision of our tax filing experience and its underlying technology, including our backend infrastructure, API to tax authorities, payment integration, risk assessment and internal tools.
    • Make sure we follow an informed decision making process by listing to users and looking into data.
    • Manage and communicate with internal stakeholders and external partners around the tax filing experience and infrastructure.

    Main requirements

    You have
    • User experience thinking and a good understanding of the business needs.
    • 4+ years of experience as a product manager working on a tech product.
    • Experience of leading a cross-functional team using agile processes.The ability to switch between thinking analytically and creatively.

    You are
    • Fluent in English.
    • An empathic person that deeply cares for user's needs and problems and likes to collaborate closely with designers, engineers, business people, and other internal stakeholders.
    • Able to make informed decisions based on qualitative user insights and quantitative user data by conducting user research, A/B tests, and analyzing data.
    • Well organised and know how to separate noise from the important things even in busy times.
    • Not afraid of making decisions, take the consequences.
    • Comfortable saying no.

    Nice to have

    Nice to have
    • Experience having worked on a mobile and/or fintech product.
    • Experience with payment APIs and backend technologies.

    Perks

    What You Gain:
    • Get to make an impact on thousands of people’s lives every day
    • Be paid a competitive salary with stock options
    • Benefit from remote work opportunities and flexible working hours
    • Be supported to grow and take leadership from day one
    • Work with the best and learn from other competent and brilliant people
    • Have the option to bring your best buddy to work. We love dogs!
    • Get relocation and visa support

items.title: Digital Fundraising Strategist
items.content:
Digital Fundraising Strategist at Rainforest Action Network

Remote

ABOUT RAN
For 30 years, Rainforest Action Network (RAN) has campaigned for the forests, their inhabitants and the natural systems that sustain life. In coalition with Indigenous communities and allies from around the world, RAN uses non-violent direct action, grassroots organizing, education, and strategic communications to challenge corporations to stop destructive operations, respect human rights, and adopt comprehensive policies that reduce their contributions to global warming.

The Digital Fundraising Strategist position is responsible for overseeing the management and daily maintenance of RAN’s digital fundraising and marketing channels, including email appeals, digital advertising, peer to peer fundraising, social media platforms, and website donation forms and lightboxes. The role requires a strong understanding of digital communications, marketing, fundraising, project management and usability. The Digital Fundraising Strategist plays a crucial supporting role to the Digital Director and will need to have a balance between strong creative and strategic thinking, technical and data analytical skills, and the ability to communicate professionally and effectively.

Responsibilities:

  • Creates and implements strategies for digital fundraising, member engagement and online advocacy campaigns across digital platforms
  • Leads the project management, writing and execution of fundraising and cultivation email campaigns; manages Peer to Peer giving campaigns
  • Responsible for our digital advertising program including: budget management; drafting, building and testing digital ads; donation landing pages; Google Grants; and growing our email acquisition program
  • Plans, project manages, creates and executes all content for EOY giving and Giving Tuesday — including EOY digital ad copy, donation landing pages, data tracking, emails, Giving Tuesday, and tax reminder campaigns.
  • Analyzes monthly and year over year data reports on the progress of digital fundraising and list growth and makes strategic adaptations accordingly. Ensure that all digital outreach efforts are consistently tracked (tracking digital acquisition ads, digital fundraising ads, membership emails, organic donations, return on investment, etc.)
  • Grows and maintains our Digital monthly and annual sustainers via email, social media and ads
  • Implements and drives supporter cultivation, including Welcome series, Sunset series, cultivation and thank you emails, automated donation responses, and an annual supporter survey
  • Manages remote production contractor and advertising vendor
  • Monitors daily donations to troubleshoot potential tech issues
  • Collaborates with Digital Campaign Manager to ensure engaging and strong community on RAN’s Facebook and Instagram pages by following social media best practices; manages and implements digital fundraising across social media channels
  • Oversees the production of multimedia fundraising assets for the organization
  • Other duties as assigned by supervisor

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3-5 years’ experience with digital fundraising for advocacy or nonprofit sectors
  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience managing online advocacy databases such as Nation Builder, Engaging Networks, Blue State Digital, Action Kit, Salsa, Convio, etc.
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Strong data analysis experience
  • Experience using A/B testing in an advocacy, fundraising and/or marketing capacity
  • Advanced understanding of Facebook ads
  • Strong creative writing skills
  • Excellent cross channel communications
  • Social media strategy experience with an emphasis on Facebook
  • Detail-oriented and able to work both with a team and independently
  • Basic understanding of HTML
  • Basic understanding of Liquid
  • Strong commitment to and belief in the power of using online resources to help empower communities and activists to make change in the world
  • Commitment to Racial Justice
  • Graphic design and video editing a plus
  • Demonstrates an awareness and sensitivity to the needs and concerns of individuals from diverse cultures, backgrounds and orientations.
  • Contributes to the creation of a diverse, equitable and inclusive work culture that encourages and celebrates differences.

RACIAL JUSTICE

RAN strives to integrate values of equity and fairness into our work, which includes bringing an intentional racial justice analysis to our programmatic work and organizational structure. We are seeking candidates who have a commitment to engage in this ongoing process and work with us to create a just and inclusive work environment and world. RAN provides all people with equal employment and volunteer opportunities while also staying committed to providing accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. We encourage applicants of color to apply for this position.

COMPENSATION

The target salary range for this position is based off a competitive San Francisco Bay Area Non-profit location, which is between $66,500 and $70,000**. The final salary will be determined based on the candidate experience & overall qualifications.

**Note: Adjustments to the final salary will also be made depending on the candidate’s geographical location compared to the SF Bay Area. (Example: If hired in a location such as Austin, TX, the salary would be geographically adjusted lower depending on the cost of labor compared to San Francisco, CA)

Benefits include full health coverage for the employee and their partner/family (plus an employer funded HSA), VSP & dental insurance, 4 weeks PTO (increases to 5 weeks after 2 years), and a Simple IRA retirement plan with a 3% fully vesting employer match. Additionally, after 5 years, staff becomes eligible for a 3 month fully paid sabbatical.

Status: Full-time

Location: San Francisco/remote

Apply for job

items.title: Product Manager, Commerce
items.content:
Product Manager, Commerce

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: Vox Media
Full Time

Overview

Vox Media is the leading independent modern media company. Known for building the best media brands and the technology that enables them, we are committed to building a better future for the industry — and getting the future of media right. Vox Media’s editorial networks include Vox, The Verge, SB Nation, Eater, Polygon, Recode, and Curbed. Our diverse storytelling and advertising businesses include the Concert publisher-led marketplace, the Vox Creative brand studio, the Chorus publishing platform, and the company’s entertainment division Vox Media Studios, which includes the Vox Media Podcast Network and Epic.

About the Revenue team:

.  Commerce is a relatively new business line at Vox Media.  You’ll lead the diverse, cross-functional teams in charge of building out the support and innovation for this nascent endeavor.  This will include both operational system support and market-facing product development.

Come join our award-winning revenue team as the Commerce, Product Manager to rethink how people shop online

About the Commerce business:

Commerce is one of the fasting growing businesses at Vox Media. The team is small and nimble, and works with groups across the company to service our audiences and their shopping needs. With a strong foundation of content and shopping behavior data the team is looking for a partner to define product strategy and deliver products that grow our business, provide service to our audience, and keep up to date with the changes, innovations, and opportunities in the commerce space.

What you’ll do:
  • This is a hybrid product and project manager role.  You are accountable for both the product strategy and the day to day project management of the team (2+ engineers).
  • You are responsible for defining and articulating an overall product vision – where do you see the commerce business in 1 – 2 years? – while still effectively managing the near term requirements.
  • The Commerce Product Manager is responsible for prioritizing the needs of stakeholders in accordance with the highest possible revenue opportunity and identifying the most efficient way to achieve that goal, all while balancing a longer term product perspective.
  • This role is accountable for both the creation and maintenance of the commerce roadmap.
  • This role is the contact for all commerce vendor evaluations, and is accountable for maintaining our stack to their specifications while also ensuring we’re working with the best partners.
  • This role is responsible for the triage of commerce related bugs and prioritizing them to be addressed by the team.

    • What you’ll bring:
    • You are passionate about making a difference in the advertising industry and can think creatively about market needs.
    • You are a proactive communicator and someone who can find the right stakeholders at the right time to inform product choices.
    • You have worked in a matrixed product organization, closely-coupled with designers and engineers.
    • You are able to communicate effectively both in presentations and in written documents, and are able to be present and available for one-off questions.

      • For more on the things we’re building and problems we’re solving, and what it’s like to work with the Product, Design & Technology teams, see our. In an effort to provide an inclusive and respectful working environment, all team members adhere to our.

       Product Team blog code of conduct

      About working at Vox Media: This is a permanent, full-time position with excellent benefits—including flexible hours and generous parental leave. Vox Media strives to provide comprehensive healthcare options for our employees and to ensure that our healthcare and other benefits are LGBTQ-inclusive. You’ll be joining a group of focused, hard-working, creative people who are passionate about doing work that’s challenging and fun—and who strive to maintain a healthy work/life balance.

      Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

      Apply for job

items.content:
Email Production Associate

Marketing
Anywhere in US
Company: Change.org
Contract

Overview

Change.org is the world’s largest social change platform, empowering more than 280 million people around the globe to win incredible and inspiring victories on the issues they care about.

Come work with our Email Marketing Team to engage millions of Change.org users on social change campaigns that drive real-life impact!

This is a great opportunity for someone who is new-ish to digital marketing, and looking to jump right in with hands-on work that contributes to team goals. The work you’ll do helps petitions recruit support, influence decision makers and WIN.

Responsibilities:
  • Implement/build emails in our email tool.
  • Assist with audience targeting strategy and build email audience segments.
  • Setup A/B and multivariate tests to learn which messages generate the strongest response rates.
  • Contribute to brainstorming sessions to develop campaign ideas and improve digital efforts.
  • Support internal vetting process for email content.
  • Coordinate with team members around the US to make sure our emails are optimized and on schedule.
  • Email proofreading and Quality Assurance testing.

    • Qualifications:
    • 1 to 2 years of work experience in digital marketing; experience in email marketing preferred.
    • Working knowledge of UX and email industry best practices.
    • Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational skills. You never drop the ball.
    • Strong writing and editing skills.
    • Knowledge of digital marketing platform or CRM, such as EveryAction, Salsa Labs or Blue State Digital Tools, Convio, Blackbaud or Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

      • Preferred Qualifications:
      • Familiarity with Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
      • Bachelor’s degree preferred.
      • HTML knowledge and at least some CSS preferred.

        • More about who you are:
        • Self-sufficient, curious, eager to learn new skills and solve problems creatively.
        • Exceptional communication skills and excellent storytelling ability.
        • Extremely well organized with strong attention to detail.
        • Strong multi-tasking and time management skills.
        • Handles her/himself well under pressure.
        • Sense of humor and knows the right moment for the right GIPHY.

          • We’re a small, results-oriented team. We’re driven by helping our users have impact. It’s a fast-paced, collaborative and supportive environment. Your co-workers are high-impact, low-ego and have a deep respect for our users. We expect you to be the same.

          Change.org is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. Join us to help change the world.

          All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

          Location: Remote (or from our office in NYC or DC)

          Term: 30-40 hours per week, 12 weeks

          Apply for job

items.title: Event & Community Coordinator
items.content:
Initial Short Term Contract to Employment/Long Term Contract
Full Time - 100% Remote Working

Join a rapidly growing, innovative, global tech startup in a role that offers opportunities for learning, growth, and impact as you design and use scalable systems that empower our events team, key evangelists, and global volunteer community.

About us

Holochain is our new open source framework infrastructure technology for distributed peer-to-peer applications. Holochain is fast, massively scalable, cost effective, resource efficient, and energy efficient. As an open source project Holochain has no business model.

Holo, which is built on Holochain, is a distributed cloud platform and marketplace for hosting and serving other Holochain applications to everyday users connected to the Internet.

Holo brings access to distributed applications to the familiar web browser by creating an ecosystem and a currency that enables distributed hosting services provided by peers.

To help fuel the growth of new patterns of technology and social interaction, we are fostering a Holochain application (hApp) ecosystem and training a developer community that will build many more apps.

You’d be working for Holo, and supporting the growth of Holo and Holochain communities.

We’re hiring someone to organize, systematize and implement processes for:

  • Events we’re hosting, such as: hackathons, conferences, meetups, team retreats, online trainings, etc.
  • Events we’re attending as sponsors, speakers, facilitators, and/or participants
  • Our grassroots global network of volunteer community organizers who hold culturally and educationally significant local events such as dev dinners, meetups, hackathons, and presentations

What you will do:

  • Strategically design and then implement processes for events we host, events we attend, and our grassroots community
  • Recruit, vet, and onboard volunteers who organize local Holochain communities
  • Support a global community of volunteer organizers to establish scalable patterns and structures
  • Organize and project manage meetup, hackathon and other event planning tools and resources – on your own and sometimes with teammates and/or volunteers
  • Roll out new project and marketing initiatives that bridge between Holo and the volunteer community
  • Assess for gaps, create systems, and track progress in our communities
  • Manage and coordinate day-to-day event logistics and prepare speaker presentations
  • Cultivate relationships to increase invitations, then organize and manage high-impact speaking events
  • Diplomatically bargain around our community growth strategy, politely declining salesy offers and where possible shifting transactional relationships into voluntary partnerships.
  • Coordinate post-event follow-up, including feedback and testimonials

What we’re looking for:

  • Skillfulness in fulfilling initiatives through organizing, tracking, and executing
  • Experience with project management and organizing tools
  • Grassroots community organizing and management skills
  • Capacity to track the big picture and be strategic
  • Strong natural attention to details
  • Natural enjoyment in creating and maintaining organization of everything - files, data, etc. (you were the kid that put and kept complex things in accessible and logical order)
  • Skillfulness with people, able to cultivate relationships, and engage volunteers
  • Discernment for priorities based on constantly evolving criteria
  • Enthusiasm for enabling and empowering others
  • Ability to operate in ambiguity and create and uphold adaptable structures
  • Strong and clear written and oral communication skills
  • Flexibility across multiple time zones and wide variety of hours
  • Motivated and attentive to creating positive, meaningful cultural and educational experiences for others
  • Motivation to grow and develop inner and outer leadership skills
  • Ability to include the word shuffleberry in your answer to the third long response question in the application, ideally included in a sentence
  • Proactivity to find alignment with others and get things done

Some details about what we offer:

  • Generous salary (National Currency)
  • Generous crypto payment program (HOT & HoloFuel)
  • Equipment reimbursement
  • Supportive trial period
  • Regular team meetings (video)
  • Collaborative and inspiring culture
  • Flexible work schedule and vacation time
  • Motivated, passionately engaged, and evolutionary global teammates

Holo is an equal opportunity employer and we celebrate our diverse, creative, and collaborative team.

items.title: Business Operations Management Expert Q&A (Contract)
items.content:
Business Operations Management Expert (Contract)

As a Business Operations Management Expert, you'll be:

  • writing thorough, step-by-step explanations
  • making revisions with our collaborative team of reviewers

As a contract Business Operations Management Expert, you'll receive the following:

  • Reliable Payments: Timely, reliable payments twice a month
  • Independence: No waiting, no assignments, and a massive library of questions for you to choose from

  • Ability to provide clear answers and thorough explanations on advanced business management topics

Do you think you can be a Business Operations Management Expert for Study.com? Click “Apply Now” at the bottom to fill out an application and submit your resume!

At Study.com, our quest is to make education fun and accessible. We’re working to help students with high quality answers to questions that they may have along the way.

items.title: Senior Content and SEO Marketer 📊
items.content:
At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 10-person team spread across Europe , Asia and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We are looking for a passionate and results-driven content & SEO marketer to grow our organic search traffic. The market is huge and the question is -- are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

Well, here’s what you’ll be doing

You’ll drive organic traffic to millions of searches per month. Literally. And will be the team expert.

You’ll do it all -- 1️⃣ produce content yourself & manage 10+ content writers to drive organic acquisition, 2️⃣ constantly do website optimization, 3️⃣ ensure team members follow best practises and 4️⃣ monitor and improve content quality & page metrics to lift conversions.

✈️ You’ll be equally responsible for strategy and research.

♂️ You’ll work in a competitive industry at a fast pace. Just check our competitors and what they are doing.

Ideally, you’re no stranger to these

You’ve scaled content marketing to 1M+ views per month.

You don’t consider organic traffic as free and can translate strategy into time and cost.

Ahrefs, Moz, Semrush and such are not just in your bookmarks. You use them daily to navigate your efforts. And you read between the lines (mention your favorite ice-cream flavor in the typical day question of the application).

♂️ You love content and know the difference between a good and a bad one. You bring evidence and make sure content marketing is done right.

Where you'll work

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it's a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly ✈️ and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that's why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia , or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way -- we believe that's how we'll win. And while the sky's the limit, remember you'll also positively change people's lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

Work remotely.

Market salary based on location and results you produce.

♂️ 22 days of paid leave.

⚕️ Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.

️♂️ Sports allowance.

Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.

Transport allowance.

✈️ Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.

Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.

How to join us

1️⃣ Apply and fill out the short form. 2️⃣ We'll review your application and invite you for an online interview to get to know you better. 3️⃣ If we like each other an assignment follows. 4️⃣ Finally, we'll make an offer if we feel you are the best fit for the position.

(view full job posting and apply here https://enhancv.com/content-marketer/)

--------

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Content & Community Lead
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Would you like to work for a fast-growing startup with a great client portfolio and do it semi-remotely?

If so we need you to help us grow our content and social media strategy! We also have great opportunities for your growth. Join our international team of passionate people and do what you do best - create great content and grow our social media. An awesome opportunity awaits!

About us

At Kandidate we help outstanding candidates and top startups find a perfect match. As a result, speeding up the recruitment process and making it enjoyable. So far we helped 100+ European tech companies hire. Some of the big names are Zego, Decoded, Trussle, Algolia and more. On the other end, we have over 13,000+ candidates to match them with through our great product.

We are working together on a mission to make recruiting more fun and efficient since 2015. Currently, as a team of more than 20 people, based mainly in London and Poland, we are looking to expand our super fun and ambitious team.

Another great thing is that we are a two-sided marketplace, which means that you will be working not only on B2C but also B2B marketing, twice the fun!

Did we mention that we are currently the leading website in the UK for commercial hiring in the tech industry? So what makes us stand out? Top tech companies choose us over traditional recruitment agencies as we help them hire top candidates faster, at a more competitive price point and offer a better user experience. Tech professionals value the job matching accuracy, better user experience and transparency we offer.

And yes, we do go out for drinks and have off-site meetups, bring dogs to work and have a young and fun team!

Who are we looking for?

Now enough about us, let’s move onto you.

Currently, we are in need of passionate and driven Content and Community Lead to join our fun and fast growing team.

This is a London based opportunity, with semi-remote conditions, so yes, you can also work from home with your pet.

In this role, we are looking for someone who is comfortable working both, as a part of the team and independently. Being self-motivated and organised is crucial.

You will play a key role in the success of our marketing campaigns and will be responsible for creating our content and community strategies. You will be reporting to the Head of Marketing.

Key responsibilities

  • Plan and execute content and social media strategy and set goals to increase brand awareness and engagement
  • Create engaging text, image and video content
  • Develop, expand and participate in communities
  • Manage the work of content writers and agencies to make sure the projects are delivered in line with our standards.
  • Ensure the accuracy, quality and consistency of all content
  • Collect, monitor and analyze social and website metrics, and make improvements accordingly
  • Oversee all written content and ensure it is optimized for SEO, brand voice and the unique needs of different channels
  • Develop effective messaging for each of our audiences
  • Continually research and assess the competitive landscape, trends and customer needs to improve the effectiveness of content
  • Conduct customer interviews for content creation
  • Organise industry events (once per quarter)

Skills and qualifications

Required

  • 3+ years of content marketing experience
  • 1+ of managing social media channels
  • Proven work experience as a community manager
  • Bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications or a related field
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent organisational and planning skills
  • Good analytical skills
  • Knowledge and understanding of algorithms and search engine optimisation
  • Comfortable with a dynamic and growing environment
  • Self-motivated, independent, organised and positive
  • A strong team player, comfortable working collaboratively and independently

Nice to have:

  • Preferred experience of organising events
  • Preferably experience of working in a SaaS/startup company and/or staffing & recruitment industry
  • An eye for design

Salary: ￡30,000 - 40,000 (depending on experience)

Target start date: 1.06.2019

Application process

Stage 1: After the CV review, we will invite you for an interview with our HoM and CPO

Stage 2: We will then invite you to work on a paid pilot project (10-20hr long). You will then present this project to our HoM, CPO and CEO.

Stage 3: Project presentation

items.title: Sales Co-ordinator
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
TRX is recruiting a Sales Co-ordinator to join the sales team rolling out the TRX system across the globe. You will be based in London in the glorious surroundings of Somerset House.

TRX is a pioneering startup revolutionising the TV distribution industry. Bringing together experts from TV Content Production, Rights Management and Technology, TRX makes thousands of hours of television content available from over 100 leading content providers such as All3 Media, BBC Studios, Lionsgate, GMA, Mediacorp, Sky Vision, Studio Canal and Zee Entertainment for TV buyers globally to acquire content in a streamlined and effective way.

TRX has an advisory board of key industry figures including Andrea Wong, former President Sony International and John Ford, former President at Discovery Communications US.

The Role:

Reporting to the Senior Sales Manager you will be responsible for:

- Working as part of the Sales team and Client Services team to support all aspects of buyer engagement
- Assisting the Sales team in all logistical aspects of buyer relationship management
- Responsible for the input and updating of all sales team admin
- Responsible for helping organise sales team trips and market diary admin
- Provide administrative support to the UK based Sales Team in general- Executing and reporting on this strategy
- Responsible for day to day buyer registrations and the process surrounding this
- Regular reporting and updating to the Sales team
- Regular monitoring of buyer activity across the TRX system
- Some client facing reporting

Desired Skills:

- Ideally, experience in a co-ordinator role at a distribution company or within an acquisitions team.
- Proven ability to take initiative and go the "extra mile" to exceed expectations
- Natural communicator, confident and well presented
- Flexible ‘can-do’ attitude with enthusiasm and initiative in abundance
- Willingness to work flexible hours to accommodate for time difference with London Head Office
- Pro-active, creative thinker and passionate, with a desire to learn and develop within the team
- Proven written and spoken communication skills
- Passion for the TV rights and distribution industry
- Efficiency, attention to detail and excellent organisation skills imperative
- Interest in tech

The Package:

- Package dependent upon experience
- Generous holiday allowance and other company benefits

Please forward your CV together with a short covering email outlining your suitability for the role. TRX.tv are keen to fill this role as soon as possible so please do not wait before applying.

items.content:
We’re looking for a dynamic, ambitious and results-driven business development manager to own Wriggle’s performance in Birmingham, and ensure it flourishes and grows over the next few years (starting with a bang in 2019!).

The role will be hands-on and entrepreneurial. You will need to roll up your sleeves to develop new business (local Birmingham restaurants, cafes and bars), and help existing partners to improve their performance, as well as owning the performance of the business unit.

Our preference is for the right candidate to know Birmingham and its food scene, and be based in our Bristol office (with the rest of the team) - travelling to Birmingham once or twice a week. However, we will also welcome applications from Birmingham-based candidates who have experience of working remotely.

Key functions include:

- Developing new business (the best local food & drink establishments)
- Managing existing accounts, and helping them to grow
- Owning the performance of the Birmingham city unit
- Delivering key projects

The right candidate will have buckets of energy, excellent organisation skills, alongside a love of Birmingham and its food scene (or – if you don’t know the Birmingham food scene yet – a passion to get to know it!). We want someone ambitious, who wants to grow with Wriggle.

Skills required:

- Proven track record in Business Development
- Excellent organisational skills
- Target-driven
- Analytical and numerate
- Excellent communication skills; personable and looking to build long-term relationships

Nice to Haves

- Experience working with restaurants/food & drink
- Photography skills
- A love of local food & drink and Birmingham

Location:

Either:

- Based in Bristol, and visiting Birmingham 1 or 2 days per week (Wriggle’s preference); or
- Based in Birmingham and visiting Bristol once a week

To apply, please send a copy of your CV and covering letter to the application email.

items.title: Commercial Partnerships Manager
items.content:
Use your deal-making skills to build a powerful network of London’s fastest-growing technology companies.

Are you excited by meeting with London’s brightest entrepreneurs and learning about ground-breaking technology? Are you ambitious, driven and hungry to establish yourself as a part of London’s thriving startup ecosystem? Do you dream of having autonomy over your own fast-paced business development career?

If so, read on!

GrantTree works with many of the UK’s most innovative companies, helping them to maximise their government funding opportunities. Our partner network consists of fast moving technology companies and affiliates including Microsoft Accelerator, Monzo and Crowdcube, to name just a few. We’re looking for an enthusiastic deal-maker to make this network even better.

As part of GrantTree’s partnerships team, you will be identifying, building and managing strategic partnerships with scaleups. You’ll be dealing directly with senior executives and founders, negotiating commercial deals and building high value client relationships. You’ll also be working with and meeting clients all over the capital, with freedom to design how and where you work (swanky cafe meetings are a staple!).

But you won’t be going it alone. You’ll be learning from an experienced and highly successful partnerships and sales team, who will prepare you to assemble and manage your own network and sales pipeline.

On a typical day, you might:

Pitch GrantTree’s services to potential clients
Broker partnerships and negotiate commercial deals with founders, FDs and CTOs
Identify, develop and manage strategic partnerships with scaleup affiliates
Attend a network event or run a workshop explaining GrantTree’s offering
Report results to GrantTree’s sales team

About Us

GrantTree has a unique way of working. In our culture, everyone has the freedom, power and trust to do their best work. We’re a self-managing company, meaning our team can choose where to work, what meetings to attend, and what to work on. We allow you to explore your potential, and do what you love doing, without the shackles of people managers. Ultimately, we aim to uphold human aliveness and commercial success simultaneously. It has been successful for us so far, although it's not for everyone (check out our GlassDoor reviews to learn more).

REQUIREMENTS
Strong networking and communications skills
At least 2 years experience in a commercial role
Success in closing sales leads
Experience with the startup and scaleup ecosystem
Curiosity and enthusiasm for cutting-edge technology
London based and able to attend evening events

BENEFITS
We believe that people should be rewarded fairly for the work they do. At GrantTree there is no secrecy over salaries and the way we work them out. For this role, your salary is likely to lie between £30-40k depending on experience.

Aside from money, we offer a place where you can be yourself and engage in empowered, purposeful work. We want you to develop your skills and fulfil your potential. We have a flexible approach to working, and while we encourage you to spend some time in the office initially and from time to time, in general you can work remotely as often as you like. Our office is in the heart of the tech community, near Old Street, and has a fab roof terrace.

Other benefits include:

£2,000 yearly training budget for courses and tools to help you on your individual developmental journey
Weekly “lunch force” allowance - sit down for a meal with different GrantTree partners each week to help build natural collaborative and friendly networks
Monthly company-wide picnics
Flexible working - you have the ability to choose where and when you work best
No dress code - bring your authentic self into work, complete with wearing what you’re most comfortable in
Up to six weeks of holiday per year
Three additional paid days off for volunteer work
Pension scheme via The People’s Pension
50% of your personal mobile phone tariff paid for
Cycle to work scheme
Quarterly wellness days and quarterly fun days
Subsidised private health insurance via Vitality
Free food, snacks, fruit, and booze
Equal Opportunities

Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. We welcome applications from everyone, regardless of the categories they put themselves in. If you think you’re the right person for the job even though you don’t quite fit the role spec, be daring and apply!

items.title: Digital Exec / PPC Analyst
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Fancy working for an extremely fast growing startup, with 12 members of staff but the revenue of a 100 person company? We are looking for a bright, smart individual at the beginning of their career to work on a collection of ecommerce, comparison and media related websites. Your day to day work will be varied and offer the opportunity to learn every aspect of digital optimisation to a cutting edge standard, a lot of the work we do is very unique so you will be required to think and learn at a rapid pace. Your primary focus will be on Google Adwords, BingAds, and Google Analytics, working on some of the most popular websites worldwide we have built and grown ourselves. Typically these sites spend up to £4 million a year on PPC and you'll be helping manage this.

You will be working in a small team of Analysts in close proximity to the founder of the company. The goal is to find someone who will be fast tracked to run many aspects of the business and likely to be managing people within the first year. We believe that anyone can be taught digital but are looking for someone with the application, aptitude and ability that is worth our investment of knowledge and time. The role offers flexibility and the option to work from home whenever you need, there will also be the chance to travel abroad from time to time. Offices are in Old Street, London.

Candidate requirements
You are creative
You have an analytical approach
You have at least 6 months experience in digital
You are an extremely fast learner
You are a self starter and can work without supervision.
At least a 2.1 degree from a top university

items.title: PR Officer
items.content:
Job Description

Job Title: PR Officer
Team: PR
Location: Remote
Reporting to: CEO
Staff Management: None
Job Type: Volunteer
Time Commitment: 3 hours minimum per week (plus any more that you are able to provide)

Main Purpose of Job
To lead the development and implementation of a PR strategy that will inspire people to make the world a better place.

Overview of the Role & Team
Reporting to the CEO and working in collaboration with members of the PR Team and the wider organisation, this position is key to increasing awareness of the organisation and its activities.

Responsibilities
Planning, developing and implementing PR strategies and campaigns.
Liaising with, and answering enquiries from media, individuals and other organisations, regarding press activity.
Researching, writing and distributing press releases to targeted media.
Collating and analysing media coverage.
Devising and coordinating photo opportunities.
Maintaining and updating information on the organisation's website.
Managing and updating information and engaging with users on social media sites such as Twitter and Facebook.
Sourcing and managing speaking opportunities.
Developing good working relationships with the media.

Requirements
Excellent communication, interpersonal and writing skills.
Drive, competence, flexibility and a willingness to learn.
Excellent organisational and time management skills with the ability to multitask.
The ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
Creativity, imagination and initiative.
Good knowledge of current affairs.
Experience in PR, communications, marketing and media is desirable.

items.title: Psychology & Marketing Guru
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are looking for a psychology whiz with a passion for marketing to delve into the growing Duel team. You will play a key role in the creation of an entirely new marketing category - Customer Advocacy Marketing. Specifically, you will join Duel.Intelligence, our research and consultancy arm, where you will contribute to the development of our approach and research. You will then help capture the value created by this insight, using cutting edge digital marketing techniques to drive leads and ultimately sales.

You will work closely with the founders and will directly affect the success of the business. We will build a team around you as we grow. You will also contribute ideas and additions to the product.

*THE BUSINESS*

Duel.Tech, an enterprise-grade Brand Ambassador Management Platform, allows brands to collaborate with brand ambassadors to create amazing content, drive social posts, referral & affiliate purchases, and leave feedback, reviews & testimonials.

Based in London and Bristol, the business is backed by Venture Capital and set for substantial growth in 2019.

*THE ROLE*

*Create and optimise Duel’s inbound marketing strategy; exploring all avenues to generate qualified leads for the *Sales Team to enact upon
*Develop our content strategy; defining what content means for Duel
*Assist in the running of our Adwords and SEO initiatives
*Research into our brand partners’ pain points and possible solutions
*Use your psychology knowledge to contribute to Duel Intelligence - a team dedicated to consulting brands based on the theories behind why customers shop the way they do
*Develop captivating content and our online presence
*Run longer term, more strategic projects that will bring a step-change in organic reach for Duel
*Analyze the metrics and ensure resources are used effectively and efficiently
*Drive traffic to our site and further convert to demos
*Maximise limited budgets to create unlimited buzz
*Help to build and manage an inbound marketing team over time


*THE PERSON*

*Be an excellent writer, able to spot a compelling story and know exactly how to turn it into something our customers and the press want to talk about
*Completely process driven. You will A/B test your life and optimise ruthlessly
*Have a fine eye for what people care about and what genuinely useful content looks like
*Be hands-on, proactive and want to get things done quickly, but to a high standard
*Have ambitious ideas of what more we should be doing and you’re ready to take full ownership of content across owned and earned channels
*Have an interest in people and how they think / behave
*Be a creative thinker who brings contrarian, provocative and remarkable ideas to the table
*A background in psychology or a related field.
*You probably read a lot


*SKILL SET*

*Understanding of psychological theory and practice
*Experience in Marketing preferred but not essential
*Passion for learning
*Experience in ecommerce and/or retail preferred but not required
*Passion for the start-ups and the tech sector
*Great at absorbing, processing and organising information


*CULTURE*

*Flexible, relaxed and fun, but absolutely driven to making the business a success
*Tech and process driven – we make tech, we love tech and we use tech to make our lives easier where possible
*We work with people we like, and we like the people we work with. This means after work drinks, happy hours, boozy lunches and good-natured wind-ups
*We’re trying to build a remarkable company, with remarkable people and a remarkable culture that you will want to shout from the rooftops about

*WHAT WE OFFER*

*Open plan, cool loft office in between Borough and Southwark (dogs welcome) with a well stocked beer and gin fridge
*Flexible working hours and home working options (in fact, actively encouraged!)
*Unlimited / Zero holiday policy. If you don’t need to be in the office, do the work required from anywhere in the world - Skype is a wonderful thing.
*On-going training where required
*Perks: gym membership, Headspace subscription and work related or personal growth reading/Audible budget
*Options scheme for all full time employees – if you help us build the company, you should own some of it!
*Competitive salary
*Bonus package


To apply - please send us your CV and links of your work (blogs, press releases, campaign copy or any other written samples of your work) to the email specified.

(No recruiters, please! We would rather save the money and put it towards an awesome team day out. Also no phone calls. Everything must be done by email. Cheers!)

items.title: Content and SEO Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
This position is a great opportunity for an exceptional digital marketer with a passion for technology to become a key part of a dynamic and cutting-edge startup.

*Company*
As a fast growing and innovative software company located in London (Southbank), MyQuickCloud is a recognised specialist of Cloud remote access technologies looking for talents to shape the next coming generation of Cloud technologies.

In February 2014, we launched our brand new generation of services, aiming to instantly turn any application into a Cloud service, from anywhere and on any device.

In 2017 MyQuickCloud was named amongst the 20 most promising enterprise mobility solution providers by CIO Review.

*Ideal Profile*
The ideal candidate would be passionate, enthusiastic and versatile.

Innovation and creativity are at the heart of what we do and our fast paced business would be best suited for someone who:
* is ready for new challenges
* is able to plan and manage projects
* is comfortable laying out and execute strategies for increasing incoming traffic and conversions

*Core mission*
Shape the company digital marketing strategy for the US and Canada going forward, with a main focus on:
* Content build-up and revamping
* Demand Generation
* Goals and KPIs
* Budgeting and execution

As our Digital Marketing Manager, you will:
* Define the overall SEO strategy
* Implement the SEO strategy
* Build an editorial calendar designed to grow organic traffic
* Write content yourself and with freelancers
* Conduct in-house link building campaigns
* Develop syndication partnerships with influencers and the press
* Create and maintain sales collateral, case studies, one pagers...
* Push studies/articles/stories to PR networks and the press
* Collaborate on web and email copy
* Operate with significant autonomy

*Skills and Experience*
You’ll also have the chance of building a team as you're hitting your KPIs and achieving your goals.

*What You Have*
* 2+ years of content marketing and SEO experience
* Experience in paid and organic acquisition marketing
* The ability to make complex subjects easy to understand
* A deep understanding of how to use data to build a content strategy
* Comfortable rolling up your sleeves to execute
* Familiarity with WordPress or other content management systems
* A portfolio of marketing content (guides, blog posts, etc.)
* Sharp attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written English
* Very good experience in project management

*Nice to Have*
* Experience with Ahrefs or a similar SEO tool
* Having and maintaining a technology blog

*Location/Hours*
* Flexible work - project based and remote working
* Target market is North America

*Compensation*
* Competitive salary
* Performance bonus

items.title: Global Campaign Manager - Small Business
items.content:
*About us*
Drive our growth and shape our future.

At GoCardless we’re looking to scale from processing £5 billion a year to over £20 billion. Our vision is to create a global connected payments network, making payments simpler on the internet no matter what country you're in or what software you are using.

We’ve built a friendly, collaborative culture where we hire and develop ambitious people that share our desire to produce work we can be proud of. We value learning and feedback, and there will be significant scope for you to develop and expand your role as our team continues its rapid growth.



*The role*
We are seeking an ambitious and high-performing Global Campaign Manager to join our rapidly expanding team at a very exciting time. We are looking for a candidate that has successful experience in planning and executing global/local marketing campaigns that drive new customer acquisition from the small business segment.

This role requires a highly organised, hard-working individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment where collaboration across teams is crucial to success. Someone who is metrics driven and motivated by seeing their work contribute to the achievement of business goals. This role reports to the Head of Global Campaigns.



*Responsibilities include:*
* Own end-to-end global campaign planning, development and execution for the small business segment

* Create innovative, successful and measurable global demand generation campaigns to drive pipeline and self-serve (web) sign-ups

* Work with creative and content teams to define content goals and approach, identify and ideate on compelling storylines, and align these elements to the campaign brief, messaging documents and activation strategy to create a comprehensive and measurable content plan

* Develop/project manage integrated media plans for campaigns – including web marketing, nurture, paid search, social media and events – in partnership with the rest of the marketing team

* Partner closely with product marketing and sales to confirm/strategise on campaign themes, messaging, personas, industries and assets etc.

* Apply KPIs, analytics, and insights to better profile, target and re-target prospects, driving continual campaign optimisation

* Work with marketing operations to ensure all tracking requirements are in place for necessary performance reporting

* Work cross-functionally to ensure the timely execution of small business segment campaigns across all geos


*Desired skills:*

* 3-4 years of B2B marketing experience with proven success in driving demand from a small business segment.

* Experience marketing for software and/or SaaS services is preferred

* Experience of marketing within a global remit - working closely with regional teams to design and build out effective global campaigns

* Ability to effectively analyse performance data and leverage insights to continually improve results

* Experience working with CRM and marketing automation platforms such as Salesforce and Pardot

* Self-starter who has built campaigns from the ground up

* Able to prioritise competing projects

* Strong stakeholder management skills


We welcome a wide diversity of candidates from varying backgrounds – if you’re unsure, please apply.

items.title: Product Executive Internship
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are looking for a talented, smart and brilliant go getter, looking to gain experience in the start-up and fin-tech world. RoosterMoney is offering a paid 3 month summer internship; a great opportunity to be part of a scaling start-up, delivering awesome customer and product experiences, with the product and customer operations teams.


About RoosterMoney

RoosterMoney is a pocket money & allowance tracking app that helps parents teach their kids the value of money in a digital age. Simple, progressive and gameful, we bring to life all the sound traditional financial principles we were brought up with (or wish we were!) and make managing money smart, fun & relevant for the modern world.

We believe the world would be a better place if we all talked about money a little earlier on in life. Research shows that our money habits are formed by the age of seven. That’s a pretty amazing opportunity to help give kids a head-start in building habits that will stick with them for life.

We are a team of 20, with half the team based in the London HQ, and the other half scattered across the UK and beyond. We operate a remote first culture, but make time to all get together every couple of months.


Why RoosterMoney?

Hundreds of thousands of families have downloaded the RoosterMoney app since our launch in January 2016 and we have over 51 currencies being used by children around the world.

RoosterMoney has been featured in The Times, Telegraph, Guardian, Wall Street Journal, New Zealand Herald to name a few. We’ve been on CNBC and are considered experts in our field.

Alongside our app, we’re launching the Rooster Card, a prepaid Visa card for kids with parental controls. This product has been designed with our users in mind, and presents lots of exciting new challenges for both the product and customer operations teams. We are scaling rapidly which offers lots of opportunity for anyone joining the company.


THE ROLE:

The successful candidate will operate with a high level of autonomy within the Product and Customer Operations teams. You are passionate about helping families teach children the value of money and excited about working on a global platform with a big social mission.

You will be a strong problem solver, organised, analytical and great at communicating with others. We look for T-shaped people who have a core set of skills they can bring to the team and the ability to build on new ones. Whatever the problem or opportunity, you find the best solution in the quickest amount of time.

You will be the bridge between the customer needs and future product developments. Always asking the question why, you enjoy digging deep into customer problems and finding optimal solutions and outcomes. You’ll get to delve deep into customer feedback, analyse and propose development opportunities. Working alongside our product owners, you’ll help bring the product requirements to life and work with the development team to implement these new features and optimisations.

We are a small team so it’s important that the successful candidate isn’t just highly competent but is a good cultural fit and understands the remote working culture.


Apply if you want to:

Work closely with a small group of determined, like-minded people to reshape the way families talk and engage with money around the world.
Contribute to the business strategy and vision.
Create positive customer experiences and champion the voice of the customer in driving product change.
Share your passion and enthusiasm with the rest of the team.


Your responsibilities:

Research future product developments and improvements
Building prototypes and supporting user testing
Working with the development teams to manage the release roadmap
Quality assurance and testing against our set criteria
Providing customer support across our channels, collecting and analysing feedback
Produce and develop customer support content
Constantly look for ways to improve the customer experience


Must haves:

Passionate about financial education and helping families have positive conversations about money.
Strong interest in technology and easily able to build more technical understanding where required.
Strong analytical approach.
Natural problem solver.
Demonstrable ability to deliver brilliant things, fast.
You are creative, think outside the box and know how to turn a brilliant idea into reality.
Faultless written and verbal communication.
Organisation is one of your middle names. Speed is your other.
Understand the opportunities and challenges of working with a remote team.


Bonus points:

You can code
You have strong design skills (ideally Sketch)
You have research experience
You have experience in customer facing roles


Benefits

Work with a fun, passionate team building something awesome:

Get paid the equivalent of the Living Wage (https://www.livingwage.org.uk/calculation)
Work from our London co-working space in Borough
Option to Work from home on fridays
Opportunity to apply for available roles internally


How to apply

To apply for this role send us your CV, cover letter and answers to the following questions:
1. What excites you about RoosterMoney?
2. What is your favourite app and why?
3. What skills do you think set you apart from others?
4. What does great service mean to you?
5. What do you like to do in your spare time?

items.title: Social Media - Marketing Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About Us

We are the world´s largest language learning community with over 90m users from 190 countries, growing at up to 30,000 new users per day. We make learning a language easy by combining AI-powered courses with instant feedback from our global community of native speakers. Our mission is to break down language barriers across the globe.

Job Description

We’re looking for an ambitious Social Media Executive to join one of the fastest growing edtech companies in the world. This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing and dynamic team, with plenty of room to develop.

At busuu things move fast. If you want to work with smart, creative, energetic people and possess the initiative, confidence and good judgement to make independent decisions every day - then you are probably the perfect addition for our growing team.

What you will be doing

You will bring your creativity and passion for social media to help develop engaging content that helps promote our brand and engage our audience.

Generating new concepts and content ideas to constantly grow and engage our audiences.
Creating and scheduling engaging content across our key social media channels.
Working closely with our customer satisfaction team to manage our online communities of more than 2.2 million followers worldwide.
Managing and updating the company’s social media calendars.
Monitoring social media channels for brand mentions and issues.
Working alongside in-house and external localisation teams, designers and videographers to manage the delivery of assets.
Maintaining brand identity through consistent tone of voice, quality of posts across the channels.
Regularly measuring channel and post performance and deep-diving into analytics to make on-going improvements.
Providing general assistance to the wider marketing team & CMO as required for ad hoc projects and tasks.
What you will bring to the table

Graduate in Journalism, English, Marketing, Communications or other relevant field
Proven track record of results delivery and excellent project management skills
Experience with social media platforms and social media management tools
Attention to detail and accuracy
Strong analytical mindset and a good business sense
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Passion for language education and digital learning, with fluent English and at least one additional languages
Not ticking every box or think you’ve got that unique set of skills we haven’t realised we need? Get in touch anyway; we’re always looking to add great people at every level.

Why you should join busuu:

Manage your own stretch projects
Competitive salary and attractive bonus scheme
Private healthcare
Yearly training budget to use as you want
Free breakfast and snacks
Free dinner if you need to stay late
Regular company trips and evenings out in London
Smart, fun and international team to work with


A bit more about us:

busuu has received several awards such as ‘Europe’s Best Education Start-up’ by TechCrunch, ‘Best of iOS Apps’ by Apple and ‘Best of Google Play’ by Google to name a few and we are part of the prestigious Future Fifty Program consisting of UK’s best Scale-Ups. We collaborate with world-leading universities (CUNY, UCL etc.) in the field of language learning research, and partner with companies such as Google, Amazon and Facebook to bring language learning to AI-powered devices (Google Home, Amazon Alexa) and into virtual reality (Oculus).

busuu has raised over 15m EUR and is backed by renowned business angels and serial entrepreneurs (Johann Hansmann, Martin Varsavsky, Brent Hoberman), PROFounders Capital and McGraw-Hill Education.

We are an ambitious, high-energy, international and friendly team of 100+, based in central London. We come from diverse backgrounds and share a passion for tech start-ups and education.

At busuu, things move fast. If you’re enthusiastic, motivated and want to help us to enable hundreds of millions of people around the world to learn a language, get in touch. It’s your chance to change the world.
