items.title: Marketing Co-founder required for Mental Health Startup
items.content:
We are looking for a Marketing Co-founder to join MyndUP and help disrupt the Mental Health industry.

ABOUT US

MyndUP is a platform that offers short bursts of mental health coaching to individuals at affordable prices through live video sessions.

Coaching includes: Life Coaching, Mindfulness, Meditation, Visualisation, Goal Setting and Neuro-Linguistic Programming.

We are looking to make mental health more acceptable and encourage people to invest in their mental health by becoming the biggest movement in this sector. We will donate a portion of our profits to a charity that specialises in mental health in under 30’s.

THE ROLE

-The key focus will be on powering growth marketing efforts
-As a Co-founder, you will have responsibilities ranging every aspect of the business and its future development
-Develop and implement a sales & marketing strategy and support with the future vision of the business
-You would join the current full-time founder and a small team of part-time/freelancers working out of co-working spaces/remotely.

BENEFITS and REMUNERATION

-A generous equity stake as well as performance-related bonuses
-Competitive salary offered at the next stage of investment.

items.title: Product manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
About MyTutor
One-to-one tuition is proven to significantly improve pupils’ grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. MyTutor’s mission is to bring life-changing tuition to all. Our handpicked network of tutors work online with pupils from all walks of life, and we’ve given over a quarter of a million lessons so far – raising results on average by one whole grade. We’re proud of the fact that over 300 schools have also chosen to work with us. And that we’ve earned a Trustpilot rating of 9.4/10.
We understand the hectic lives of families with teenagers, and our flexible lesson times mean parents can juggle schedules more easily. On our website, it’s simple to find a tutor your child gets on with – and every lesson is tailored to their needs. Also, by having lessons via live video, pupils can access the best tutors no matter where they live or when they need help. No travelling for Mum and Dad, no waiting around, no strangers in your home. Pupils can have their lessons anywhere – at Grandma’s, at a friend’s house or on holiday, so there’s no disruption in the run-up to exams.
Tuition is now more affordable and accessible, making life less stressful for busy parents doing their best.

About The Role
You’ll be joining at an exciting time as our consumer business rapidly scales. We’re looking for a consumer product manager focussed on making it easy for parents and students to find great tutors that deliver results. You’ll be leading our consumer product strategy, working closely with design, technology and the wider consumer team and reporting into our Head of Product.

What will I be doing?
- Manage, understand and prioritise the consumer product roadmap, so the team is always working on the most impactful features
Regularly interact with our target audience, customers and our parent panel to clearly define and frame problems for the team to solve
- Evaluate and learn from your solutions using data analysis and user feedback in order to understand business impact
- Work closely with the wider MyTutor team ensuring stakeholders are involved and up to speed on proposed changes, through workshops, requirement gathering sessions and product demos
- Love all things product and always be working to deliver the best product innovations for our customers
- Be a great team player as you’ll be working with smart, driven people passionate about delivering great features for our customers.

What skills should you have?
- Previous experience in a Product Manager role
- Clear communicator of product decisions and the rationale behind them. Be comfortable in making decisions - - without consensus
- Experience working with qualitative customer insights, and quantitative customer data to help inform your decisions. Bonus if you’ve conducted user research.
- Good technical understanding in order to work with the development team to scope and prioritise work
Provide input into design decisions, helping create intuitive simple user experiences


Benefits
- Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
- A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support
- Training and investment in your learning
- Your own laptop and hardware to use as you please
- Competitive salary and option package
- Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
- Tuesday Breakfasts, Friday drinks and regular team events & outings
- 24 days holiday (plus public holidays)

MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with an EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

items.title: User Advocate
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=12, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Role: *User Advocate* / *Customer Lead*
Duration: *3 months to start immediately*, possibility to extending to full-time role
Location: *Remote or London*

Did your parents ever ask you to fix the computer? Did you have fun doing it? Could you explain to them why it was not working?

Are you the person who everyone asks for help with their mobile phone or computer? Do you enjoy it for the fun - and wish you could get paid for it?

And, what about being part of a fast-paced startup environment? Would that be interesting? If so, then this role is for you!

*Who is OWLR?*
"OWLR":http://www.owlr.com is a multinational team working to make home security cameras smarter, simpler and even more secure. Rather than being a boring alarm company, we here at OWLR are injecting humour, ease of use and amazing user experiences into our products to make Moms and Dads really happy.

One of the key parts of our business are the people who work with our users through email and chats. You would be the front face of our company with our users and get your hands dirty with testing our apps with cameras from around the world and being the discoverer of what works and does not work with our products.

You get to work from your home office, with a great team and gain a set of amazing experiences.

*WHAT ARE YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES?*
As the User Advocate, you will:

* *Engage with Users on Email and Forums* - our users send us emails to solve their problems, and you get to use our Knowledge base and engineers to find solutions and reply in a prompt and friendly manner. You get to use your problem solving skills to diagnose and teach them the steps to solve their problem - since every question is often a new puzzle each time.

* *Engage with Users on Apple App Store and Google Play Store* - with over 1.7M downloads, we get lots of compliments and chats on the Apple and Google App Stores - and you are the voice of the product there.

* *Play with and test the Apps as we release them* - since the engineers are furiously working to build better apps for our users, you are the key person who learns what we are doing, and how we can make sure we serve the users first and foremost.

*WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR*
*You. Or someone like you.* You will likely have some enthusiasms that we are looking to work with:

* *KEY SKILL: You love the English language* - you use words to explain thoughts and care about spelling, even a bit of grammar and love showing off your vocabulary. Our team is distributed around the world and your skill in communication is key to make everything work out right.

* *You act with a sense of responsibility* - rather than an office environment with your boss looking over your head, you OWN your tasks and deliver on them to your users and the whole team’s needs.

* *KEY SKILL: You love to solve problems and dive right in* - you want to solve problems and look for cause and effect, triggers and outcomes. We have plenty of technology puzzles in that our past staff of engineers, teachers, literature students, designer and others on how to solve - it always comes down to YOUR interest and ability to solve puzzles.

* *KEY SKILL: You have a high level of emotional intelligence, empathy and maturity* – can you stay calm and professional, even when under pressure? Because our users are people too! They and the engineers (and the CEO) all have passion for our product, and you are the tip of the soft sword making things better for us all.

* *You are adaptable and have a real sense of humor* – life is unpredictable and we can guarantee that no day “at the office” will ever be the same.

* *You have the confidence to speak out on behalf of the users* - instead of treating our users as ATMs, we work hard to make our users successful - because when users are happy, we are successful. YOU have the responsibility and the empathy to make changes.

* *You are a stickler for detail* - you are the one that tells us when things are going wrong on the web, in reviews, in our emails - you are the person who makes us look great!

* *You have a SOLID Internet connection (or could get one)* - you need to be well-connected and have solid computer skills.

* *You have a general understanding of technology and the ability to understand how software works* - this may seem simple, but do you know how Microsoft Word works? How the file is stored on the system and how Word saves files and makes edits? How the webpage you pulled up in your browser showed up there? And would you LIKE to learn?

*IT WOULD BE NICE IF YOU HAD...*
Yeah - this is a list of other traits that are possible, but you will likely learn as you work with us and the team. Things like:

* *General Network Technology Understanding* (e.g. What is an IP address? What are ports? What is DNS for? What is UDP?)

* *Experience with IP Cameras/IP Cams/CCTV*

* *Working knowledge of the Android and iOS operating systems* (how they work, not just using them on your phone)

*WHAT DO WE WANT?*
We want you to grow and develop and help us do the same. We are looking for you to join us and we ask, aside from your responsibilities of managing the users and solving their problems, we need you to make yourself available on text (or Slack) during working hours and be responsive and make the company-wide afternoon video call set at 4:40 PST (usually).

You could work in our flexible workspace or from your own home and you will be working with an internationally distributed team from London, San Francisco, Sao Paulo, Pakistan and Cape Town.

*WANT TO LEARN MORE?*
Please submit your CV, github account (if you have one) and a response to the questions below an answer to the following question the address in the posting.

* *Cover Letter:* send us a focussed cover letter explaining why you would be great for this role. Include experiences or reasons that makes YOU uniquely qualified for this.

* *Personal Story:* Additionally, we would like you to tell us a story of a time where you had to figure out something in order to help a person other than yourself.

Specifically, tell us about a situation where you had to help someone figure something out that you had no knowledge of. For instance:

* Someone asked you for directions and you had no idea where the place was. What did you do? How did it turn out?

* Someone asked how to use a feature on Microsoft Word you had never used. What did you do? How did it turn out?

* Someone asked you how to do a particularly tough writing assignment that you had never done before. What did you do? How did it turn out?

items.title: Digital Marketing Demigod
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
*Our Story*
Vanquish Fitness is a rapidly growing fitness and lifestyle clothing brand, based in London.

The brand found its identity by releasing apparel inspired by high fashion trends as well as functional design. We believe that with our brand, team, and values, there is nothing that can stop us from being one of the most successful athleisurewear brands in the industry.

We want you to be another star player in our team to help us achieve this.

*Our Culture*
We’re focused on making an impact.

At Vanquish we encourage creativity, ownership, and solution-based thinking. The majority of the success we have had as a team in our 5-year history is from promoting a collaborative environment. This includes being open to making mistakes, positively challenging each other, and having the autonomy to create their best work.

You will be joining a passionate team who are making their mark in the fitness industry.

*The traits we are looking for are:*

*Analytical* - You have the opportunity to scale channels you manage indefinitely.
As a result, we expect you to take reasoned, measured data-based decisions.

*Self-starter* - We are growing. Fast. You will assist with new initiatives and solve problems and challenges that come our way. We want people who are comfortable to be left to find their feet.

*Hungry* - We crave those who are versatile, willing to learn and love new challenges. Most importantly, to be motivated to have a massive impact on both themselves and Vanquish Fitness.

*Dependable* - You will have autonomy (after training is complete) so strong performance is necessary. You will be open-minded and willing to take and give constructive feedback.

*Responsibilities:*
*Manage and launch PPC campaigns
*Manage email campaigns
*A/B test relentlessly
*Work alongside the creative/brand team
*Assist on cross-channel marketing initiatives
*Ultimately, your role would be to help rapidly scale Vanquish’s digital presence

*Our ideal candidate:*
*1+ years of managing PPC campaigns in a performance marketing role
*Resonates with the listed values
*Ready to take a hands-on approach to grow the business
*Loves to learn and willing to get out of their comfort zone

*Nice to have:*
*Social media marketing experience (Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Snapchat, Twitter)
*Interested in high fashion, streetwear or fitnesswear
*Experience within a startup environment
*Entrepreneurial spirit

*Benefits:*
*Salary £25-33k dependant on experience/fit
*Incredible responsibility in one of the fastest growing clothing companies in the UK.
*Opportunity to shape VQ’s future.
*Opportunity to build your network within the fitness industry
*Opportunity to learn in a fast-paced environment
*20 days of holiday plus bank holidays
*Frequent gym sessions and dinners with the team
*Work closely with the two founders
*Casual dress code

Please include “Better than yesterday” at the beginning of your application to show that you’ve read this far.

items.title: Content Marketing Executive
items.content:
We’re looking for a B2B Content Marketing Executive to join our friendly and hardworking commercial team.

Who we are

At PassFort, we share a powerful vision to enable businesses & individuals to establish trust online. We currently do this by giving businesses the tools they need to automate and digitalise the onboarding, verification and management of their customers - that means customers can be onboarded in real-time, without ever having met in person.

We're transforming how trust is established online, in the same way that Salesforce transformed sales, Stripe transformed payments, and AWS transformed DevOps.

What you’ll be doing

As our first Content Marketing Executive, you’ll have ownership of our content marketing strategy. You’ll develop a range of content to nurture existing customers and leads, and attract new customers to our platform.

This role is for someone outgoing and proactive! You’ll be driven to write the article, story, case study, or angle that positions PassFort as an industry expert. You’ll interview internal teams, external partners, clients and industry experts to not only understand our product and how we add value, but also what’s topical and where we can really stand out. You’ll also build strong relationships with journalists to ensure our content has the widest reach and impact.

This is a fantastic growth opportunity. We’re happy to provide all the support you need initially, but we see this progressing into an autonomous role where we’ll trust you to run with your ideas.

Working closely with our Marketing Director and the wider commercial team (currently 4 people), you will:

- Develop content including thought leadership pieces for our website; company news articles and updates; press releases; customer testimonials and case studies
- Write email content for our lead nurture programme
- Write ad content for AdWords, AdRoll, and other channels
- Keep our website content up-to-date
- Work with an outsourced designer to collaborate on content for both web & print
- Work with our web agency to ensure site content is optimised for search
- Keep on top of industry trends, hot topics, and news
- Distribute content across social and professional channels like LinkedIn & Twitter

What we’re looking for

- A self-starter, able to work autonomously and seeking opportunities to grow
- Commercial experience as a marketing content writer
- Strong communication skills - you’ll be confident picking up the phone to speak with a range of stakeholders
- Able to grasp technical concepts (we don’t need you to be deeply technical, but you’ll need a high level technical understanding of our product)
- Knowledge of SEO
- General marketing knowledge, B2B ideal
- A positive outgoing attitude
- Commercial understanding - your content will help to build a strong sales pipeline so demonstrating ROI will be an important part of your role

We’d love it if you had

- Any of the following to help take our content to the next level over time - video production, graphic design, website management
- Startup, FinTech/RegTech, SaaS experience

The Perks

- Great location - we’re situated in a WeWork near Blackfriars with a fantastic view of the Thames
- An annual learning & development budget to spend on professional or personal development, we’re invested in both
- Birthday off - relax and put your feet up
- Dental cover
- Access to Perkbox - discounts to services and products (and honestly it’s fantastic)
- Equally Enhanced Maternity/Paternity/Shared Leave pay
- Generous holiday entitlement
- Pension contributions - investing in your future is important
- Pick your own equipment and kit
- Biscuits… we’re a bit obsessed. We have a weekly ‘guest’ biscuit to broaden your biscuit horizons.

items.title: Digital Content Manager
items.content:
Eventopedia is an intelligent venue finding platform for event planners and a lead generation platform for global hotels and venues. Our users are event planners all over the world and our clients are hotels, venues and suppliers in global destinations. Recently funded by leading industry angels and a fast growing client base.

THE ROLE

We are looking for a content creator using written and filmed medium with an audience-first mindset. Candidates will be experts in content generation for SEO, managing web and social accounts, understand the nuances, advantages and shortcomings of each platform and know how to utilise data in formulating a campaign strategy to drive registered users and leads. You'll be the sort of person who knows who to follow on Twitter and loves exploring the best venues and other related topics in hospitality

RESPONSIBILITIES

- Orchestrating digital content strategies across existing and new online platforms leveraging in-house content technology.

- Driving traffic and engagement that translates to sales and brand promotion.

- Managing a content marketing budget.

- Implementing SEO best practices.

- Writing and editing web copy in line with brand, tone of voice and house style guidelines which you’ll set.

- Building and editing content pages in the CMS.

- Developing testing strategies around medium (images, video) and message (headline, social share text), to inform a constantly updating set of best practices for engaging off-platform audiences (Social, Search, etc.)

REQUIREMENTS

- BSc in Marketing, English, Journalism or related field. (Not essential for the right candidate but they will need to show their skills clearly)

- Experience as a digital content creator or journalist, ideally in an agile multidisciplinary setting.

- Data-driven and highly analytical.

- Exposure to SEO best practices and writing content for SEO.

- Proficiency with Google Analytics, search console and social media analytics.

- Excellent written and verbal communication.

- Proven work experience as a content writer, copywriter or similar role

- Hands-on experience with content management systems, Word, Excel, Powerpoint etc.

BENEFITS

- Competitive salary with equity options and annual bonus.

- All the gadgets they need to over perform.

- Strong meritocratic culture where everyone’s opinion is valued and considered.

- Training where appropriate so you can develop your skills and career.

- Pension scheme.

- 28 days of holidays including bank holidays.

- Flexible working with an office in Central London or remote working for the right candidate.

items.title: Digital Marketer (ASAP!)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are looking for a self-motivated and organised Digital Marketing & Community Lead to help us spread the word about sprinters and Growth Camps.

The intern will have the opportunity to directly work with Mevish Aslam, CEO of sprinters and Growth Camps, to coordinate and implement marketing campaigns and event activities to grow the membership base of sprinters online community and upcoming Growth Camps.

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who wants to work in an entrepreneurial and invigorating work environment, get relevant digital marketing experience onto your CV and is keen to demonstrate your leadership qualities to deliver on goals.

You will have the chance to work on:

Digital Marketing
Curation and creation of on-brand content for our social media channels
Support on email marketing
Create performance reporting across all digital marketing channels
Come up with creative campaigns to drive membership
Reach out to communities to share upcoming giveaways and promote the Growth Camp.

Community Management
Ensuring that every customer email or new inquiry gets a friendly response within 24 hours
Lead the on-boarding process for new users
Lead our quarterly membership feedback survey
Come up with recommendations on how to engage and delight our members

Events
Support execution of our community events online
Publishing of event pages
Capturing content for digital marketing and feedback after the event

This internship is a voluntary role to help you gain relevant work experience. The position is remote, for 3-6 months.

Note: If you do an exceptional job there is a high probability you will be invited to join the Growth Camp, a 5-Day Growth Hacking Camp in Spain this summer - program fees covered by us!

items.title: Junior Product(Tech) Marketeer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Big Picture Labs Ltd is an early stage B2C Fintech product startup based in London. We are building an innovative solution in financial management. The startup is at a crucial stage with the MVP ready and we are nearing our launch to beta users. This presents an exciting opportunity for a junior marketeer/brand ambassador to join the team and be part of a big positive change- quality experience is guaranteed. To be successful in this role, you'll need the below listed skills/experience. A background in visual design will be a bonus.
We are fairly open about the reward mechanism and strongly believe that any employee should grow with the company. This opportunity is initially for 3-4 months duration, with possibility of extension/conversion to permanent role.


For this role we ideally look for:
• Someone who enjoys meaningful work and want to shape the future of finance through innovative tech for good solutions
• Enthusiasm for content creation on platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Youtube
• Ability to explore new marketing channels beyond the obvious and create innovative campaigns
• Understanding of various digital/social media marketing
• Identifying and establishing a strong professional link with influencers
• Ability to sell our product vision to our early adopters
• Outgoing personality and proactive attitude towards your work
• Creativity and ability to learn fast
• Ability to work with time and budget constraints



Bonus points for:
• Experience using Adobe Photoshop and Indesign (or similar tools)
• Past projects using social media marketing strategies and tools
• Experience in content creation on platforms like Snapchat, Instagram, Youtube
• Experience writing newsletters, blogs, and building a community

items.title: Digital Designer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=15}
items.content:
We are looking for a creative Digital Designer to join the Commercial team here at Nutmeg. You will regularly design concepts, deliver world class digital designs and develop new creative ways to engage with our customer base as well as review competitor activities for the marketing team here at Nutmeg. The role will focus on concepting and designing brilliant HTML5 digital display advertising. You will work closely with the marketing and content teams, so we can produce highly targeting content, at scale.

REQUIREMENTS
What you’ll need to do:

Understand, digest and create amazing designs by understanding objectives from the detailed briefs
Research the market and keep on trend with competitors and market trends
As the Digital Designer you will thrive to produce clear and precise challenging programmatic designs
Work alongside the creative content and copywriter teams to deliver compelling creative campaigns
Take on board the learnings from previous campaigns and engagement to better our exposure to prospective customers
Review and optimise all E-commerce creative on an ongoing basis
What you’ll need to have:

Proficient in HTML5 digital display production
Concepting and storyboarding of digital display creative - both direct response and brand
Proficient in HTML5 digital display production – again both direct response and brand
Experience of using DoubleClick studio essential
Experience of developing and designing bespoke Paid Social creative (Facebook and Instagram)
Video concepting and editing skills
Designing infographics
BENEFITS
We’re a diverse team of fun, genuine, smart people with a common mission to shake up financial

services and change the way people manage their money in an intelligent easy way.



A fintech leader located in Vauxhall, London, we work in a modern, open plan office. We use cutting

edge technologies and development tools like Mesos and Docker. We brainstorm and work with

whiteboards and post-its and collaborate across the entire business to do our jobs – awesomely.

We’d say we’re similar to a typical tech company: casual, flexible, agile, flat-structured and fastpaced.

All while making sure we maintain professional (FCA-regulated) standards in everything we

do.



We’re passionate and motivated and take pride in providing a great experience for our customers

and empowering generations of investors. We want like-minded people to join us. As a Nutmegger,

you’ll be part of a tightknit, hard-working, innovative team at the top of their game, facing new

challenges every day.

items.title: Marketing Growth Analyst
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Hello, we’re Anorak. We’re busy building the world’s smartest independent insurance adviser - and we need an outstanding Marketing Growth Analyst to join our rapidly growing team based at our London offices to help us design, build and deliver our service.

We’re building a regulated advice platform to give everyone access to tailored life insurance advice. We’re backed by AXA group funded, Kamet – a fast insurtech start-up studio backing entrepreneurs who build groundbreaking technology companies.

Our people are what make us awesome; Our team is made up of data scientists, tech geeks, design heavyweights and insurance experts from all over the world.

Alongside our Head of product, you will be responsible for understanding the end-to-end customer funnel in order to optimise opportunities and help users realise the full potential of our life insurance advice platform. You will work in collaboration with different teams including Engineering, Design and Product.

You will deeply understand and measure the effectiveness of Anorak platform by defining and monitoring operational metrics for the team, run review cadences within them and collaborate with different stakeholders to understand our user needs and product capabilities.

Requirements

Establish Anorak’s growth framework

* Work with the product, design and engineering teams to define & own the growth delivery framework
* Utilise qualitative and quantitative insights to develop hypotheses & drive A/B testing
* Define metrics and KPIs to measure the effectiveness of experiments
* Take a customer-centric approach to growth to uncover insights and drive action
* Work with designers and developers to create a coherent and agile testing approach
* Develop, own and present product’s performance reporting suite
* Communicate and foster alignment for the growth strategy across the company.
* Implement ‘non technical’ optimisation initiatives, including planning, idea management, testing, optimisation, reporting, and forecasting; this includes: defining test criteria and method, metrics, creating and executing tests (using Optimizely, or similar tools)

Deliver conversion improvement on the platform

* Own and execute experiments plan to improve funnel metrics
* Identify poorly performing features and workflows, and work towards improving them.
* Improve platform metrics at each stage of the user flow starting with entry point into the funnel (landing pages, campaigns, SEO, etc.)
* Develop, implement and test email automation and cross channel CRM
* Report performance

Who you are

* You have 5+ years of experience in a product/marketing growth role, with a proven track record ideally in a scale-up business
* You have prior experience with using and implementing marketing automation tools
* You have run hundreds of tests and have a clear perspective on what does and doesn’t work
* You have a sharp product sense that allows you to determine what will work for users, what will most effectively move the metric, and what will be too complex to build & test
* You have experience working with analytics tools and using them to drive improved online performance incl. Mixpanel / Google Analytics / Google Tag Manager / A/B testing tools such as Google Optimise or Optimizely
* You are well organised with great attention to detail.
* You are a “do-er”, willing to work hands-on including stepping in to work directly with the development team
* You are an excellent communicator in English, whether it be in words or in writing.

Benefits

Why join Anorak?

There are a whole bunch of factors that make Anorak a great place to work; not least that we’re on the cutting edge of technological change, working at the intersection of business, digital technology and creativity.

Here’s just a few more reasons why Anorak could be the place for you:

* You’ll work in this booming as part of a future global leader.
* You’ll work with an international network of experts
* You’ll benefit from a stimulating working environment with creative projects
* You will benefit from AXA’s expertise and operational support
* You will enjoy a steep learning curve

Additionally we offer:

* 25 days holidays
* Private Medical insurance (Vitality)
* Pension contribution - 5% employee / 4% employer
* Death in Service (life insurance)

items.title: User Researcher
items.content:
The property industry is broken and we’re fixing it. The Housing Crisis is an issue which has an effect on all of us. We’re helping to make a systemic change in the property industry, using our software to make the sector more dynamic, transparent, and efficient.

*About the company*
LandInsight is a new platform that is fundamentally changing how the property industry buys land for development. It’s a big data platform that speeds up the process of finding, assessing and buying land. It comes at an important time, one of the biggest challenges for the UK housing crisis is tackling the shortage of development land. Our tech has changed the game and as a result we’ve become the UK’s fastest growing PropTech company (and we’ve got the awards to prove it!).

People are taking notice too - our user base is doubling regularly and already, tens of thousands of homes have been built on sites that were sourced using LandInsight, and that’s just the beginning.

To support and accelerate this growth we’re looking for ambitious, creative and collaborative people to join the LandInsight family.

*Our culture*
Our values are ‘open’, ‘empower’ and ‘home’ and we regularly hold ourselves accountable to these. The people who work here feel that they are challenged, but also feel like they have the environment and tools to succeed.

We truly believe that businesses flourish when people work collaboratively. That’s why we prioritise team building and facilitation. We are in constant contact with the company founders, so are able to learn about the conception of and running of a tech startup that is scaling. We run weekly sessions to ensure every voice is heard and empowered to grow and contribute.

We don’t just make empty gestures about our culture - we were voted as the 3rd best UK SaaS Company to work at, and have also received awards for ‘Diversity Advocate’ and ‘Best at Employee Development’.


*Your mission *
As LandInsight’s first User Researcher your mission is to build a deep understanding of our customers and prospects. You’ll be in charge of driving both qualitative user research and quantitative product insights, interpreting the data to provide compelling insights.
By understanding our users, the problems they face, and how they use our product, you’ll play a key role in both our product development and the future strategy, helping us deliver the best site finding experience possible.

*Responsibilities*
*You will provide user insights to our cross-functional product teams, working alongside our Product Managers, Engineers and Designer to generate hypotheses and plan and run research to help us deliver better solutions to the problems we are solving for our customers
*You will ensure we are tracking the right product metrics and translating those findings into compelling recommendations
*You will champion data driven decision making, and will ensure company wide visibility of the insights you develop
*You will develop research programmes to help inform the strategic direction of the business, including both existing and future products
*You will provide leadership in research technique and methodology

*Essential criteria*
*Experience applying a range of user research methodologies.
*Able to choose the appropriate approach for different situations, balancing the desire for robust research methodology with business demands
*Experience turning research data into clear insights that inform decision-making
*Experience tracking and analysing SaaS product metrics in analytics platforms such as MixPanel
*A demonstrable track record of your user insights delivering tangible product benefits
*You are results-orientated, a self-starter, with the ability to juggle several projects at once
*Excellent communication skills

*Desirable criteria*
*Experience of B2B SaaS software
*Experience in PropTech

*Why work for us?*
*Flexible working hours
*Professional and personal training budget
*Competitive salary and equity options
*25 days paid holiday (additional to bank holidays)
*Unlimited unpaid holidays
*Dog friendly office
*Loads of social events, including a quarterly away day, an annual ski trip and monthly socials
*Gym and wellness contributions, and a cycle to work scheme
*Dedication to hiring for cultural fit, so you know you’re going to be sitting next to someone who you want to grab a beer/glass of prosecco with (usually at the free WeWork bar we have available after 2pm every day!)

items.title: Search Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*We’re looking for a world-class paid search marketer to help millions of people discover an easier way to get great clothes and feel confident about the way they dress.*

Thread is an ambitious, well-funded fashion technology startup based in London that's looking to reinvent retail.

We’re part of a new generation of retailers, helping customers overwhelmed by near-infinite choice to get the clothes that are perfect for them. We combine human stylists and powerful machine learning algorithms to create amazing recommendations, and have developed a full e-commerce platform for an end-to-end shopping experience. Our ambition is to become the clothes button on your phone (Thread = clothes, Spotify = music, Uber = taxi), changing how millions of people across the world buy their clothes.

Paid search is a new channel for Thread (unusual for a retailer, we know), and this is an opportunity to shape a core growth channel for one of London’s most exciting startups. So, we’re looking for a smart, versatile, results-driven digital marketer to join Thread and help us find new customers who will love our service. You’ll work as part of a world class marketing team, with talent from Made.com, Spotify, Wieden + Kennedy and beyond.

You’ll be based in our brand new Aldgate office, which has lots of natural light, plants, a relaxed Studio area for coworking with music, and an outdoor terrace for barbecues and working outside when it’s sunny.

*Key Responsibilities*
* Own forecasting, delivery and reporting of Paid Search. Channels Managers at Thread are autonomous, with the freedom to set whatever strategy and tactics best deliver on goals
* Build and deliver the Paid Search testing roadmap. You’ll be responsible for identifying our highest value search opportunities, prioritising them into a roadmap, and rallying the resources to deliver the tests
* Be a world class expert in the channel. Thread Channel Managers combine a deep technical knowledge of their channels and relationships with partners to get access to new tools and insights, and a constant desire to stay ahead of the market
* Develop Thread’s paid search strategy. As we launch new markets, consider new brands we want to partner with and shape our overall strategy, you’ll be responsible for helping us to understand Paid Search, and ensure we’re set up for success

*Are you the one? You are if you have:*
* A few years experience of managing paid search, preferably with experience working on large product catalogues, including experience on Google Shopping and non-brand PPC
* Exceptional analytical skills, with an ability to deliver clear reporting, accurate forecasts, and actionable insights. SQLs skills strongly preferred
* Strong communication skills; you’re able to communicate the big picture and intricacies of Paid Search to the rest of the team
* Experience managing relationships with stakeholders at Google to access new products and expertise
* A love for analytics and optimisation. You are comfortable and happiest digging through mounds of data to find insights and drive results
* A broad interest and passion for marketing. You know things never stay the same, so you’re always learning about what’s next and what’s driving that change

*Benefits*
* The chance to break new ground and develop cutting-edge techniques for acquiring new customers online
* The opportunity to become recognised as one of the best in your field by being a core operator for a high-profile startup
* The chance to solve hard problems in a fast growing business, providing an unrivalled opportunity to develop your skill set
* Be part of a collaborative, values-led team that are working hard to create one of the highest quality cultures in the world. Learn more about how we’re doing this in our culture deck
* Relaxed, sociable work environment with lots of responsibility and autonomy
* Free team lunches four times a week, as well as fruit and snacks. We also have drinks and snacks together as a company on Fridays, as well as regular company trips to fun things like comedy shows, axe throwing, quizzes, bowling and weekly yoga classes
* Choose your own work equipment. It’s important to us that you’re set up for success in your role and comfortable in your setting
* Working-from-home opportunities and flexible working hours, to help you develop a healthy work-life balance
* Unlimited vacation time so you can recharge and relax
* Equal parental leave. We offer 4 months fully paid leave for both mothers and fathers following the birth or adoption of their child
* A competitive salary and a generous equity stake in the company (you're working hard to make the company successful, so we believe you should share generously in the reward!)

items.title: Co-founder Counsellor / Psychologist wanted!
items.content:
We are looking for a Counselling Psychologist or ideally a Clinical Psychologist who is motivated to work for an innovative startup and becomes a co-founder.

The technology is already in place but it will need adjustments. We have a few requests from people who want to register for our service. Please, have a look at our website and mobile app to know more about what we currently offer: https://betterthoughts.co.uk. This is the beginning and everything can be changed!

At minimum, we are looking for someone who is able to start engaging with users by assessing their mental health problems and then orientate users to the right available professionals. For this, on top of your professional expertise, you need to have good writing and communication skills and give us constant feedback. So we can eventually re-adjust the business value proposition. As a co-founder, you will also help to pitch the project to potential investors and will be working closely with the stakeholders.

The goal is to build a great product and service to help people to feel better in a modern and convenient way. It is very important that our clients give us good feedback and we need your help to improve.

You don’t need to work in an office and you can work remotely with flexible time for now.

We will apply for funding’s as soon as we have a strong value proposition, and so it will be easy to convince potential investors. We cannot provide a salary at this stage, but as your position is key to the business, you will benefit financially as soon as possible.

This is an unmatched opportunity to be an equity co-Founder!

_If this sounds interesting, please get in touch._

items.title: User Researcher
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
We’re Farewill - we build simple, beautiful products to change the way the world deals with death.

We’ve grown quickly to lead our industry, becoming the biggest (and favourite) will-writer in the UK in just 3 years. We launched our probate service in March 2019, helping families at the difficult, emotional time of a bereavement.

We’re a growing, tight-knit, multidisciplinary team of 25+ genuinely nice people. We're at the forefront of legal technology, playing a crucial role in modernising important legal services. In January 2019 we received £8m in Series A funding.

*The opportunity for a user researcher:*

You’ll be working on the fascinating, difficult problem of death. Our customers are facing difficult choices that impact the rest of their lives: they may be planning for the future; they may be dying; they may have lost a loved one. It’s a challenging subject and a challenging market. What we do has a big impact on real people.

We have a strong research and design culture, from the ground up and top down. Our design team are generalists with a strong focus on research, and our developers are user-focused. We work collaboratively on problems and user needs. But... we have no dedicated user researcher! You’ll be the first. This is an amazing opportunity for you to define the discipline of user research at Farewill and cement a strong research-and-user-centric ideology. Make it your own. In time we hope you’ll have the opportunity to lead other researchers, if you aspire to leadership.

*About you:*

You’re empathetic. You’re an experienced user researcher. You’re a generalist: you apply the right method to the question at hand. Your first love is qualitative research but you have a solid grounding in quant. You have plenty of hands on experience of research in its many forms, but for you it’s never just about outputs: it’s about bringing people along on the journey, furthering a shared business mission and - most of all - working in teams to build brilliant, user-centric products.

*In the next 12 months, you’ll:*

* Work embedded in our wills and probate teams, collaborating closely with product managers, designers, developers and others to build products that solve problems and meet user needs
* Improve existing products and help launch new ones
* Build the research function at Farewill from scratch, in collaboration with and support from Tom Hiskey, Victor Hwang and others in the design and tech teams
* Gain a deep understanding of our products, users and business goals: you’ll be the main voice of the user in the business
* Plan, run and analyse qualitative studies, including interviews, remote and in-person usability tests, and contextual and ethnographic research (yes you’ll be running usability tests, but this role is much more than just testing)
* Document and curate research, building a central knowledge resource for future projects
* Communicate findings not only within the product teams but also with the wider business, to help bring others along on the journey

*Ideally you'll have some or all of the following:*

* Empathy, listening and ability to speak with customers at a difficult time
* Experience leading the research effort within a product team
* Working collaboratively with designers, developers and others to build fantastic products
* Experience organising and running research studies and recruiting participants
* Experience with a variety of qualitative methods, such as remote and in-person usability testing, interviews, diary studies, ethnographic research and card-sorting
* A grounding in quantitative research including surveys and data analysis
* Self-organised and able to handle multiple projects and priorities
* A brilliant communicator: you bring research to life, bringing practical ideas to teams to help build user-focused solutions
* Ability to bring the team along on the journey and buy into the value of research
* Pragmatism: you apply the right amount of research for a given context and problem

*Bonus points for:*
* Experience working with bereaved or vulnerable users
* Being scrappy and working on a few things at once (we’re a startup!)
* Working with other insight-driven people including data analysts and quant researchers
Complementary interests or experiences beyond research (for example, many of our developers have design backgrounds)

BENEFITS
Competitive salary and share options
Santander cycles membership
Regular off-site days and team lunches
Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day
28 days holiday + bank holidays

items.title: Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About movemeon

We’re a fast growing, tech-enabled, central London based growth business. We were founded with the simple aim to make discovering great jobs easier.

Today Movemeon is used by 35,000+ members, 2,500+ businesses (from the likes of Uber and Apple to early stage VC-backed startups) and in 100+ countries. ~200 candidates and ~15 businesses join the membership every week. We deliver them unique opportunities, insight and events through an exclusive members network.

We are also planning to expand fast into new geographies and new professional niches as well as exploring exciting new products like payspective.com. It’s all go!

We can take you through our vision when we meet you. Suffice to say, we are thinking big and need your help to execute.


The team

The two founders, Nick Patterson and Richard Rosser set-up movemeon after their frustration with recruitment agencies. We are now a team of 16 and are highly international (French, Italian, Portuguese, German). We’re continuing to expand and expect a steady flow of new joiners this year. Our office is near Vauxhall (central London) in a complex also home to other growth businesses.

About the Product manager role

We are looking for someone to take our product to the next level. It’s an opportunity to be hands-on and take as much responsibility as you can handle, managing our developers and participating in the creation of the product vision/ roadmap from day one.

Your key responsibilities will include:
• Understanding our users: speak to our customers and understand what they like, and what frustrates them. Use this intelligence, plus feedback collated from the team, to understand what we need to build as a priority.
• Managing the product roadmap: You’ll be working with our head of product to understand how the product can be optimized for each function (in addition to the user priorities). You’ll participate in the creation of the product roadmap, prioritizing the ongoing delivery of highest impact changes. You will also communicate progress against this roadmap to the broader team: putting you at the centre of the business
• Owning our email: You’ll be the owner of all the automatic emails that come from our site and will be in charge of their optimisation
• Running the sprint process: You’ll help the teams to develop great technical and design specifications for the developers to work towards. You’ll then lead a team of two back-end developers (offshore) to deliver against these specifications. You will have responsibility for improving the process/ managing the contract with the developers to ensure they are delivering to our standards
• Identifying high-impact UX changes: we want you to be consistently updating the look and feel of the site. You will be expected to regularly use the site as a “user” and see what frustrates you
• Measure and iterate: Measure the impact of the changes we make, and use the results to inform further product changes. We measure the impact of pretty much everything we do. So you’ll get to see (and analyse) plenty of interesting data that will show just how much your hard work is contributing to the growth of the business.

What the right candidate will bring to the table

We’re looking for someone with coding experience (PHP and HTML) or a degree in computer science. Strong problem solving and logic, as well as analytics, are great for any product role.

Specifically we’re looking for:
• Knowledge of PHP and HTML/ degree in computer science
• Evidence that you are a 'do-er' (yes, thinking is important but lots of stuff needs to get done). You’ll be proactive and demonstrate that you get stuck in, organize things and have probably always had holiday jobs / part time work etc.
• Super organized – we are growing fast which means things change regularly and can be chaotically busy. You’ll need to keep a clear head and religiously get through your to do list.
• Entrepreneurship in your DNA – you never fancied / tried but got frustrated with a corporate job.
• Desire to take on responsibility quickly. As MMO grows, we’ll want you to grow with us. So that means quickly stepping up to manage more aspects of the business and potentially more people too.
• Minimum of a 2:1 degree from a UK Russell Group (or international equivalent) university
• Fluent written and spoken English
• Fun team member (we have lots of it)


So if this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you (see details below).

About our offer:

• Exciting business in a time of rapid growth
• Start-up environment and ethos (i.e. we don’t do face time and we don’t do anything that doesn’t need to be done)
• Respect for and encouragement of your own ideas and initiatives
• Real responsibility
• Fun, smart team of normal people
• A sensible work life balance (we leave the office by 6pm every day and don’t work weekends)
• Monthly team fun & annual away weeks (like last year’s trips to Montenegro and Barcelona)
• An office in central SW London (we’re based near Vauxhall tube)
• 25 days holiday + 2 extra days at Christmas
• Competitive salary & quarterly bonus related to metrics you can track and control

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience. We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Spotify, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a few!) and are passionate about helping them put their customers’ at the heart of their decision making.

In three short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals. We have big plans and are now looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join us to amplify our product marketing strategy as we develop the Chattermill platform. The Product Marketing Manager will undertake key industry and customer research to refine our customer personas and enhance our sales enablement collateral, processes and approach.

*As a Product Marketing Manager, you will:*

* Take care of the creative development and publication of a range of product related marketing collateral including blog posts, case studies, webinars, and thought leadership pieces to convey Chattermill’s capabilities to partners and prospective clients
* Develop sales collateral and product marketing materials that set us apart from our competitors and showcase our product capabilities
* Support sales efforts by developing enabling collateral for all stages of the sales cycle including white-papers, slide decks, and videos
* Work to position Chattermill as a Category Leader in the Customer Experience space
* Take ownership of marketing activities around the launch of upcoming products and release of our upgraded platform
* Collaborate with product management and strategy leaders to develop a launch model and ensure launches are integrated with campaigns
* Partner with product development and engineering teams through the complete product development cycle to help create our communication strategies for our platform to ensure an audience-centric approach across the product portfolio
* Conduct research to gather insight around target personas including their buyer needs and the purchasing decision process
* Partner with Sales and Customer Success to establish strategies to drive customer retention, up-sell and cross sell the product portfolio

*What we’re looking for:*

* Prior experience in B2B marketing, product marketing, marketing communications or sales enablement marketing
* Experience in implementing marketing strategies and campaigns that provide product insight to customers
* A track record of producing impactful sales enablement materials and marketing collateral
* Excellent project management skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and campaigns
* A collaborative individual who thrives when working with cross functional teams
* A strong understanding of content strategy and copy production across product marketing and sales enablement
* High emotional intelligence and the ability to think like each of our customers
* A lateral thinker who takes an indirect and creative approach to problem solving
* You’re excited at the prospect of coming up with creative approaches to Marketing that we may not have done before
* A strong customer focus and the ability to identify different customer and market segments, various buyer personas, and develop initiatives that address these specifically
* Strong commercial awareness and the desire to help grow the business

*Nice to have:*

* Prior experience working with SaaS products
* A good understanding of Customer Experience and passion for helping our clients in this area
* Degree level education in Marketing or similar
* Design skills and experience using Sketch or Illustrator
* Experience with customer research and user segmentation
* Prior experience in Product launch and market positioning

*Why join us?*

* A competitive salary and stock options
* Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!
* 25 days holiday (in addition to bank holidays)
* Company pension plan matched at 3%
* A big focus on personal development including a £500 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns
* Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, gym memberships and more
* Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home
* Lovely office (with great coffee, events, and a rooftop terrace)
* Office wellness events like Monday Mindfulness and yoga
* Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.title: Insight Analyst
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
